jobs.title: Consumer Growth Operations Manager
jobs.description:
## About the Role

This role is a unique opportunity to make a direct impact in shaping the food delivery category and the future of Uber Eats in Mexico.

As a Consumer Growth Manager, you’ll define and implement the strategy for eater acquisition, retention, and engagement across Mexico. You’ll work closely with the local Territory team and the broader Operations organization to ensure strategies are aligned and executed effectively.

This position calls for a blend of analytical expertise, strategic thinking, strong execution, and collaboration across teams.

## What You’ll Do

Strategy Development

- Design and lead a roadmap of initiatives to drive user acquisition, retention, and engagement.


Process Optimization

- Scale and refine new and existing processes to help the business operate efficiently and grow sustainably.


Budget Management

- Manage promotional budgets effectively to maximize acquisition, engagement, and retention impact.


Product Improvement

- Identify and advocate for new features that enhance the Uber Eats customer experience.

- Collaborate with central teams to prioritize and localize product rollouts for Mexico.


Stakeholder Management & Collaboration

- Build strong partnerships with cross-functional, regional, and central teams (e.g., Marketing, Community Operations, Policy, Communications, Legal) to drive long-term growth and strengthen Uber’s global network.


## Basic Qualifications

- A minimum of 3 years of experience solving analytical problems in business consulting, investment banking, or a high-growth environment.

- Professional proficiency in English and Spanish.

- Strong critical thinking and analytical skills; comfortable making data-driven decisions in complex situations.

- Ability to communicate effectively across diverse teams and stakeholders.

- Advanced Excel skills.

- SQL experience is a plus.


## Preferred Qualifications

- Hands-on experience with SQL for data analysis and decision-making.

jobs.title: Software Engineer II, Frontend (Web)
jobs.description:
### **About the Role**

**_Please note: this hybrid position is based in São Paulo, Brazil – welcoming both local professionals and those open to relocating._**

At Uber, Frontend Engineers build web experiences that power the way people move and receive things around the world. As part of our engineering team, you’ll work on large-scale applications that impact millions of users.

You’ll collaborate with cross-functional partners (design, backend, data science, product). Your work will help shape the future of Uber’s core rider experiences and delivery logistics — defining how people interact with Uber on the web.

### **About the Teams**

**Delivery:** The Delivery team is focused on innovating and streamlining how products and services reach our customers. In this role, you'll contribute to building efficient and robust systems that support order processing, logistics, and real-time tracking. Your contributions will help optimize the end-to-end delivery experience, making it more reliable and seamless for both drivers and customers.

**Mobility (Rider Core):** Millions of people depend on Uber’s web application to make ride reservations and get on-demand Uber rides. The Rider Core Team at Uber is redefining what it means to Uber and expanding our products beyond on-demand rides. In this role, you'll work with many distributed teams, ranging from designers, engineers, and data scientists, to provide market-defining products and trip planning experiences over the web.

### **Basic Qualifications**

- Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or related field; **OR** 4+ years of professional software engineering experience.
- Proficiency in Javascript, React or VueJS or Angular plus HTML, CSS, and web APIs.
- Understanding of modern web application architecture and frameworks.
- Advanced English communication skills
- Algorithm & Data Structures fundamentals, including hash tables, trees, stacks, queues, linked list, DFS, BFS

### **Preferred Qualifications**

- Experience with back-end systems (Go, Python, TypeScript, etc.)

jobs.title: Technical Program Manager II
jobs.description:
**About the Role**

As a TPM in the GSS team, you will drive critical Data Engineering programs collaborating with multiple stakeholders from cross functional teams across the Org. You will be acting as a crucial data partner to stakeholder teams to own and drive processes for creating high quality data assets for analytics and ML applications.

This will involve partnering closely with them to conceptualize Data Engineering solutions, own the program organization and execution, collaborating with vendor teams , routinely track and manage program progress ,publish progress reports to leadership teams. You will look for ways to standardize program execution , set accountability by tracking progress, resolve dependencies, proactively identify risks and communicate status to leadership and stakeholders.

**What the Candidate Will Need / Bonus Points**

\-\-\-\- What the Candidate Will Do ----

1. Lead complex and diverse programs in the Data Eng space to build data foundations and systems for high quality data assets for the company.
2. Partner with diverse teams like other Data Eng teams, Data Science, Product, ML to define scope , gather requirements , propose solutions, plan timelines and dependencies.
3. Lead the vendor partner teams to drive execution , unblocking them on technical challenges, maintain accountability, track progress, proactively identify and mitigate risks.
4. Maintain program governance, defining and measuring KPI, reporting status and issues to leadership.
5. Conceptualize and deploy Generative AI-based solutions for the automation of Data Engineering workflows aimed at improving program efficiency.

\-\-\-\- Basic Qualifications ----

1. 8+ years in technical program management or data engineering development. Technical background in Data Engineering is a must. A minimum of 2 years of experience as a team lead managing Data Engineers is preferred.
2. Proficient in SQL and programming languages such as Python.
3. Strong understanding of Data Warehousing and Data Modeling concepts.
4. Good knowledge of designing ETL pipelines utilizing the Hadoop Tech Stack.
5. Proven ability to design high-quality, end-to-end data solutions in an Agile environment, from requirement gathering through production deployment. Proficient in tools like JIRA for program tracking.
6. Demonstrate strong team leadership, coupled with excellent communication and collaboration skills, effectively bridging technical and non-technical audiences.
7. Exhibit a strong focus on strategic problem-solving, thriving in ambiguous situations to architect and deliver long-term, scalable solutions.
8. Leverage Generative AI to drive efficiency and develop cutting-edge solutions for various data-related inefficiencies and challenges.

\-\-\-\- Preferred Qualifications ----

1. A minimum of 2 years of experience as a team lead managing Data Engineers is preferred.
2. Proven ability to design high-quality, end-to-end data solutions in an Agile environment, from requirement gathering through production deployment.
3. Experience using Generative AI to drive efficiency for various data-related inefficiencies and challenges.

jobs.title: Research & Insights Manager II
jobs.description:
**About the Role**

As Research & Insights Manager II, you will lead the strategy and operations of our in-house global tracking ecosystem. You will be the primary owner of the process and program management for our tracking tools, working in close collaboration with our Data Science team to build a world-class insights engine.

You’ll be in charge of creating the infrastructure and processes that enable the broader Research & Insights team to extract meaningful signals from large data sets. Beyond program management, you will act as a lead analyst—conducting your own research based on tracking data and "connecting the dots" between sentiment trends, internal behavioral data, and custom research to influence global decisions across Marketing, Product, and Operations.

**What You’ll Do**

- **Global Program Management:** Own the operational excellence of Uber’s global tracking programs (Brand Health, Safety, etc.). Manage processes with Data Science to ensure data quality, consistency, and timely delivery of insights across all markets.
- **Data Science Collaboration & Infrastructure:** Partner deeply with Data Science and teams to optimize our tracking tools. This includes helping to define the requirements for dashboards and automated reporting pipelines that allow the business to self-serve critical metrics.
- **Process Creation & Enablement:** Design and implement scalable processes that enable the wider Research team to easily access, analyze, and visualize tracking data. You will be the "power user" who teaches others how to leverage these tools effectively.
- **Synthesis & Strategic Analysis:** Go beyond reporting numbers by conducting deep-dive analyses. You will triangulate tracking findings with internal behavioral data and other primary research to provide a holistic view of the user and identify "white space" opportunities and double click on our key initiatives.
- **Global Stakeholder Impact:** Deliver clear, narrative-driven insights to senior leadership across Policy, Marketing, and Product. You will ensure our tracking programs evolve to answer the most pressing business questions for both Mobility and Delivery

**Basic Qualifications**

- 7+ years of work experience in consumer-focused market research, marketing, or consulting
- Bachelor degree in market research, statistics, economics or a related field
- Demonstrated ability to work with complex datasets. You are comfortable speaking the language of Data Scientists and translating business needs into technical requirements.

**Preferred Qualifications**

- Graduate degree in business, market research, statistics, economics or a related field
- Experience using SQL, R or SPSS
- Passion for leveraging insights from multiple sources to guide business and marketing strategy
- Ability to work in a quick-moving environment and prioritize among projects while maintaining attention to detail
- Self-starter and problem-solving attitude to ensure success of research projects in a changing environment
- Interest in working with a large and diverse set of stakeholders, vendors and team
- Excellent critical thinking, project management, and communication skills
- Proficiency in moderating 1:1 interviews and focus groups
- Hands-on experience at a research supplier - writing questionnaires and discussion guides, fielding research, etc.
- Experience with market research in multiple countries/regions

For San Francisco, CA-based roles: The base salary range for this role is USD$157,000 per year - USD$174,000 per year.

You will be eligible to participate in Uber's bonus program, and may be offered an equity award & other types of comp. You will also be eligible for various benefits. More details can be found at the following link [https://www.uber.com/careers/benefits](https://www.uber.com/careers/benefits).

jobs.title: Senior Sensor Systems & Calibration Engineer
jobs.description:
## About the Role

We are seeking a highly skilled and versatile Senior Sensor Systems & Calibration Engineer to build and scale our hardware, software, and process infrastructure that ensures the accuracy and reliability of our advanced multi-sensor perception and compute systems.

In the near term, you will develop and sustain the physical calibration environments: turntables, fixtures, targets, markers, and alignment rigs, that enable precise multi-sensor calibration for early vehicle platforms. Over time, you will drive the evolution of these workflows toward software-driven, automated, and production-ready solutions, partnering with perception, systems, and platform teams to ensure our calibration strategy scales with fleet and platform growth.

This role bridges hardware integration, sensor calibration, software tooling, and operational readiness. You will define SOPs, quality gates, and data integrity practices that enable high-throughput, repeatable calibration, whether performed manually, via hybrid workflows, or through fully automated software pipelines.

## What You’ll Do

- Own setup, maintenance, and continuous improvement of early hardware-based calibration environments, including turntables, optical targets, alignment fixtures, and sensor characterization rigs.
- Develop, document, and refine SOPs for calibration and sensor alignment workflows to ensure repeatability, safety, and scale-out readiness across labs and cities.
- Collaborate with perception, systems, and hardware engineering teams to define calibration requirements, ensuring both hardware and software approaches meet accuracy and throughput goals.
- Establish and maintain calibration data integrity practices, including labeling standards, versioning, traceability, and automated data checks.
- Partner with software engineers to build or integrate software-based calibration tools, automation scripts, and validation pipelines as we transition away from hardware-heavy approaches.
- Design scalable calibration and QC workflows that can be executed reliably by vendors, regional operations teams, and automated pipelines.
- Analyze calibration performance data and field feedback to drive continuous improvements in accuracy, robustness, and reliability.
- Support integration and validation efforts for new sensor and compute configurations, including bench-level testing and first-article vehicle builds.
- Coordinate with facilities and operations teams on lab layouts, environmental controls, equipment uptime, and safety compliance.
- Train and mentor technicians and cross-functional partners on calibration methods, equipment handling, data integrity, and workflow adoption.

## Basic Qualifications

- 5+ years of hands-on experience in sensor calibration, hardware testing, systems integration, or related engineering roles in automotive, robotics, aerospace, or industrial environments.
- Strong understanding of multi-sensor calibration fundamentals (camera, LiDAR, radar, IMU, or similar).
- Experience developing and executing SOPs, test procedures, or quality processes for complex systems.
- Proficiency in measurement and diagnostic tools (oscilloscopes, alignment lasers, calibration targets, optical measurement systems).
- Solid foundation in Linux command line and scripting (bash, Python, or similar) for calibration automation, data checks, or workflow tooling.
- Excellent organizational, documentation, and communication skills, with a focus on rigor, clarity, and repeatability.
- Proven ability to work cross-functionally in lab, production, or fleet environments and manage complex workflows.

## Preferred Qualifications

- Experience with vehicle perception systems or multi-sensor calibration frameworks (e.g., Kalibr, OpenCV calibration tools, ROS-based workflows).
- Solid understanding of 3D geometry, linear algebra, and numerical optimization techniques (e.g., least squares, non-linear optimization libraries like Ceres or g2o).
- Experience with photogrammetry or Structure from Motion (SfM).
- Familiarity with deep learning-based approaches for sensor calibration.
- Hands-on experience with camera models (pinhole, fisheye) and LiDAR/radar point cloud processing
- Familiarity with software-based calibration pipelines, perception model alignment, or automated sensor validation tooling.
- Background in hardware automation, test infrastructure design, or scaling calibration throughput.
- Ability to balance hands-on equipment work with system-level design, tooling ownership, and documentation for large-scale operational rollout.
- Bachelor’s degree in Mechanical, Electrical, Robotics, or Systems Engineering (or equivalent practical experience).

For Sunnyvale, CA-based roles: The base salary range for this role is USD$180,000 per year - USD$200,000 per year.

You will be eligible to participate in Uber's bonus program, and may be offered an equity award & other types of comp. You will also be eligible for various benefits. More details can be found at the following link [https://www.uber.com/careers/benefits](https://www.uber.com/careers/benefits).

jobs.title: Especialista de Atendimento (PCD) - Espaço Uber Barra Funda
Head of Customer Success - Enterprise Regional
locations: New York, New York, United States
jobs.description:
**About the Role**

As a Manager of Customer Success Management, you will play a critical role in ensuring merchant success. This role is going to be split between leading a team focused on optimizing operational health _(including a combination of operational efficiency, customer experience, and financial health)_, and enabling and driving revenue growth by supporting upselling and cross-selling efforts working hand-to-hand with Client Partners, Account Management Managers and Heads of Segment, to analyze merchant performance, identify operational pain points, and develop tailored solutions to merchants. Your role will be a co-orchestrator of our Enterprise Partnerships, ensuring their ongoing success.

**What You'll Do**

**Lead a team** of Customer Success Managers, ensuring the timely and accurate monitoring of merchant operational health, driving product adoption, executing on agreed plans, ensuring customer retention and expansion, and guiding them in the right direction to effectively identify and solve potential issues.

**Co-own and manage relationships** with key restaurant brands, **developing and executing the strategy** to achieve quarterly and annual growth goals.

**Drive revenue growth** by identifying upselling and cross-selling opportunities, expanding product adoption and communicating the value of our newest products with a lens of creativity to differentiate our offering.

**Analyze performance** metrics to identify growth opportunities​ **and present data-driven** recommendations to help partners optimize their performance.

**Employ critical thinking and creative problem-solving** skills to navigate relationships and difficult partner conversations performance.

**Build strong relationships** with senior stakeholders and key decision-makers both internally and externally.

**Handle the big picture and the tiny details.** You are organized, timely and ensure nothing gets missed; you are also attuned to high-level strategy and consistently come up with new ways to add value to existing partnerships.

**Partner with cross-functional teams.** Be the voice of the customer and effectively navigate internal processes with partners from various teams such as Product, Marketing, Operations, Legal, Finance, etc.

### **Basic Qualifications:**

- A minimum of 8+ years of relevant experience in strategic sales or account management with Enterprise clients (preferably in a tech, SaaS, advertising or retail media company).
- Bachelor's degree in Economics, Finance, Business Administration, or a related field.
- Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively collaborate with internal and external stakeholders.
- Creative thinker with a passion for problem-solving and driving innovation.
- Ability to thrive in a fast-paced and constantly evolving environment, with a proactive and results-driven mindset.
- Proven track record of driving revenue growth and achieving targets​.
- Basic proficiency in SQL, with the ability to adjust and refine queries as needed.

### **Preferred Qualifications:**

- Excellent listening, communication and relationship-building abilities​. Experience managing high-value relationships and influence stakeholders, securing buy-in with senior external partners.
- Proficiency in negotiation, forecasting, and problem-solving skills. Experience selling into or partnering with large, complex enterprise brands and organizations.
- Organizational skills - you’ll need to prioritize ongoing processes and projects simultaneously.
- Data-driven decision mentality and sound business judgment through strong analytical thinking. Ability to translate data into insights and consult on core business objectives.
- Track record of building and executing strategic sales/marketing plans (quarterly & annual).
- Ability to work cross-functionally and manage multiple stakeholders.
- Speed, resourcefulness, and a go-getter mentality. You are comfortable working in a fast-paced environment and navigating ambiguity.
- Experience with CRM and analytics tools (e.g., Salesforce).
- Proficiency in Microsoft Excel, Google Sheets, and reporting tools for data analysis.

jobs.title: Learning and Development Specialist IV - Sales Trainer
jobs.description:
**About the Role**

The Sales Trainer will be a key driver in maximizing sales effectiveness and quality across our BPO partner network. This role will work closely with the Community Operations Learning team and, crucially, will partner with **Digital Sales Operations** to ensure training programs are aligned with strategic sales goals, process efficiency, and performance metrics.

The ideal candidate for the Sales Trainer role brings deep sales enablement expertise and a strong commitment to elevating revenue performance. They model high standards of sales excellence and consistently inspire better execution through their knowledge and craft. This Sales Trainer will spend dedicated time traveling and conducting Train-the-Trainer (TTT) sessions in our Outsourcing BPO Partners

**What the Candidate Will Need / Bonus Points**

\-\-\-\- What the Candidate Will Do ----

- Lead trainings and TTT sessions for BPO trainers on the 10-day onboarding, evergreen modules, and initiative launches.
- Ensure that facilitation guides, role plays, and QA frameworks are properly understood and applied by BPO trainers.
- Partner with Enablement to validate content accuracy, provide feedback on gaps, and ensure commercial concepts are not diluted during delivery.
- Manage ongoing calibration sessions with BPO trainers to reinforce quality and consistency across sites.
- Act as the first line of feedback for Enablement on delivery challenges, regional nuances, and trainer capability gaps.
- Support with local and region specific content updates.

\-\-\-\- Basic Qualifications ----

- At least 3 years of experience in training & development
- Some experience designing learning materials
- Strong communication, time management, teamwork,  collaboration, and prioritization skills
- Previous facilitation experience
- Some business or creative writing experience
- Relevant training certifications
- Stakeholder management and project management

\-\-\-\- Preferred Qualifications ----

- 3+ years of experience specifically in a B2B or B2C Sales Enablement, Sales Training, or Sales Coaching role within a high-growth or tech environment.
- Certification or advanced training in a recognized Sales Methodology (e.g., Challenger Sale, SPIN Selling, Sandler Training).
- Demonstrated ability to design, develop, and implement blended learning solutions (including e-learning, virtual, and in-person) for a remote/outsourced sales workforce.
- Direct experience working with, or managing training for, Business Process Outsourcing (BPO) partners in a multinational context.
- Proficiency with Learning Management Systems (LMS) administration and e-learning authoring tools (e.g., Seismic,
- 3+ years of relevant experience with proven facilitation experience, ideally with exposure to L&D or enablement in a sales context.
- Strong sales background in SMB sales, with hands-on experience in selling, objection handling, and value-based pitching.
- Familiarity with training methods and techniques.
- Advanced organisational skills with the ability to handle multiple assignments.
- Fluency in English
- Must work well in a team environment, contributing to a synergistic work environment where people learn from one another and continuously improve processes
- Ability to adapt global curricula to regional market realities and to support localization with relevant examples and scenarios.
- Proficiency with core sales tools (Salesforce, Seismic, Outreach/Groove) to model best practices for BPO trainers.

For Chicago, IL-based roles: The base hourly rate amount for this role is USD$34.50 per hour.

You will be eligible to participate in Uber's bonus program, and may be offered other types of comp. You will also be eligible for various benefits. More details can be found at the following link [https://www.uber.com/careers/benefits](https://www.uber.com/careers/benefits).

jobs.title: Staff Software Engineer
jobs.description:
**About the Role**

The Membership team is responsible for developing and reinventing the Uber and UberEats app to be a member-first experience from: price to perks . You will be on a super collaborative team designed to maximize your ability to deliver results. You will be working on code that's closest to the eaters today and consumers in the future. Your work will impact the foundations of Uber around the world. You will be building the biggest lever for Uber.

For an industry synonymous with convenience, it’s ironic that the first thing you have to do when you pick up your phone is make a bunch of repetitive decisions. Uber Members will get something nobody else does: a single platform across all their on-demand needs, anywhere in the world, that always guarantees the best: price, selection, priority, and perks.

jobs.title: Sr Staff Software Engineer - Compute Platform
jobs.description:
**About the Role**

We are seeking a highly experienced Senior Staff Engineer to lead the technical strategy and execution for our Compute Platform team in Bangalore, with a focus on Kubernetes orchestration and cloud-native infrastructure. This individual will be responsible for designing, scaling, and evolving the systems that power our mission-critical applications, enabling developers across the company to build, deploy, and operate services with speed, reliability, and security.

As a senior technical leader, you will define architectural direction, guide large-scale initiatives, and mentor engineers while collaborating across product and infrastructure organizations.

**What you'll do**

1. Own the technical vision, architecture, and strategy for the global compute platform org.
2. Define and execute the roadmap for our compute platform, focusing on scalability, performance, and efficiency.
3. Drive architectural decisions and set technical direction for compute scheduling, resource allocation, and container orchestration systems.
4. Ensure high availability and reliability of the compute platform through best-in-class observability, automation, and incident response practices.
5. Drive adoption of best practices in scalability, availability, and security for multi-tenant compute environments.
6. Evaluate emerging technologies in cloud-native ecosystems and guide their integration into the platform.
7. Partner with product and infrastructure teams to deliver high-impact, cross-organizational initiatives.
8. Mentor and coach engineers, helping grow their technical depth and leadership skills.
9. Influence company-wide engineering standards and practices.

**What you'll Need**

1. 10+ years of software engineering experience, including expertise in distributed systems or infrastructure engineering.
2. Deep expertise in Kubernetes internals, container runtimes, and cloud-native compute platforms.
3. Strong background in containerization, resource scheduling, and cluster management at scale.
4. Hands-on experience with performance tuning, reliability engineering, and cost optimization in compute environments.
5. Excellent leadership, communication, and organizational skills, with a track record of building and mentoring high-performing teams.
6. Strong coding proficiency in one or more languages such as Go, Java, or Python.
7. Demonstrated ability to drive cross-functional technical initiatives and deliver impactful results.

\-\-\-\- Preferred Qualifications ----

1. Experience with hybrid cloud or multi-cloud compute environments.
2. Contributions to open-source Kubernetes or CNCF projects.
3. Familiarity with modern stateful data infra and ML platforms running on top of compute infrastructure.
4. Knowledge of emerging compute paradigms such as serverless, GPU scheduling, or federated orchestration.
5. Prior experience working in fast-paced, large-scale environments with mission-critical workloads.
6. Experience mentoring engineers at staff+ level.

jobs.title: Ad Operations Specialist
jobs.description:
**#GreatMindsDon’tThinkAlike** At Uber, we take pride in our diversity and working environment that sees you as more than just a person that can do the job, but a unique individual that can level up our organization with a perspective only you can offer. Uber provides a truly open culture that encourages all to voice their thoughts.

**About the Role**

The **Ad Operations Specialist** will play a key role in Uber Advertising across Australia, New Zealand, Japan, and Taiwan, working closely with offshore teams and sales to ensure seamless campaign setup and execution. Based in Sydney or Melbourne but working across all APAC countries, this role will drive business growth, acting as a local escalation point for Sponsored Listings and Display Ad campaigns, while also bridging the gap between business needs and offshore trafficking teams.

This is **a technical operations role** that requires **strong problem-solving skills** and comfort working with complex ad-serving systems.

The role is critical to the success of Uber's advertising partners, their campaigns, and the in-country Ad Sales teams across APAC. With Ads being one of Uber’s major growth priorities, this position is essential in the market. As Uber’s portfolio of advertisers expands, this role will be pivotal in scaling operational processes to support continued sales growth.

**Your Impact in Role**

You’ll thrive in this role if you enjoy solving complex problems, dissecting issues across multiple systems, and working closely with technical and engineering partners.

- Dive deep - troubleshoot technical issues with campaigns and, if necessary, escalate to engineering.
- Facilitate calls between sales and offshore teams to ensure the optimal setup of campaigns with complex, multi-layered logic.
- Escalate challenges and blockers that hinder the campaign execution workflow to cross-functional teams worldwide.
- Understand ad platform updates that affect campaign setup and communicate these to stakeholders.
- Participate in pre-campaign discussions to ensure complex campaigns are set up for success from the beginning.
- Assist in the regional deployment of global operational initiatives.
- Act as the point of contact (POC) for the ad-server platform, collaborating with local and central subject matter experts to resolve issues.
- Track and monitor key weekly operational & performance metrics using internal tooling, often requiring SQL, as well as product dashboards.

**The Experience You'll Bring**

- Proven experience in the digital advertising industry, with a strong understanding of ad operations, technology, scripting, and working with ad-tech and backend systems.
- Comfortable navigating complex systems and independently resolving ambiguous technical issues.
- Minimum three years of experience in Ad Operations, AdTech, digital advertising, or a similar role at a data-driven, tech-savvy company.
- Strong communication skills, with the ability to work independently.
- Analytical mindset, with data-driven and quantitative skills, including proficiency in MS Excel and Salesforce.
- Strong project management and stakeholder management skills.

**Preferred Qualifications**

- Bachelor's degree in a quantitative, scientific or technical field.
- Experience in the ANZ market, working with advertisers across various industries.
- Hands-on experience in managing and optimizing digital advertising campaigns.

jobs.title: 2026 Program Manager II, Tech, ISB, India
jobs.description:
**About the Role**

Uber Scaled Solutions is one of Uber’s biggest bets, with the ambition to build one of the world’s largest data foundries for AI applications. Data Labeling operations is a core functional team within Uber AI Solutions (UAIS), responsible for the end-to-end lifecycle of annotation programs for B2B clients. At its core, our success in this space is defined by our ability to build industry-leading data annotation programs.

As a seasoned program manager, you will be a “builder-owner” with a “go-get-it” mindset who is ready to solve and build early stage projects. You will also solve zero-to-one problems by demonstrating the ability to build the vision while rolling up your sleeves to dive deep into execution and identify opportunities for improvement. See the forest and the trees, we say. You will also represent UAIS along with our Account executive in front of our customers and hence have to demonstrate a strong customer-obsessed mindset

You will drive cross-functional efforts with geographically distributed teams including Operations, Product, Engineering and Legal to define the Program level execution strategy, product roadmap, define scalable data labeling workflows leveraging internal tools, external vendors, and automation.

\-\-\-\- What the Candidate Will Do ----

**Core Operations and Execution**

- **Zero-to-One Strategy**: Define programs and key objectives from scratch to support LLM model training in the burgeoning Gen AI space.
- **Operational Muscle:** Design and drive scalable data labeling workflows that leverage internal tools, external vendors, and automation.
- **Optimization:** Relentlessly optimize workflows for efficiency, accuracy, and cost-effectiveness, incorporating active learning and pre-labeling.
- **Resource Management:** Forecast resource requirements and manage program budgets, including vendor costs and internal resource allocation to meet deadlines.
- **Quality Frameworks:** Implement robust quality assurance processes and use metrics like inter-annotator agreement and precision/recall to monitor and improve output

### **Project Governance**

- **Client Representation:** Act as a key technical lead in Customer meetings, translating complex requirements into success criteria.
- **Cross-Functional Leadership:** Drive efforts across Operations, Product, Engineering, and Legal to define Program-level Ops strategy.
- **Vendor Management:** Engage and manage high-level relationships with data labeling vendors, ensuring adherence to strict quality standards.
- **Inclusive Advocacy:** Influence stakeholders to adopt inclusive and unbiased labeling practices to mitigate bias in AI models

### —\- Basic Qualifications —-

- **4+ years of experience** managing scaled operations programs, with 1+ year in GenAI/model training including text, image, video or audio data labeling
- Graduating in 2026.
- **Proven track record** of managing large-scale projects with cross-functional teams and external vendors in fast-paced, **ambiguous environments**.
- **Strong technical knowledge** of machine learning concepts and data annotation platforms.
- **Excellent communications skills**, both written and verbal, with the ability to influence technical and non-technical stakeholders

### **Preferred Qualifications**

- **Exceptional Communication:** Mastery of written and verbal communication with the ability to **influence both technical and non-technical stakeholders**.
- **Builder Mindset:** Demonstrated ability to take initiative, make **big bets**, and work independently across internal and external organizations.
- **Domain Expertise:** Familiarity with human-in-the-loop systems, data annotations tools, and ethical AI best practices
- **Technical knowledge** of machine learning concepts and data annotation platforms.
- Strong understanding of the gig economy landscape, freelancer behaviors, and recruitment strategies

jobs.title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer - Ranking and Recommendations
locations: New York, New York, United States
jobs.description:
**About the Role**

The Shopping Ranking Team mission is enabling eaters to effortlessly make shopping decisions and find what they need. We pursue this mission via an ML-driven algorithmic approach, applying state-of-the-art Machine Learning (ML), Optimization techniques to learn from massive datasets Uber has, and build a scalable and reliable shopping intelligence ranking and recommendation systems.

We are actively seeking a Senior Machine Learning Engineer who excels in problem-solving and critical thinking, is proficient in coding, with proven track records of learning and growth, and has a deep interest in ML model, feature and infrastructure development. Candidates will have the opportunity to work across various lines, from infrastructure development to ML model development, productionalization, offering a diverse and enriching experience.

Join us in our pursuit of excellence as we are building the next generation of shopping ranking and recommendation systems.

**What the Candidate Will Need / Bonus Points**

\-\-\-\- What the Candidate Will Do ----

1. Design and build Machine Learning models in Ranking and Recommendation domain.
2. Productionize and deploy these models for real-world application.
3. Review code and designs of teammates, providing constructive feedback.
4. Collaborate with Product and cross-functional teams to brainstorm new solutions and iterate on the product.

\-\-\-\- Basic Qualifications ----

1. Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics or related field, with 4+ years of full-time engineering experience.
2. 4+ years of ML experience and building ML models
3. Experience working with multiple multi-functional teams(product, science, product ops etc).
4. Expertise in one or more object-oriented programming languages (e.g. Python, Go, Java, C++).
5. Experience with big-data architecture, ETL frameworks and platforms, such as HDFS, Hive, MapReduce, Spark, , etc.
6. Working knowledge of latest ML technologies, and libraries, such as PyTorch, TensorFlow, Ray, etc.
7. Proven track records of being a fast learner and go-getter, with willingness to get out of the comfort zone.

\-\-\-\- Preferred Qualifications ----

1. Experience with building ranking and recommendation systems in production, making practical tradeoffs among algorithm sophistication, compute complexity, maintainability, and extensibility in production environments.
2. Experience with taking on vague business problems, translating them into ML + Optimization formulation, identifying the right features, model structure and optimization constraints, and delivering business impact.
3. Experience with design and architecture of ML systems and workflows.
4. Experience owning and delivering a technically challenging, multi-quarter project end to end.

jobs.title: Sr Staff Program Manager, Tech
jobs.description:
**About the Team:**

At Uber, we reimagine the way the world moves for the better. There are several operations and technologies that enable this mission and Uber’s GSS (Global Scaled Solutions) org, now externally known as Uber AI Solutions, leads many of those capabilities such as data annotation, generation and evals for AI/ML innovation, app testing, localization/internationalization, map editing, digitization programs and more. We combine technology and human intelligence optimally to run these scaled programs. To do this efficiently and with high quality, we have built industry leading tech and ops muscle and have now externalized the same.

The tech+ops solution coupled with Uber’s strength of building a platform for flexible work will enable enterprises world-wide to accelerate their data, AI and product journeys. We have seen a lot of positive traction and demand from enterprises as we incubated this business and now are looking to grow this into a meaningful business line for Uber. While we do this, we look forward to creating flexible earnings opportunities through digital tasks for millions of people across the world. Together, our tech, operations expertise and platform for knowledge work are uniquely positioned to be the best-in-class human in the loop solution for the industry.

One of the capabilities we are growing is data collection - both in field and remote - with customers across Gen AI, Autonomous Vehicles, Mapping, Telco, CPG/Retail and more. With unparalleled access to our earner network globally and tech capabilities, we aim to be a leader in the space and are looking for experts to help build and shape this capability.

**About the role**

We are building one of the most scalable, high-quality data collection engines powering the next generation of AI. Our projects span audio, image, video, LiDAR, text, and multimodal datasets, across dozens of countries and environments.

We are looking for a Senior Staff Program Manager to own and drive complex, multi-country data collection programs end-to-end.

This role is ideal for someone who has thrived in startup environments where speed, hustle, and creative problem-solving matter more than rigid process. You will manage diverse contributor networks, oversee global operations, and ensure datasets meet strict client standards and high quality, at scale.

**What the Candidate Will Do:**

- **Program Management and Ownership:** Translate client SOWs into executable programs — scope, timelines, budgets, workforce model, and quality control frameworks.
- **Execution Excellence:** Solve operational bottlenecks in real time — whether it’s participant churn, equipment issues, location access, or low-quality submissions - and ensure program delivery and success. Build processes, systems and playbooks that help scale data collection programs systemically
- **Quality & Compliance:** Ensure data meets specs, surpasses accuracy thresholds, and complies with privacy/consent/data protection laws globally.
- **Stakeholder Management:** Act as the program point of contact with clients, internal teams, and external vendors. Provide progress reports, risk assessments, and mitigation plans.
- **Analytics & Reporting:** Monitor collection KPIs via dashboards, identify issues early, and drive corrective action.
- **Continuous Improvement:** Codify learnings into playbooks and SOPs for repeatability and faster future deployments.
- **Cross-functional collaboration and influence:** Influence our tech roadmap to build a world class data collection engine. Work with privacy, legal, ops and supply teams to unlock new use cases, markets and scale programs

**Basic Qualifications:**

- 8+ years experience in program management or operations, with a strong background in field execution, network rollout, retail infrastructure setup, survey/logistics operations, or IoT deployments.
- Proven ability to design and manage multi-region programs involving devices, people, and data workflows.
- Experience managing large external vendor ecosystems and multi-million-dollar budgets.
- Strong stakeholder management skills — able to translate complex technical requirements into executable field plans.
- Excellent leadership, problem-solving, and communication abilities.
- Willingness to travel periodically to oversee field operations.

**Preferred Qualifications:**

- Experience in AI data collection, autonomous systems, or network data testing environments.
- Familiarity with sensor-based collection technologies (LiDAR, cameras, GPS, or RF-based systems).

For Sunnyvale, CA-based roles: The base salary range for this role is USD$212,000 per year - USD$235,500 per year.

You will be eligible to participate in Uber's bonus program, and may be offered an equity award & other types of comp. You will also be eligible for various benefits. More details can be found at the following link [https://www.uber.com/careers/benefits](https://www.uber.com/careers/benefits).

locations: New York, New York, United States
jobs.location: New York, New York, United States
jobs.description:
**About the Role**

Grocery is Uber’s fastest growing business line, delighting customers with next-hour delivery of household essentials from their favorite local stores. The Delivery Experience team is focused on building best-in-class products and technology to help shoppers fulfill grocery orders.

The Delivery Experience team is looking for a strong Backend engineer to help build the next generation of fulfillment tools to allow shoppers to quickly and accurately pick and pack items. As a backend engineer, you'll be responsible for features from the inception to launch. You'll collaborate closely with engineers across the tech stack and be expected to give input on how we design new experiences for our shoppers.

**\-\-\-\- What the Candidate Will Do ----**

1. Lead the design, development, and deployment of scalable and reliable backend systems for Shopper Experience team
2. Collaborate with cross-functional teams including data scientists, product managers, and other engineering teams to deliver end-to-end solutions.
3. Develop and enhance our platform infrastructure to support advanced analytics and experimentation capabilities.
4. Implement robust developer and testing infrastructure to streamline development workflows and ensure high-quality code.
5. Drive continuous improvement in system architecture and operational excellence, with a focus on performance, scalability, and maintainability.
6. Stay current with the latest technologies and industry trends, evaluating and integrating new tools and methodologies as appropriate.

1. Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related technical field or equivalent practical experience
2. Proficiency in one or more programming languages such as Java, C++, Python, or Go.
3. Strong experience with distributed systems and microservices architecture
4. Proven track record in designing and implementing large-scale, high-performance systems.
5. Experience with data analytics and experimental design in an engineering context.
6. Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to think critically and creatively.
7. 5+ years of experience as a Backend engineer

5. Demonstrated leadership skills, with experience in mentoring and guiding junior engineers.
6. Proven experience of shipping high-quality product features on schedule and with high velocity

jobs.title: Legal Director Mexico
jobs.description:
**About the Role**

The Legal Director for Mexico leads the legal strategy for one of Uber’s most vital and complex global markets. You will own the whole legal landscape for Uber Rides, Uber Eats, and all new initiatives, operating at the intersection of fast-paced business innovation and a fluid regulatory environment. This role requires sharp judgment, business acumen, risk tolerance, and the ability to influence other stakeholders as the business operates at an urgent pace.

This is not a role for following a playbook; you will be writing one in real-time for a rapidly evolving, high-stakes environment. You'll navigate critical litigation, major policy shifts, and the pressure of public scrutiny, making decisions that have immediate real-world impact on millions of users and earners, while managing a team. The challenge of building trust and driving the business forward in this high-growth environment is what makes this work so profoundly meaningful.

**What You’ll Do**

- Lead and develop the in-country legal team, fostering a high-performance culture that operates as a core business partner across all functions in the Mexico market.
- Act as the chief legal counsel and a trusted advisor to the Mexico General Manager and the cross-functional leadership team on country-level strategy, risk management, and regulatory compliance.
- Navigate and direct legal strategy for critical, high-profile litigation, regulatory challenges, and public policy issues that shape the future of ridesharing and delivery in Mexico.
- Manage high-stakes external counsel relationships, ensuring quality, cost-effectiveness, and alignment with our internal standards and commitment to diversity.
- Translate legal complexity into clear, systems-based, and actionable advice that enables continuous innovation and efficiency across the Uber Rides and Uber Eats platforms.
- How you’ll spend your time:

  - 30% Strategic Decision-Making and Policy Influence
  - 30% Team Leadership and Development
  - 20% High-Stakes Litigation and Risk Management
  - 20% Cross-Functional Alignment and Internal Consulting

**What You’ll Need**

- 12+ years of significant post-qualification experience (PQE) in a top-tier law firm or as in-house counsel, with at least 5+ years in a leadership role managing a legal team.
- Law degree (JD or equivalent) from an accredited university and admitted to practice law in Mexico.
- LLM from a university in an English-speaking country, or equivalent professional experience in such jurisdiction.
- Professional working fluency in both Spanish and English (written and verbal) is required to draft legal documents and advise senior global stakeholders.
- Demonstrated experience navigating high-stakes regulatory matters in Mexico's legal environment.
- Strong background in high-stakes administrative litigation.
- Inclusive leadership style that fosters collaboration, trust, and accountability.

**Preferred qualifications**

- Experience providing legal counsel for high-growth technology platforms (e.g., ridesharing, delivery, FinTech) in a highly regulated and fast-evolving market.
- Proven ability to lead through ambiguity and make rapid, high-quality decisions with incomplete information and shifting priorities.
- History of effectively managing a high-volume litigation portfolio and driving policy outcomes with governmental agencies.
- Strong cross-functional influence skills to drive One Uber decisions and align diverse regional and global teams on a unified legal strategy.

### **Who We’re Looking For**

- A business-minded lawyer who sees the law as a tool to enable growth, not just to manage risk.
- A creative problem solver who thrives in ambiguity and finds practical solutions where there’s no clear rulebook.
- Someone who uses influence and persuasion, not hierarchy, to move people and decisions forward.
- A confident communicator who isn’t afraid to use their voice, even when their view is unpopular, and knows how to do so with tact and credibility.
- A strong partner to the business: proactive, curious, and able to translate complex legal issues into clear, actionable guidance.
- A calm, steady presence under pressure who keeps perspective and helps others do the same.
- A people leader who raises the bar for their team, develops talent, and fosters trust and accountability.
- Someone who balances conviction with humility, firm in their principles, but open to feedback and new ideas.

Uber's mission is to reimagine the way the world moves for the better. Here, bold ideas create real-world impact, challenges drive growth, and speed fuelds progress. What moves us, moves the world - let’s move it forward, together.

jobs.title: Senior Global Account Executive - Direct, Global Delivery Partnerships
locations: New York, New York, United States
jobs.description:
**About the Role**

The Uber Eats team is looking for sharp, highly motivated individuals to join our Global Delivery Partnerships team with a focus on managing and expanding relationships with our largest global restaurant partners such as RBI, Domino’s, and Starbucks. As a Global Account Executive, you will be responsible for building new commercial partnerships and renegotiating existing agreements that define how these iconic QSR brands leverage Uber Direct’s white-label delivery solutions.

Who are we looking for? Someone who has proven success negotiating commercial agreements, building best-in-class partnerships with complex brands, and developing deep executive-level relationships; this person is also passionate about food and Uber, and thrives in a fast-paced, cross-functional environment. Your primary focus will be working with our restaurant partners and internally across Product, Engineering, Marketing, Operations, Legal, and Finance to develop shared goals and strategies to grow and optimize our partnerships in the US and across mega-regions.

**What You'll Do**

- Build relationships with C-level executives and key decision makers within partner organizations
- Develop and execute partnership strategy to achieve quarterly growth goals
- Expand product adoption and increase marketing investment, clearly communicating the value of our newest products with a lens of creativity to differentiate our offerings
- Employ critical thinking and creative problem-solving skills to navigate negotiations and difficult partner conversations
- Handle the big picture and the tiny details. You are organized, timely and ensure nothing gets missed; you are also attuned to high-level strategy and consistently come up with new ways to add value to existing partnerships
- Partner with cross-functional teams. Be the voice of the customer and seamlessly navigate internal processes with stakeholders from various teams such as Product, Engineering, Marketing, Operations, Legal, Finance, and more
- Bring your analytical A-game. Develop business models and analyses with Ops Analysts to understand trends, provide meaningful insights, and track the impact of initiatives against our goals

**Basic Qualifications**

- Minimum of 8 years of full-time experience in end-to-end Enterprise sales and/or partnerships

**Preferred** **Qualifications**

- Experience leading conversations with executive-level external stakeholders
- Experience selling into or working with large, complex enterprise brands and organizations
- Experience with food delivery and/or third-party marketplaces at a high-growth tech company
- Experience working in ads sales, marketing, operations, business development or partnerships at a leading restaurant or CPG brand
- Experience building and executing strategic sales plans that result in success

jobs.title: Sr Manager, Science - Driver Pricing
jobs.description:
**About the Role**

The Driver Pricing science team, jointly with the driver pricing engineering orgs, is responsible for driver offer pricing algorithms, driver promotions, and driver positioning, driving marketplace efficiency, consistency, and long term driver health through these algorithms. It is also responsible for measurements and long term studies for monitoring of health of these systems and our driver community.

**What You'll Do**

- Manage and support a team or scientists and science managers
- Work with eng and product partners to continuously optimize key pricing and promotion systems
- Come up with metrics and measurements/ experimentation methodology to learn about the impact of these systems
- Work with business/operations teams to give insights about marketplace health, earnings health, and help solve global business problems.

**Basic Qualifications**

- Ph.D. degree in Math, Economics, Bioinformatics, Statistics, Engineering, or other quantitative fields
- Minimum of 7 years of experience with 4 years of people management experience.
- Experience in building and managing high performance science teams - including mentoring and coaching senior ICs and people managers.
- Experience with experimental design, exploratory data analysis, statistical analysis, causal inference, and model development.

**Preferred Qualifications**

- Proficient in both a data ETL language (e.g. SQL) and a scripting language like Python or R for data analysis.
- Track record in prioritizing and driving multiple work-streams forward simultaneously
- Ability to empower a team while providing them with career paths that align with business goals.
- Proven track record of collaborating with and influencing stakeholders.
- Principled yet pragmatic, having conviction and being authentic in your approach, but situationally aware enough to adapt when needed.
- Exhibit sound business judgment, long term and deep analytical thinking. Adept at influencing various stakeholders.
- Excellent storyteller with the ability to translate deep technical subjects into understandable narratives for non-technical audiences.
- Able to build a clear technical vision of the system that balances customer empathy, business needs and practical considerations.

jobs.title: Machine Learning Engineer II, Pricing
locations: New York, New York, United States
jobs.description:
**About the Role**

Uber’s Marketplace is at the heart of Uber’s business and the Dynamic Supply Pricing (DSP) team develops the models, algorithms, signals, and large-scale distributed systems that power real-time driver pricing for billions of rides. Engineers on the team work on cutting-edge marketplace ML problems and real-time multi-objective optimizations serving 1M+ predictions/second. They regularly present $1B+ opportunities to executive stakeholders and receive close mentorship from the most senior engineers within the organization, setting you up for fast-tracked career growth and the opportunity to learn from experienced technical leaders.

We are looking for exceptional ML engineers with a track record of extraordinary impact and with a passion for building large-scale systems that optimize multi-sided real-time marketplaces. In this role, you will lead the design, development, and productionization of advanced ML models and pricing algorithms, covering deep learning, causal modeling, and reinforcement learning. You will work with engineers, product managers, and scientists to set the team’s technical direction and solve some of Uber’s most challenging and most complex business problems in order to provide earnings opportunities for millions of drivers worldwide.

**What You Will Do**

- Design, develop, and productionize end-to-end ML solutions for large-scale distributed systems serving billions of trips
- Develop novel pricing approaches for online marketplaces combining machine learning, algorithmic game theory, and optimization to provide earnings opportunities for millions of drivers
- Partner with senior engineers to plan the scope and execution of projects and mentor junior team members on design and implementation
- Work with a team of engineers, product managers, and scientists to design and deliver high-impact technical solutions to complex business problems

**Basic Qualifications**

- Ph.D., M.S. or Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Machine Learning, or Operations Research, or equivalent technical background with exceptional demonstrated impact
- 2+ years of experience in developing and deploying machine learning models and optimization algorithms in large-scale production environments
- Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, Scala, Java, or Go
- Experience with large-scale data systems (e.g. Spark, Ray), real-time processing (e.g. Flink), and microservices architectures
- Experience in the development, training, productionization and monitoring of ML solutions at scale, ranging from offline pipelines to online serving and MLOps
- Familiarity with modern ML algorithms (e.g. DNNs, multi-task models, transformers) and mathematical optimization (e.g. LP, convex optimization), combined with proven ability and ambition to continuously deepen expertise in these areas

**Preferred Qualifications**

- Experience in translating ambiguous business problems into technical solutions in a structured and principled way
- Strong communication skills, including through documentation and design discussions
- Experience in developing and deploying pricing algorithms for multi-sided real-time marketplaces with strategic agent behavior
- Experience in reinforcement learning and causal machine learning

The Uber Advertising Sales team is looking for strategic sellers to be founding members of our newly formed Uber Advertising division. As an Ads Client Partner, you will be responsible for building mutually beneficial advertising partnerships with our largest partners within the export business.

You will own the advertising sales strategy for a portfolio of top brands and drive adoption of a growing suite of ad offerings across our Mobility and Delivery platforms. You will also work closely with our Partner Managers to consistently deliver on our partners’ marketing objectives.

- Proven success in selling advertising solutions to large, complex enterprise brands and organizations

jobs.title: Senior Enterprise Account Executive, Uber AI Solutions
jobs.description:
_**This is a hybrid role and you must be located in, or willing to relocate to, San Francisco for the position.**_

**About the Role**

At Uber, we're reimagining how the world moves for the better. Uber AI Solutions powers this mission by delivering advanced capabilities in synthetic data generation, localization, map editing, product testing, and AI-driven customer support — now extending these strengths to enterprises to accelerate their own AI and automation journeys.

As a Senior Enterprise Account Executive, you’ll drive revenue growth and cultivate strategic enterprise relationships across the GenAI and Technology verticals.

You will own the full sales cycle, from identifying opportunities to closing strategic deals, while ensuring exceptional delivery and customer satisfaction. This role combines business development, strategic execution, and cross-functional leadership to drive measurable impact and long-term growth.

**What You’ll Do**

- Identify, prospect, and build relationships with key enterprise customers across the GenAI and Technology verticals.
- Secure new enterprise partnerships by engaging key decision-makers and influencers, understanding their current and future needs, and delivering tailored AI and automation solutions.
- Consistently meet and exceed revenue targets, identifying opportunities for Uber AI Solutions to expand its impact across customer organizations.
- Lead executive meetings, solution demonstrations, and strategic sales engagements to advance opportunities and close high-value deals.
- Partner cross-functionally with implementation, strategy, operations, and product teams to ensure seamless delivery and customer success.
- Stay informed on emerging GenAI trends, market developments, and competitive dynamics to inform go-to-market strategy.
- Represent Uber AI Solutions at industry events and conferences, strengthening market presence and cultivating long-term relationships.

**Basic Qualifications**

- 5+ years of sales experience (minimum 4 years in a full sales cycle role: prospecting, outreach, pitching & closing) in a technology environment
- 1+ years of experience selling data labeling/annotation, language services, and/or quality/testing OR B2B sales experience at Uber
- Experience selling new products or in new markets

**Preferred Qualifications**

- Bachelor’s degree or equivalent
- 8+ years of B2B sales experience within the AI ecosystem, spanning advanced technology domains such as MLOps platforms, data operations, data labeling, and emerging GenAI infrastructure and applications.
- Proven experience securing new business meetings through cold outreach and partnering effectively with BDR/SDR teams to build pipeline.
- Ability to gather and translate customer technical requirements into solutions, with experience running pilots or trials to drive customer adoption and support deal closure
- Demonstrated success selling in challenging market conditions and partnering with Product teams to shape roadmap and development
- Experience working with legal and procurement teams and/or senior stakeholders
- Adept at Salesforce and Excel/Google Sheets - reporting, data analysis, and process improvement
- Revenue/forecasting experience
- Experience working in a start-up or entrepreneurial work environment
- Strong interpersonal, presentation, and negotiation skills
- Experience using Outreach, Linkedin Sales Navigator, Zoominfo, and Salesforce.
- Experience representing the company at industry events and building relationships to generate leads and drive business opportunities

jobs.title: Sr. Associate, FRM SOX Assurance Business Process
jobs.description:
At Uber, we're not just moving people and things; we're building a global business grounded in integrity. Our Financial Risk Management (FRM) SOX Assurance team is the backbone of that integrity, ensuring our financial reporting is accurate, trustworthy, and compliant with the Sarbanes-Oxley Act (SOX).

As a Senior on this team, you'll be on the front lines, safeguarding our financial data and helping us navigate the complexities of a dynamic, global company. This isn't just about checking boxes—it's about asking the right questions, acting with conviction, and boldly improving our processes to drive meaningful outcomes and maintain the trust of our stakeholders.

## **What You’ll Do:**

- Program Management and Execution: Oversee the Sarbanes-Oxley (SOX) compliance program for designated business process areas. This includes managing the full project lifecycle, from initial planning and scoping through comprehensive testing and final reporting, to ensure the timely completion of all deliverables.
- Risk Assessment and Control Evaluation: Conduct end-to-end evaluations of internal controls over financial reporting (ICFR). This responsibility entails identifying key financial reporting risks, assessing the design of controls, and executing tests of their operating effectiveness in collaboration with IT SOX specialists.
- Stakeholder Engagement: Serve as a primary liaison to key stakeholders, including business process owners, as well as internal and external audit teams. Cultivate and maintain professional relationships to facilitate effective communication and alignment on program objectives.
- Deficiency Management and Remediation: Assist in the process for identifying and evaluating control deficiencies. Investigate root causes, partner with business units to ensure corrective action plans are appropriate, and monitor remediation efforts through to successful completion.
- Process Enhancements and Optimization: Drive continuous improvement initiatives within the SOX program. Identify and recommend opportunities to enhance the efficiency and effectiveness of compliance activities through control optimization, process automation, and the application of data analytics.
- Team Mentorship and Development: Provide mentorship and professional guidance to new or junior analysts. This includes reviewing work products, delivering constructive feedback, and fostering a culture of collaboration and continuous learning.
- Reporting and Analysis: Assist in the preparation of clear and concise reports for Financial Risk Management (FRM) leadership and key stakeholders. These communications will articulate the status of SOX compliance, highlight significant risks, and provide actionable insights on overall control effectiveness.
- Regulatory Compliance: Stay abreast of changes in SOX and other related regulations and best practices, and ensure the company's compliance program is updated accordingly. This includes monitoring changes to PCAOB auditing standards and SEC guidance.

**Basic Qualifications:**

- Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Finance, or a related field.
- 4+ years of relevant experience in SOX, internal audit, or public accounting.

**Preferred Qualifications:**

- CPA, CA, CIA, CISA, or other relevant professional certification is highly preferred.
- Exceptional Communication: The ability to distill complex financial concepts for any audience, from engineers to executives. You can articulate risk in a way that is clear, concise, and compelling.
- A Sharp, Analytical Mind: Drive and curiosity to dig into details, connecting the dots between processes, and solving complex puzzles. Solving problems with critical thinking and a meticulous eye for detail.
- Adaptability and Resilience: A flexible mindset that is comfortable navigating ambiguity and thriving in Uber's fast-paced, ever-evolving environment.
- Strong Business Acumen: A genuine curiosity about how Uber's business operates and the ability to connect the dots between internal controls and our broader strategic goals.
- Unwavering Integrity: A deep commitment to doing the right thing, with the courage to uphold the highest standards of professional conduct and ethical judgment.
- Passionate about your work and a desire to have a big impact.
- Enthusiastic about Uber!

For San Francisco, CA-based roles: The base salary range for this role is USD$122,000 per year - USD$135,500 per year.

You will be eligible to participate in Uber's bonus program, and may be offered an equity award & other types of comp. You will also be eligible for various benefits. More details can be found at the following link [https://www.uber.com/careers/benefits](https://www.uber.com/careers/benefits).

jobs.title: Uber Rides Support Specialist (French Speaker)
jobs.description:
**About The Role**

Here at Uber, we believe world-class support is what builds real trust with our users. It’s not a back-office function; it’s a key feature of our product. We're investing in it, and we're doing it right. We’re looking for a standout Customer Support Representative to join our FR Rider team. This isn't your typical support role. You'll go "Beyond Support" to Be Proactive: Flag issues to your team, Solve the Tough Stuff: Tackle critical issues that matter most, and One Uber: Jump into cross-support when needed. This is a full-time role on a fantastic operations team. Ready to be at the core of Uber's growth? Apply now!

**You're the right fit if you:**

- Are obsessed with finding amazing, human-centric solutions to problems.
- Communicate with clarity and empathy.
- Have a deep understanding of how Uber works and can navigate complex situations.
- Build trust effortlessly and are known for your way with words.

**What You Will Do**

- Deliver high-quality support for the critical issues
- Be a passionate contact point for riders while answering any questions that come your way
- Show empathy to frustrated riders while solving problems and addressing unsatisfactory experiences
- Triage issues and raise them when necessary
- Turn negative interactions into positive discussions and identify ad-hoc online opportunities to be leveraged to drive positive sentiment
- Collaborate to proactively draft messages to address new users' concerns
- Be a cross-support champion: be ready to support different LOBs across the COE

**Basic Qualifications**

- Proficiency in French and English is required!
- Commitment - You are extremely committed to delivering your daily tasks and responsibilities
- Proactiveness - you take the initiative to solve Customer issues and are on top of all requests
- Great Communication. You know how to communicate with customers, especially via message and phone.
- Empathy. Incredible sense of understanding of both riders and drivers, eaters and delivery partners
- Calm under pressure. You have excellent organizational skills, integrity, and follow-through on tasks
- Natural curiosity. You love learning how things work and are always looking for creative solutions.
- Eloquence. You're able to strike the perfect tone, whether you're explaining a new policy to riders or drivers, explaining the importance of certain complicated metrics, or responding to support issues over email.
- Agility. You can move quickly with care. You embrace change and can absorb new information with ease
- Engagement. You thrive to be on the front lines of a highly visible, fast-growing brand
- Comprehension. Excellent reading and writing skills in French and English
- Customer-obsessed! Willingness to help others and create support experiences that exceed users' expectations
- Organization. Skilled at handling multiple issues at once to resolve a large number of inquiries efficiently
- Collaborative attitude. You are a great teammate and have the ability to work well in a collaborative environment,
- Flexibility. Weekend and weekly evening shifts are required
- Uber advocate. You care deeply about the product and getting others excited to ride and partner with Uber
- Uber Rider support experience is a strong differential

**Preferred Qualifications**

- Experience in a high-volume environment, including service industries, retail, hospitality, or other support environments preferred but not mandatory;
- Bachelor's degree or college experience is preferred but not mandatory

jobs.title: Staff Machine Learning Engineer - Uber AI Solutions
jobs.description:
**About the Role**

Uber AI Solutions is one of Uber’s biggest bets with the ambition to build one of the world’s largest data foundries for AI applications and evolve into a platform of choice for a variety of online tasks. The Moonshot AI team focuses on optimizing the Uber AI Solutions gig marketplace through intelligent supply and demand matching. We also accelerate human-in-the-loop data annotation with automation and develop robust automated evaluation systems.

We are in the early stages, with significant opportunities to build new ML models for the gig marketplace. This includes integrating advanced ML models to enable ML-assisted annotations for various use cases, such as Gen AI Labeling, Image/Audio/Video Classification, and Image/Video Segmentation, building LLM-as-Judge for automated quality evaluation, training ranking models to recommend gigs to earners, etc..

In this role, you will collaborate closely with product managers, program managers, and cross-functional teams to deliver real world impact. You’ll help grow Uber AI Solutions into a leader in the space.

**What You'll Do**

1. Contribute to and influence the technical direction for Uber AI Solutions, particularly around ML applications and research.
2. Identify and choose the right problems that will benefit from ML expertise.
3. Design and develop a suite of ML models that will help solve the above problems.
4. Collaborate with backend and frontend engineers to integrate your solutions into our products & platforms.
5. Explore novel ideas and innovative solutions that can lead to a step change in our products
6. Work with cross-functional counterparts like the ML Ops team to understand their needs and improve the models accordingly.
7. Provide mentorship to engineers on the team and across partner orgs to help raise the technical bar.

**Basic Qualifications**

1. Ph.D., MS, or Bachelors degree in Computer Science or a closely related discipline.
2. Proficiency in Computer Vision (CV), Natural Language Processing (NLP), or Deep Learning, with a solid grasp of the latest advancements in Generative AI.
3. Strong desire for continuous learning and professional growth, coupled with a commitment to developing best-in-class systems.
4. Excellent problem-solving and analytical abilities.
5. Proven ability to collaborate effectively as a team player.

**Preferred Qualifications**

1. 8+ years of industry experience in ML/AI.
2. A strong publication record in top-tier AI/ML conferences and journals, demonstrating a history of impactful research.
3. Proven track record of training large models on distributed infrastructure.
4. Demonstrated ability to rapidly prototype, signaling curiosity and an experimental approach.
5. Experience collaborating effectively across an organization, not limited to just within teams.

jobs.title: Senior Account Executive, Uber Eats, Paris
jobs.description:
Chez Uber Eats, notre mission est simple : **permettre aux Français de commander les plats qu’ils aiment… en moins de 25 minutes.** Comment ? Grâce à la technologie Uber et à un réseau de 45 000 restaurants et commerçants partenaires en France.

Tu rejoins une équipe qui développe la sélection de restaurants disponibles sur l’app Uber Eats dans plus de **300 villes en France**.

Notre objectif : proposer une **offre variée, locale et savoureuse**, tout en faisant découvrir des pépites culinaires à nos utilisateurs.

Concrètement, tu seras responsable de **tout le cycle de vente**. Les échanges se font principalement par téléphone et e-mail, avec quelques déplacements ponctuels selon les priorités business.

### **Tes missions au quotidien**

- Identification des restaurants à très fort potentiel dans ta région
- Prise de contact (prospection)
- Présenter avec clarté et enthousiasme les services et la valeur ajoutée d’Uber Eats aux restaurateurs
- Gérer l’ensemble du processus commercial : de la prospection à la signature, jusqu’à la première commande
- Mener des négociations avec des établissements stratégiques à fort potentiel
- Contribuer à la stratégie commerciale : comment croître vite, partout, et intelligemment
- Prioriser les prospects en fonction de leur potentiel, de la diversité culinaire ou de leur notoriété locale
- Onboarding des nouveaux partenaires sur la plateforme

**Nous recherchons une personne qui :**

- possède au moins 3 années d'expérience en Sales post études. Avoir géré des cycles de ventes longs et complexes est un plus
- maîtrise les fondamentaux : prospection téléphonique, négociation, closing
- est à l’aise pour créer du lien avec différents interlocuteurs et construire des relations fortes
- est organisée, autonome, orientée résultats, et sait s’adapter à un environnement en constante évolution
- a d’excellentes capacités de communication et un vrai pouvoir de conviction
- parle parfaitement français et possède un bon niveau d’anglais

### **Pourquoi nous rejoindre ?**

- Tu travailleras sur un produit utilisé chaque jour par des millions de personnes
- Tu évolueras dans un environnement stimulant, apprenant, et tourné vers l’impact
- Tu rejoindras une équipe ambitieuse, solidaire, où chacun a un vrai rôle à jouer
- Tu bénéficieras d’un accompagnement et d’opportunités concrètes d’évolution chez Uber
