jobs.title: Software Engineer II
jobs.description:
**About the Role**

As a Software Engineer in the Maps and Experimentation organization, you will play a pivotal role in engineering the high-scale foundational platforms that power Uber’s most critical global operations. In this role, you will own the end-to-end development of robust backend services, real-time data infrastructure, and intelligent workflows—whether for geospatial optimization or company-wide experimentation.

You will fuse multiple disciplines to build systems that serve as the backbone for hundreds of internal services and mobile apps across Rider, Eater, Driver, and Freight. By delivering decision-grade insights and automating complex ecosystem flows, you will directly impact the efficiency, reliability, and velocity of Uber’s core business. This is an opportunity to solve problems at the intersection of large-scale engineering, data science, and product design, empowering teams to push boundaries with confidence.

**What You Will Do**

- Develop and implement scalable APIs called by 100s of downstream dependencies across Uber
- Build low-latency, high-QPS microservices (tens of thousands + RPS) with strict availability SLOs.
- Build and optimize large-scale data pipelines in Spark/Presto to compute experiment metrics, power analyses, and marketplace-level supply-demand insights.
- Collaborate with data scientists and product managers to translate statistical models into robust, production-ready APIs and batch workflows.
- Utilize software development best practices to ensure systems are reliable (monitoring, alerting, logging, etc)
- Design and document architectural solutions to complex engineering problems

**Basic Qualifications**

- Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or a related technical field
- 2+ years of experience in professional software development experience, developing and deploying systems in production environments
- Knowledge of different compilation steps (and ability to fix) in languages such as Go, C, C++, or Java.
- Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including the ability to document architectures and algorithms.
- Experience with Software Engineering Best Practices.

**Preferred Qualifications**

- Experience with geospatial data and location-based services.
- Familiarity with sensor data processing and analysis.
- Experience with Go, Java
- Experience with distributed systems
- Masters preferred

jobs.title: Program Manager II, Tech, Data Collection
jobs.description:
**About the Role**

At Uber, we reimagine the way the world moves for the better. There are several operations and technologies that enable this mission and Uber’s GSS (Global Scaled Solutions) org, now externally known as Uber AI Solutions, leads many of those capabilities such as data annotation, generation and evals for AI/ML innovation, app testing, localization/internationalization, map editing, digitization programs and more. We combine technology and human intelligence optimally to run these scaled programs. To do this efficiently and with high quality, we have built industry leading tech and ops muscle and have now externalized the same.

The tech+ops solution coupled with Uber’s strength of building a platform for flexible work will enable enterprises world-wide to accelerate their data, AI and product journeys. We have seen a lot of positive traction and demand from enterprises as we incubated this business and now are looking to grow this into a meaningful business line for Uber. While we do this, we look forward to creating flexible earnings opportunities through digital tasks for millions of people across the world. Together, our tech, operations expertise and platform for knowledge work are uniquely positioned to be the best-in-class human in the loop solution for the industry.

One of the capabilities we are growing is data collection - both in field and remote - with customers across Gen AI, Autonomous Vehicles, Mapping, Telco, CPG/Retail and more. With unparalleled access to our earner network globally and tech capabilities, we aim to be a leader in the space and are looking for experts to help build and shape this capability.

**About the role**

We are building one of the most scalable, high-quality data collection engines powering the next generation of AI. Our projects span audio, image, video, LiDAR, text, and multimodal datasets, across dozens of countries and environments.

We are looking for a Program Manager to own and drive complex, multi-country data collection programs end-to-end.

This role is ideal for someone who has thrived in startup environments where speed, hustle, and creative problem-solving matter more than rigid process. You will manage diverse contributor networks, oversee global operations, and ensure datasets meet strict client standards and high quality, at scale.

**What you will do**

1. **Program Management and Ownership:** Translate client SOWs into executable programs — scope, timelines, budgets, workforce model, and quality control frameworks.
2. **Execution Excellence:** Solve operational bottlenecks in real time — whether it’s participant churn, equipment issues, location access, or low-quality submissions - and ensure program delivery and success. Build processes, systems and playbooks that help scale data collection programs systemically
3. **Quality & Compliance:** Ensure data meets specs, surpasses accuracy thresholds, and complies with privacy/consent/data protection laws globally.
4. **Stakeholder Management:** Act as the program point of contact with clients, internal teams, and external vendors. Provide progress reports, risk assessments, and mitigation plans.
5. **Analytics & Reporting:** Monitor collection KPIs via dashboards, identify issues early, and drive corrective action.
6. **Continuous Improvement:** Codify learnings into playbooks and SOPs for repeatability and faster future deployments.
7. **Cross-functional collaboration and influence:** Influence our tech roadmap to build a world class data collection engine. Work with privacy, legal, ops and supply teams to unlock new use cases, markets and scale programs

**Basic Qualifications**

1. 5+ years Experience in program management or operations
2. Exposure to AI/ML data programs, sensors, or field data collection.
3. Multi-country operations experience
4. Proven track record managing large-scale distributed programs, ideally in data, logistics, field operations, or crowdsourcing.

**Preferred Qualifications**

1. Strong program management fundamentals — planning, governance, risk management.
2. Hands-on hustler who thrives in ambiguity and doesn’t wait for perfect instructions.
3. Exceptional stakeholder management — from C-level clients to field contributors.
4. Data-driven operator — comfortable with metrics, dashboards, and root-cause analysis.
5. Bias for action, resilience under pressure, and ability to work across cultures and geographies.

jobs.title: (SMB) Associate Account Manager
jobs.description:
Uber Eatsでは、日本国内の中小規模レストランパートナーの信頼できるアドバイザーとして、ビジネス成長とイノベーションを推進するビジネスリーダー兼アカウントマネージャーを募集しています。

本ポジションはSMBビジネスにおける重要な役割であり、レストランパートナーの重要セグメントにおけるエンドツーエンドの体験管理を担当していただきます。

求める人材は、強力な関係構築力、新たな市場機会を発見し活用する能力、そして顧客志向の思考、クリティカルシンキング、戦略立案、営業専門知識、オペレーショナルエクセレンス、リーダーシップをバランス良く兼ね備えた方です。変化の速い環境において、長期的な戦略イニシアチブと短期的な戦術的アクションの両方をバランスよく遂行できる、高い適応力を持つ人材を求めています。

## **主な業務内容**

1. レストランパートナーとの強固で長期的な関係を構築・維持する
2. レストランパートナーのニーズや要望を理解し、適切なサポートを提供する
3. データドリブンな思考でレストランパートナーの課題を迅速に特定し、解決に必要なリソースとサポートを提供する
4. マネージャーおよびリーダーシップチームと協力し、日本におけるSMB機能の未来を構築する
5. 他部門(オペレーション、マーケティング、カスタマーサポート等)と連携し、課題を解決する
6. 月次・四半期の営業目標を達成または上回る成果を出す

## **応募要件**

### **必須要件**

1. 成長企業での営業またはアカウントマネジメント経験3年以上、ソリューション営業スキルを有すること
2. データ分析とパフォーマンスモニタリングに基づいた意思決定ができること
3. エネルギッシュで、地域社会をより良くしたいという意欲があること
4. 日本語がネイティブレベル、英語の読み書きに抵抗がないこと(英語力向上への意欲がある方も歓迎)

### **歓迎要件**

1. 日本の飲食業界における豊富なネットワークおよび実務経験
2. SaaS製品、インターネット広告、マーケットプレイスエコシステムへの理解
3. 部門横断的なステークホルダーとのプロジェクトマネジメント経験

jobs.title: Sr. Strategy & Operations Manager
jobs.description:
**About the Role**

Merchants are at the heart of the Uber Eats experience, shaping the quality, variety, and reliability of what customers enjoy on our platform. Uber Eats Japan is now seeking a dynamic and strategic-minded individual to join as a Sr. Strategy & Operations Manager. In this role, you will be responsible for proactively designing and managing initiatives across the entire spectrum of merchant lifecycle—driving better merchant selection, performance, and engagement.

**Your Impact In Role**

1. Analyze data, synthesize insights, and distill key takeaways to inform critical business actions and decision-making
2. Define and monitor key performance metrics, building intuitive dashboards and reporting frameworks that provide clear visibility into business health and guide leadership decisions
3. Translate merchant strategy into execution by designing and implementing operational initiatives that enhance merchant reliability, engagement, and overall experience
4. Lead workstreams with relevant cross-functional partners (e.g., Sales, Operations, Legal) by aligning on priorities and driving key critical initiatives forward

**The Experience You’ll Bring**

1. 5+ years of relevant experience in Strategy, Operations, Consulting, High-Growth Tech or related fields
2. Problem-solver; ability to tackle ambiguous problems logically using structured, data-driven approaches
3. Strong analytical abilities, including proficiency in SQL and data analysis to inform decision-making
4. Excellent communication, coordination, and stakeholder management skills
5. Highly self-motivated, with the ability to work independently and manage multiple workstreams simultaneously

**Preferred Qualifications**

1. Proficiency in business-level Japanese
2. Advanced SQL, automation and modelling a plus

jobs.title: Business Operations Manager, Intercity
jobs.description:
**About the Role**

Uber Intercity is a service that allows users to book rides between cities. Outstation cab travel is a multi billion dollar opportunity; and Uber is at a very nascent stage, having tapped just a fraction of this opportunity. Intercity is a critical growth bet for Uber in India South Asia region and also globally.

As a Business Operations Manager in the Uber Intercity team, you will help us fuel the growth of this product category and have a measurable impact across the region using a combination of strategy, planning, stakeholder management and data driven decision making. You would be in charge of demand generation, cracking growth opportunities, improving product experience and be a global thought partner for product teams, other mega-regions and regional stakeholders.

These require you to have a growth hacking mindset, deep understanding of consumer experience, ability to think out-of-the-box and commitment to operational excellence. You will need to be a strong planner and stakeholder manager to work together with our Product, Engineering, Marketing, BD, Rider Ops and CommOps teams to ensure all decisions are coordinated and timely executed.

**What the Candidate Will Do**

1. Growth Strategy: Create and execute a coherent strategy to scale Uber Intercity in India South Asia region. Develop a deep understanding of the outstation travel industry, competitor landscape and consumer needs; and assess growth opportunities for Intercity. Monitor industry trends and competitor landscape and dynamically respond to market needs.
2. Rider growth: Develop and execute growth hacking and rider acquisition/ engagement initiatives. Rider analytics which includes demand funnel, rider profiling, rider lifecycle management, etc. to extract insights that drive growth. Identify unique local marketing opportunities aligned with business priorities and work with the Marketing team to deliver campaigns against them. Evaluate, prioritize, and close strategic partnership opportunities.
3. Product: Continuously collaborate with global product and ops teams to proactively plan, design and build new features that deliver a magical experience.
4. Customer experience: Collect rider and driver insights through CRM, research, support inbounds, etc and design & execute ops & product initiatives to solve rider and driver-side issues.
5. Leverage problem-solving skills to identify issues on the marketplace, rider, and driver fronts. Use data analytics and qualitative research to test hypotheses, make sound business judgments, and decide on the next steps.
6. Cross-functional collaboration & program management for executing identified projects (e.g., Product, Supply, Core Marketplace, S&P, Marketing, CommOps, Policy, Comms, Legal, Ops etc.).

**What the Candidate Will Need**

1. 3+ years of relevant experience in management consulting, high-growth startups, investment banking or similar professions with a high focus on strategic thinking, problem-solving and data analytics.
2. Bachelor's degree from top universities in Engineering, Economics, Business, or other disciplines with a quantitative focus; MBA from a top-tier institute.
3. Proficiency in data analytics & SQL is a strong plus for deriving business insights and taking data backed decisions.
4. Strategic thinking, structured problem solving and business acumen. Creative mindset that enjoys experimentation and is willing to take bold bets despite risk of failure.
5. Manage and deliver end-to-end projects on time with autonomy in a rapid growth environment; and demonstrated ability to coordinate, plan and prioritize tasks across multiple projects.
6. The ability to communicate and present information to stakeholders across all levels of the business.

Uber's mission is to reimagine the way the world moves for the better. Here, bold ideas create real-world impact, challenges drive growth, and speed fuelds progress. What moves us, moves the world - let’s move it forward, together.

jobs.title: Account Executive, Marseille, Uber Eats
jobs.description:
Chez Uber Eats, notre mission est simple : **permettre aux Français de commander les plats qu’ils aiment… en moins de 25 minutes.** Comment ? Grâce à la technologie Uber et à un réseau de 45 000 restaurants et commerçants partenaires en France.

Tu rejoins une équipe qui développe la sélection de restaurants disponibles sur l’app Uber Eats dans plus de **300 villes en France**.

Notre objectif : proposer une **offre variée, locale et savoureuse**, tout en faisant découvrir des pépites culinaires à nos utilisateurs.

Concrètement, tu seras responsable de **tout le cycle de vente**. Les échanges se font principalement par téléphone et e-mail, avec quelques déplacements ponctuels selon les priorités business.

### **Tes missions au quotidien**

- Identification des restaurants à très fort potentiel dans ta région
- Prise de contact (prospection)
- Présenter avec clarté et enthousiasme les services et la valeur ajoutée d’Uber Eats aux restaurateurs
- Gérer l’ensemble du processus commercial : de la prospection à la signature, jusqu’à la première commande
- Mener des négociations avec des établissements stratégiques à fort potentiel
- Contribuer à la stratégie commerciale : comment croître vite, partout, et intelligemment
- Prioriser les prospects en fonction de leur potentiel, de la diversité culinaire ou de leur notoriété locale
- Onboarding des nouveaux partenaires sur la plateforme

**Nous recherchons une personne qui :**

- possède au moins 1 année d'expérience en Sales post études. Avoir géré des cycles de ventes longs et complexes est un plus
- maîtrise les fondamentaux : prospection téléphonique, négociation, closing
- est à l’aise pour créer du lien avec différents interlocuteurs et construire des relations fortes
- est organisée, autonome, orientée résultats, et sait s’adapter à un environnement en constante évolution
- a d’excellentes capacités de communication et un vrai pouvoir de conviction
- parle parfaitement français et possède un bon niveau d’anglais

### **Pourquoi nous rejoindre ?**

- Tu travailleras sur un produit utilisé chaque jour par des millions de personnes
- Tu évolueras dans un environnement stimulant, apprenant, et tourné vers l’impact
- Tu rejoindras une équipe ambitieuse, solidaire, où chacun a un vrai rôle à jouer
- Tu bénéficieras d’un accompagnement et d’opportunités concrètes d’évolution chez Uber

jobs.title: Sales Manager, Uber Eats SMB
jobs.description:
**About the Role**

Uber Eats is seeking an exceptional **Sales Manager** to join our **US&C Restaurants Team**. In this role, you will lead a high-performing team of SMB Sales Representatives focused on driving new business acquisition and accelerating market growth. You’ll be responsible for achieving ambitious monthly revenue targets, developing your team’s skills, and ensuring strong collaboration across functions to deliver best-in-class results.

This is a highly visible leadership opportunity for a driven, strategic, and people-first leader who thrives in fast-paced environments and is passionate about building teams, growing businesses, and making an impact.

**What You Will Do**

1. **Lead & Develop:** Coach, mentor, and inspire a team of Sales Representatives to achieve and exceed acquisition and revenue goals.
2. **Drive Results:** Monitor performance, quota attainment, and pipeline health to ensure consistent execution and delivery against targets.
3. **Enable Success:** Conduct regular deal reviews, call observations, and performance calibrations to identify strengths and growth areas.
4. **Foster Collaboration:** Partner closely with cross-functional teams (Sales Operations, Account Management, Marketing, and City Operations) to align on market priorities and optimize performance.
5. **Strategic Influence:** Serve as a key thought partner to Territory Leadership on short- and long-term business strategy, growth opportunities, and process improvement.
6. **Optimize Systems:** Work with Sales Operations to analyze performance data, improve workflows, and ensure the team has the tools needed to sell effectively.

**Basic Qualifications**

- 4+ years of full-cycle sales experience
- 1-2 years of sales management experience
- Proven ability to meet or exceed sales targets in a fast-paced, metrics-driven environment

**Preferred Qualifications**

- Experienced people leader with strong communication skills and high emotional intelligence
- Consistent track record of developing top sales talent and leading teams to exceed revenue goals
- Analytical mindset with experience using data to inform coaching, forecast accuracy, and sales strategy
- Experience managing both Inside Sales and Field Sales teams preferred
- Familiarity with Salesforce CRM or similar tools

For Seattle, WA-based roles: The base salary range for this role is USD$95,500 per year - USD$106,250 per year.

You will be eligible to participate in Uber's bonus program, and may be offered an equity award, sales bonuses & other types of comp. You will also be eligible for various benefits. jobs.title: Applied Scientist - Legal Data and Economics
jobs.description:
**About the Role**

Applied science can drastically advance and accelerate modern legal work. Uber’s legal applied science team uses applied science to partner with legal, compliance, and security professionals, harnessing the power of tools ranging from SQL queries to genAI. They partner with the Legal team globally and use their understanding of Uber data and the Uber platform to answer legal questions and inform legal and factual arguments with data. As part of this work, they analyze large datasets, create data pipelines, and build statistical models.

**What the Candidate Will Need / Bonus Points**

\-\-\-\- What the Candidate Will Do ----

1. Build a deep, nuanced understanding of Uber’s large and unique data as well as its platform and communicate this understanding to lawyers, regulators, and other stakeholders
2. Propose, design, and execute data analyses, data pipelines, and statistical models to inform, enrich, and advance the work of our Legal Team and other teams across the company
3. Evaluate and quantify risk using a variety of quantitative methods for the Legal Team
4. Work in an inclusive and diverse team of data scientists who will support your development as a data scientist and who, in turn, you will influence and shape

\-\-\-\- Basic Qualifications ----

1. 4+ Years professional experience and demonstrated interest in quantitative analysis of legal, economic, or policy issues
2. Experience using and picking up data science tools to query (e.g., SQL) and analyze (e.g., Python, R) data at scale
3. Ability to collaborate and communicate well: building and managing relationships with clients, communicating with non-technical audiences, and collaborating with cross-functional partners
4. Ability to own and drive projects independently: balancing excellence and attention to detail with the need to prioritize work and deliver within tight deadlines

\-\-\-\- Preferred Qualifications ----

1. Advanced degree in relevant field (economics, statistics, policy, etc.)
2. Professional experience in data science and economics in a legal context
3. Professional experience in legal, economic, or policy setting
4. Experience using Presto and Hive to query and Python and R to analyze data at scale

For San Francisco, CA-based roles: The base salary range for this role is USD$155,000 per year - USD$172,000 per year.

jobs.title: Senior Account Executive, Uber AI Solutions
jobs.description:
**About the Role**

Uber AI Solutions is seeking a Senior Account Executive to work out of our San Francisco office location.

As our team scales up, we are in need of someone who knows how to operate within Uber, and can effectively connect with folks on verticals such as AV, Robotics, and Government. This is an opportunity to join a division still in its early phase of growth and drive real impact for the future of Uber. Our team is responsible for assisting clients create new ML models by providing staffing, training, evaluation, human in the loop, and program management muscle to build the future of AI.

**What You’ll Do**

- Identify, prospect, and build relationships with potential customers across AV, Robotics & Government Sectors.
- Attend & generate meaningful leads from Industry events
- Sign new logos, upsell, and manage accounts once closed

**Basic Qualifications**

- 6+ years B2B sales experience (minimum 3 years in a full sales cycle role: prospecting, outreach, pitching & closing) in a technology environment
- Experience with consultative sales, consulting, sales and preparing statements of work
- Experience selling new products or in new markets
- Proven ability to collect feedback from customers on products, services, and pricing

**Preferred Qualifications**

- Bachelor’s degree or equivalent

- Experience working with legal and procurement teams and/or senior stakeholders
- Ability to gather and translate customer technical requirements into solutions, with experience running pilots or trials to drive customer adoption and support deal closure
- Adept at Salesforce and Excel/Google Sheets - reporting, data analysis, and process improvement

- Experience working in a start-up or entrepreneurial work environment
- Strong interpersonal, presentation, and negotiation skills
- Demonstrated success selling in challenging market conditions and partnering with Product teams to shape roadmap and development

- Proven experience securing new business meetings through cold outreach and partnering effectively with BDR/SDR teams to build pipeline.
- Experience representing the company at industry events and building relationships to generate leads and drive business opportunities

jobs.title: Software Engineer II - Personalization (Growth & Marketing)
jobs.description:
**About the Role**

The Growth & Marketing organization sits at the intersection of infrastructure, intelligence, and user engagement—building platforms that power over 10 billion personalized and timely communications each month across Uber’s global user base. We solve the critical challenge of moving beyond "one-size-fits-all" marketing by generating billions of personalized messages each month, covering key moments in the user journey across all of Uber's lines of business.

In this role, you'll work on core backend services that power personalized recommendations across surfaces like Uber Eats, Rides, and more for millions of customers. You’ll collaborate closely with applied science, product and marketing partners to build reliable, intelligent systems that maximize engagement—ensuring Uber reaches the right user, at the right time, with the right message.

**What You Will Do**

1. Design, build, and operate scalable backend services for large-scale recommendation systems, including candidate generation, real-time content ranking and guardrailing.
2. Partner with Applied Scientists to productionize and iterate on ML models that improve the relevance and quality of personalized content for millions of users.
3. Collaborate closely with Product and Marketing teams to ship features that have a direct impact on user engagement and business growth.
4. Write clean, maintainable code and participate in design reviews, code reviews, and incident responses

\-\-\-\- Basic Qualifications ----

1. 3+ years of experience in backend or platform software engineering.
2. Proficiency in at least one modern backend language (e.g., Go, Java).
3. Strong grasp of computer science fundamentals (data structures, algorithms, OOP).
4. Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or equivalent practical experience.

\-\-\-\- Preferred Qualifications ----

1. Experience designing or operating large-scale distributed systems.
2. Experience with building or working on recommendation systems or personalization
3. Familiarity with machine learning lifecycle, including feature engineering, A/B testing and deploying models to production.
4. Experience with real-time data processing and event-driven architectures.
5. Excellent debugging, problem-solving, and performance tuning skills.

For Seattle, WA-based roles: The base salary range for this role is USD$167,000 per year - USD$185,500 per year.

jobs.title: Associate Counsel, Product and Commercial, EMEA
jobs.description:
**About the Role**

We have an outstanding opportunity for an experienced generalist attorney to support the full range of Uber's business lines across Europe, the Middle East, and Africa (EMEA) for the EMEA Product and Commercial Legal team. This position will be based in Amsterdam, Uber’s EMEA HQ.

The Product and Commercial Legal team owns and drives all product-related legal reviews across the region, drafts and negotiates contracts with key regional partners, and contributes expertise to a wide range of other important initiatives.

In this role, you’ll advise Uber’s EMEA business teams while working closely with legal and non-legal stakeholders at the global, regional, and local levels. This role requires flexibility, versatility, and the ability to learn quickly. As a legal team, we go where the business needs us - what you're working on today might not be what you're working on next week!

If you’re passionate about solving challenging legal problems with maximum business impact, come join our team!

**What You'll Do**

Lead regional legal reviews of new products and features, including Mobility, Delivery, and other new and innovative product lines.

Draft and negotiate contracts with key regional partners, prepare templates for wider regional use, and help shape contracting strategy for the region.

Serve as the "face of Legal" to the EMEA business. Be an active and trusted business partner, and ensure the provision of timely business-focussed advice on issues large and small.

Provide critical and proactive legal and strategic feedback on a wide range of sophisticated and strategic issues. It's our job to peer around corners for the business and ensure that we are well-positioned for the future.

Be a strong communicator and collaborator to effectively support a high-performing, diverse team to achieve our legal and business priorities.

**What You'll Need**

- Minimum 3+ years of legal experience
- License to practice law in at least one EU country
- Professional fluency in written and spoken English (additional language skills a plus)
- Strong academic credentials and law degree from a top law school or university

**Preferred Qualifications**

- In-house experience at a global company.
- The ability to juggle multiple projects at a time in an exciting, fast-paced environment, both collaborating as a team to stay in sync and working independently to get the job done.
- Superior analytical skills, innovative thinking, and a desire to take the initiative and think two steps ahead.
- Strong interpersonal skills and highly collaborative with both business leaders and cross-functional partners, with a strong ability to build relationships, gain credibility, and partner across functions to build consensus.
- Self-motivation with a strong affinity for vision setting, strategic problem solving, and driving action.
- _Enthusiasm about Uber and our mission!_

jobs.title: Account Manager
jobs.description:
**About the Role**

The Account Manager role is an exciting opportunity to showcase your relationship management, sales, and strategic account growth skills. This role focuses on post-sales engagement with small-to-medium-sized businesses, including restaurants and other local merchants.

As an Account Manager, you will play a critical role in retaining and growing our highest-value accounts, ensuring that new partners are set up for success, and identifying opportunities for expansion and increased revenue. Your ability to consult, strategize, and drive long-term value will be key to making Uber Eats the preferred platform for our partners.

**What the Candidate Will Need / Bonus Points**

\-\-\-\- What the Candidate Will Do ----

1. Manage a portfolio of SMB restaurant partners on Uber Eats, driving growth and retention.
2. Proactively identify risks & opportunities within your book of business, engaging merchants via outbound calls, performance reviews, and data-driven recommendations.
3. Consult and upsell additional Uber Eats products and services to optimize merchant performance.
4. Build meaningful, long-term relationships to position Uber Eats as the go-to delivery platform.
5. Maintain consistent communication via email, phone, and in-person meetings where applicable.
6. Champion restaurant feedback to help shape internal strategy and drive insights.
7. Act as an ambassador for Uber Eats, ensuring partners understand and leverage our platform's full potential.

\-\-\-\- Basic Qualifications ----

1. 3+ years of experience in sales, account management, operations, or a related field.
2. Strong analytical skills, with the ability to interpret large data sets and drive actionable results using Excel/Google Suite and Salesforce.
3. Excellent communication & negotiation skills – the ability to clearly articulate value propositions and overcome objections.
4. Highly organized and detail-oriented, with a strong work ethic.
5. Willingness to roll up your sleeves and dive deep into partner relationships and business challenges.
6. Proficiency in Salesforce or similar CRM tools.

\-\-\-\- Preferred Qualifications ----

1. Strong critical thinking ability
2. Experience creating processes and solving problems in scale
3. Bilingual, English & Spanish or English & Mandarin

jobs.title: Senior Market Expansion Manager
jobs.description:
**#GreatMindsDon’tThinkAlike** At Uber, we take pride in our diversity and working environment that sees you as more than just a person that can do the job, but a unique individual that can level up our organization with a perspective only you can offer. Uber provides a truly open culture that encourages all to voice their thoughts.

**About The Team**

Since launching the service in Japan in Sep. 2016, Uber Eats has become deeply rooted in the local food culture, both shaping and celebrating it, and helping small and large businesses connect with customers. We have seen incredible customer love and acceptance over the past seven years of Uber Eats in Japan. We started in Tokyo and now our service is nationwide in all 47 prefectures.

2025 brings a new chapter of the Delivery story, our vision is to 'deliver anything, to anyone, at anytime' and our goal is to make Uber a daily essential in people's life. We aim 2x Active store by end of 2027.

**#GoGetIt** embodies the attitude and mindset of Delivery at Uber. We need to ensure that we are growing all sides of our marketplace (merchants, delivery partners and eaters), so that we can provide the best customer experience possible for our consumers, as well as facilitating growth and earnings for our merchants and delivery partners.

**About the Role**

Uber is a technology company whose mission is to reimagine the way the world moves for the better. We connect consumers and restaurants, grocers, and other merchants so they can buy and sell meals, groceries, and other items, then we match them with independent delivery service providers.

Our technology helps people connect and move in over 70 countries and 10,000 cities around the world. Uber Eats Japan is seeking a sales manager to lead our outbound sales representatives - someone who does this with both short and long-term market goals in mind. You will ensure that the right people and processes are in place to get there. You'll work closely with your peer sales managers, program manager, onboarding team, and with support from XFN team.

**Your Impact in Role**

- Build and manage a successful Outbound sales acquisition team responsible for exceeding sales KPIs and working closely with leadership and cross-functional teams.
- Be a strategic thought partner to the SMB and broader restaurants organization in regards to customer engagement, onboarding, restaurant partnerships & expansion plans.
- Drive and monitor successful execution to achieve results. Implement an efficient sales management system, and drive the sales discipline required to achieve sustainable results.
- Execute in short-term with a high sense of urgency and accountability while maintaining a vision and preparing for long-term sustained success.
- Work closely in a matrixed environment with local, regional and global support, operations, marketing, strategy, analytics, design, engineering, and finance teams to grow your business.
- Create a high performance culture in your team centered on customer focus, including hiring & coaching for continuous growth.

**The Experience You'll Bring**

- Fluency in Japanese and Business English.
- 5+ years of experience in B2B high growth companies with a track record of sales performance and leadership experience in account acquisition.
- Sales transformation skills, stakeholder influencing skills and ability to manage through ambiguity are also core to success.

**Preferred Qualifications**

- 2+ years team management experience

jobs.title: Regional Operations Manager, Marketplace Efficiency
jobs.description:
**About the Role**

On the Uber EMEA Delivery Regional Operations team, we serve the business and local markets by partnering with Product, Local Operations, and Cross-functional partners to build and scale impactful Products and data-driven Processes across EMEA.

You will be joining the Marketplace Efficiency team which is responsible for building Processes and scaling Products across Courier Pricing & Incentives, Reliability Management, Dispatch & Logistics, and Timeliness, to make sure that all actors find value in the platform (Earners, Merchants, Consumers, and Uber itself). In that sense, the team drives key business metrics on Financial Performance, Courier Earnings, Consumer Experience and overall Reliability of the Marketplace.

**What You'll Do**

1. **Scale Marketplace Products in EMEA:** As the EMEA Product Champion for Marketplace, ensure the interface between EMEA Operations, Cross-functional, and Product teams - contribute to Product Requirement Definitions, Experimentation, Launch, and Scape-up of new products, and perform Analytics for ongoing optimisation of Products.
2. **Build & Scale Processes:** Build and scale Processes across EMEA in order to enable the business to efficiently operate and grow, and give time back to Country Ops. Build thorough insights and analytics on managed processes.
3. **Project Management and Execution:** Act as the Project Manager for Products and Processes managed by you, creating launch and expansion plans, aligning multiple team members, tracking issues, driving root-cause analyses, measuring marketplace performance, and tracking progress against goals.
4. **Analytics & Data-Driven Decision Making:** Build comprehensive, data backed frameworks & models to drive marketplace decisions (such as on investment and pricing) in the region and optimise our marketplace efficiency.
5. **Partner Management & Teamwork:** Build credibility and deliver high make valuable contributions to Local Operations teams (strong Partner Management), through insights & analytics, and end to end process management of key initiatives. Collaborate with a diverse group of partners across cross-functional teams in EMEA and globally.

**What You'll Need / Bonus Points**

1. At least 3 years of experience in Business Operations, Product Operations / Management, Management Consulting, or Investment Banking with a strong analytical background
2. Excellent interpersonal, and team member management skills with an ability to form long term relationships in diverse, cross-functional, and global environments
3. Demonstrable project management skills

**Preferred Qualifications**

1. Understanding of marketplace dynamics, adapting to a constantly evolving work environment, in the context of a fast-growing company
2. Advanced analytical skills in SQL and Excel/G-Sheets/Tableau. Exposure or interest in Python or other statistical programming languages is a plus.
3. A creative attitude that understands and enjoys experimental design and statistical methods

jobs.title: Associate Acquisition Account Executive, Japan
jobs.description:
#Greatmindsdontthinkalike

Uber Japanの求人にご関心をお寄せいただき、ありがとうございます。

私たちは、多様性を尊重し、個性を活かせる職場づくりを大切にしています。Uberでは、単に「仕事ができる人材」ではなく、あなたにしかない視点でチームに新たな価値をもたらす「一人の優れたプロフェッショナル」としてお迎えします。

すべての社員が自分の意見を自由に共有し、成長できる環境を提供しています。

* * *

### チームについて

レストランはUber Eatsの中心的存在です。日本の多様で質の高いレストラン業界は、Uber Eatsのグローバルな成長を支える大きな力となっています。

日本のアクイジションチームは、競争の激しい市場の中でUber Eatsの存在感をさらに拡大していくための重要な役割を担っています。

私たちのミッションは、プラットフォーム上で成功できる高ポテンシャルなレストランを発掘し、魅力的な提案を行い、スムーズにオンボーディングへ導くこと。

Uberにとって戦略的に重要な市場である日本で、次なる成長フェーズを共に築いていきましょう。

* * *

### 仕事内容

アクイジション アカウント エグゼクティブとして、主要都市の優先度の高い飲食店パートナーを対象に、営業活動の全プロセスを担当していただきます。

あなたの取り組みは、Uber Eats上での飲食店の多様性や品質を高めるだけでなく、顧客体験の向上、そして長期的で信頼できるパートナーシップの構築にもつながります。

スピード感のある環境の中で、課題を自ら発見し、主体的に解決へ導く姿勢が求められます。

* * *

### 主な業務内容

- 優先度の高いレストランパートナー候補に対し、初回コンタクトから契約、稼働、初期成長支援までの営業サイクルを一貫して担当

- 各店舗の課題や目標を理解し、Uber Eatsの価値提案を最適な形で伝えることで強固な関係を構築

- 東京・大阪・地方都市など、担当エリアを戦略的に分析し、高インパクトな新規開拓機会を特定

- オペレーション、マーケティング、アカウントマネジメントチームと連携し、スムーズなオンボーディングを支援

- データやツールを活用し、リード管理・優先順位設定・フォローアップ・パイプライン運営を効率的に実行

- 現場のフィードバックをもとに、プロダクト・価格・プロセス改善に貢献


* * *

### 求めるスキル・経験

- **エンド・ツー・エンドの営業経験**：リード獲得から商談、契約締結まで一人で完結できる方

- **高い実行力と粘り強さ**：課題があっても諦めず、確実に成果を出せる方

- **優れたコミュニケーション力**：日本語で自信を持って説明・交渉ができる方（英語での読み書きができれば尚可）

- **営業・ビジネスセンス**：個人経営の飲食店からチェーン展開企業まで、相手に合わせた提案ができる方


* * *

### 歓迎スキル・経験

- B2B営業、パートナーシップ、または事業開発の経験（目安：2〜4年）

  特にテック業界、ホスピタリティ業界、またはFMCG業界での経験を歓迎します

- ビジネスレベル以上の日本語力と、基礎的な英語力（読み書き）

- 日本の飲食業界・飲食文化に対する深い理解

- CRMシステム（例：Salesforce）の使用経験、およびKPI達成を重視する環境での営業経験

- 個人およびチーム目標の達成に向けて自律的に行動できる方

- マルチタスク管理能力が高く、細部まで丁寧に対応できる方

jobs.title: Representante de Ventas en Campo Monterrey
jobs.description:
## Sobre la oportunidad

Estamos construyendo un Equipo de Ventas de Campo con el objetivo principal de incrementar la oferta en distintas ciudades de México.

El role de Field Sales Representative es clave: será los ojos y oídos de Uber en el mercado. Su misión será asegurar que la oferta responda a la demanda, conectando proactivamente con socios conductores potenciales a través de visitas en campo y llamadas dirigidas, comunicando de forma efectiva la propuesta de valor de Uber.

## Responsabilidades

- Identificar y encontrar prospectos (conductores de taxi o independientes) directamente en campo (80% del tiempo) para referirlos y/o convertirlos a la plataforma.

- Actuar como la voz del socio conductor, capturando información de valor en cada interacción.

- Facilitar sesiones informativas con socios conductores actuales y potenciales, comunicando claramente la propuesta de valor de Uber.

- Participar en campañas dirigidas a conductores potenciales o recientemente registrados.

- Gestionar interacciones con conductores activos o prospectos para entender sus necesidades, inquietudes y objetivos; posicionar a Uber como solución.

- Apoyar a los conductores durante el proceso de registro y asegurarse de que estén listos para completar sus primeros viajes.

- Colaborar con distintos stakeholders para integrar sus insights cuando sea necesario.

- Crear y/o aprovechar procesos escalables de adquisición de conductores que puedan replicarse en múltiples ciudades.

- Gestionar alianzas estratégicas con terceros.


## Requisitos Básicos

- 2+ años de experiencia cuantificable en ventas de campo B2C/B2B, gestión de cuentas o soporte al cliente de alto volumen, con conversión como métrica principal.

- Alto nivel de autonomía y autogestión, habiendo manejado un ciclo de ventas o territorio completo con mínima supervisión.

- Capacidad demostrada para gestionar múltiples prioridades, tomar decisiones rápidas y operar en entornos dinámicos y acelerados.

- Excelentes habilidades interpersonales y pasión por interactuar con personas.

- Nivel de inglés intermedio, necesario para la comunicación con equipos internos y documentación
- Capacidad para operar con resiliencia, persistencia y enfoque ante la ambigüedad o metas de conversión desafiantes.

- Disponibilidad para viajar dentro del país para apoyar campañas estratégicas de oferta y lanzamientos de nuevos mercados.

## Cualidades preferidas

- Conocimiento o experiencia laboral en la industria de taxis, transporte o logística en México.

- Experiencia comprobada en la creación y gestión de alianzas externas o negociaciones con terceros.

jobs.title: Engineering Manager II- AdsTech, Data Insights and Recommendations
jobs.description:
**About the Role**

As an Engineering Manager, you will play a critical role in driving Uber’s rapidly expanding Ads Engineering organization at India. You will lead the Reporting and Recommendations team, responsible for building the foundational data, insights, and personalization systems that power advertising across all Lines of Business — Mobility (Display & Journey Ads), Delivery (OFD Sponsored Listings), and Grocery/CPG Ads.

Your team will own the platforms that enable advertisers to understand ad performance, optimize spend, and reach the right audiences through scalable reporting, recommendations, and datamart solutions. You’ll work closely with cross-functional leaders across product, data science, and other engineering teams to deliver a unified, data-driven Ads ecosystem serving diverse advertiser and merchant needs globally.

**What the Candidate Will Need / Bonus Points**

\-\-\-\- What the Candidate Will Do ----

#### Team Empowerment

1. Foster a collaborative, inclusive, and high-performance culture that values creativity, ownership, and continuous learning.
2. Provide mentorship, clear career paths, and development opportunities to help engineers grow as technical and thought leaders.

#### Engineering Leadership

1. Promote a culture of technical excellence — emphasizing strong design principles, code quality, and peer reviews.
2. Lead design and delivery of scalable data, reporting, and recommendation platforms used across Ads products and LOBs.
3. Drive the architectural vision for multi-LOB insights generation, personalization, and measurement frameworks.

#### Multi-Functional Collaboration

1. Partner with Product Managers, Data Scientists, and cross-functional engineering teams to define the long-term roadmap for Ads reporting and recommendations.
2. Collaborate with teams across Mobility, Delivery, and Grocery Ads to integrate performance insights, targeting, and experimentation capabilities into a cohesive data platform.
3. Translate advertiser and business requirements into reusable, scalable, and high-impact data solutions.

#### Operational Excellence

1. Ensure the highest standards of data quality, availability, and trust across Ads reporting and datamarts.
2. Implement robust observability, anomaly detection, and automated recovery mechanisms.
3. Champion platform efficiency and standardization to minimize redundant data pipelines and accelerate new feature delivery.

\-\-\-\- Basic Qualifications ----

14+ years of overall software engineering experience, including 3+ years in engineering management leading backend and data-intensive systems.

Proven track record in designing and scaling data or reporting platforms, preferably in e-commerce, advertising, or On-Demand Delivery (OFD) domains.

Deep technical expertise in distributed systems, real-time and batch data processing, and analytics (e.g., Spark, Hive, Pinot, Kafka, Flink, Presto).

Experience working with recommendation or personalization systems and collaborating with ML/Applied Science teams.

Strong leadership and communication skills with the ability to drive clarity, alignment, and accountability across global teams.

\-\-\-\- Preferred Qualifications ----

Prior experience in AdTech, attribution, or measurement systems.

Strong product sense — able to balance technical design with advertiser value and business outcomes.

Demonstrated success in building horizontal data or platform solutions supporting multiple business verticals.

Experience managing hybrid global teams and fostering collaboration across time zones.

jobs.title: Program Leader, Autonomous Vehicles (AV) Support Operations - EMEA CommOps
jobs.description:
**About the Role**

We are seeking a seasoned and strategic Program Leader to spearhead our Autonomous Vehicle (AV) support operations in EMEA. This senior leadership role is critical to shaping the future of AV support at Uber, requiring a professional with a proven track record in high-stakes, live support environments. You will be responsible for not just building, but strategically scaling and optimizing our support infrastructure for AV riders, ensuring unparalleled accuracy and service excellence.

As a key leader, you will go beyond foundational setup; you will define the long-term vision for AV support, driving a culture of precision, continuous improvement, and deep domain expertise. This position demands a leader who can navigate the complexities of emerging AV technology, manage sophisticated cross-functional relationships, and mentor a team to perform with exceptional accuracy.

We are looking for an expert in operations management who thrives in a dynamic, live support setting and is passionate about building a best-in-class service organization for a revolutionary technology.

**What you'll do**

Strategic Operations & Leadership

1. Architect & Scale: Design and execute the long-term strategy for scaling AV support operations, moving beyond initial setup to optimize for efficiency, quality, and future growth.
2. Drive Performance Excellence: Establish and enforce rigorous, accuracy-focused performance standards and SLAs tailored to the unique demands of live AV support.
3. Develop Leaders: Recruit, mentor, and develop a high-caliber team, including Team Leads, fostering a culture of ownership, accountability, and subject matter expertise.
4. Strategic Resource Management: Lead strategic workforce planning, forecasting, and resource allocation to ensure the team is equipped to handle evolving AV operational complexities and volumes.

Service & Experience Innovation

1. Champion Rider Trust: Act as a senior advocate for the rider, leveraging deep data analysis and qualitative feedback to identify and eliminate friction points within the AV experience.
2. Innovate Support Solutions: Develop and implement cutting-edge support strategies that enhance service quality, with a strong emphasis on maintaining high accuracy and achieving first-contact resolution for complex on-trip AV issues.
3. Cultivate Deep Expertise: Become a central authority on AV operations and support protocols, guiding the team through ambiguous scenarios and serving as a key resource for global stakeholders.

Cross-Functional Influence & Partnership

1. Build Strategic Relationships: Forge strong, collaborative partnerships with senior stakeholders in Product, Engineering, and Safety teams to ensure support capabilities are co-developed with AV technology.
2. Translate Insights into Action: Create and manage robust feedback loops that deliver critical operational insights to technical teams, directly influencing AV product enhancements and support tool development.
3. Lead Complex Problem-Solving: Spearhead initiatives to resolve systemic, high-impact challenges unique to the AV support landscape, employing structured methodologies to drive lasting improvements.

**Basic Qualifications**

01. Experience: Minimum of 10+ years of experience in operations management, with a significant portion within a fast-paced, high-stakes technology or customer support environment.
02. AV or Relevant Tech Exposure: Demonstrable experience working in environments focused on autonomous vehicles, robotics, or other emerging, complex technologies is required.
03. Live Support Expertise: Proven track record of managing teams in a live, real-time support setting (e.g., inbound phone, incident response, dispatch operations) where immediate and accurate responses are critical. Asynchronous (email/ticket) support experience alone is not sufficient.
04. High-Accuracy Operations: Experience in a role where maintaining exceptionally high accuracy and quality standards was a core performance metric and responsibility.
05. People Management: At least 5 years of direct people management experience, with a proven ability to develop both individual contributors and junior leaders.
06. Operational & Strategic Acumen: Expertise in scaling operations, driving efficiency, and translating high-level business goals into tactical execution plans.
07. Leadership Agility: Ability to be 'hands-on' and go deep into operational details, policies, and processes while also zooming out to set the long-term strategic vision.
08. Advanced Problem-Solving: Superior ability to structure and solve complex, ambiguous problems with a data-driven approach.
09. Stakeholder Influence: Exceptional communication and stakeholder management skills, with the ability to influence and align senior cross-functional partners and executives.
10. Data-Driven Decision Making: High proficiency in using data and analytics to drive insights, forecast trends, and make informed strategic decisions.
11. Resilience & Agility: Demonstrated ability to lead effectively under pressure in a dynamic, rapidly evolving industry.

**Preferred Qualifications**

1. Advanced degree in Business, Operations Management, or a related field.

jobs.title: Head of LatAm Risk and Fraud -  Payments
jobs.description:
**About the Role**

As the Head of LatAm Risk, you will lead Uber’s largest scaled risk operations team tasked with detecting payment fraud (digital and cash), ATO response, abuse prevention, and policy enforcement across our global marketplaces. You’ll partner closely with Regional General Managers, Country General Managers, Risk Leads, Product, Data Science, Policy and Regional Ops to ensure operational execution aligns tightly to the evolving threat landscape and business KPIs.

You will be directly accountable for ensuring that all operational metrics tied to fraud and abuse investigations are consistently met or exceeded. This includes driving vendor performance, maintaining high quality standards, and delivering outcomes within budgeted costs.

**What You'll Do:**

1. **Drive the LATAM Risk planning cycle (end to end):** You will act as the primary liaison between Product, Decision Science, Local Teams, and Regional RiskOps to ensure all initiatives are captured, prioritized, and tracked to build a strong roadmap and establish the foundation of key strategic priorities based on regional needs.
2. **Oversee all Risk KPIs to maintain losses under control:** You'll own key P&L metrics such as Chargebacks, DNS, Arrears, Refunds and appeasements/promo/incentive abuse. You’ll need to continuously and proactively monitor performance to ensure year-end targets are met. This role requires a deep understanding of LATAM fraud Modus Operandi, ranging from friendly fraud to GPS spoofing, collusion, and merchant fraud among others. Ensuring effective protection across all lines of business is a must.
3. **Partner with cross-functional teams (including Identity, Safety, and Operations):** You’ll need to address evolving and multi-layered fraud types that require coordinated solutions. Work quickly, iterate based on feedback, and deliver end to end responses. Positioned close to both frontline operations and strategic leadership, you will translate real-time fraud patterns into actionable improvements to detection and mitigation strategies, serving as the connective link between operational teams and rule creators to keep defenses up to date.
4. **Establish and operationalize advanced risk mitigation frameworks:** You will proactively review our fraud deterrence and detection capabilities, with a strong emphasis on enabling growth through friction reduction, improved accuracy in decisioning, reducing false positives and providing a superior user experience, all achieved without compromising loss thresholds.
5. **Define regional standards:** As a leader, you will define regional/global standards and elevate the overall performance of the team by fostering greater consistency, ensuring ongoing training, maintaining strong motivation, and sharpening focus, ultimately raising the bar for excellence.
6. **Drive automation initiatives and identify processes that can scale or sunset:** In collaboration with Product and DS, you'll identify manual tasks that can be automated without compromising fraud accuracy.

**What You'll Need:**

01. 10+ years experience in scaled operations, risk management, or trust & safety.
02. Deep understanding of the Payments and Fraud ecosystem.
03. Strong data literacy; can partner deeply with Data Science and Product.
04. Experience in KPI ownership (chargebacks, ATO, abuse) and goal setting.
05. Ability to navigate cross-functional stakeholder relationships across DS, Ops, Policy, and Engineering.
06. Expert SQL proficiency.
07. Excellent judgment, critical thinking, and decision-making skills.
08. Ability to translate data findings into business strategy.
09. Self-motivated with the ability to work independently.
10. Ability to work closely with cross-functional stakeholders to execute decisions.
11. Strong verbal and written communication, and presentation skills.
12. Ambition and enthusiasm to seek opportunities to build value.
13. Problem-solving - Able to solve high-complexity problems by using logic, common sense and data not only by identifying the root cause of a problem but also being capable of providing actionable insights and mitigation plans.
14. MBA graduate or Bachelor's degree.

locations: New York, New York, United States
jobs.location: New York, New York, United States
jobs.description:
**About the Role**

Uber is home to one of the largest and most unique insurance programs in the world and insurance data lies at its foundation. We're looking for an experienced manager to lead our critical insurance data infrastructure. This will involve everything from designing new data models and improving existing data processes to expanding the scope of the data program to support Uber's ever-growing portfolio. This team works cross-functionally to ensure our data processes align with industry best practices and stakeholder needs.

**What You Will Do**

1. Manage a team of 3 to deliver projects on time with high quality
2. Design comprehensive quality checks to facilitate accurate analyses and to ensure Uber's insurance data meets compliance standards
3. Collaborate with data scientists and engineers to build and improve on the availability, integrity, accuracy, and reliability of data logging and data pipelines.
4. Collaborate with business leaders to manage project intake, roadmap, prioritize, and manage staffing against key initiatives
5. Partner with internal and external stakeholders, including actuaries, engineers, program managers, and data scientists to identify challenges and opportunities for insurance data models

**Basic Qualifications**

1. M.S. or Bachelor's degree in Math, Economics, Bioinformatics, Statistics, Engineering, Computer Science, or other quantitative fields
2. 5+ years of relevant professional experience
3. Minimum 2 years of management experience
4. Proficiency with SQL, Python, big data frameworks (ex. Hadoop, Spark)
5. Proficiency in a scripting language (Python preferred)
6. Experience with Excel and some dashboarding/data visualization (ex. Tableau)

**Preferred Qualifications**

1. Experience building/maintaining SOX compliant control data environment
2. Basic understanding of insurance concepts and working with insurance loss data
3. Experience with an ETL framework like Airflow
4. Project management skills - Ability to drive projects end-to-end

jobs.title: Marketplace Product & Projects Operations Manager
jobs.description:
## About the Role

We’re looking for a highly analytical, proactive, and execution-focused problem solver to join the Marketplace Product Champions team. In this role, you’ll support two critical areas of the Delivery marketplace. You’ll help coordinate product rollouts, lead deep-dive analyses, and ensure product levers deliver measurable impact across LatAm.

As a key connector between LatAm Operations and Global Product, you’ll elevate regional needs and help influence product roadmaps for long-term impact. You’ll collaborate closely with cross-functional partners to ensure new features launch smoothly, marketplace performance is well understood, and communication remains clear and consistent across local and global teams.

## What You’ll Do

- Lead product rollouts: Coordinate scoping, testing, launch support, and impact evaluation for marketplace features.

- Own marketplace performance and reliability: Monitor key KPIs related to supply health, reliability, and timeliness.

- Drive operational impact: Translate operational challenges into structured product requests, supported by data, analysis, and clear business cases.

- Support regional product planning: Provide data-driven recommendations to Product, Operations, and regional partners to support prioritization and alignment.

- Communicate and align stakeholders: Share product updates, timelines, and insights with cross-functional teams in a clear and engaging way.

- Lead analytical deep dives: Identify root causes of marketplace issues and present compelling, data-backed insights to drive alignment and decisions.

- Manage feedback and issues: Gather partner feedback, monitor product issues, triage bug escalations, and support best-practice sharing across the region.


## Basic Qualifications

- A minimum of 3 years of experience in Operations, Product Strategy, Project Management, or related roles; experience in tech, marketplaces, logistics, product, or consulting is a plus.

- Proficiency in written and spoken English, with comfort communicating with senior stakeholders.

- Strong analytical skills, including proficiency in SQL and Excel, with the ability to analyze trends, generate insights, and build clear business cases.

- Strong execution skills, with attention to detail and a focus on delivering high-quality outcomes.

- Solid planning and organizational abilities, with experience managing multiple workstreams and priorities simultaneously.

- Proven cross-functional collaboration skills, with the ability to influence, align, and build strong relationships across teams.

- Clear and adaptable communication skills, tailored to different audiences.

- Strong problem-solving skills, including the ability to work through ambiguity, evaluate tradeoffs, and measure impact independently.

- Business acumen and understanding of marketplace dynamics to help prioritize high-impact opportunities.

- Resilience and adaptability, with a proactive mindset when navigating change or challenges.


## Preferred Qualifications

- Experience in logistics, supply-demand modeling, pricing levers, or dispatch systems.

- Prior exposure to Product Champion, Product Operations, or similar product-enablement roles.

At Uber, Frontend Engineers build web experiences that power the way people move and receive things around the world. As part of our engineering team, you’ll work on large-scale applications that impact millions of users.

You’ll collaborate with cross-functional partners (design, backend, data science, product). Your work will help shape the future of Uber’s core rider experiences and delivery logistics — defining how people interact with Uber on the web.

### **About the Teams**

**Delivery:** The Delivery team is focused on innovating and streamlining how products and services reach our customers. In this role, you'll contribute to building efficient and robust systems that support order processing, logistics, and real-time tracking. Your contributions will help optimize the end-to-end delivery experience, making it more reliable and seamless for both drivers and customers.

jobs.title: Global Data Analyst
jobs.description:
## About the Role

Uber is reshaping the future of grocery & retail by building the world’s leading marketplace for on-demand local commerce. As part of our Global Operations team for Grocery & Retail (GR), you will play a key role in ensuring our merchant partners thrive on the Uber platform.

In this role, you will be responsible for designing and scaling analytical solutions, developing robust reporting tools, and delivering actionable insights that empower our merchants and internal stakeholders. You will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams—including Product, Finance, Legal, Tax, Account Management, and Regional Ops—to streamline operations, improve merchant experience, and enhance Uber’s offerings.

We’re looking for a highly analytical, technically-skilled, and collaborative candidate who thrives in a fast-paced, ever-evolving environment.

## What You’ll Do

- Scale Reporting Excellence: Design, develop, and maintain best-in-class reporting tools and dashboards to support merchants globally.

- Automate and Optimize: Build automated solutions to simplify access to insights and reduce manual work, enabling scalable, data-driven decision-making.

- Enhance Merchant Experience: Continuously improve reporting systems to ensure merchants receive valuable, actionable insights in a seamless and intuitive format.

- Drive Insightful Analyses: Conduct deep-dive analyses and synthesize complex data into clear, strategic recommendations for leadership and cross-functional teams.

- Stakeholder Management: Coordinate with a broad set of stakeholders—Product, Finance, Legal, Support, Policy, and more—to align goals, manage dependencies, and ensure timely execution.

- Support Product Launches: Ensure new product features and merchant needs are reflected in our data and supported by scalable reporting infrastructure.

- Documentation & Knowledge Sharing: Create and maintain technical documentation on reporting tools and processes for internal teams and external partners.


## What You’ll Need

- Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Business Analytics, Computer Science, or related fields.

- 3+ years of experience in business intelligence, analytics, or data engineering roles.

- Expert proficiency in SQL, with the ability to write complex queries and optimize for performance across large datasets.

- Experience with Python, including statistical analysis, data manipulation, and automation workflows.

- Strong analytical thinking and business judgment, with a proven ability to solve complex problems across teams and product areas.

- Exceptional attention to detail, with a focus on scalability, accuracy, and efficiency.

- English proficiency.

**Preferred Qualifications**

- Experience building and maintaining business intelligence systems and reporting tools.

- Solid understanding of e-commerce, grocery, or retail operations.

- Familiarity with Python libraries such as `pandas`, `NumPy`, `matplotlib`, and `SciPy`.

jobs.title: Software Engineer II - Fares Platform
jobs.description:
**About the Role**

The Fares Platform Team is at the heart of Uber's business, powering all global fares for our entire ecosystem, from rides and deliveries to new initiatives. Our systems are critical tier-1 components that handle tens of billions of dollars in gross bookings. We own the full stack, including platform fare calculation, data science models for upfront pricing, and the mobile fare experiences that our customers see.

As a backend engineer, you'll join a fast-paced, solutions-oriented team to build powerful and robust features for our critical internal configuration platform. You'll make a tangible impact by working closely with a diverse group of stakeholders, including product managers, operations, data scientists, and engineers across the company.

**What You'll Do**

As a member of the Fares Platform team, you will be instrumental in:

- **Building and expanding our core backend systems** to enable new features and support key product launches across Uber's global business.
- **Working with stakeholders across the company**—from product managers to data scientists—to deeply understand business problems and develop effective technical solutions.
- **Owning the full development lifecycle**, from design and implementation to deployment and monitoring, ensuring the reliability and performance of your systems.
- **Maintaining system health** by participating in on-call rotations and proactively identifying and addressing potential issues.

**Basic Qualifications**

- **2+ years of professional experience** as a backend engineer, with hands-on experience in a language like Go, Java, or Python.
- **Experience designing and building large-scale, distributed systems**, with a focus on system reliability, performance, and maintainability.
- **A solid understanding of computer science fundamentals**, including data structures, algorithms, and systems design.

**Preferred Qualifications**

- **Proven track record of building scalable, highly available backend services** within a microservices architecture.
- **A strong understanding of system design** with experience working across multiple backend services to deliver a cohesive solution.
- **High standards for code quality** and engineering excellence, including a focus on thorough testing, clear documentation, and maintainable code.
- **Experience in the payments or fintech space**, particularly with systems that handle financial transactions and data.

jobs.title: Implementation Specialist, Uber for Business
jobs.description:
**About the Role**

As an Implementation Specialist within Uber for Business, you will be responsible for managing large and LATAM wide initiatives to increase the adoption, and product penetration in our main markets with Top Clients.

You will entirely lead the execution of post-sales and adoption programs, you will also be responsible for retaining and driving revenue within top clients through adoption and cross-selling strategies.

Our product expertise will make you uniquely qualified to share the best practices and recommendations with internal teams, with the goal of providing an extraordinary customer experience and growing revenue through account penetration and adoption!

This is a hybrid role - our team collaborates in-person out of our incredible office in Santiago 3 days/week. We encourage our employees to work from our office on additional days if they desire to do so.

**What you'll do:**

The implementation specialist will be responsible for:

- Onboarding customers to our Uber for Business dashboard
- Ensuring they can effectively utilize the platform to manage their employee trips, expenses, and other related activities.
- Interact with team members to execute the best implementation strategy with customers
- Retaining and driving revenue within top clients through adoption and cross-selling strategies.

**What you'll need:**

- Outstanding organizational skills and the ability to balance attention to detail with swift execution - we need to do things quickly, and we need to do them seamlessly
- Strong communication and interpersonal skills to interact with clients and team members effectively.
- We are seeking a candidate with strong basic analytical skills who can effectively integrate an analytical mindset with a commercial approach
- Patience and problem-solving skills to address any issues or questions that arise during the onboarding process.

jobs.title: Commercial Operations Manager, Uber Advertising
locations: New York, New York, United States
jobs.location: New York, New York, United States
jobs.description:
**About the Role**

We are seeking a high-impact, results-oriented individual to own the design, execution, and activation of our most critical sales programs. This is a hands-on role focused on translating strategic goals into actionable programs that drive sales performance.

You will be the program management leader responsible for taking strategic sales initiatives from concept to launch. You will also own the sales activation and enablement for these programs, ensuring the sales team is fully equipped, trained, and motivated to execute and win.

**What You'll Do:**

- **Strategic Program Management:** Own the end-to-end program management of strategic sales initiatives
- Develop detailed project plans, manage timelines, and coordinate with all cross-functional stakeholders (Sales, Marketing, Finance, Product, Legal) to ensure a successful launch
- **Sales Activation & Enablement:**Act as the activation lead for your programs. Partner with our core Sales Enablement team to create all necessary materials, including playbooks, one-pagers, training decks, and communication plans
- Deliver program-specific training and communications to ensure the sales team understands the "why, what, and how" of each initiative
- Drive adoption and field engagement for your programs, acting as the go-to subject matter expert
- **Performance & Analytics:**Define the key performance indicators (KPIs) and success metrics for each program _before_ launch
- Track program performance, analyze results, and deliver data-driven insights and post-mortem reports to leadership on what worked and what to improve
- **Cross-Functional Partnership:**Build and maintain strong relationships with sales leadership to understand their key priorities and challenges
- Act as the central point of coordination, ensuring all teams are aligned on program goals, timelines, and execution

**Basic Qualifications:**

- 5+ years' experience in Sales Operations, Advertising Sales Operations, Commercial Operations, Revenue Operations, or a Deal Desk function
- Proven experience in B2B enterprise sales motions, deal structuring, and contract fundamentals
- Analytical acumen, with a proven ability to turn data into actionable business insights
- Exceptional communication skills and a demonstrated ability to act as a trusted, influential partner to sales leadership and cross-functional teams
- Bachelor's degree

**Preferred Qualifications:**

- 7+ years' experience in Sales Operations, Advertising Sales Operations, Commercial Operations, Revenue Operations, or a Deal Desk function
- 5+ years' of  direct experience in Sales Operations, Sales Enablement, Program Management, or Go-to-Market (GTM) Operations within a fast-paced B2B environment

jobs.title: Lead Product Manager for Uber's Safety Media Product Team
locations: New York, New York, United States
jobs.description:
**About the Role**

At Uber, “Stand for Safety” is a core value and central to our mission of reimagining how the world moves. The Safety Product team builds innovative technologies that enhance safety for riders, drivers, couriers, and the communities we serve.

As a Lead Product Manager for the Safety Media team, you will lead our mission to build recording products that can bring additional peace of mind to every ride. You’ll be responsible for delivering scalable, user-friendly solutions that see broad adoption across our platform.

In this role, you will drive the next-gen of on-device recording tech, building reliable video & audio capture that works across diverse devices & conditions. Your work will operate at a massive scale, supporting recording for millions of trips every day across thousands of device types in over 70+ countries, giving riders and drivers added protection.

This role requires a strong technical background, exceptional leadership skills, and a passion for driving innovation in the safety space.

**What the Candidate Will Do**

1. You will partner with leads from Engineering, Data Science, Operations, Design, and Support to establish a bold vision and execute on it in a way that balances speed, technical depth, engineering considerations and quality.
2. You will combine technical expertise with strong product sense, diving deep into technical and analytical challenges yourself, while obsessing over user experience & find novel solutions. You will work side by side with engineers & design to prototype new device media capabilities, test them in real-world scenarios, and iterate quickly to validate technical feasibility & user value.
3. You will need to be an inspirational leader for your team and cross-functional stakeholders. Internalize and deeply understand Uber’s mission and strategies, as well as the mission and objectives of your team. Formulate a long and short-term product strategy to develop breakthrough products and solutions based on deep customer insights, and business needs.
4. Galvanize technical and business stakeholders across the company to align to your vision. Lead other leaders without authority. Understand the differences in priorities across the business and across different local regions is essential. You will work with our regional teams to understand issues on the ground and make those solutions a part of your roadmap.
5. Partner with User Experience Research, Operations, and Support teams to seek insights on user problems and evangelize those problems, along with your proposed solutions, across Uber. Work with our regional teams to understand issues on the ground and make those solutions a part of their roadmap.
6. Develop positive partnerships and make strategic trade-offs advised by data. Collaborate and partner with engineering/business to develop a clear roadmap and drive execution across the organization. Work with researchers to conduct a program of quantitative and qualitative insight gathering and evaluation. Anticipate and remove obstacles that slow down or prevent us from delivering on product objectives.
7. Effectively present and communicate product strategy, implementation, and plans to various communities ranging from your immediate team to business audiences, external partners, and executive leadership.
8. Build and cultivate a strong team culture with a focus on execution and results. Be a highly effective collaborator and a magnet that cross-functional partners seek out for input and look forward to working with.

**Basic Qualifications**

1. Product Experience: Minimum 5+ years of product management experience delivering highly successful and innovative products with your fingerprints all over them -- and you're deeply proud of what you've accomplished.
2. Bachelor degree or equivalent.
3. Technically proficient - You have collaborated with engineers in developing sophisticated technical architecture as part of the products you have built. You understand the right questions to pose and the right proposals to bring forward in a highly technical context, in order to optimize the team’s direction to maximize utility to the user and value to the business.
4. Vision - You have crafted an inspiring and coherent product vision, multi-year strategy, and quarterly roadmap that your team and the business emphatically accepted and rallied behind.
5. Product Sense - Stellar design instincts, sharp analytical skills, and thoughtful product decisions. A high bar across the board — from your own contributions to the people you work with to the products you work on. You own what you build.
6. Experience leading product managers and product management teams.
7. Leadership Experience: Prior experience setting and delivering on a strategy you crafted, where you were accountable for the outcomes.
8. A “Driver” mentality. You are biased toward action, a great collaborator, a master disambiguate/simplifier, and constantly pushing toward clarity and delivery.
9. Grittiness. You never hesitate to roll up your sleeves and solve something hands-on.

**Preferred Qualifications**

1. Experience working directly on Video, Recording, or Media-focused products and platforms within an engineering and product management context.
2. Experience working within a highly matrixed organization including collaborators across Product, Eng, Business Ops, Public Policy, and more.
3. Experience running sophisticated experiments to assess the efficiency of releases.
4. Experience identifying risk trends and finding efficient ways to address them.
5. Strong technical fluency in areas like mobile platforms (iOS/Android), device reliability constraints (storage, battery, bandwidth), or security/privacy tradeoffs that come with handling sensitive media.
6. Track record of pairing technical depth with strong product sense, turning complex engineering capabilities into simple, trusted, and widely adopted user experiences.
