jobs.title: Safety Investigations Specialist I
jobs.description:
**About the role and team**

This role is at the heart of Uber’s commitment to safety, supporting users during critical and often stressful incidents on the Uber Rides and Uber Eats platforms. You will be responsible for investigating complex safety reports, making difficult decisions under pressure, and communicating with users who may be distressed. This isn't just about closing tickets; it's about upholding our standards in real-time.

The right person for this role remains calm and objective, even when handling sensitive situations and incomplete information. You'll need to balance empathy with firm policy application, acting as a critical advocate for our community. This work is challenging but provides a direct path to making our platform safer for millions of users.

**What you’ll do**

- Investigate complex and sensitive safety incidents from start to finish, gathering facts from multiple sources to make sound judgments.

- Communicate directly with users (riders, drivers, eaters, and others) by phone and messaging, showing empathy while clearly explaining policies and outcomes.

- Manage a high-volume, live queue of urgent cases, prioritizing critical issues and making swift, decisive actions to secure accounts and mitigate risk.

- Document case details thoroughly, ensuring every action is clear, justified, and compliant with our internal processes and safety standards.

- Collaborate with internal teams like legal, insurance, and law enforcement relations to resolve escalations and provide necessary information.


**How you’ll spend your time**

- 50% Case Investigation & Resolution

- 30% User Communication (Phone & Messaging)

- 20% Documentation & Cross-Functional Collaboration


**Basic qualifications**

- Experience in a high-volume customer support or escalated support role.

- Experience handling sensitive, urgent, or high-priority issues, such as in a crisis center, investigations, or claims management.

- Proficiency in navigating multiple computer systems simultaneously (e.g., ticketing systems, knowledge bases) to manage a high-volume caseload.

- Availability to work in rotating shifts, including weekends and evenings, totaling 40 hours per week.


**Preferred qualifications**

- Demonstrated ability to remain calm, objective, and empathetic while handling emotionally charged situations.

- Strong critical thinking and problem-solving skills, with an ability to make sound decisions with incomplete information.

- Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with experience in de-escalation and navigating difficult conversations.

- High degree of personal integrity and commitment to doing the right thing.

**About the Role**

This role serves as the bridge between the PM/Eng teams and the Sales organization for Uber’s advertising products. The Product Go-To-Market Manager ensures Uber builds the right ad products with effective launch strategies. They coordinate input from sales and clients to inform product roadmaps, drive product adoption efforts, and close the feedback loop between the field and the product team.

**What You'll Do:**

- Define and implement processes to channel field input into product strategy and align go-to-market plans with product roadmaps
- Develop and execute end-to-end launch plans for new ad products, coordinating cross-functional readiness (e.g. sales training, marketing, legal, support) to ensure successful rollouts
- Monitor product performance and gather feedback post-launch, advocating for key insights from advertisers and sales teams to guide continuous product improvements

- Bachelor's degree

- Excellent organizational and communication skills, able to engage stakeholders at all levels and translate business needs into product requirements
- Strategic and analytical mindset with knowledge of the ad tech ecosystem; experience managing go-to-market projects

jobs.title: Senior Manager, BizOps - Global Portfolio Analysis
locations: Washington, District of Columbia, United States
New York, New York, United States
jobs.location: Washington, District of Columbia, United States
jobs.description:
**About the Role**

The Global BizOps team is responsible for building and continuously improving an advanced business data and tools ecosystem. This ecosystem empowers every Mobility Operations staff member to understand the ground truth of our business quickly.

The Global Performance Analysis (GPA) Lead challenges executive leadership to focus on the biggest, most consequential aspects of business performance. In doing so, this role enables a globally aligned ‘management by exception’ model where regional teams contextualise business performance via a global lens, and challenges from executives steer operations analytical capacity to be focused on the most globally-relevant questions and assumptions.

This role, which is anticipated to build out a small team of direct report ICs over time, will utilize (and motivate) new global analytical tools to achieve a deeper level of understanding of our business performance than we’ve ever had before; deep diving on metric trends, relationships, inter-dependencies, variabilities, sensitivities, uncertainties, risks, assumptions and BBQs (‘big bold questions’) with a particular focus on (1) understanding how our business is evolving / will evolve over the next 3-5 years, and (2) identifying what we can do NOW to optimise performance later.

This role will work closely with the Global Head of BizOps and the Head of Global S&P to evolve the content of Uber Mobility’s executive materials, and will work closely with BizOps “Economic Performance” and other Ops counterparts in each region, to ‘operationalise’ a model where all ‘top down’ challenge and questions are appropriately contextualised, framed, prioritised and reported back on. The GPA Lead will also work with these regional and local stakeholders to help shape and contextualize/couch ‘bottoms up’ findings in a way that they can be immediately understood within the existing executive narrative of performance.

### **What You'll Do**

- **Analyze global business performance** using advanced analytical tools and surface key insights, risks, opportunities and questions.
- **Maintain a constantly updated perspective** of the most important global and regional performance characteristics and update this view in light of new signals. “What should we care about right now?” and “are we focusing on the right topics?” are your P0 concerns
- **Enable and coordinate a ‘management by exception’ model** across global and regional operations teams, enabling all analytical efforts to be applied in a prioritised and efficient manner.
- **Deep dive on priority questions, hypotheses and opportunities** to understand ground truth and report back to Mobility leadership on what’s happening and whether we should consider taking action
- **Maintain a clearly documented and transparent PoV** on the most important BBQs (Big Bold Questions) and Assumptions on which business strategy is based. Use this to help organise analytical resources where appropriate to answer BBQs and challenge assumptions.
- **Face off to regional BizOps Economic Performance Leads** (and/or their Ops equivalents) in each region, to ensure a coherent and globally scaled approach to cost saving, cost avoidance, capacity release and capacity re-investment; as a mechanism for freeing up resources to be re-focused on globally prioritised regional topics
- **Develop deep SME knowledge of the economics and dynamics** of Uber’s mobility business, and use this to steer, coach, challenge leaders. Ultimately, this role will also contribute to the development of semantic layers for future biz performance focused AI-interfaces.
- **Provide input to the DMAP Design Lead** w.r.t. what analytical tools, models and other capabilities should be prioritised for development, and/or where specific or bespoke requirements exist to enable us to solve gnarly problems or go after outsize opportunities

**Basic Qualifications**

- **Experience:** 8+ years of experience designing, building \*and\* using internal analytical tools within a data-driven organization to analyse and report on business performance.
- **Business Acumen / Intuition:** Deep understanding and intuition for the drivers of business performance within a complex and dynamic marketplace environment, and an ability to go beyond the data to consider the ‘so what’ and zero in on P0 characteristics
- **Technical:** Strong data visualisation skills (R, Python, Tableau, Looker Studio, etc.); you’re able to perform exploratory data analysis to rapidly deep dive into topics and analyse them / diagnose them / develop recommendations
- **Quantitative:** STEM background with experience in time series analysis; this can be in financial services, hedge funds, or in industrial / medical fields. The key is demonstrated experience interpreting multivariate performance trends and using this to challenge the consensus view of performance.
- **Communication & Influence:** Able to articulate complex analysis in simple terms for senior leaders and a wide variety of other stakeholders; without losing the richness of insights. I.e. being ‘as simple as possible but no simpler’
- **Stakeholder Management:** Acts as a coach and partner to a large number of global and regionally located stakeholders; enabling, steering, challenging and nudging in a way that builds trust rather than erodes it

**Preferred Qualifications**

- A combination of Quantitative PhD and industry experience
- Has held a quantitative analyst role analysing the performance of portfolios of assets.
- Has experience of business performance analysis within retail or consumer industries
- Quantitative consulting experience a big plus; with examples of the findings you surfaced / the value these brought to your clients
- Comfortable being hands-on / working quickly with R, Python, and coding-based statistical & analytical tools. Bonus points if you’ve built your own analytical suites previously
- Experience presenting to CxO level stakeholders and/or boards

For New York, NY-based roles: The base salary range for this role is USD$186,000 per year - USD$207,000 per year.

For Washington, DC-based roles: The base salary range for this role is USD$186,000 per year - USD$207,000 per year.

For all US locations, you will be eligible to participate in Uber's bonus program, and may be offered an equity award & other types of comp. You will also be eligible for various benefits. More details can be found at the following link [https://www.uber.com/careers/benefits](https://www.uber.com/careers/benefits).

jobs.title: Head of Northern Europe, Public Policy
jobs.description:
**About the Role**

We are looking for someone to lead Uber’s Public Policy team in Northern Europe, based in Amsterdam and reporting to the Senior Policy Director for France, EU and Northern Europe.

You will be leading a team of two and working in one of the world’s most talked-about tech companies on legislation that shapes our digital future, the future of work, AI and AV regulations, and urban sustainability and logistics. The Northern Europe region covers the Netherlands, Belgium, Luxembourg, Denmark, Norway, Sweden, Finland, and Ireland).

**What You'll Do**

1. Develop a clear and ambitious Public Policy strategy across a very varied region, so that it aligns with our mobility and delivery business objectives. You will proactively influence and anticipate policy trends, and design effective advocacy campaigns;
2. Lead and inspire the Northern Europe Policy team to help your colleagues grow professionally while delivering best-in-class integrated campaigns;
3. Represent Uber and establish a strong network of partners and allies with third-parties and decision-makers, embodying at all times the values and transparency that drive our advocacy work;
4. Protect and promote our EMEA Amsterdam HQ, closely monitoring trends, debates, and policy developments that affect our corporate presence;
5. Create trusted relationships with policy, operational and cross-functional country-level teams, to firmly anchor Uber positions into our day-to-day operations.

**What You'll Need**

1. **An agile and strategic mind:** The Uber policy team manages multiple policy fields, and Northern Europe is extremely varied. You must be adaptable, quick-minded, and able to immerse yourself quickly into new topics. You will be expected to identify and act independently on issues, and drive them internally as well as externally with senior stakeholders.
2. **An experienced manager:** You will need to make the most of the combined talent of the team, and provide both support and autonomy to allow public policy professionals to perform at their best and grow in their roles;
3. **A good communicator:** You should be able to articulate arguments clearly and simply, without jargon, to high-level internal and external audiences. You'll need strong writing skills and the ability to distill complex business issues into clear, actionable advice
4. **A team-player:** Success at Uber depends on the ability to organize different teams around shared goals. We’re looking for someone who is well-organized, enjoys collaborating across teams to drive swift and effective outcomes, and has the ability to build trusting and long-lasting relationships, internally and externally.
5. **An appetite to learn and grow:** Uber is a fast-paced environment where you are guaranteed to learn a lot. We are looking for someone who is able to handle uncertainty and change, and makes the most of feedback.
6. **Fluency in English (oral and written) is essential.**

**Bonus Points If**

**10+ years of experience** engaging with decision-makers and managing policy issues in a corporate, government, or third-party setting.

**Fluency in Dutch** would be a strong advantage.

**Experience** in the fields of tech, mobility and labour law is an advantage .

jobs.title: Uber Eats Coordinator - Merchant Expert Team (English Speaker)
jobs.description:
**About the Role**

We are seeking a highly motivated and detail-oriented Customer Service Specialist to join our Merchant Expert team.This is not a typical reactive support role, you’ll take ownership of merchant relationships, anticipate issues before they arise, and go the extra mile to ensure exceptional outcomes. You’ll handle high-impact situations, including escalations from account managers and complex restaurant ownership changes, with confidence and care. Success in this role means picking up the phone before problems escalate, driving retention with strategic outreach, and finding win-win solutions that strengthen partnerships. We want someone who thrives on solving challenges, communicates with clarity, negotiates effectively, and takes pride in exceeding merchant expectations.

**What You'll Do**

01. **Escalation Management:** _._ Act as the POC for merchant escalations from account managers. Take full ownership, investigate, find root causes, and resolve complex issues effectively. This includes both outbound and in some cases possible inbound calls to resolve issues.
02. **Collaborate:** cross-functionally with Central and Ops teams and AM’s to resolve merchant/process issues and drive satisfaction
03. **Change of Ownership Process & Proactive Account Management:** Own the end-to-end process for restaurant change of ownerships. This includes:
04. Initiating contact with the new and previous owners _._(call to explain COO process and set correct expectation regarding timeline & comm)
05. Collecting, verifying, and processing all necessary legal and financial documentation in a timely manner.
06. Coordinating with internal teams (e.g., Legal, Finance, Onboarding) to ensure a smooth transition.
07. Proactively managing communication with all parties to prevent delays and provide status updates.
08. Handle all interactions with merchants in an account management style, focusing on building long-term relationships and ensuring their continued success on our platform.
09. Utilise outbound calls as a primary tool to ensure high-touch service, confirm satisfaction, and expedite the return of documents and completion of tasks.
10. Anticipate merchant needs and proactively offer solutions before issues are reported.
11. **Basic Sales & Churn Management:** Apply basic sales training to identify opportunities to upsell or cross-sell additional products and services to merchants during interactions.
12. Utilise basic churn management training to identify at-risk merchants and implement strategies to retain them, particularly during periods of transition or high-stress escalations.
13. Address and resolve concerns that could lead to merchant churn, turning negative experiences into positive outcomes.
14. **Documentation & Reporting:** Maintain meticulous records of all merchant interactions, ownership changes, and escalation resolutions in Bliss/Salesforce
15. Provide clear, regular updates to account managers and leadership on active cases.
16. Surface patterns and recurring issues to improve processes and enhance our product offering.

**Basic Qualifications**

1. Minimum of 6 months experience in a customer service, account management, or merchant support role.
2. Minimum 6 months experience in Delivery LoB
3. Exceptional verbal and written communication skills with a professional and empathetic tone.
4. Outstanding work ethic, attention to detail and curiosity
5. Ability to adapt to a constantly evolving fast-paced environment
6. Speed, resourcefulness, and go-getter attitude.
7. Highly responsive and data-oriented attitude, able to take the initiative and maintain high-quality relationships with all kinds of partners

**Preferred Qualifications**

1. Proven experience handling complex, escalated customer issues with successful outcomes.
2. Demonstrated ability to manage multiple priorities and projects simultaneously in a fast-paced environment.
3. Strong problem-solving and analytical skills, with the ability to troubleshoot issues independently and take initiative to find effective solutions.
4. **Comfortable using outbound calls to build relationships and meet goals.**
5. Work well with others, sharing knowledge and ideas to improve processes, enhance user experiences, and create a better work environment.

jobs.location: New York, New York, United States
jobs.description:
**About the Role**

We are actively looking for a resourceful, proactive, and experienced graphic designer to help build out our Creative team within the broader ads team. As a Graphic Designer, you will support the Uber Advertising Sales and Account Management team to drive sustainable revenue growth. You’ll be a pivotal partner to sales and product teams as you support the creation of campaigns, websites and product launches. You can take a brief or concept and make it come to life in visually stunning ways. You are highly skilled across facets of design and adept at sharing your work with clients and partners.

**What You'll Do:**

- Collaborate with multiple internal teams to define workflows, influence product and business decisions, and develop materials that bring ideas to life
- Collaborate cross-functionally, balance the needs of stakeholders, and break down complex needs into simple, compelling solutions
- Create, inspire, and sustain a standard of excellence with a focus on craft and quality
- Present concepts to clients (and internal teams) with poise
- Design solutions across multiple surfaces, partnering with a wide variety of teams to bring their vision to reality
- Champion creativity in advertising on Uber by creating tangible examples, prototypes and supporting the growth of Uber Advertising.
- Own the prototyping process: build work based on briefs, seek feedback and push projects over the finish line
- Design websites, case studies, decks, and materials that drive advertiser success across the Uber platform
- Lead creative direction for CRM ad campaigns and new digital ad products

**Basic Qualfications:**

- 5+ years of professional work experience within digital Graphic Design, with a portfolio of past work

- Advanced proficiency with Adobe CC, Figma
- Bachelor's degree

**Preferred Qualifications:**

- Experience working digital-first daily
- Passionate about design, learning new tools, and bringing the best and latest design solutions to the job
- Resilient and resourceful in face of ambiguity, thriving on change
- Comfortable working cross-functionally with many other roles and stakeholders
- Experience with motion graphics and After Effects
- Past roles at an ad agency or internal ads marketing organization
- High level of attention to detail, organizational skills, and self-accountability

For New York, NY-based roles: The base salary range for this role is USD$130,000 per year - USD$144,000 per year.

You will be eligible to participate in Uber's bonus program, and may be offered an equity award & other types of comp. You will also be eligible for various benefits. More details can be found at the following link [https://www.uber.com/careers/benefits](https://www.uber.com/careers/benefits).

jobs.title: Account Partner, Eats SMB
jobs.description:
**About the Role**

Uber Eats is looking for sharp, highly motivated individuals to join our Small-to-Medium Sized Business (“SMB”) Account Management Team to be focused on our Southeast markets (Miami based). As an SMB Account Manager, you will work efficiently and effectively with our SMB restaurant partners to optimize restaurant operations, strengthen our relationship with partners through excellent consultative recommendations for business growth, and identify upsell opportunities for other product offerings. This is a client-facing role as an individual contributor.

##### What You'll Do

- Collaborate with a high-value portfolio of restaurant partners to retain and grow a book of business of SMB accounts on the Uber Eats platform
- Identifying new sales opportunities through product adoption and location expansion
- Identify opportunities and recognize additional revenue potential
- Identify key risks to our partnerships, and work quickly and diligently to ensure we are delivering the best possible experience for our partners and to ensure 100% account retention
- Collect and synthesize restaurant partner feedback into insights that can inform and drive the product and business roadmap
- Build meaningful, lasting relationships to make Uber Eats the delivery platform of choice for our restaurant partners

**Basic Qualifications**

- At least 1 year of experience in a B2B, client facing role (Sales, Customer Success, Account Management, or upper management retail/food industry)

**Preferred Qualifications**

- Experience navigating the customer lifecycle including prospecting new contacts within an existing client organization
- Self-starter attitude and ability to thrive in a fast-paced, autonomous team environment
- Strong interpersonal skills, with the ability to clearly frame a value proposition, probe for objections, remove obstacles, and eliminate barriers to gain commitment
- Willingness to hustle, roll-up sleeves, and get in the weeds with our highest value partners in order to hit quarterly and annual revenue, retention, and adoption targets
- Ability to think strategically and analyze restaurant needs to both unlock opportunities and creatively problem-solve
- Demonstrate time management and organizational skills with the ability to multitask and prioritize based on impact CRM experience (Salesforce experience a plus)
- Google Suite Experience is highly preferred

For Miami, FL-based roles:

The total annualized on-target earnings (OTE) for this position is USD  $72,800 - $76,663. The OTE includes a base hourly rate of USD $24.50 per hour - $25.80 per hour and an annualized cash variable incentive target of USD $21,840-$22,999. The cash variable incentive target is based on individual sales performance and its payment is based on the terms of the Sales Incentive Plan.

jobs.title: SMB Account Executive, Uber for Business
jobs.description:
### About the Role

Sales at Uber for Business (U4B) means navigating ambiguity, earning trust fast, and solving problems that don’t come with a script. It’s not about pushing a product—it’s about building long-term partnerships in a fast-changing environment. If you’re resilient, resourceful, and energized by the messy reality of doing big things—this is where you’ll grow.

As an Account Executive within the U4B SMB team in Brazil, you are at the forefront of our growth engine. You won't be following a polished corporate manual; instead, you’ll be out in the market, prospecting and closing deals in a high-speed environment where the answers aren't always clear. This role is for someone who thrives on ownership and is excited by the challenge of managing a high volume of prospects while maintaining the grit needed to turn a "no" into a "yes."

This is a hybrid role—our team collaborates in person out of our office in Sao Paulo at least 3 days/week (Tuesday, Wednesday, and Thursday).

### What You’ll Do

- **Drive New Business:** Prospect, pitch, and close the newest products in the U4B portfolio, targeting decision-makers across diverse SMB industries in Brazil.

- **Manage the Hustle:** Navigate high-volume outreach and pipeline management with urgency, keeping the momentum moving even when things get messy.

- **Solve Real Problems:** Listen to customer pain points and move quickly to offer practical solutions, ensuring our B2B tools help their businesses move better.

- **Own Your Numbers:** Take full accountability for your bi-annual and quarterly targets, managing your pipeline within Salesforce with discipline and clarity.

- **Collaborate at Speed:** Work cross-functionally with operations and product teams to share feedback from the field and help resolve blockers for your clients.

- **Adapt and Grow:** Stay resilient through tough negotiations and shifting priorities, using every challenge as an opportunity to sharpen your sales skills.

- **Build the Foundation:** Help write the playbook for a growing line of business by creating trackers and playbooks that help the team scale.


### Basic Qualifications

- Minimum 2 years of B2B sales experience (at least 1 year in an Account Executive or similar closing role).

- Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration or a related field.

- Proficiency in English and Portuguese.


### Preferred Qualifications

- Experience in SaaS or high-growth tech environments.

- Strong interest in using data-driven insights to refine your personal sales strategy.

- Adaptability to handle high-pressure environments and the "ambiguity" of a rapidly evolving product suite.

- Proven ability to manage a large portfolio of accounts while maintaining attention to detail.

- A "go-get-it" attitude and a team-player mindset focused on collective excellence.

jobs.title: Program Manager II, Tech
jobs.description:
**About the Role**

We are seeking a highly experienced Program Manager, Quality Assurance, to join the Uber AI Solutions (UAIS) QA team. For over a decade, our QA organization has been instrumental in ensuring the quality of Uber’s critical products. We are now expanding our mission, leveraging this deep expertise to help external partner companies launch defect-free products and significantly reduce their QA cycle times.

This role requires a unique blend of technical QA mastery, strategic vision, and client-facing skills. You will be one of the key custodians of quality, responsible for managing the full lifecycle of testing (both manual testing and automation) and production bug management for both internal Uber products and our new external customers.

**What you will Do:**

1. **Go-to-Market (GTM) Strategy:** Work closely with the Sales team to act as the primary technical QA expert, pitching our advanced testing capabilities and service offerings to prospective clients.
2. **Customer Engagement & Conversion:** Lead the execution and delivery of successful product testing pilots with external prospects, playing a critical role in converting these engagements into full-time Managed Service contracts.
3. **Solution Architecture:** Understand the core pain points and quality gaps of our customers, and strategically gauge the best possible solution—leveraging both internal UAIS QA frameworks (both manual testing and automation) and industry-leading external tools—to solve their problems.
4. **Quality Leadership:** Lead the development, implementation, and continuous improvement of product testing strategies across both internal Uber products and partner company deliverables.
5. **Operational Oversight:** Provide strategic and operational leadership for end-to-end testing, release quality, and production bug management processes across complex application ecosystems.
6. **Framework Development:** Define and execute complex testing and quality assurance frameworks, ensuring all Uber and client products maintain the highest quality standards. The framework should help us to seamlessly test for both AI and non-AI products.

**What you will Need:**

1. 8+ years of experience in program management and client management as a QA manager are required.
2. **QA Expertise:** Solid, deep understanding of the entire QA lifecycle (both manual testing and automation), including functional, non-functional (performance, security), and acceptance testing required for various product types (web, mobile, AI/Agentic).
3. **Automation Platforms:** Proven, hands-on experience working with industry-leading low-code/no-code test automation platforms and successfully using them to address gaps in product quality and accelerate development cycles.
4. **Program Management:** Demonstrated success in a Program Management role focused on quality or engineering processes, with the ability to manage complex cross-functional projects.
5. **Strategic Acumen:** Ability to transition between strategic planning (defining long-term quality vision) and operational execution (managing daily testing challenges).
6. **Client Communication:** Exceptional presentation, negotiation, and written communication skills, necessary for pitching services and translating technical needs into business value for external clients.
7. **Vendor Management:** Demonstrated experience successfully collaborating with and managing external vendor teams or third-party service providers to deliver QA services or product solutions.
8. **Global Flexibility:** Willingness and ability to travel (domestic and international) as required to support client engagement and delivery. Must be flexible to adjust shift timings to align with global customers and time zones.

\-\-\-\- Preferred Qualifications ----

1. Experience utilizing leading test automation tools such as TOSCA and TESTIM.
2. Direct experience partnering with AI Engineering teams to test and successfully launch AI/Agentic products.
3. Experience in managing the end-to-end financial budget of a large-scale program or QA vertical.

jobs.title: Groceries & Retail Junior Account Manager Colombia / Costa Rica
locations: San Rafael de Escazu, Costa Rica
jobs.description:
## **About the Role**

The Account Partner drives growth, operational excellence, and long-term success for Uber’s retail partners. You will own a portfolio of merchants—from local stores to large supermarket chains—and act as their primary strategic partner. This role requires strong commercial acumen, advanced data analysis skills, and the ability to navigate operational and technical topics with merchants and internal teams.

You’ll diagnose performance trends using dashboards and raw data, identify growth opportunities, design number-backed strategies, and ensure flawless execution across catalog, integrations, and product workflows. You will also own complex conversations, from commercial adjustments to operational escalations, while influencing cross-functional teams to bring solutions to life.

This position is ideal for someone curious about technology, passionate about solving problems through data, proactive in driving impact, and comfortable managing diverse stakeholders in fast-changing environments.

## **What You'll Do**

- Own a portfolio of retail merchants, acting as their main strategic partner and driving retention and growth.

- Use data analysis (dashboards + raw data) to diagnose performance issues, identify opportunities, and build number-backed growth plans.

- Prepare commercial storytelling using data to demonstrate ROI and justify merchant investments.

- Support the acquisition of new strategic merchants and collaborate with Sales on transitions into the active portfolio

- Improve operational performance by analyzing key app metrics (cancellations, stock accuracy, catalog health) and driving corrective actions.

- Navigate technical and catalog-related topics (integrations, catalog structure, API/webhook/basic concepts) with internal teams and merchants.

- Proactively identify opportunities, lead initiatives, and adapt quickly in a fast-evolving retail environment.


**Basic Requirements**

- Intermediate-Advanced proficiency in English to manage internal projects, communications, and ticket-based requests.
- 1–2 years of full-cycle account management or B2B sales experience in a fast-paced, analytical environment.

- Strong communication skills with the ability to handle complex or difficult conversations with merchants.
- Strong data analysis skills (Google Sheets/Excel proficiency required) and the ability to create insights using dashboards (e.g., Tableau) or raw data

- Demonstrated success managing commercial relationships and negotiations to achieve a measurable quota or revenue target.

- Customer-centric approach and strong organizational skills, with the ability to manage multiple priorities.

- Demonstrated ability to effectively manage stakeholder engagement and alignment across internal teams or external partners.

- Curiosity and openness to understanding technical concepts related to integrations, catalog structure, and system workflows—no programming required

## **Preferred Qualifications**

- Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Marketing, Economics, or a related field
- Familiarity with Salesforce or similar CRM tools for pipeline management and disciplined reporting.
- Proven ability in negotiation, deal-making, and upselling digital marketing tools (ads, offers, campaigns) that directly accelerate partner growth.

- Experience working with a mixed portfolio of accounts (SMB, mid-market, or enterprise) in the retail, grocery, e-commerce, or CPG industries.

- Strong analytical curiosity with a focus on improving operational metrics like cancellation rates and basket size, reflecting a high level of business acumen and data focus.

jobs.title: Customer Success Manager, Uber Direct (Sweden)
jobs.description:
**About the role and team**

Uber Direct is our white-label delivery service that enables merchants in Sweden to offer fast, same-day delivery from their own websites, apps, or stores — with no need for customers to use the Uber app. You will own the long-term commercial health of these partnerships, ensuring they scale effectively on our platform. Your work bridges the gap between digital strategy and physical logistics at a massive scale.

Success here requires the grit to solve messy problems and the influence to align stakeholders with competing priorities. You must stay steady under pressure, using data to navigate ambiguity and drive results for your partners. You will build deep expertise in the local delivery ecosystem and help define the standard for how the Swedish market experiences on-demand logistics.

**What you’ll do**

- Lead long-term strategic relationships with key Swedish merchants, acting as the primary owner for their growth and success on the Uber Direct platform.

- Navigate complex operational challenges by analyzing performance metrics and delivering high-impact recommendations that improve delivery reliability and user experience.

- Drive cross-functional collaboration with product and operations teams to unblock partner issues and influence the product roadmap based on local market insights.

- Scale account impact by conducting deep-dive business reviews and identifying expansion opportunities that align partner goals with Uber’s marketplace dynamics.

- Manage the end-to-end merchant health cycle, from proactive performance monitoring to resolving high-stakes escalations with urgency and clear communication.


**Basic qualifications**

- 3+ years of experience in customer success, account management, or strategic consulting within a high-growth environment.

- Bachelor's degree in Business, Economics, or a related field.

- Fluency in Swedish and English (written and verbal).

- 3+ years of experience using data analysis tools (Excel) to drive decision-making and present findings to stakeholders.


**Preferred qualifications**

- Expertise in a marketplace business

- Proficiency in SQL for independent data extraction and deeper analytical insights.

jobs.title: Sales Manager, Uber Eats, Ireland
jobs.description:
**About the Role**

This isn't just a sales leadership role; it's about leading a high-impact team to shape the future of food delivery in Ireland and drive real-world merchant growth. You'll build and scale our business, which means you'll be leading in a fast-moving environment.

Your team's partnerships will have a tangible impact on local restaurants and the way people move and eat in your city. You’ll oversee their efforts in outreach, negotiation, relationship building and merchant onboarding.

The Uber Eats Sales Manager will lead a team of high-performing Account Executives, overseeing their efforts in outreach, negotiation, relationship building and merchant onboarding. Success requires a strategic mindset, the ability to set geo-level commercial strategies, and strong people leadership to guide your team in achieving key business metrics. Equally important is a people-first approach, ensuring the development and growth of your individual contributors. Bonus points if you have experience in the local restaurant industry!

**What you’ll do**

- Define and lead the geo-level commercial sales strategy for Uber Eats in Ireland, translating business goals into clear sales plans and team priorities.
- Manage and develop a team of Account Executives by setting expectations, reviewing pipeline health, and supporting ongoing professional growth.
- Support high-value commercial negotiations, stepping in when needed to guide deal structure and ensure long-term, mutually beneficial partnerships.
- Drive strong execution by monitoring performance metrics, identifying risks early, and adjusting team focus where needed.
- Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams—such as Operations, Marketing, and Legal—to resolve partner challenges

**How you’ll spend your time**

- **40%** – Coaching, performance management, and developing team members
- **30%** – Setting and refining geo-level commercial strategy and goals
- **15%** – Supporting key commercial deals and resolving partnership blockers
- **15%** – Cross-functional collaboration and internal alignment

**Basic qualifications**

- 5+ years of experience in B2B sales or commercial management, with a focus on outbound prospecting and high-volume lead generation in a high-growth environment.
- 3+ years of experience leading, coaching, and developing a sales or commercial team to achieve regional targets.
- Demonstrated experience using data—including pipeline metrics and market insights—to forecast revenue and improve team performance for a group of at least 5 direct reports.
- Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Economics, or a related field, or equivalent experience through at least 5 years in a commercial leadership role.
- Fluency in English (verbal and written), demonstrated through professional experience managing stakeholders and contracts.

**Preferred qualifications**

- Experience leading commercial teams within the technology, food delivery, SaaS, or hospitality sectors.
- Advanced in one or all of Google Sheets/Excel, Salesforce
- Demonstrated ability to influence cross-functional teams and senior leadership in environments with competing priorities.
- A track record of taking ownership of large-scale initiatives and successfully driving them to completion in a dynamic environment.

jobs.title: Program Manager, Analytics
jobs.description:
**About the Role**

As a member of the GSS DAS team, you will have the opportunity to drive the analysis behind various Product and Ops related decisions at Uber. You will perform a range of activities demonstrating your analytical thought leadership and will be involved in leading multiple data-driven projects including , but not limited to :

1. Design of KPI tracking systems for complex company-wide metrics across various Uber products and teams globally
2. Performing analytical deep dives to drive product/strategy road-map
3. Design of efficiency analytical data marts that mimic product flow at scale

\-\-\-\- What the Candidate Will Do ----

You will work on a range of analytics projects to help partner teams in boosting efficiency and fostering growth throughout the business. Your role will entail delivering valuable qualitative insights and collaborating with engineering, data science, and product teams to develop analytics solutions.

The ideal candidate is experienced working with large data sets and data visualization, as well as being passionate about data and analytics. Following would be what you will do day-to-day:

1. Utilize expertise in data analysis, and visualization to develop end-to-end analytical solutions.
2. Translate analytical solution into actionable insights and recommendations for technical and non-technical audience in a clear, concise and persuasive way
3. Maintain and continue to raise the bar for quality/efficiency of analytical solution delivery
4. Focus on long term improvements by building, maintaining, and documenting best practices within the team and seek continuous improvement opportunities
5. Lead vendor data analysts in project execution
6. Do all that it takes to drive and deliver multiple analytical and data engineering projects to partner teams across Uber
7. Get pumped up by deciphering huge data sets and cutting through irrelevant distractions to the heart of the core data questions from partner teams
8. Attention to detail, accuracy is a must!
9. Humble and scrappy - not afraid to take on lower level projects when it will clear roadblocks for the team

\-\-\-\- Basic Qualifications ----

1. Minimum 4 years experience working in business intelligence, analytics, data engineering, or a similar role
2. Experience using SQL in a production environment.
3. Experience using Python or R to work with large data sets at scale.
4. Experience with dashboarding and using data visualization tools.
5. Fluency in communicating data insights (Methods, Results & Actions) with the peer group
6. Should be a team player and being able to multitask
7. Ability to work with remote teams and across time zones
8. Being able to raise the bar for quality/efficiency within the team

\-\-\-\- Preferred Qualifications ----

1. BS / MS degree equivalent experience in Statistics, Economics, Engineering, or other quantitative fields.
2. Experience in experimental design and analysis, exploratory data analysis, data modelling and statistical analysis.
3. Experience managing projects across large, ambiguous scopes and driving initiatives in a fast moving, cross-functional environment.
4. Experience working with Product and Engineering teams

jobs.title: Lisbon Sr Territory Lead, Uber Eats
jobs.description:
**About the Role**

At Uber, we ignite opportunity by setting the world in motion. We take on big problems to help drivers, riders, delivery partners, and eaters get moving in more than 600 cities around the world. We welcome people from all backgrounds who seek the opportunity to help build a future where everyone and everything can move independently. If you have the curiosity, passion, and collaborative spirit, work with us, and let’s move the world forward, together.

Uber Eats was launched in Portugal in November 2017 and is now the most downloaded Food Delivery App. We are available in 70+ cities, delivering from over 6,000 stores (restaurants and others) and growing quickly!

Uber Eats delivers the best of your city right when you want it. Our curated menus feature dishes from the local spots you love and the ones you’ve always wanted to try, as well as really anything else you may need on the go, from groceries, to beauty products, to flowers. It’s the same cashless payment as an Uber ride. You just have to tap the app and get anything delivered right to your doorstep and enjoy!

As the Lisbon Territory Lead for Uber Eats, you’ll play a pivotal role in one of our most strategic and high-performing markets globally. You’ll be responsible for owning the business performance of Lisbon end-to-end, driving commercial excellence through a team of experienced Account Managers.

We’re looking for a local market expert with B2B sales background, preferably in tech and/or hospitality/restaurant business who thrives in fast-paced environments. You must be fluent in Portuguese and bring a relentless drive for results, exceptional negotiation skills, and a talent for leading and inspiring high-performing teams.

The right candidate will have a rare combination of sound strategic vision, creative problem-solving, drive for results, and interpersonal ability to keep strong relationships with our merchant ba

### **What You'll Do**

1. **Strategy:** Own your market by defining business priorities, set bold timelines to reach those goals and take financial decisions
2. **Lead a local team:** you will have local teams on the ground that will help you managing your business. That's why we look forward to hiring optimistic leaders: developing these teams while shaping the organisation is key to our long term success.
3. **Drive performance and target achievement:** you will make sure your team performs at a very high level, always bringing incremental value to current and new merchants, and as a consequence, to Uber Eats
4. **Develop & Optimize Processes:** Uber is a company that moves fast and does things at large scale. You will help design processes; whether it be prospecting, onboarding, account management, training, etc. to fuel growth and drive efficiency.
5. **Restaurant Partners Relations:** Grow number of partners on the platform, manage partner development, monitor metrics, and ensure high-quality experiences on the Uber Eats system to provide the most reliable food delivery service in town.
6. **Team work:** Work closely with other teams, including Operations, Commops, Marketing, Comms and Policy and Regional teams, to implement new processes and products in your territory
7. **Be on the ground**: Have full control of your territory, meet your biggest partners and manage your team.
8. **Hustle**: take ownership and do what it takes to get the job done.

### What You Will Need

1. At least 5 years experience in operations management, management consulting, investment banking, strategy work in a large business, growing a startup or similar experience.
2. Outstanding commercial acumen and negotiation and deal-making capabilities
3. Proven team leadership and performance management experience
4. Data-driven decision making mentality and sound business judgment through analytical thinking
5. Ability to take initiative and easily adapt to constantly-changing work environment
6. A creative mindset and enjoy putting in place initiatives to solve practical issues
7. Fluency in Portuguese and English is required
8. SQL is a plus

jobs.title: Safety Investigation Specialist I - ANZ One Triage
jobs.description:
**#Greatmindsdontthinkalike:** At Uber, we take pride in our diversity and working environment that sees you as more than just a person that can do the job, but a unique individual that can level up our organization with a perspective only you can offer. Uber provides a truly open culture that encourages all to voice their thoughts.

**About the Role**

As an ANZ Safety Shift-Lead Specialist, you are the frontline for managing critical inbound escalations across the ANZ Safety landscape. Operating in a high-stakes environment, you’ll triage and direct sensitive user or stakeholder-raised cases, ensuring each is appropriately categorised, prioritised, and routed to the right team. Your role is pivotal to maintaining queue health, supporting the safety specialists operations, and ensuring that service delivery aligns with Uber’s global safety expectations. You’ll partner closely with cross-functional stakeholders and regional teams to drive proactive queue oversight, metrics adherence, and continuous operational improvement.

**Your Impact in Role:**

- **Triage and Escalation Ownership:** Act as the first point of contact for inbound critical safety escalations from users or internal stakeholders. Carefully review crash-detection escalations, user verbatims and supporting details, determine the nature and urgency of the case, and assign to the relevant ANZ Safety team for resolution - ensuring timely, accurate, and balanced queue distribution.
- **Queue Oversight & Management:** Own real-time queue management across MNL Urgent, SYD IRT and L4+ teams. Assign safety contact escalations by the users and stakeholders, monitor dashboards and filters, and coordinate across Slack channels to maintain workflow transparency and reduce backlog risk.
- **Operational Support & Coordination:** Lead handoff management, ensure unresolved or investigators who are out of office with open cases are redirected or reassigned, and provide regular status updates across active filters. Coordinate revision of aging or OOO cases to avoid user impact.
- **Performance Tracking & Reporting:** Support metric health by ensuring teams can meet key targets, especially around first-action timing and investigation readiness. Assist in managing overnight escalations and flag patterns that could affect regional and global SLAs.
- **Subject Matter Expertise and Enablement:** Function as a queue SME by supporting ANZ Safety Specialists through communication, tool navigation, and updates. Offer guidance on case movement, hold pattern management, and prioritisation logic.

**The Experience You'll Bring:**

**Basic Qualifications:**

- At least 6 months of customer support experience handling sensitive issues
- Strong EQ, emotional regulation, communication, problem-solving, and critical thinking skills

**Preferred Qualifications**

- **Analytical Judgment:** Ability to quickly assess urgency and risk level of escalated verbatim, and apply strong judgment to direct cases to appropriate teams.
- Attention to Detail: Confident in reviewing incident metadata, categorizing cases, and maintaining accurate dashboard and filter alignment.
- **Clear Communication:** Strong written and verbal communication across modalities (Slack, JIRA, chat, email) to align with internal stakeholders and peers.
- **Operational Awareness:** Understanding of service-level drivers such as queue pressure, case aging, and capacity constraints, with a mindset for action and escalation prevention.
- **Collaborative Approach:** Work closely with regional leaders, L&D, and Safety Investigations Specialists to enable seamless workflows and shared performance goals.

jobs.title: Senior Enterprise Account Executive, Uber for Business Japan
jobs.description:
**About the Role**

Uber for Business (U4B) in Japan is rapidly expanding, and positioned as the next star market to scale in the following years. We’ve been on a mission to create an Uber community within business organizations, leveraging our delightful Delivery and Mobility services to move every organization forward with Uber.

In this role, you will be immersed in an elite sales group and startup-like environment to show the sales velocity and establish enterprise business for U4B Japan

You will be accountable for driving new business acquisitions, managing forecast/ pipelines and executing through the GTM strategies. The ultimate goal is to land and expand the Enterprise segment with the essence of Uber for Business solutions.

Learn more about Uber for Business in Japan below:

- [About Uber for Business in Japan](https://www.uber.com/jp/ja/business/)
- [Uber for Business Japan Country Manager Interview](https://news.mynavi.jp/article/20251021-3521068/)

* * *

**What the candidate will do**

1. Plan, strategize and execute the sales GTM plan to achieve the quota in every half year within the Enterprise segment (employee headcount > 2,000)

2. Strong at identifying the pain points and being able to craft the winning narratives/ pitches to expand the lead-generation.

3. Solid pipeline management to drive the pacing and forecast numbers with a mature structure and sales cadence.

4. Coordinate end-to-end sales motions for corporate customers including qualification, education, pricing/quoting, contract negotiation, close deals and launch/ implementation.

5. Ability to prioritize and locate the key decision makers with sales velocity.

6. Work cross-functionally to ensure an effective account launch.

7. Continuously assess customers' evolving needs and aligning Uber for Business's value proposition to drive linkage and adoption

**Basic qualifications**

1. 7+ years of B2B sales in the enterprise sector – preferbly selling platform service or tech solution.

2. B2B direct sales background with 0-100 pipeline management experience.

3. Proven track record of crafting narratives to drive new business acquisitions – selling "nice-to-have" type of product.

4. Passionate, resilient, self-disciplined and hustling with hunter mindset. Self-initiating invidivual with a builder mindset.

5. Good communication and interpersonal skills to work effectively with cross functional teams, and manage multiple stakeholders.

6. Ability to thrive in a highly dynamic and fast-pacing environment.

7. Fluent in Japanese & Business level English.

* * *

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer - Android
jobs.description:
**About the Role**

As a Senior Android Engineer, you’ll help shape the AV rider journey end-to-end—from educational entry points and booking flows to real-time trip updates and in-vehicle Android tablet interactions across AV partner fleets. You’ll identify user pain points and design scalable solutions across geographies and AV partners. and design solutions that scale across geographies and AV partners. You’ll also mentor teammates and define our mobile technical roadmap.

**What You Will Do**

- Lead Android design and development of end-to-end AV rider experiences, including booking flows, on-trip interactions, and educational surfaces
- Partner with PMs, designers, and backend leads to own product outcomes
- Mentor junior engineers and contribute to broader technical strategy
- Drive rigorous experimentation and data-driven iteration across experience surfaces

**Basic Qualifications**

- Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related technical field or equivalent practical experience
- 3+ years of experience in Android development
- Proficiency in platform-specific architecture patterns and frameworks (Kotlin/Java)
- Understanding of user experience and performance optimization on mobile
- Self-starter mindset and a bias for shipping impactful features

**Preferred Qualifications**

- 5+ years of software engineering experience
- Experience shipping complex mobile features in production
- Familiarity with metrics platforms (e.g., Experimentation, Analytics SDKs)
- Prior involvement in developing new product paradigms or zero-to-one launches

For San Francisco, CA-based roles: The base salary range for this role is USD$198,000 per year - USD$220,000 per year.

jobs.title: Head of Channel Sales, Uber Eats Japan
jobs.description:
**About the Role**

We are seeking a high-performing, entrepreneurial Channel Sales Partner (CSP) Lead to drive and scale our largest indirect sales channel in Japan. This is a critical leadership role responsible for managing a team of three, owning our most strategic CSP relationships, and doubling the impact of this channel over the next 12 to 18 months.

In a country where relationships, trust, and hyper-local expertise matter, our CSPs are force multipliers, and extend our reach where we cannot go directly. Your role will be to accelerate this growth engine by optimising partner performance, strengthening internal processes, and ensuring we win in the market through local excellence.

**Your Impact in Role:**

1. **Drive acquisition targets** \| Own and exceed acquisition targets by developing data-driven sales strategies and ensuring consistent execution across teams.
2. **Develop and execute the CSP growth strategy** \| To double the channel’s contribution to merchant acquisition, activation, and revenue in Japan.
3. **Lead strategic partner relationships \|** This will include joint business planning, performance reviews, and the co-creation of incentive programmes.
4. **Manage and grow a high-performing team of three \|** Fostering a culture of ownership, operational excellence, and continuous improvement.
5. **Design and implement scalable partner processes \|** This includes onboarding, support models, and enablement tools to improve partner productivity and retention.
6. **Collaborate cross-functionally \|** With Sales Operations, Legal, Marketing, Finance, and regional stakeholders to optimise systems and remove operational friction.
7. **Represent the voice of CSPs within Uber \|** Advocating for market-specific needs with product and central teams to ensure our model remains competitive and effective.

**The Experience You’ll Bring:**

1. Five to eight years of experience in sales, partnerships, channel strategy, or business development, ideally in a high-growth or operationally complex environment
2. Proven track record of managing a team and delivering business outcomes end to end
3. Strong analytical and strategic thinking skills, with experience using data to drive decision-making
4. Excellent communication and influencing skills, with the ability to align diverse stakeholders in a matrixed organisation
5. Deep understanding of Japanese business culture and regional market dynamics
6. Professional proficiency in both Japanese and English

Preferred Qualifications

1. Experience leading or scaling channel sales programmes or partner ecosystems
2. Prior exposure to working with start-up or SME partners in fragmented or relationship-led markets
3. Familiarity with performance-based incentive design and partner enablement tooling
4. Experience working cross-functionally with product, legal, finance, or operations teams in an international context
5. Prior experience in the food delivery, logistics, or tech platform space

jobs.title: Associate Acquisition Account Executive, Japan (新規開拓営業)
jobs.description:
**About The Team:**

Restaurants are at the heart of Uber Eats, and Japan’s dynamic, diverse, and high-quality restaurant scene is one of the strongest contributors to our global business. The Japan Acquisition team plays a pivotal role in scaling Uber Eats’ footprint, particularly in a highly competitive and nuanced market. Our mission: to identify, pitch, and onboard high-potential restaurants that will thrive on our platform and delight customers across Japan. This is your chance to help shape the next phase of growth in one of Uber’s most strategic markets.

**About the Role:**

As an Acquisition Account Executive, you will directly contribute to Uber Eats’ growth in Japan by owning the full sales cycle with top-priority local merchants in strategic cities. Your work will improve the quality and variety of food options on the platform, drive customer satisfaction, and build deep, long-lasting relationships with our restaurant partners.

You’ll be expected to bring strong commercial acumen, a proactive approach to problem-solving, and the ability to operate in a fast-paced, culturally nuanced environment.

**What You’ll Do**

1. **Own the full end-to-end acquisition cycle** of Japan’s highest-priority local restaurant partners — from first contact through to activation, go-live, and early growth support.

2. **Develop strong merchant relationships** by understanding their unique business challenges and aligning Uber Eats’ value proposition with their goals.

3. **Manage a defined city-level territory** (e.g. Tokyo, Osaka, or emerging cities) with a strategic lens, identifying opportunities for high-impact acquisition.

4. **Collaborate cross-functionally** with Ops, Marketing, and Account Management teams to ensure a smooth merchant onboarding and activation experience.

5. **Leverage funnel data and tooling** to manage outreach, prioritization, follow-ups, and pipeline progression with operational rigor.

6. **Continuously test and refine your approach**, bringing feedback from the field to inform product, pricing, and process improvements.

**Basic Qualifications**

1. **Proven end-to-end sales capability** \| Comfortable leading prospecting, negotiation, commercial terms, and closing deals independently.

2. **Strong executional discipline** \| You know how to deliver measurable results and consistently move the needle despite setbacks.

3. **Excellent communication skills** \| Able to clearly and confidently communicate complex ideas to internal stakeholders and external partners alike in Japanese (required) and English (basic).

4. **Sales and business acumen** \| You understand what makes businesses tick and tailor your pitch to resonate with different restaurant profiles - from family-run shops to multi-location brands.

**Preferred Qualifications**

1. 2–4 years experience in **B2B sales, partnerships, or business development** roles, ideally in tech, hospitality, or FMCG.

2. Fluency in **Japanese (business level or higher)** and basic English (読み書きができて英語力を上達したい意志があればぜひ挑戦してみてください）

3. Deep local knowledge and understanding of Japanese restaurant culture.

4. Familiarity with **CRM systems (e.g., Salesforce)** and experience working in a performance-driven sales environment.

5. Comfortable working towards **individual and team sales targets**
6. Highly organized, detail-oriented, and capable of managing multiple conversations in parallel.

jobs.title: Senior Strategic Operations Associate, Uber Rent & Car Delivery
locations: New York, New York, United States
Washington, District of Columbia, United States
jobs.location: New York, New York, United States
jobs.description:
**About the Role**

The automotive and transportation industries are rapidly evolving, reshaping the car rental landscape. As part of Uber’s Consumer Vehicles team, this role focuses on building and leading a three-sided car rental marketplace by differentiating our value proposition for vehicle suppliers—including rental car companies, car-share operators, OEMs, and dealerships.

While Uber’s large customer base is a powerful source of demand, our most successful partnerships extend far beyond being a marketing channel. We provide solutions that help suppliers grow their businesses, expand into new categories and markets, and optimize operations. Together, we create opportunities for reinvestment and shared success—positioning Uber as the #1 rental marketplace suppliers want to work with, the #1 place consumers go to rent cars, and the best platform for drivers.

The Car Delivery business line sits at the forefront of this value proposition, offering innovative solutions to rental car companies and fleet operators. As part of this team, you’ll help build and scale services that enable suppliers to request drivers on the Uber platform for vehicle delivery, repositioning, and essential operational tasks such as servicing, cleaning, and refueling.

As a member of the CV team, you will play a pivotal role in shaping the future of our on-demand vehicle delivery marketplace. You’ll ensure seamless vehicle access for customers, with a focus on convenience, speed, and maintaining balance across the three sides of the marketplace—earners, suppliers, and customers.

This role blends strategic thinking with operational rigor, requiring close collaboration with cross-functional teams and external partners to unlock value at scale. You’ll use data-driven insights to identify growth opportunities, improve marketplace efficiency, and build long-term partnerships that benefit all stakeholders.

**What You'll Do**

- Drive Operational Excellence: Lead initiatives that improve the efficiency of our on-demand vehicle delivery marketplace—balancing supply and demand, reducing delivery times, and ensuring seamless vehicle access for customers
- Leverage Data for Impact: Analyze complex data sets to uncover insights that shape strategic decisions. Use these insights to optimize marketplace performance, identify growth opportunities, and strengthen operational effectiveness
- Ensure Marketplace Balance: Manage the three-sided marketplace—earners, suppliers, and customers—to deliver a consistent, reliable experience and meet key performance objectives such as on-time delivery and overall reliability
- Build and Scale Supplier Relationships: Collaborate with rental car companies, dealerships, and fleet managers to deepen partnerships, expand our offerings, improve their operational efficiency, and drive long-term, mutually beneficial outcomes
- Strategic Cross-Functional Collaboration: Partner closely with Product, Tech, Operations, Legal, and Finance to design and execute innovative solutions aligned with Uber’s business objectives and long-term Consumer Vehicles strategy

**Basic Qualifications**

- Minimum 4 years of experience in operations, business consulting, finance, or a similar analytical role.
- Proven track record of operational execution and strong project management skills across functions
- Exceptional communication skills, with the ability to engage both internal and external stakeholders, effectively.
- Ability to independently analyze data and develop insights to support critical business decisions.
- Proficiency in SQL and Python.
- Bachelor's degree.

**Preferred Qualifications**

- Experience managing partnerships or external stakeholders
- Expertise in marketplace dynamics, pricing strategies, and operational optimization.
- Strong ability to drive strategic alignment and build consensus across cross-functional teams.
- Demonstrated success in fostering collaboration and enabling effective teamwork on complex projects.
- Experience working on global projects or in an international setting.

For New York, NY-based roles: The base salary range for this role is USD$129,000 per year - USD$143,000 per year.

For San Francisco, CA-based roles: The base salary range for this role is USD$129,000 per year - USD$143,000 per year.

For Washington, DC-based roles: The base salary range for this role is USD$129,000 per year - USD$143,000 per year.

For all US locations, you will be eligible to participate in Uber's bonus program, and may be offered an equity award & other types of comp. You will also be eligible for various benefits. More details can be found at the following link [https://www.uber.com/careers/benefits](https://www.uber.com/careers/benefits).

jobs.title: Finance Manager
jobs.description:
**About the Team**

The Regulated Entities and Compliance (REC) Group is a global function that enables Uber to meet regulatory obligations across all markets where payments services are offered. In Taiwan—a key growth market—Uber operates as a regulated Third-Party Payment Service Provider (TPPSP), responsible for safeguarding and disbursing funds to fleet partners and merchant partners.

To support increasing regulatory expectations, Uber is establishing **Uber Payments Taiwan (UPT)**, a new regulated payments entity. The Finance Manager will be a foundational leader in building the financial and compliance infrastructure for this entity.

**About the Role**

We are seeking a Finance Manager to build and lead the finance function for UPT from the ground up. This role is critical in ensuring end-to-end financial governance, safeguarding operations, reconciliation accuracy, and regulatory reporting, while also preparing the entity for future Electronic Payment Institution (EPI) requirements.

Reporting to the Head of Regulatory Payments, Taiwan, you will work closely with senior leadership, cross-functional teams (Finance, Legal, Risk, Compliance, Product, Operations), as well as banks, trust institutions, and regulators. You will design and operationalize financial controls and reporting processes that meet Uber’s global standards and Taiwan’s evolving regulatory landscape. This is a hands-on leadership role in a lean, fast-moving regulated environment.

**What You Will Do**

• Build and lead all financial and accounting operations for UPT, ensuring full compliance with TPPSP and future EPI standards.

• Oversee safeguarding operations, reconciliation processes, and financial governance frameworks.

• Deliver timely, accurate regulatory, statutory, and management reporting.

• Act as finance lead for internal and external audits.

• Establish financial controls aligned with Uber’s GRC and global policies.

• Support strategic planning, licensing readiness, and new regulated product launches.

• Lead forecasting, financial planning, and cross-functional financial insights.

• Contribute to global REC initiatives on compliance, budgeting, and licensing.

**Basic Qualifications**

• CPA/CA/ACCA or equivalent preferred.

• 6+ years of finance experience in regulated financial services or payments.

• Strong analytical skills; ability to work with large datasets and apply accounting fundamentals.

• Excellent communication skills in Mandarin and English.

• Ability to operate independently in lean, fast-paced environments.

• Based in Taiwan; open to travel for regulatory or operational needs.

**Preferred Qualifications**

• Experience with safeguarding frameworks, trust account structures, or reconciliation processes.

• Familiarity with TPPSP/EPI regulatory reporting or FSC requirements.

• Experience supporting audits and controls in regulated environments.

locations: New York, New York, United States
jobs.location: New York, New York, United States
jobs.description:
**About the Role**

The Uber Eats team is looking for sharp, highly motivated individuals to join our Enterprise team in the Grocery & Retail segment covering some of our most strategic partners. As an Enterprise Partner Manager, you will work efficiently and effectively with our merchant partners to drive revenue growth, operational excellence, and customer service. Enterprise Partner Managers will work closely with merchants, local and central operations, product, sales, marketing and engineering teams to manage and optimize partnerships and provide maximum value for both Uber and its merchant partner.

You will succeed in this role if: you produce your best results in a team environment; you possess an insatiable appetite to continuously learn; you value ideas over hierarchy; customer obsession runs in your DNA.

**What You'll Do**

- Internal and external advocate. Be the merchants' go-to person and navigate internal processes to provide the best outcome for the client and our market
- Bring your analytical A-game. You will be building business models, performing analysis with local/central operations teams s to understand trends, provide actionable insights, and track productivity and success of initiatives to ensure we are driving towards the best possible outcome
- Handle the big picture and the tiny details. You are organized and always on top of your deadlines to ensure nothing gets missed. You also have an eye to the big picture and flourish by creating new ways to add to existing partnerships
- Drive initiatives. You will drive and support key initiatives across our business teams to grow strategic and long term opportunities with our various partners. This involves wearing many hats and jumping in to help your teammates when the needs arise
- Read between the lines. You will be working with stakeholders from various teams such as Product, Marketing, Operations, Legal, Finance, etc.
- Drive day-to-day interactions with our top tier partners
- Employ critical thinking and creative problem-solving skills to navigate relationships

**Basic Qualifications**

- 6+ years of Partner Management experience, with a focus on Retail/CPG
- Previous client-facing experience with enterprise/mid-market accounts.
- Previous experience with managing complex data set and tracking/hitting multiple OKRs.
- Consistent track record of successfully handling complex partnerships

**Preferred Qualifications**

- Retail/CPG experience strongly preferred
- You will spend the majority of the time working with various internal and external teams, building and cultivating new relationships with potential and existing partners within all parts of an organization.
- You are a self-starter and collaborative leader. Everywhere you go, you cannot help but flex and stretch your analytical powers, pitching in as needed, but also knowing when to take control and lead a conversation with an Engineer, Product Manager, or C-Level Executive
- Product sense. You know what makes a product experience not just good, but amazing. You lead cross-functional teams to create partner integrations that delight users and drive measurable impact
- Speediness and resourcefulness. This team moves fast and always operates in new spaces. You pick up things fast and run with them

jobs.title: Sr. Quality Assurance Engineer
jobs.description:
**About the Role**

The Software QA Engineer II role at Uber, provides an advanced opportunity to lead global testing initiatives and drive quality excellence across complex features and products. Working closely with quality advocate peers, automation engineers, and cross-functional teams, you will ensure that Uber's Delivery products are released with the highest quality standards. You will take ownership of end-to-end test strategy, risk management, and process improvements, leveraging your expertise to enhance quality frameworks, improve testing efficiency, and mentor team members.

**What the Candidate Will Need / Bonus Points**

\-\-\-\- What the Candidate Will Do ----

01. Lead end-to-end test design, execution, and maintenance of new features within the UberEats space, collaborating with US-based product/engineering teams and offshore/onshore testing vendors.
02. Leading software migration testing efforts
03. Act as a senior point of contact and strategic advisor between cross-functional teams and offshore testers, driving quality and accountability.
04. Implement flexible and scalable processes to ensure efficient workflow across teams, aligning with larger organizational goals.
05. Establish and manage comprehensive regression testing strategies to guarantee the integrity of existing features.
06. Proactively identify quality gaps and recommend technical, process, and tooling improvements to strengthen the quality ecosystem.
07. Communicate testing issues, propose data-driven solutions, and drive resolutions.
08. Oversee offshore bug management teams, ensuring thorough bug triage and prompt resolutions.
09. Collaborate closely with Release Management to ensure timely and high-quality releases of apps and features.
10. Translate complex Product/Engineering requirements into detailed test flows and test cases for effective coverage.
11. Lead and oversee multiple testing efforts simultaneously, coordinating work distribution, tracking parallel projects, and ensuring timely completion.
12. Mentor and coach team members, fostering subject matter expertise in testing practices and the product domain.
13. Manage project risks, stakeholder expectations, and ensure alignment across engineering, operations, and external testing contractors.
14. Drive metrics-focused discussions, track and analyze key performance indicators, and use data to inform testing strategies at both the team and organizational level.
15. Self-starter, identifying continuous improvement opportunities in testing processes and quality initiatives.
16. Drive cross-functional alignment and collaboration, influencing stakeholders at all levels of the organization.

\-\-\-\- Basic Qualifications ----

Proven experience in manual and automated testing of consumer-facing mobile and web applications.

Strong project management skills, with a track record of managing complex, large-scale testing projects.

Proficiency in risk management, stakeholder management, conflict resolution, and project communication.

Expertise with iOS, Android devices, web browsers, and macOS environments.

Fluency in written and spoken English.

Deep understanding of SDLC, PRD, ERD, bug lifecycle, and quality processes.

Familiarity with testing software migrations

Strong working knowledge of Jira, bug trackers, and Test Case Management tools.

Experience working with global teams across multiple time zones (especially US/India).

\-\-\-\- Preferred Qualifications ----

8+ years of testing experience, with at least 2-3 years in program management roles.

Experience in quality assurance of global consumer applications in continuous integration/continuous delivery environments.

Expertise in testing scalable, end-to-end mobile and web solutions.

Demonstrated ability to process and analyze large data sets to drive improvements and inform decision-making.

Prior experience in the rideshare or delivery industry, including customer support or related roles.

Advanced conflict resolution and stakeholder management abilities, working with multiple high-profile projects simultaneously.

Recent experience in using AI/LLM tools to augment daily work
