jobs.title: Software Engineer II
jobs.description:
## About the role:

Collaborates with stakeholders to design, develop, optimize, and productionize machine learning (ML) or ML-based solutions and systems that are used within a team to solve moderately complex problems. This role also leverages and improves ML infrastructure for model development, training, deployment needs and scaling ML systems.

## About the Team:

_This team is within Uber's Machine Learning Platform (Michelangelo)_

_We are building a truly extensible machine learning ecosystem. This system provides a comprehensive tool chains to empower ML engineers to build high quality machine learning solutions in all perspectives in Uber's business._

_Our team is composed of collaborative people with deep knowledge in various domains, such as, but not limited to, distributed systems, analytical systems, large-scale backend services, large-scale computing infra, feature stores, data vis and cloud-based AI solutions._

_\[Meet Michelangelo: Uber’s Machine Learning Platform (http://eng.uber.com/michelangelo/)\]_

_Working on building the control plane and ML app framework, that supports all ML use cases in Uber._

_On this team, we:_

- _Build, test and manage the micro services._
- _Build frameworks for training and serving applications_
- _Build applications with nonSQL storages._
- _Build pipelines offline and streaming related to generative AI needs in Uber, such as but not limited to:_
  - _Data Ingestion_
  - _Model Fine-tune and model accuracy_
  - _Prediction Evaluation_
  - _Monitoring_

## Minimum qualifications:

- Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics or related field, WHICH INCLUDES 2-year total technical software engineering experience in one or more of the following areas:


- Programming language (e.g. C, C++, Java, Python, or Go)

- Training using data structures and algorithms

- Machine learning (e.g., tree-based techniques, supervised learning)

- Machine Learning Software such as Tensorflow/Pytorch, Caffe, Scikit-Learn, or Spark MLLib


- Note the 2-year total of specialized software engineering experience may have been gained through education and full-time work experience, additional training, coursework, research, or similar (OR some combination of these).  The year of specialized experience is not necessarily in addition to the years of Education & full-time work experience indicated.


## Technical skills:

Required:

- Feature management

jobs.title: Account Manager (m/w/d), Uber Eats, Berlin
jobs.description:
## Account Manager (m/w/d) – Uber Eats, Berlin

Uber Eats is seeking a motivated and results-driven **Account Manager (m/w/d)** to join our expanding team in Berlin. In this role, you'll play a pivotal part in shaping the success of our restaurant partners across Germany, fostering high-impact relationships and driving business growth on the Uber Eats platform.

If you're passionate about the food industry, excel at building strategic partnerships, and thrive in a fast-paced environment, we want to hear from you.

### What You'll Do

As an Account Manager (m/w/d), you'll serve as the primary point of contact for a portfolio of our most valued restaurant partners. You'll be responsible for ensuring their continued success and expansion by focusing on:

- **Strategic Account Growth:** Manage 100-150 high-value partners to retain and grow their business, identifying sales opportunities through product adoption and location expansion.

- **Maximizing Potential:** Proactively uncover opportunities to unlock additional revenue for both our partners and Uber Eats.

- **Risk Mitigation & Retention:** Identify potential partnership risks and work diligently to provide a premier experience, aiming for 100% account retention.

- **Partner Advocacy:** Synthesize partner feedback into actionable insights to help inform our product and business roadmap.

- **Relationship Building:** Cultivate long-term partnerships to position Uber Eats as the preferred delivery platform for your accounts.

- **Account Planning:** Develop long-term growth and marketing plans through regular business reviews and data-driven analysis.


### Your Qualifications

- **Languages:** Fluency in both **German and English** is required.

- **Professional Experience:** 2+ years in B2B Sales, Account Management, or retail/food industry management.

- **Relationship Management:** Skilled at navigating the customer lifecycle and building commitment with key stakeholders.

- **Soft Skills:** A proactive self-starter with excellent communication, negotiation, and organizational skills.

- **Strategic Mindset:** Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities to drive partner growth.

- **Drive:** Results-oriented mindset with a dedication to hitting revenue and retention targets.

- **Technical Skills:** Proficiency in Google Suite and CRM systems (Salesforce is a significant plus).

jobs.title: Data Analytics Specialist III - Automation Specialist
jobs.description:
**Automation Specialist**

Uber is expanding its Krakow Center of Excellence into a leading Technology Hub for Central & Eastern Europe.

We are seeking Automation Specialists to design, build, and maintain automation solutions that streamline operations and enable Uber to scale seamlessly across Rides and Eats.

**About the role**

You will develop automations of varying size and complexity, from medium-scale tasks to large-scale business processes, fully automated end-to-end.

As an Automation Specialist, you will be responsible for building solutions that are resilient, scalable, and adaptable, following best practices and continuously refining them with data-driven improvements.

You will translate business requirements into clear technical tasks, delivering automation solutions iteratively and incrementally, and aligning priorities closely with the Operations Coordinator.

**About the Team**

The team’s mission: backing creativity with operational efficiency.

Based in the Krakow CoE, the team is cross-functional and supports operations at regional and global level.

We focus on four core areas:

- Business Processes (design, execution, optimization)
- Automation (process automation, real-time monitoring, refactoring)
- Data Analytics (query, deepdive, self-operating dashboard, data pipeline)
- Data Science (modeling, machine learning, patterns identification, prediction)

The span of work is large, covering multiple verticals (such as Uber Rides, Eats, High Capacity Vehicle, Payment, Strategy & Planning) and Mega-Regions (such as Global, EMEA, US&C).

We’re offering a hybrid model of working (60% minimum based out of our Krakow office, 40% optional work from home).

**What you'll do**

- Design, build, and maintain automations to enhance efficiency and scalability
- Streamline workflows, automate entire processes, refactor, build data-pipelines
- Suggest innovative approaches to solve complex business problems, at scale, following the best practices in terms of quality, time management, technical documentation, code review
- Analyze business requirements or suggest improvements, proactively
- Conduct root cause analyses and propose data-driven strategies
- Present your work to Stakeholders and adapt your communication to a variety of audiences, using either technical or business terms

**What you'll need**

- Ability to write high quality code with best practices, in according to global standards
- Good knowledge in Python, API endpoints, Pandas Library, Apache Spark
- Knowledge in SQL, with the ability to select, clear and transform dataset
- Ability to analyze datasets accurately and storytell
- Knowledge in creating Flows (ex.: Lucidchart)
- Analytical and data-driven approach for solving complex problems
- Excellent written and spoken Communication (in English)
- Ability to work on your own initiative independently (proactive), in Group (excellent Teammate), and with Stakeholders

- Motivation to learn all along the way and improve continuously Scripts, with SQL and Python, to automate actions of varying sizes and time-horizons,

jobs.description:
**About the Role**

You will be a Senior Software Engineer working on vehicle sensor data collection. The ideal candidate will be able to identify issues, provide solutions and implement the fixes as well as setting a high technical excellence bar in all things we do.

**What the Candidate Will Need / Bonus Points**

Design and deliver software and tools for vehicle sensor data collection.

1. Systems architecture design, including management of upstream and downstream dependencies
2. Provide technical leadership, influence and partner with fellow engineers to architect, design and build scalable solutions for sensor data collection that can stand the test of scale and availability, while reducing operational overhead

4. Participate in periodic on-call rotations and be available for critical issues

2. Bachelor degree in computer science, computer engineering or related fields
3. Proficient in Python, C++ and Linux

jobs.title: Consumer Growth Lead - Central And South America
jobs.description:
## About the Role

As the Consumer Operations Lead, you’ll bring our high-level LatAm consumer strategy to life in the CASA region. You’ll turn strategic goals into clear operational plans—driving day-to-day execution while building the systems and infrastructure that support sustainable, long-term growth.

In this role, you’ll lead a talented team of six, partnering closely with local teams and cross-functional stakeholders to ensure our core consumer growth drivers are delivered with excellence.

This position is both strategic and hands-on: you’ll help shape priorities at the regional level while owning the mechanisms, experiments, and execution plans that unlock lasting growth across CASA.

## What You’ll Do

- Bring the LatAm strategy to life in CASA: Translate high-level regional strategy into a clear operational plan—driving execution to attract new users, improve retention, and build the foundations for long-term success.

- Contribute to regional priorities: Represent CASA in LatAm forums, bringing forward local insights, advocating for the consumer perspective, and ensuring strong alignment between regional and market-level plans.

- Lead and develop a high-performing team: Manage, mentor, and empower a team of six individual contributors to deliver impactful results.

- Turn insights into action: Analyze data, experiments, and performance trends to identify opportunities, uncover drivers, and translate findings into actionable recommendations.

- Partner for results: Collaborate with local teams, sub-regional leaders, and cross-functional partners to align priorities, remove roadblocks, and ensure progress toward key growth metrics.

- Own the CASA experimentation roadmap: Design, prioritize, and evaluate experiments that drive measurable impact—and scale successful playbooks across markets.


## Basic Qualifications

- Experience: A minimum of 5 years in strategy, operations, consulting, or other analytical roles. Candidates from all professional backgrounds are encouraged to apply.

- Collaboration: Proven ability to build strong, trust-based partnerships across teams and functions.

- Analytical Strength: Skilled in using data to diagnose challenges, generate insights, and drive informed decisions.

- Business Acumen: Ability to connect analytical findings to business strategy and outcomes, turning insights into tangible results.

- Growth Mindset: Proactive, adaptable, and resilient—you see challenges as opportunities to learn and improve.

- Stakeholder Management: Skilled at influencing and aligning diverse stakeholders through structured communication and sound reasoning.

- Communication: Fluent in both Spanish and English, with the ability to communicate complex ideas clearly and effectively.

- Executional Excellence: Strong organizational and prioritization skills; able to deliver high-quality work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.


## Preferred Qualifications

- Proficiency in SQL

- Experience managing and developing teams

jobs.title: Business Development Representative, U4B
jobs.description:
**About the Role** Uber for Business is growing exponentially, and we are looking for a strong Business Development Representative to drive our business forward at this exciting time. You’ll work closely with the other BDRs, Account Executives and Sales Managers to increase Uber for Business in the UK. As a BDR, you will be sourcing new ways for U4B to interact with clients and driving deep partnerships. We need highly motivated self-starters, who thrive on challenges and relish a team environment of natural problem solvers. Our suite of products has multiplied in recent years, so we’re looking for an all rounder who has the drive to sell holistically across an organisation with passion, poise and energy. As a Mid-Market Business Development Representative, you will be instrumental in customer acquisition for Uber for Business within the EMEA market.

**What the Candidate Will Need:**

- Be responsible for generating revenue pipeline through outbound prospecting (cold calls/emails).
- Identify new business opportunities, prospect the right decision makers within a business.
- Meet and exceed all assigned activity and pipeline creation targets.
- Bring an innovative approach to prospecting and acquisition, with a customer oriented mindset.
- Work with the Account Executives and Sales Managers within your region to develop and iterate on a prioritisation model, and internal tools and prospecting processes.
- Communicate effectively and efficiently via phone, email, video conferencing and in-person meetings.

**What You'll Need:**

- 12 - 36 months of B2B sales/business development experience is highly preferred.
- Bachelor’s degree required
- Experience of prospecting into large accounts.
- Ability to build and manage email sequences.
- A history of consistently exceeding KPIs and activity targets.
- Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to obtain the necessary information from the prospect, while also ensuring a mutually beneficial conversation.
- Creative thinking about how to set appointments.
- Driven and excited about a fast-paced team environment.
- Excellent organisation, project management and time management skills, and ability to take initiative.

**Preferred Qualifications**

- Hunter mentality and proven track record of outbound success - cold calling, email campaigns, and social outreach.
- Proficiency with sales tools including LinkedIn Sales Navigator, ZoomInfo, Groove, and Salesforce.
- Experience supporting multiple Account Executives in a fast-paced sales environment.
- Strong organization and time management - comfortable juggling priorities and managing follow-ups.
- A self-starter mindset with a passion for learning and exceeding goals.

jobs.title: Senior Sales Operations Associate, Uber for Business
jobs.description:
##### **About the Role**

We are seeking a Sales Operations pro to support the Sales Ops function for Uber for Business, acting as a trusted partner to Sales leadership while driving alignment between strategy and execution. Our Sales Ops team supports and enables frontline GTM teams to sell & service more efficiently and effectively by providing strategic direction and reducing friction in the GTM process. This role will play a key role in optimizing performance and enabling sustainable growth across our Enterprise segments.

This role requires strong operational rigor, analytical depth, and executive-level communication. The right candidate will help us provide more visibility, direction, and strategic oversight on target setting, account prioritization, share of wallet penetration, and pipeline management to unlock more growth for U4B!

This is a high-impact opportunity to shape the future of Uber’s B2B Sales Ops engine and drive performance at scale across some of our most strategic segments.

**What You’ll Do**

- Stakeholder management: Partner closely with senior sales leaders and cross functional partners to align on strategy
- Strategy: Partner with sales leadership to set performance targets for sales teams, recommend actions for improvement and work together to integrate positive changes within the operational environment
- Analytics: provide key partners with critical reporting information and sales insights
- Pipeline and Forecast: provide analytical and operational support to continuously improve our forecasting, pipeline management, and methodologies
- Effectively communicate: find simple ways to convey insights and recommendations from sophisticated analysis results to business leaders

**Basic Qualifications**

- 3+ years of work experience with 3 years of relevant experience in Sales Operations, preferably in a fast-growing B2B environment
- Excellent Excel modeling skills, particularly as it pertains to financial modeling
- Experience with SQL
- Bachelor's degree or equivalent (Business Administration, Economics, Mathematics, Finance, Accounting, etc.)
- Detailed success in sophisticated matrixed organizations where you worked directly with senior leaders


**Preferred Qualifications**

- 4+ years of work experience with experience in Sales Operations, preferably in a fast-growing B2B environment
- Strategic approach yet operationally focused and data-driven with a keen eye for details and passionate about accuracy
- Excelling in a collaborative environment! You translate team member needs into clear tasks and deliverables for contributors, and work through dependencies, bottlenecks, and tradeoffs with ease
- Verbal and written communication skills. Strong consensus building and executive presence to communicate and defend plans to Uber for Business executives
- Experience with forecasting and data enrichment tools (ZoomInfo, LinkedIn Sales Navigator, etc.)

For Canada-based roles: The base salary range for this role is CAD$114,000 per year - CAD$127,000 per year.

jobs.title: Senior Optimization Engineer
locations: New York, New York, United States
jobs.description:
**About the Role**

The Consumer Real-Time Pricing team within the Delivery Marketplace organization is responsible for balancing supply and demand in the Eats/Delivery Marketplace. Our team builds signals, algorithms, recommendations and levers that work in real-time to keep the marketplace in balance. Our work has a direct impact on Uber’s top & bottom line.

Optimization/Operations Research Engineers lead efforts within the team and broader Delivery Marketplace organization to drive ideation, development and productionization of optimization solutions with real-time and ML-based signals that solve strategically important problems. Some existing problem spaces that the team works on:

- Develop the objective function which balances magical user experience and economics of the business
- Improve timeliness for Uber delivery trips
- Maximize throughput of trips the marketplace can handle
- Set optimal prices to achieve marketplace balance

It is a challenging yet rewarding job. You will have a lot of opportunities to work with product managers, Applied Scientists and ML and BE engineers. You will be in charge of solving Uber-scale problems with the right techniques and algorithms.

## **What You Will Do**

- You will work with a mixed team of Backend Engineers, MLEs, and Applied Scientists
- You will build new scalable algorithms for real-time delivery pricing products across hundreds of global marketplaces
- You will take things from mathematical formulation through to prototype and experiment. You will work with backend engineers to put your ideas into production
- You will help identify new opportunities for improving our algorithms and models

**Basic Qualifications**

- Masters in relevant fields (Operations Research,  Computer Science, Mathematics, Industrial Engineering, etc.) with a focus on optimization modeling
- 5+ years of industry experience developing algorithms and models for large-scale deployment
- Experience with optimization packages such as Gurobi, CPLEX, and OR Tools
- Strong communication skills and ability to work effectively with cross-functional partners
- Proficiency in one or more coding languages such as Python, Java, Go, or C+

**Preferred Qualifications**

- PhD in relevant fields (Operations Research,  Computer Science, Mathematics, Industrial Engineering, etc.) with a focus on optimization modeling
- Experience with two or three-sided marketplace design, matching/allocation, pricing optimization, etc
- Familiarity with Machine Learning models, experimentation (e.g., A/B testing) and causal inference
- Experience with real-time optimization systems (optimization under tight time constraints)

jobs.title: Territory Account Manager, Mid-Market
jobs.description:
**About the Role**

Despite being a worldwide company, Uber Eats’ path to success originates from a strong local presence, deeply involving our restaurants and couriers in this journey.

The Account Managers are embodying this strategy, by driving the development of specific cities and areas, with a focus on top restaurants.

This role is a rare opportunity to help grow Uber Eats in France with a strong sense of ownership.

This role calls for a rare combination of operational mindset, savvy number-crunching and exceptional relationship management. You should thrive in an "all hands on deck" environment, love solving problems, thrive in a startup culture, and above all be passionate about our restaurant partners.

**What you'll do**

- Drive our business performance in your assigned territory, own your portfolio
- Build the best restaurant offering and optimizing their operational performance
- Identify and initiate new partnership opportunities with top restaurants in your city, handle complex negotiations
- Tackle or escalate complex support issues for timely resolution for our top restaurant partners
- Champion deep relationships with top restaurant partners, identifying and acting on opportunities while selling growth levers to expand their delivery business
- Seek for and achieve restaurant industry deep understanding
- Drive on-the-ground knowledge and context about the city you operate in to the wider Uber Eats France team
- Act as an ambassador of Uber Eats mission, brand, and product

**Basic Qualifications**

- Minimum 1 year of professional experience in Account Management, Startups, or Consultancy.
- Excellent command of French, including in technical or business contexts.
- Strong analytical mindset: comfortable working with data, running analyses, and translating insights into actionable recommendations.
- Exceptional listening and communication skills.
- Proven ability to manage multiple priorities and deliver high-quality results within tight deadlines.
- Strong problem-solving mindset: identifies challenges quickly and thinks creatively to find effective solutions.

**Preferred Qualifications**

- Strong motivation and genuine passion for the restaurant industry eager to collaborate with top partners and build a business together.
- Professional proficiency in English.
- Highly autonomous and proactive, capable of driving impact with limited oversight.
- Dynamic energy and strong sales drive.

jobs.title: Program Lead - Global Safety Reporting & Routing
locations: New York, New York, United States
Washington, District of Columbia, United States
jobs.description:
**About the Role**

We are searching for a Senior Program Manager to join the Global Safety Support team who will help enable a best in class customer experience program. You will be reporting into the Safety Reporting, Channel, & Routing Program Leader and will be responsible for strengthening our safety support reporting and routing processes in close partnership with our Safety Operations, Safety Product, Safety Data, Safety Process, and Regional Operations teams. You will set and implement program requirements that ensure our safety reporting is readily accessible with sufficient information to inform routing and handling. This role will require a high amount of cross-functional collaboration and influencing and vision setting on the safety reporting experience and ability to understand and leverage GenAI models. You should be able to problem solve and address complex challenges, produce high quality written documentation, and build effective automation processes.

**This position can be based in Chicago, New York, Washington DC or Amsterdam.**

**What the Candidate Will Do**

- Develop, implement, and monitor impact of program and business requirements for safety reporting and routing to improve the customer experience and obtain sufficient information to support high quality and fair outcomes.
- Drive optimization of reporting and routing processes through working closely with the Product team to pilot, test, and monitor/QA impact of automations.
- Set business level requirements for leveraging GenAI bots to improve reporting and routing of safety incidents ensuring they collect sufficient information for effective handling and actioning and provide a positive user experience
- Make our Uber Help Center for safety more efficient and effective in meeting customer and support needs.
- Develop and maintain clear, comprehensive program documentation (including process flows, business requirements docs, project and communication plans) tailored to diverse business audiences.
- Build consensus among different stakeholder groups to drive effective customer entry points (such as safety toolkit, Help Center) that ensure high quality support and outcomes.
- Develop content and standard operating procedures to improve process adherence and accuracy on a global scale
- Partner with Data Analytics, Policy, Product, and Regional CommOps stakeholders to define processes to support data integrity

**Basic Qualifications**

- Minimum of 5-7 years of experience in program management, process optimization, analytics, user experience design and/or managing cross-functional projects and stakeholders

**Preferred Qualifications**

- 5 years of product, operations, or customer experience work, while managing cross-functional and global projects, stakeholders, and actionable insights
- GenAI and automation experience in customer reporting
- Six Sigma or related process excellence background
- Previous user experience background & understanding of customer needs
- Self-motivated with a strong affinity for problem solving
- Demonstrated success in using data to make customer-focused decisions and to facilitate behavior change in support organizations
- Exceptional written and verbal communication skills across multiple functions and teams -- a natural storyteller and consensus builder
- Experience with program management, customer support strategy, or quality assurance
- Basic SQL Skills

For Chicago, IL-based roles: The base salary range for this role is USD$140,000 per year - USD$155,000 per year.

jobs.title: SMB Hero アソシエイトアカウントマネージャー・Associate Account Manager, SMB Hero, Uber Eats
jobs.description:
## **\#GreatMindsDon’tThinkAlike**

Uberでは、多様性を大切にしています。

私たちは、単に「仕事ができる人」としてではなく、あなただけが持つ視点で組織を次のレベルへ引き上げてくれる、唯一無二の存在として一人ひとりを尊重しています。

Uberには、誰もが自由に意見を発信できる、真にオープンなカルチャーがあります。

## **ポジションについて**

Uber Eatsでは、日本のSMB（中小規模）ローカルヒーローレストランを担当する

Business Leader / Partner Success Account Manager を募集しています。

本ポジションは、SMBビジネスにおける重要な役割として、

レストランパートナーのエンドツーエンドの体験をマネジメントし、事業成長とイノベーションを推進します。

主なミッションは以下の通りです：

- 新規獲得したレストランブランドのスケール支援

- 地域で高い認知を持つブランドとの戦略的パートナーシップ構築

- レストランとUber Eats双方にとっての長期的な成功の実現


理想的な候補者は、レストランパートナーのCレベルや主要な窓口と密に連携しながら、

勝ち筋となる戦略を設計し、効果的なGo-To-Marketプランを構築できる方です。

このポジションには、

関係構築力、市場機会を見極める力、論理的思考力、戦略立案力、営業力、オペレーション力、リーダーシップ

をバランス良く備え、スピード感のある環境で

中長期の戦略と短期的な実行を両立できる柔軟性が求められます。

## **主な業務内容（Your Impact in Role）**

- 約 80〜100店舗のSMBローカルレストランパートナーを担当

  （Cレベルとの交渉が必要なアカウントもあれば、OFDの将来性について議論できる適切な窓口を特定するところから始めるアカウントも含まれます）

- レストランパートナーとの長期的で強固な関係構築・維持

- 週次（WoW）でビジネス状況を把握し、データから潜在的なビジネスシグナルを特定

- 課題を迅速に見極め、データドリブンな視点で必要なリソース・サポートを提供

- マネージャーおよびリーダーシップチームと連携し、日本におけるSMB Hero機能の将来を構築

- オペレーション、マーケティング、カスタマーサポートなどのクロスファンクショナル（XFN）チームと協業

- ステークホルダーに対して進捗をタイムリーに共有し、必要に応じて方向性を調整

- 月次／四半期の売上目標の達成、またはそれ以上の成果創出


## **求める経験・スキル（The Experience You’ll Bring）**

- 高成長企業における営業経験3年以上（ソリューションセールスの経験必須）

- リーダーシップのサポートを受けながら、SMBのCレベルとコミュニケーション／交渉ができるスキル

- マーケットプレイス型ビジネスへの理解

- エネルギッシュで、地域社会をより良くしたいという意欲を持つ方

- 日本語流暢、英語は最低限の読み書きが可能な方


* * *

## 歓迎要件（Preferred Qualifications）

- 日本の飲食業界での経験、または広いネットワークをお持ちの方

- クロスファンクショナル（XFN）なステークホルダーを巻き込んだプロジェクトマネジメント経験

- 英語

jobs.title: Digital Sales Center Performance & GTM Lead (m/w/d), Spain
jobs.description:
### **About the Role**

As the Performance Lead for our Delivery Sales Centre (DSC) in Spain, you’ll play a pivotal role in bringing Uber’s global DSC strategy to life across diverse country markets. You’ll act as the connective tissue between global initiatives and local execution—ensuring our restaurant acquisition and growth efforts are adapted to regional realities, operationally sound, and delivering impact at scale.

This role is ideal for someone who thrives in fast-paced, matrixed environments and is passionate about translating strategy into execution. You’ll be driving measurable outcomes across BPO-led teams while shaping the future of how Uber Eats grows its merchant base in Spain.

### **What You’ll Do**

- **Drive Local Strategy Execution** Adapt and implement the Spain DSC strategy to align with country-specific business priorities, commercial dynamics, and regulatory environments.

- **Lead BPO Performance & Partner Management** Oversee and coach external BPO sales teams across multiple geographies, ensuring consistent delivery against acquisition, onboarding, and retention KPIs.

- **Own GMV Growth for SMB Segment** Take full ownership of DSC-driven Gross Merchandise Volume (GMV) performance in your countries. Diagnose challenges, uncover opportunities, and proactively drive performance improvement.

- **Lead Go-To-Market Execution** Design and launch new DSC initiatives in coordination with cross-functional stakeholders. Ensure timely rollout, fast feedback loops, and scalable impact.

- **Leverage Data to Optimize Sales Outcomes** Analyze funnel metrics to improve conversion, identify performance levers, and enable coaching at the BPO and team lead level.

- **Foster Cross-Functional Alignment** Act as the primary DSC representative for local Ops, Sales, and Marketing teams. Build a strong two-way communication flow between central DSC leadership and in-country teams.


### **What You’ll Need**

- **Proven Sales Leadership** Experience leading high-velocity sales operations or BPO-led teams, ideally in a tech, platform, or marketplace business.

- **Strong Analytical Acumen** Ability to turn data into actionable insights. Familiarity with funnel diagnostics, sales ops, and continuous performance improvement.

- **Stakeholder Influence** Adept at working cross-functionally with senior leaders, aligning diverse stakeholders toward shared goals.

- **Execution-Oriented Mindset** Comfortable navigating ambiguity and balancing strategic direction with day-to-day operational excellence.

- **Program Management Skills** Experience leading complex, multi-country rollouts of commercial or sales programs is a plus.

- **Communication Excellence** Able to clearly articulate priorities, influence decision-makers, and inspire action across internal and external teams.


### **What Success Looks Like**

- Regional DSC programs consistently hit or exceed GMV targets

- BPO teams deliver sustained performance across acquisition, onboarding, and retention KPIs

- Local teams feel empowered and supported by central DSC initiatives

- Scalable playbooks and performance levers are adopted across countries

- Spain's SMB restaurant growth is accelerated through structured, data-backed execution


### **Why Join Uber?**

At Uber, we move the real world. Your work will directly impact restaurants and communities across Spain, powering real economic opportunities.

You’ll collaborate with a diverse team of passionate, sharp thinkers who are all-in on solving big challenges—and you’ll grow fast doing it. Whether you’re launching new programs or transforming BPO sales execution, your work will be career-defining.

Join us and grow with the challenge. Learn more about our benefits here: [Uber Benefits](https://www.uber.com/nl/en/careers/benefits/)

Uber's mission is to reimagine the way the world moves for the better. Here, bold ideas create real-world impact, challenges drive growth, and speed fuelds progress. What moves us, moves the world - let’s move it forward, together.

jobs.title: Ad Effectiveness Specialist
jobs.description:
**#GreatMindsDon’tThinkAlike** At Uber, we take pride in our diversity and working environment that sees you as more than just a person that can do the job, but a unique individual that can level up our organization with a perspective only you can offer. Uber provides a truly open culture that encourages all to voice their thoughts.

**About the Role**

The Ad Effectiveness team equips the Uber Advertising organization and our clients with a 360° view of critical decision-making dimensions, including how to measure campaign performance and provide recommendations for optimization. In this role, you will work within the ad measurement strategy organization to operationalize new measurement product development, partnerships, and capabilities that meet the needs of our customers.

**Your Impact In Role**

- Translate concepts, measurement solutions, and underlying statistical fundamentals of the ads efficacy and measurement ecosystem to the needs of advertisers across verticals
- Structure and conduct analyses to generate campaign effectiveness outcomes and recommendations
- Create and present compelling narratives to senior leadership at clients and at Uber
- You will track unaddressed advertiser requirements, identifying opportunities for new strategic initiatives
- This role reports into and will work in close collaboration with the Ad Measurement Strategy Lead.

**The Experience You'll Bring**

- Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative or business field
- 3+ years of ads measurement experience within an advertising platform/publisher, media agency, advertiser, or research company
- Experience with third-party measurement providers such as Kantar, Circana, Happydemics, etc.
- A deep understanding of attribution modeling, market mix modeling, multi-variate testing, brand and conversion lift
- A strong understanding of the digital advertising and measurement ecosystem
- Experience with ads measurement for one or more of the following verticals: technology, retail, entertainment, restaurants, travel, CPG, telco, or finance

**Preferred Qualifications**

- Advanced degree in business, math, statistics, economics, or a related field
- Experience building and influencing client or partner relationships
- Experience with team or peer leadership and development
- Experience with any of the following: SQL,R, SPSS/STATA, Tableau

jobs.title: Head of SMB Account Management (m/w/d) - Uber Eats Germany
jobs.description:
**About the Role**

Restaurant Partners are the backbone of Uber Eats, allowing us to create outstanding consumer selection and powering the growth of our platform as we innovate and expand our suite of products. As Head of SMB Account Management (m/w/d) at Uber Eats - Germany, you are a business owner who will drive the growth strategy and customer experience for our existing restaurant partners (and growing!).

You will be responsible for the Account Management of SMB Restaurants for Germany, leading a team of managers and their Account Managers across different locations in Germany. SMB Restaurants is the largest segment of Uber Eats, responsible for the majority of our sales and growth. Germany is one of the key growth markets globally, where you'll have the potential to shape a business for the future.

**What you'll do:**

- Lead & Inspire: You will lead the complete team of restaurant SMB Account Managers for Uber Eats Germany, focusing on hiring, developing, and retaining a strong and motivated pool of talent.
- Cultivate Partnerships: Work closely with our Restaurant Partners, building lasting relationships and ensuring their satisfaction and success working with Uber Eats.
- Drive Mutual Growth: Be instrumental in boosting restaurant revenue and value on the Uber Eats platform. This involves strategically leveraging tools like marketing and product adoption while ensuring a strong end-customer experience.
- Collaborate Across Functions: Expertly manage stakeholder relationships, working cross-functionally with Sales, Operations, and Marketing to enhance the restaurant partner experience and achieve growth targets.

**What you'll have:**

- Language Proficiency: Fluency in German is required and based in Berlin.
- Proven Leadership: An extensive track record of managing, coaching, and developing high-performing account management teams of 20+ members, including the management of other leaders.
- Industry Experience: Substantial experience in a fast-paced B2B environment, ideally with a focus on SMB and a significant digital component.
- Strategic & Scalable Mindset: Strong project management skills with a demonstrated ability to design and implement scalable processes that drive efficiency and growth.
- Data-Driven Acumen: Advanced analytical skills with the ability to translate complex data into actionable insights and strategic recommendations.
- Entrepreneurial Spirit: A true ownership mentality, with a passion for building from the ground up and a relentless drive to achieve shared goals.
- Exceptional Communication: World-class interpersonal skills, with a natural ability to build rapport, foster collaboration, and influence stakeholders at all levels.

jobs.title: Client Partner, Uber Advertising CPG
jobs.description:
**About the Role**

The team is looking for a strategic seller to be a member of our CPG team. As a Client Partner, you will be responsible for building mutually beneficial Ads partnerships with CPG partners. You will lead the ads sales strategy for a portfolio of top tier CPG brands and drive the adoption of an expanding suite of ads offerings across our Mobility and Delivery platforms. You will work closely with cross-functional partners to consistently deliver on our partner's needs.

**\-\-\-\- What You'll Do ----**

1. Partner with cross-functional teams will be responsible for developing and executing ads partnership strategies that deliver on your partners’ needs and exceed quarterly growth goals.
2. Build relationships with the Director, VP, and C-level marketing executives and key marketing decision-makers within partner organizations
3. Employ critical thinking and creative problem-solving skills to navigate relationships and difficult partner conversations.
4. Be an indispensable cross-functional partner across the Product, Marketing, and Operations team to ensure we are delivering on partner needs.
5. Expand ads product adoption. Communicate the value of our newest ads products with a lens of creativity to differentiate our offering.

**\-\-\-\- What You'll Need ----**

1. 5+ years' experience in end-to-end Enterprise / Large Customer Digital Advertising Sales or CPG Marketing
2. Experience selling ads solutions to large, complex brands or organizations
3. Ideally have worked with CPG Brands in your current or most recent organization
4. Speed, resourcefulness, and a go-getter mentality. You are comfortable working in a fast-paced environment and navigating ambiguity
5. Agile, and ability to adapt quickly to challenges

**\-\-\-\- Preferred Qualifications ----**

1. 6+ years of enterprise digital advertising sales experience with large, complex brands.
2. Deep understanding of the CPG advertising landscape and proven success partnering with CPG clients.
3. Strategic sales planner skilled in negotiation, problem-solving, and data-driven storytelling to influence decision-makers.
4. Strong leadership and account management capabilities.
5. Proficient in Salesforce and Excel; SQL a plus.

jobs.title: Indirect Tax Manager  - US&C
jobs.description:
**About the Role**

We are looking to add a Manager to our US&C Tax Business Advisory team!

Are you a team player, not afraid of a rapidly changing environment, and have a broad tax technically sharp background? Do you love tax technical debates, are strong at analytical thinking coupled with business acumen to advise non-tax stakeholders, have curiosity to delve into novel tax issues, possess a passion for details, and are able to perform under pressure? If so, this role offers an amazing opportunity to make an immediate impact as a primary stakeholder supporting Uber’s business teams.

At its core, your job is to work on strategic initiatives and projects, including analyzing and advising on the tax implications of new products and lines of business across US&C and globally. More specifically, you will need to identify tax risks, suggest practical solutions and technical requirements, and oversee their implementation.

In your role, you will work in a highly motivated and supportive team. You'll work closely together with  Operations, Product, Legal, and other stakeholders in designing Uber's latest products and features. Key is to understand the business needs while providing full tax support to deliver a seamless, tax-compliant, and efficient experience for Uber, our Partners, and End Users.

**What You'll Do:**

- Provide full end-to-end tax advice and support on strategic initiatives and projects as well as new products while managing tax risks and ensuring tax requirements are implemented.
- Challenge the status quo and identify opportunities for improvement in Uber's existing business models.
- Design, test and implement scalable improvements and solutions to the tax issues you identify.
- Perform tax research and monitor / analyze existing and proposed tax legislation to identify impacts to Uber’s business lines / products.
- Work with regional Tax Business Advisory tax teams to coordinate global projects regarding new product offerings, modifications to existing products and other strategic initiatives
- Partner with key contacts in business teams, finance, treasury, accounting, and legal to identify and implement tax planning strategies and minimize potential tax risks
- Partner with and manage external advisors as necessary
- Review contracts and collaborate with business, legal, and tax teams to ensure contracts contain key terms consistent with global tax structure
- Support tax provision and tax audits as necessary

## **Basic Qualifications**

- 5+ years of experience in a public accounting firm, law firm, and/or in-house with experience in sales and use tax, Canadian GST/HST and related provincial taxes, or other indirect taxes.
- Bachelor's or advanced degree in Tax, Accounting, Finance, Economics or a related field.

**Preferred Qualifications**

- MST or LL.M. in Tax is a bonus!
- Technical Tax experience in areas such as corporate income tax, 1099 reporting, transfer pricing and employment tax would be a plus.
- Strong interpersonal skills and highly collaborative with strong ability to build relationships, gain credibility, and partner across functions to build consensus.
- Clear communicator, team orientated, and willing to take initiative while thinking two steps ahead.
- Confidence and flexibility to operate in a fast-paced, rapidly changing environment.
- Inquisitiveness, along with the ability to spot issues, get to the heart of a matter, and articulate plans to address them.
- Passionate about your work and a desire to have a big impact.
- Enthusiastic about Uber!

For San Francisco, CA-based roles: The base salary range for this role is USD$149,000 per year - USD$166,000 per year.

You will be eligible to participate in Uber's bonus program, and may be offered an equity award & other types of comp. You will also be eligible for various benefits. More details can be found at the following link [https://www.uber.com/careers/benefits](https://www.uber.com/careers/benefits).

jobs.title: Sr. Staff Engineer, Backend - Delivery
jobs.description:
**About the role:**

Sr. Staff Engineers at Uber have an impact across a variety of business and technology decisions spanning projects and locations. We are passionate and pragmatic technologists who are able to design scalable systems while deliver efficient code. We are humble teachers, technically mentoring a team of talented engineers while also executing on delivering uniquely ambitious projects! As a Staff Engineer on the Engineering team in Brazil, you will be an early member of Uber's first development center in LATAM.

**What You'll Do**

Leads efforts within the organization to drive the development and maintenance of backend services and solutions to support user-facing products, downstream services, or infrastructure tools and platforms used across Uber.

The work you do will initially focus on advanced technologies to improve safety around the world, such as advanced telematics, machine learning, high scale distributed systems, real time data processing and mobile development, among others.

## **Minimum qualifications:**

- PhD or equivalent in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics or related field **OR** +10-years full-time Software Engineering work experience.

- Programming language (e.g. C, C++, Java, Python, or Go)

## **Technical skills:**

- Distributed systems
- Product engineering
- Scalability engineering

**About our teams**

**Grocery**

Uber is redefining the future of grocery & retail. A company that started by transporting people from place to place, now transports nearly anything a customer could want or need, on-demand. The Grocery Engineering Team is responsible for ensuring that as we move to transport more than just people & restaurant food, our platform evolves to provide a best-in-class experience for customers, earners and brands. Today this team is focused on grocery, but will continue to flex into a longer tail of categories in the future.

jobs.title: Senior ML Engineer (Dynamic Pricing)
locations: New York, New York, United States
jobs.description:
**About the Role**

The mission of the Surge team is to maintain overall marketplace reliability by balancing supply/demand in real-time through dynamic pricing. We build scalable real-time systems to understand the state of the market, forecast future demand, make predictions using ML models, solve network optimization programs, and eventually make pricing decisions for each rider session.

Surge plays a critical role in service of Uber’s mission to make transport accessible. We generate billions of dollars in annual gross bookings for the company by optimizing network efficiency and make a significant contribution to driver earnings. In addition to pricing, the signals we generate are some of the most important features used in practically every optimization/ML system across Uber. Although we are a backend team, what we do has an outsized impact on our riders because prices and reliability are two of the most important elements of customer experience.

**What You'll Do**

You will work with a mixed team of Engineers, Operations Researchers, and Economists to build large-scale pricing optimization systems to set prices based on real-time marketplace conditions for Uber’s rides products globally.

- You will end-to-end design and implement models for marketplace effects and behaviors
- You will define relevant metrics and monitoring
- You will conduct experiments, iterate on models, and identify new opportunities to apply machine learning to our problem space

**Basic Qualifications**

- PhD in relevant fields (CS, EE, Math, Stats, etc.) with a focus on Machine Learning.
- 3+ years of experience in an ML role with an emphasis on data and experiment driven model development.
- Expertise in deep learning and optimization algorithms.
- Experience with ML frameworks such as PyTorch and TensorFlow.
- Experience building and productionizing innovative end-to-end Machine Learning systems.
- Proficiency in one or more coding languages such as Python, Java, Go, or C++.
- Strong communication skills and can work effectively with cross-functional partners.
- Strong sense of ownership and tenacity toward hard machine-learning projects.

**Preferred Qualifications**

- Experience in serving and monitoring online training systems such as real time recommendation systems.
- Experience designing and implementing novel metrics for performance evaluation.
- Experience handling time series data and time series forecasting (experience handling spatial temporal data is plus).
- Deep understanding of models such as VAE (Variational Auto Encoder), SSM (State space model), and Normalizing Flow.
- Experience in inference optimization and monitoring model performance efficiency and being able to identify bottlenecks.
- Proven track record in conducting experiments and tracking models in high-complexity environments.

For New York, NY-based roles: The base salary range for this role is USD$198,000 per year - USD$220,000 per year.

jobs.title: Senior Strategic Operations Associate, Uber for Business Self-serve - EMEA
jobs.description:
**About the Role**

We’re looking for a Senior Strategic Operations Associate to help us scale Uber for Business, one of the most exciting and fastest growing business units at Uber. The role is focused on growing Uber for Business’s self-service channel in EMEA, a complex region with some of our fastest growing markets. It will require strong cross-functional partnership to continuously align strategic vision and fearlessly drive execution.

We are flexible regarding location and can base this role in either our London or Amsterdam office. While the remit is initially UK-centric, the scope will eventually evolve to encompass the wider EMEA region.

**What the Candidate Will Need / Bonus Points**

\-\-\-\- What the Candidate Will Do ----

1. **Growth strategy and launch** \- Partner with the Global teams in Ops, Marketing, Product, and Support to define and launch new growth initiatives for key EMEA markets.
2. **Program management** \- Manage the execution of a portfolio of growth initiatives in partnership with cross-functional partners (Product, Marketing, Support, Sales operations, etc.). Where appropriate, collaborate with stakeholders to tailor global initiatives to the regional context.
3. **Analytics** \- Use your analytical skills to identify growth opportunities and drive strategy through business insights
4. Build and maintain reporting to track progress across a variety of top line and operational metrics for the region
5. Communicate findings and insights to diverse audiences including Uber for Business leadership and cross functional teams in Monthly Business Reviews or other forums
6. **Market intelligence** \- Monitor macro and competitive trends in key EMEA markets, and develop recommendations for how to respond – through commercial levers, product innovation, etc.
7. **Be a subject matter expert**\- Become an expert on the Uber for Business self-serve product and the SMB segment, and leverage your expertise to shape the agenda for regional growth.

\-\-\-\- Basic Qualifications ----

1. 4+ years of experience in project/program management, operations, or related field
2. Experienced SQL user or similar query language
3. Bachelor’s degree

\-\-\-\- Preferred Qualifications ----

1. Excellent presentation and communication skills, with experience managing meetings and presentations with senior leaders
2. Analytical thinker, with experience using data to drive business decisions
3. Strong business acumen, with experience evaluating a line of business and understanding how to drive commercial growth
4. Strong organization and project management skills, including ability to prioritize and lead multiple projects and processes simultaneously
5. Skilled in synthesizing information quickly to distill key takeaways, and to weave insights into a compelling story that clarifies and inspires
6. Experience building deep relationships with cross-functional stakeholders, anticipating their concerns and successfully advocating for your priorities
7. Comfort addressing ambiguity, for example, shifting priorities or unfamiliar problems
8. An ability to identify new sales use cases, playbook findings, and share out with regional teams to gain adoption and accelerate growth
9. B2B Experience is an asset, but not required

jobs.title: Sales Trainer
jobs.description:
**About the Role**

The Sales Trainer will be a key driver in maximizing sales effectiveness and quality across our BPO partner network. This role will work closely with the Community Operations Learning team and, crucially, will partner with Digital Sales Operations to ensure training programs are aligned with strategic sales goals, process efficiency, and performance metrics.

The ideal candidate for the Sales Trainer role brings deep sales enablement expertise and a strong commitment to elevating revenue performance. They model high standards of sales excellence and consistently inspire better execution through their knowledge and craft. This Sales Trainer will spend dedicated time traveling and conducting Train-the-Trainer (TTT) sessions in our Outsourcing BPO Partners.

**What You'll Do**

1. Lead trainings and TTT sessions for BPO trainers on the 10-day onboarding, evergreen modules, and initiative launches.
2. Ensure that facilitation guides, role plays, and QA frameworks are properly understood and applied by BPO trainers.
3. Partner with Enablement to validate content accuracy, provide feedback on gaps, and ensure commercial concepts are not diluted during delivery.
4. Manage ongoing calibration sessions with BPO trainers to reinforce quality and consistency across sites.
5. Act as the first line of feedback for Enablement on delivery challenges, regional nuances, and trainer capability gaps.
6. Support with local and region specific content updates.

**What You'll Need**

1. 3+ years of relevant experience with proven facilitation experience, ideally with exposure to L&D or enablement in a sales context.
2. Strong sales background in SMB sales, with hands-on experience in selling, objection handling, and value-based pitching.
3. Familiarity with training methods and techniques.
4. Advanced organisational skills with the ability to handle multiple assignments.
5. Fluency in English and Portuegese
6. Must work well in a team environment, contributing to a synergistic work environment where people learn from one another and continuously improve processes
7. Ability to adapt global curricula to regional market realities and to support localization with relevant examples and scenarios.
8. Proficiency with core sales tools (Salesforce, Seismic, Outreach/Groove) to model best practices for BPO trainers.

**Preferred Qualifications**

1. 3+ years of experience specifically in a B2B or B2C Sales Enablement, Sales Training, or Sales Coaching role within a high-growth or tech environment.
2. Certification or advanced training in a recognized Sales Methodology (e.g., Challenger Sale, SPIN Selling, Sandler Training).
3. Demonstrated ability to design, develop, and implement blended learning solutions (including e-learning, virtual, and in-person) for a remote/outsourced sales workforce.
4. Direct experience working with, or managing training for, Business Process Outsourcing (BPO) partners in a multinational context.
5. Proficiency with Learning Management Systems (LMS) administration and e-learning authoring tools (e.g., Seismic)

jobs.title: Frontend Staff Engineer - Rider
jobs.description:
**About the Role**

The Rider Web team is looking for an engineer to join the team responsible for the foundation of all web applications at Uber. This team focuses on providing a high-performance, secure, and reliable web ecosystem for all of our users through the creation and support of developer tools, and frameworks.

The team’s main goal is to make Uber’s web engineers productive and its web applications high quality utilizing a modern tech stack (.js & Redux, ES2017+, RPC, and Node.js). Some of our main products include Fusion.js, the framework Uber used in hundreds of internal and external web applications, as well as Base Web, Uber’s component library.

**What You Will Do**

- Work with the team lead to implement the web stack of the future which can be leveraged by multiple use cases. The stack should be performant, and should enable rapidly building features
- Focus on all aspects of developer experience, and ensure its easy to build and test providing best in class tooling

**Basic Qualifications**

- Bachelors or equivalent in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics or related field
- 5-years full-time Software Engineering work experience, which includes 3-years total technical software engineering experience in one or more of the following areas:
  - Programming language (e.g. JavaScript, CSS, Node.js)
  - Architecting, building, and maintaining web applications

- _Note the 3-years total of specialized software engineering experience may have been gained through education and full-time work experience, additional training, coursework, research, or similar (OR some combination of these).  The years of specialized experience are not necessarily in addition to the years of Education & full-time work experience indicated._

- Build and evolve the underlying architectural foundation for Rider's web applications
- Create developer tools to increase the productivity and quality of our product teams
- Continue to refine and define our tech stack, utilizing open source tools, generalizing product-specific code, and/or building novel solutions to needs we encounter
- Contribute features and fixes back to open-source software, or create and promote our open-source tools
- Communicate and collaborate within and across teams to drive company-wide, large-scale projects
- Mentor, educate, and support those around you, as well as other web engineers within the company

**Preferred Qualifications**

- Deep JavaScript knowledge and experience with Node.js
- Expert in core and emerging web technologies and APIs (HTTP2, TCP/IP, CSS/HTML, Browser JS APIs).
- Deep understanding of Web and Information Security concepts and concerns, such as CORS, CSP, CSRF, XSS, etc
- Expert in debugging and profiling Browsers and Node.js, and understand ways to decrease page load speed and runtime slowdowns
- Knowledgeable in modern web tools (npm, Babel, Browserify/Webpack/Rollup, etc.) and modern web frameworks (Angular, Vue, etc.)

jobs.title: Risk and Compliance Specialist II - Global ATO
jobs.description:
**#Greatmindsdontthinkalike:** At Uber, we take pride in our diversity and working environment that sees you as more than just a person that can do the job, but a unique individual that can level up our organization with a perspective only you can offer. Uber provides a truly open culture that encourages all to voice their thoughts.

**About the Role**

You will be at the forefront of rebuilding Uber to be a brand not only known for its outstanding product, but for its awesome customer service. You will deliver only the best customer service for riders and partner-drivers globally across multiple support platforms: email, live chat, instant messaging, and phone.

Be the charming, natural problem-solver our customers will love. You understand them and will do your best to reach the resolution needed. You will cause riders to continue riding, and partner-drivers to continue operating on the platform. You will also be the reason that customers will rave about the brand and will advocate for us to get more people to be users of the app.

Be goal-oriented, not only for the company and for our vision, but also your career. As you grow within the organization, you will proactively share how you think we could improve the way we do things and drive these changes - after all, in Uber, we adopt new ideas and constant change.

**Your Impact in Role:**

**Flexible to use multi-modalites (messaging, phone, and chat)**

**Global ATO / OB:**

- Respond to account take over, fraud related concerns via outbound phone and messaging.
- Able to multi-task and meet the responsibilities end of the day.
- Able to suggest and make recommendations for process improvements/changes.
- Escalate concerns/issues to ensure better manage customer experience.
- Fluent in English (Oral & Written).

**Global ATO / Chat:**

- Respond to account take over, fraud related concerns via chat and/or messaging and/or outbound modality
- Able to multi-task and meet the responsibilities end of the day
- Able to suggest and make recommendations for process improvements/changes
- Escalate concerns/issues to ensure better manage customer experience
- Fluent in English (Oral & Written)

**The Experience You'll Bring:**

**Basic Qualifications:**

- Work experience in high energy, productive environment.
- Excellence in both written and spoken English.
- Exceptional comprehension and writing skills.
- High proficiency using computers (typing, quickly navigating between various tools) and software
- Excellent problem-solving skills, ability to connect effectively what users are asking for with answers to their true issues.
- Passion for creating support experiences that exceed users' expectations.
- Willingness to work in a team environment, contributing to a collaborative work environment where people learn from one another and continuously improve processes on behalf of users.
- To be an Uber ambassador - you care passionately about the product and getting others excited to ride and partner with Uber.
- A willingness to work on different shifts, totaling 40 hours per week, including weekends, holidays, and weekly evening shifts.
- Willing to be moved from time to time to other projects and accounts or where the business needs them.

**Preferred Qualifications**

- A bachelor's degree from any field is preferred but not a requirement.
- 1+ years of total work experience in a high-growth, productive constantly changing environment.
- Work experience in customer-centric industries (ex. Hotels, airlines, banking) is preferred.
- Extensive experience dealing with different markets (countries) and having a good understanding of cultural differences is preferred.

jobs.title: Country Manager, Uber Eats, Finland
jobs.description:
**About the Role**

Based in Helsinki, this is a **career-defining role** for an exceptional entrepreneurial leader, tasked with accelerating our market entry, driving rapid post-launch expansion, and establishing Uber Eats as the dominant delivery platform.

You will have the autonomy to define the market strategy, build and scale a world-class operation, and forge high-impact partnerships that deliver sustainable value to consumers, couriers, and our restaurant partners nationwide.

**What You'll Do:**

This role requires a unique balance of strategic leadership, commercial command, and hands-on operational excellence.

- Full P&L Ownership: Assume full ownership of the Finland P&L, defining commercial targets, and driving high-velocity, sustainable, and highly efficient market growth.
- Define Market Strategy: Design and execute the nationwide scaling strategy for 2026 and beyond, ensuring tight alignment with global Uber Eats priorities while deeply localising for consumer behavior and competitive dynamics.
- Hardwire Efficiency: Champion operational excellence by driving improvements across the three sides of the marketplace (consumer, courier, restaurant) to ensure best-in-class performance, speed, reliability, and outstanding customer support.
- Cross-Platform Leverage: Collaborate strategically with the Uber Mobility (Rides) team to unlock cross-platform efficiencies, share resources, and leverage the full power of the combined Uber network in Finland.
- Inspire and Lead: Recruit, mentor, and lead a diverse, high-performing local team, cultivating a culture defined by inclusivity, data-driven decisions, innovation, and urgency.
- Strategic Partnerships: Forge and manage high-value, lasting relationships with key stakeholders, including enterprise restaurant groups, policymakers, government agencies, and local community leaders.
- Brand Ambassadorship: Serve as the definitive public face of Uber Eats in Finland, handling all media engagements, press opportunities, public events, and policy communication.

**What You'll Need:**

- 8+ years of proven experience in strategic, operational, or executive leadership roles, with a clear history of launching, scaling, and driving impactful commercial outcomes in fast-paced environments.
- Native fluency in Finnish and professional working proficiency in English.
- Demonstrated P&L responsibility or equivalent experience managing complex commercial budgets and resource allocation.
- A strong, validated track record of building and leading diverse, high-performing teams and fostering a culture of ownership and rapid iteration.
- Exceptional executive communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to influence and inspire both internal teams and external partners (media, policy, enterprise).

**Preferred Qualifications:**

- Deep knowledge of the restaurant, hospitality, or last-mile delivery industries.
- Previous experience working within a mobile consumer marketplace or high-growth tech platform.
- Proven experience in crisis communications, public relations, and external brand representation.

jobs.title: Software Engineer II, iOS - Autonomous Mobility & Delivery [SF Bay Area]
jobs.description:
**About the Role**

The AM&D (Autonomous Mobility & Delivery) team owns the autonomous future of Uber’s Rides and Eats business. As we move towards a world where autonomous and human-driven vehicles coexist, Uber is tackling the challenge of building a hybrid marketplace that seamlessly integrates autonomous vehicles into the existing mobility and delivery ecosystem. This requires a delicate balance of optimizing experiences across human and AV drivers, ensuring the marketplace remains reliable, efficient, and scalable.

In order to achieve this, at Uber AM&D, we touch almost all existing experience surfaces Uber provides: from the Uber Rider App, to the UberEats App, to the UberEats Merchant App. Our mission is to make sure the entirety of Uber’s Mobility and Delivery experiences work for the autonomous future before it arrives at scale. As we look ahead, we expect significant business growth and are looking for a Software Engineer II to help drive this journey forward.

**What You Will Do**

1. Design, develop, and improve solutions used by millions of members, in collaboration with a team of talented engineers, Product Managers and Designers.
2. Build user-facing products, working across rider, driver, eater and merchant apps.
3. Write high-quality code and uphold standards for testing and coverage.
4. Align the team on solutions to ambiguous problems and analyze the tradeoffs of different technical solutions
5. Contribute to engineering cultivation in terms of quality, monitoring, and on-call practices.

\-\-\-\- Basic Qualifications ----

1. BS/BE degree or equivalent in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics or a related field
2. Proven knowledge of iOS development is a must-have, with at least 3 years of experience in the industry.
3. Grit, drive and a deep sense of ownership
4. Experience coding with one or more of Swift, Java, Scala, Go, C++, Python (or similar)
5. Strong communication and collaboration skills

\-\-\-\- Preferred Qualifications ----

1. Extensive iOS development experience, including Swift and/or Objective-C programming

jobs.title: Sr. Revenue Ops Associate, Outreach & Automation, Uber for Business
locations: New York, New York, United States
jobs.location: New York, New York, United States
jobs.description:
**About the Role**

The Uber for Business (U4B) Revenue Technology team is tasked with introducing features and products that empower Sales and cross-functional partners. Our objective is to enhance efficiencies through improved data, AI, and system upgrades. Through this, we have driven millions in incremental pipeline, saved our sales teams tens of thousands of hours, and autonomously onboarded new customers. We bridge the gap between the business, tech, and best-in-class technology and data.

**What You'll Do**

Global Tool Launch & Change Management (40%)

- High-Impact Launch Leadership: Lead the end-to-end global technical program for the launch and implementation of a new sales engagement platform. This includes technical readiness, data migration strategy, integration development, and deployment across all sales territories
- Executive Visibility & Communication: Own the program narrative and manage communications for senior leadership, providing clear, concise updates on status, risks, and impact
- Organizational Change Management (OCM): Design and execute a comprehensive change management strategy to drive user adoption and ensure the successful transition of thousands of global sales users to the new platform
- Technical Program Oversight: Partner directly with Engineering and Sales Operations to manage technical timelines, solve complex integration hurdles, and ensure system scalability and performance globally
- Post-Launch Success & Monitoring: Define, track, and report on key metrics and usage patterns post-launch to monitor the platform's health, measure adoption success, and identify optimization opportunities for future iterations

#### Program & Product Strategy & Optimization (35%)

- Tool Strategy & Optimization: Identify strategic opportunities to better leverage existing sales outreach tools (e.g., LinkedIn Sales Navigator, ZoomInfo, etc.) to maximize ROI and sales effectiveness
- Adoption & Enablement Partnership: Collaborate closely with the Sales Enablement team to translate identified tool leverage opportunities into cohesive adoption strategies, training plans, and measurement frameworks
- Define Product Roadmap: Serve as the product manager for key GTM tools within the Outreach & Automation Pod, developing a clear, data-driven product roadmap and vision based on business objectives and user pain points
- Gap Analysis & Solution Design: Translate complex business gaps and objectives (e.g., pipeline generation challenges, content utilization) into well-defined, actionable technical requirements and solutions for the engineering team
- Data Source Aggregation: Lead programs focused on integrating and standardizing diverse data sources (e.g., CRM data, engagement data, firmographic data) to provide a unified, reliable view for automation and content surfacing tools

#### Execution & Delivery (25%)

- Cross-Functional Leadership: Partner closely with Sales/Revenue Operations, Sales Enablement, Sales Leadership, Engineering, Data Science, and Marketing teams to align priorities, manage dependencies, and drive successful project delivery
- Stakeholder Management: Proactively communicate program status, risks, and performance metrics to executive stakeholders and core team members. You can see around the corner of possible blocks and delays, alerting your stakeholders accordingly
- Program Management: Utilize best-practice project management methodologies to oversee the full lifecycle of complex technical programs—from ideation and requirements gathering to deployment, change management, and post-launch optimization
- Operational Excellence: Establish clear Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) and Objectives and Key Results (OKRs) for all owned products and programs, monitoring performance and driving continuous improvement


**Basic Qualifications**

- Bachelor's degree in Business, Computer Science, or a related field; or equivalent practical experience
- 5+ years of combined experience in Program Management, Project Management, Operations, or Consulting, with a significant focus on technology or revenue-generating teams
- Proven experience leading or contributing to the technical launch and change management for a major, global business application (e.g., CRM, CPQ, Conversational Intelligence, or Sales Engagement platform)


**Preferred Qualifications**

- Strong familiarity with the GTM sales technology ecosystem and proven experience working with tools such as Salesforce, Groove, LinkedIn, ZoomInfo, Clay, etc.
- Demonstrated ability to apply a product management mindset to program execution, prioritizing features, defining user stories, and iterating based on business impact
- Highly skilled at bridging technical and non-technical teams, effortlessly translating technical constraints and possibilities into clear business implications and vice versa
-  Proven success in a matrixed environment, driving alignment and achieving results across multiple functions (Sales, Marketing, Engineering, Enablement)
- Experience working directly with an internal engineering/development team on custom tooling or integrations
- Familiarity with data governance and data standardization best practices
- Certification in a relevant program/project management methodology (e.g., PMP, CSM, SAFe)

jobs.title: Senior Operations Manager, Compliance, SSA
jobs.description:
**About the Role**

Local Operations team, in collaboration with regional and central teams, leads our vision, strategy, execution and tactics for their country Operations. Operations is all about running our business on the ground and helping earners get the most out of Uber’s platform.

South Africa mobility landscape is highly regulated. Compliance with legal and internal policy requirements is critical in building trust with regulators, earners and riders on the platform, and helps minimize the risk of disruption to the business.

The Sr Operations Manager role for Risk Operations is a unique opportunity to shape the strategies, policies and processes around earner access and eligibility experience and strive towards always having the right set of drivers and vehicles on our platform. The team is responsible for compliance to external regulations and internal policies, and to minimize operational risk on the platform.

We are looking for an outstanding problem solver with a solid understanding of the ride-sharing business. The ideal candidate has a good track record of resolving underlying causes of complex, multifaceted, new, and often cross-functional problems. The candidate is expected to be a good communicator, and be able to demonstrate strong stakeholder management skills.

**What the Candidate Will Do:**

1. Formulate, lead, implement and monitor the rollout of our operational risk strategy, frameworks, tactics and processes
2. Lead cross-functional projects, collaborating closely with other functions including other verticals within Operations, Policy, Legal, Community Operations, Product, and Central Ops teams
3. Proactively identify problems that scale, independently formulate solutions and operationalise initiatives to mitigate risk and improve operational efficiency
4. Help problem-solve complex business problems and act as a thought partner for Cross-functional teams
5. Engage with Product and Technology teams to represent South Africa, prioritize feature improvements and design new products
6. Drive business decisions through analytical insights and customer empathy

**What the Candidate Will Need:**

1. Min 5 years of experience in operations, product, strategy or consulting
2. Ability to take initiative and prioritise in a fast-paced work environment. You are comfortable dealing with uncertainty in a constantly-changing work environment.
3. Strategic & operational problem solving and creativity
4. Data-driven decision making mentality and sound business judgement through strong analytical thinking and experimentation
5. Solid communication and stakeholder engagement skills - you are able to rally people behind a common goal and easily generate consensus if you’re facing push back
6. A strong sense of ownership and user empathy

\-\-\-\- Preferred Qualifications ----

1. SQL is highly desired. The role would require you to build your querying skills
2. Previous experience in regulatory compliance or risk mitigation is a plus
3. MBA is a plus

jobs.title: Consumer Marketing Manager I
jobs.description:
**About the Role**

We’re looking for a curious, driven, and detail-oriented Marketing Manager to support growth and engagement initiatives across Uber’s mobility business in Canada. You’ll play a key role in helping plan and execute marketing campaigns that drive product adoption and deepen engagement with priority audiences.

In this role, you’ll collaborate closely with teams across Operations, Product, Comms, and Performance Marketing, gaining exposure to full-funnel marketing and developing hands-on experience building programs that deliver both brand and business impact.

**What You'll Do**

- **Campaign Development & Execution:** Support the end-to-end execution of field and retail marketing campaigns, including managing timelines, reviewing assets, organizing feedback, and ensuring delivery across all relevant channels.
- **Project Management:** Own workback schedules for assigned projects. Proactively flag blockers, surface status updates, and make prioritization trade-offs as needed to keep things on track.
- **Cross-functional Coordination:** Collaborate with stakeholders across Marketing, Ops, Creative, and Analytics to ensure campaigns are aligned to business goals and run smoothly.
- **Agency & Creative Management:** Partner with internal creative, production, and agency teams to help bring campaigns to life—supporting the development of consumer-centric work that drives engagement, product trial, and short- to mid-term growth.
- **Asset & Brief Support:** Help draft creative briefs, consolidate stakeholder feedback, and ensure assets are accurate and on-brand before launch.
- **Data Gathering & Reporting:** Partner with Analytics and Marketing teams to help gather data for reporting, QA campaign tracking, and pull directional results post-launch.

**Basic Qualifications**

- 5+ years of consumer marketing experience, specializing in a combination of field marketing, retail marketing and middle & through the funnel marketing that has driven brand and business impact
- Bachelors Degree

**Preferred Qualifications**

- Familiarity with working alongside agencies and production partners to support creative development and delivery
- Ability to synthesize campaign inputs and performance data into clear summaries that inform next steps and optimization
- Demonstrated ability to manage multiple workstreams simultaneously and shift priorities based on changing business needs
- Strong organizational skills with a proactive mindset—comfortable taking initiative and anticipating what’s needed to move projects forward
- Comfort navigating ambiguity and fast-moving environments; able to stay calm and focused under pressure
- Familiarity with key marketing performance metrics and how they tie back to business objectives (e.g. conversion rates, engagement, match rates, media mix)
- In house experience at a consumer focused tech company.
- Experience leading marketing campaigns in Canada

For Canada-based roles: The base salary range for this role is CAD$114,000 per year - CAD$127,000 per year.
