jobs.title: Business Operations Manager, Auto
jobs.description:
**About the Role**

As a Marketplace Manager, you will be responsible for growing key markets in Uber’s 3-wheeler portfolio while improving rider and driver experience. This is a unique opportunity to build one of the fastest-growing product categories in India South Asia - Uber Auto, while creating direct P&L impact via sustainable growth.

You will lead multiple interesting projects to improve Auto’s penetration, spanning across India and South Asia. These will include shaping Product-led growth, building a deep understanding of consumers, balancing pricing/incentives to grow business, and expanding across tier-2/3 cities while working alongside a very capable cross-functional team.

This role will be pivotal to achieving the above goals by helping drive strategic decisions through a data-driven approach, creative thinking, hustle, analytics, and a consumer-first operational mindset.

**What the Candidate Will Do**

1. Lead marketplace for multiple cities, drive growth, improve rider and driver experience for Auto. Critically analyze existing data and develop frameworks to continuously improve existing processes on pricing, incentive, and marketplace management.
2. Forecast growth trajectory of the category and plan demand/supply requirements to exceed both topline and bottomline targets.
3. Be the voice of riders and drivers to identify product/process gaps and coordinate with the right teams to fix platform experience.
4. Partner with cross-functional teams (Regions, New Supply, Driver Operations, Finance) to drive Auto’s category agenda and measure the impact of new/existing product launches & processes.
5. Partner with global product teams to a) Launch and scale new product features, b) Identify and deploy best practices c) Improve the VC profile of the category.

**What the Candidate Will Need**

1. 3+ years of work experience in deep analytics/consulting/startups. Keen interest in the marketplace and growth-related analytics.
2. Exceptional analytical, problem-solving, Excel, and data management skills. SQL experience is a must.
3. Ability to work with remote teams and across time zones to develop strategies and foster a cohesive and creative work environment.
4. Strong communication and organization skills, with the ability to synthesize a lot of information quickly, highlight key takeaways, and disseminate actionable insights.
5. A desire to learn and constantly improve; you're expected to take initiative and experiment with new processes or improve existing ones.

jobs.title: Software Engineer II
jobs.description:
The **Compute Platform** team builds the next generation of Uber’s global container orchestration platform on **Kubernetes**—designed to be secure, reliable, scalable, and highly efficient. Our infrastructure spans both **on-prem data centers and cloud environments**, supporting a diverse range of workloads including stateless, stateful, batch, streaming, and ML/AI.

jobs.title: Representante de Ventas en Campo - CDMX
jobs.description:
## Sobre la oportunidad

Estamos construyendo un Equipo de Ventas de Campo con el objetivo principal de incrementar la oferta en distintas ciudades de México.

El role de Field Sales Representative es clave: será los ojos y oídos de Uber en el mercado. Su misión será asegurar que la oferta responda a la demanda, conectando proactivamente con socios conductores potenciales a través de visitas en campo y llamadas dirigidas, comunicando de forma efectiva la propuesta de valor de Uber.

## Responsabilidades

- Identificar y encontrar prospectos (conductores de taxi o independientes) directamente en campo (80% del tiempo) para referirlos y/o convertirlos a la plataforma.

- Actuar como la voz del socio conductor, capturando información de valor en cada interacción.

- Facilitar sesiones informativas con socios conductores actuales y potenciales, comunicando claramente la propuesta de valor de Uber.

- Participar en campañas dirigidas a conductores potenciales o recientemente registrados.

- Gestionar interacciones con conductores activos o prospectos para entender sus necesidades, inquietudes y objetivos; posicionar a Uber como solución.

- Apoyar a los conductores durante el proceso de registro y asegurarse de que estén listos para completar sus primeros viajes.

- Colaborar con distintos stakeholders para integrar sus insights cuando sea necesario.

- Crear y/o aprovechar procesos escalables de adquisición de conductores que puedan replicarse en múltiples ciudades.

- Gestionar alianzas estratégicas con terceros.


## Requisitos Básicos

- 2+ años de experiencia cuantificable en ventas de campo B2C/B2B, gestión de cuentas o soporte al cliente de alto volumen, con conversión como métrica principal.

- Alto nivel de autonomía y autogestión, habiendo manejado un ciclo de ventas o territorio completo con mínima supervisión.

- Capacidad demostrada para gestionar múltiples prioridades, tomar decisiones rápidas y operar en entornos dinámicos y acelerados.

- Excelentes habilidades interpersonales y pasión por interactuar con personas.

- Nivel de inglés intermedio, necesario para la comunicación con equipos internos y documentación
- Capacidad para operar con resiliencia, persistencia y enfoque ante la ambigüedad o metas de conversión desafiantes.

- Disponibilidad para viajar dentro del país para apoyar campañas estratégicas de oferta y lanzamientos de nuevos mercados.

## Cualidades preferidas

- Conocimiento o experiencia laboral en la industria de taxis, transporte o logística en México.

- Experiencia comprobada en la creación y gestión de alianzas externas o negociaciones con terceros.

jobs.title: Data Analytics Specialist III
jobs.description:
**#Greatmindsdontthinkalike**: At Uber, we take pride in our diversity and working environment that sees you as more than just a person that can do the job, but an outstanding individual that can level up our organization with a perspective only you can offer. Uber provides a truly open culture that encourages all to voice their thoughts.

## About the Team

Community Operations is the heart and soul of our **#BuildWithHeart** approach at Uber. We work with customers, people earning money on the platform and partners at enormous scale. Community Operations helps operationalise every new and existing product and idea that Uber comes up with - it’s an organisation that touches every part of Uber!

**About the Role**

In the **APAC Analytics & Insights** team, we collaborate with Community Operations managers across the region to enhance the customer experience. The analyst plays a critical role in generating insights from customer support data—pinpointing key concerns, identifying gaps in existing processes, and empowering stakeholders to make data-backed decisions that improve customer experience and deliver business value through a smoother, more effective support journey.

**Your Impact in Role:**

- **Translate business problems into analytical solutions** by writing efficient SQL queries to extract and analyse relevant data.
- **Conduct root-cause analysis** to uncover drivers of customer support interactions and identify gaps across processes, products, or operations.
- **Identify opportunities to enhance the customer experience** and provide stakeholders with data-driven insights to inform long-term improvements.
- **Build and maintain dashboards** to monitor KPIs, surface trends, and highlight anomalies requiring stakeholder attention.

**Basic Qualifications**

- Strong business acumen and the ability to translate business questions into analytical solutions
- Expertise in data querying and manipulation using **SQL**
- Proficiency in **Python** for data analysis and automation tasks
- Experience with data visualization and dashboarding using **Tableau**
- Strong skills in **Google Workspace (G-Suite)** tools (Sheets, Slides, Docs, etc.)
- Proven experience in stakeholder management and presenting insights to stakeholders
- Excellent communication skills and a flair for data-driven storytelling
- Self-starter with a proactive approach to identifying opportunities for improvement

**Preferred Qualifications**

- Background in **Statistics** or strong understanding of statistical methods
- Experience in **A/B testing or Experimentation (XP)** setups
- Advanced proficiency in Python with a strong ability to debug and resolve errors in fast-paced environments.

jobs.title: Customer Support Specialist - Autonomous Vehicles team
jobs.description:
**About the Role**

At Uber, we’re building a future where autonomous vehicles and human drivers seamlessly work together to make transportation more reliable, affordable, sustainable, and safer. Our vision is one of a hybrid future, with AVs operating alongside drivers and couriers, each bringing their unique capabilities to the table. As the largest on-demand mobility and delivery platform in the world, Uber is uniquely positioned to help AV companies deploy and scale their technology globally.

As the COE Specialist on the Autonomous Vehicle team, you will be at the center of delivering on this mission to build the best support experience for Autonomous Vehicle users.

**What You Will Do:**

- Handle Customer Interactions via inbound or outbound phone and messaging
- Ensure continuous process improvement, advocating passionately on behalf of our community to influence the overall customer experience
- Provide accurate, valid, and complete information by using the right methods/tools
- Have a strong understanding and knowledge of your LOB, staying up to date with changes, roll-outs, and ongoing initiatives.

**Basic Qualifications**

- Excellent knowledge of English (written and spoken at C1 minimum)
- Fluent Arabic
- Previous call handling experience (inbound preferred)
- Exceptional communication skills.

**Preferred Qualifications**

- Detail Oriented: Proven ability to multitask and follow through while paying strict attention to detail.
- Naturally Curious: Coachability, open to incorporating feedback, and dedication to improvement of your craft.

jobs.title: Program Manager II, Tech
jobs.description:
**About the Role**

Uber Scaled Solutions is one of Uber’s biggest bets with the ambition to build one of the world’s largest data foundries for AI applications and evolve into a platform of choice for a variety of online tasks. Data Labelling operations is one of the core functional teams within Uber Global Scaled Solutions (GSS) with the responsibility to oversee the end-to-end lifecycle of the data annotation programs for B2B clients. At its core, our ability to build industry-leading data annotation programs is our right to win in this space.

As a seasoned program manager for data labeling in the Gen AI space, you will be responsible for defining the programs and its key objectives to support LLM model training. You will drive cross-functional efforts across Operations, Product, Engg and Legal to define the Program-level Ops strategy, define scalable data labeling workflows leveraging internal tools, external vendors, and automation.

The role will also shape and lead Scaled Solutions task/ product/ feature launches and improvements by working closely with global Supply, product, and engineering teams.

You will be required to work with a geographically diverse team.

True to Uber values, we are looking for a leader with an “owner” and “go-get-it” mindset who is ready to scale a brand new business line. You need to be customer-obsessed and “build with heart” ‌ while demonstrating ability to build the vision as well as roll up the sleeves and get into action to “see the forest and the trees”.

If you’re passionate about re-imagining the gig marketplace for skilled workers and impacting the lives of millions of skilled gig workers while working with a top-tier team, this is the opportunity for you

**What the Candidate Will Need / Bonus Points**

\-\-\-\- What the Candidate Will Do ----

01. Define the key objectives for data labeling projects to support generative AI initiatives
02. Partner with stakeholders (Account Executives, Data Scientists, Machine Learning Engineers, and Product Managers) to identify data requirements and success criteria
03. Represent Scaled Solutions in Customer meetings along with Account Executives
04. Design scalable data labeling workflows that leverage internal tools, external vendors, and automation
05. Optimize workflows for efficiency, accuracy, and cost-effectiveness, incorporating active learning and pre-labeling techniques where appropriate.
06. Engage and manage relationships with data labeling vendors, ensuring timely delivery and adherence to quality standards
07. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to align labeling efforts with broader AI model development timelines
08. Implement robust quality assurance processes to validate labeled datasets against gold standards
09. Use metrics such as inter-annotator agreement, precision/recall, and throughput to monitor quality and make improvements
10. Manage program budgets, including vendor costs and internal resources.
11. Forecast resource requirements and ensure efficient allocation to meet deadlines
12. Advocate for inclusive and unbiased labeling practices to mitigate bias in AI models

\-\-\-\- Basic Qualifications ----

1. 5+ years experience managing scaled operations programs with 1+ year experience in GenAI / model training
2. Experience working in a fast-paced, ambiguous work environment
3. Strong knowledge of machine learning concepts and model training data needs
4. Experience working with data annotation platforms and tools.
5. Proven track record of managing large-scale projects with cross-functional teams and external vendors

\-\-\-\- Preferred Qualifications ----

01. Experience in Generative AI, including text, image, video or audio data labeling
02. Familiarity with human-in-the-loop systems
03. Proficiency in data annotation tools and scripting languages to analyze datasets and processes
04. Strong understanding of ethical AI and best practices for minimizing dataset bias.
05. Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to influence technical and non-technical stakeholders
06. Strong understanding of the gig economy landscape, freelancer behaviors, and recruitment strategies
07. Excellent project management skills, with a proven ability to juggle multiple priorities and deadlines
08. You are a builder who wants to be empowered to make big bets
09. Demonstrated ability to work independently and effectively across internal and external organizations
10. Ability to take initiative in a constantly-changing work environment
11. Exceptional written and verbal communication, and organizational skills

jobs.title: Customer Support Representative - Croatian speaker
jobs.description:
**About the Role**

At Uber, providing excellent customer support that establishes trust for riders and driver partners - our community - is a core feature of our product experience! We help people resolve their issues and turn unhappy users into our most loyal advocates. The right candidate is always looking for unique and exciting ways to resolve problems with exceptional support and exceptional communication, ensuring that problems are resolved promptly while developing trustworthy relationships with our community.

**What You Will Do**

- Deliver high-quality service across multiple support platforms (email, chat, phone).
- Be a passionate advocate for users while answering any questions that come your way.
- Show empathy to frustrated users while solving problems and addressing unsatisfactory experiences.
- Build loyalty among new users and get our early adopters to fall in love with Uber all over again.
- Triage issues and escalate them when necessary.

**Basic Qualifications**

- Croatian language B2 level
- English language B2 level
- 6 months of previous experience in customer support
- Exceptional communication skills: Effective communicator, verbal & written.
- Detail Oriented: Proven ability to multi-task and follow through while paying strict attention to detail.
- Naturally Curious: Coachability, openness to incorporating feedback, and dedication to the improvement of your craft.
- Excellent Teammate: You collaborate internally or across functional/regional areas to get the best possible outcome partners/councils.

jobs.description:
**About the Role**

The primary goal and responsibility will be to ensure experience excellence for our customers in terms of various domains, including assortment, pricing, promotions, content, availability, and search.

The Catalog Analyst works empirically, finding explanations and solutions in the data, through pilots and trial and error. Knows how to work in groups within catalog, business development, operations, or commercial partners. Knows how to set priorities, and acts fast and decisively.

**What the Candidate Will Do**

- Data-Driven Insights: Extract actionable insights from available data in order to support local catalog excellency.
- Develop Processes: Develop and implement processes that empower our team to manage and improve KPIs.
- Collaboration: Collaborate closely with all other local teams to develop operational projects that drive catalog improvements, while understanding the business need.

- Minimum of 2-3 years of business experience driving scaled operations, strategy, or project/program management.
- Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Office (Excel and PowerPoint mainly).
- Advanced SQL Skills.
- Proficient English speaker

- Problem solving mindset; ability to identify problems, determine the correct analysis to assess them and come up with solutions.

jobs.title: Sr Account Executive, Uber Eats, Lyon
jobs.description:
Chez Uber Eats, notre mission est simple : **permettre aux Français de commander les plats qu’ils aiment… en moins de 25 minutes.** Comment ? Grâce à la technologie Uber et à un réseau de 45 000 restaurants et commerçants partenaires en France.

Tu rejoins une équipe qui développe la sélection de restaurants disponibles sur l’app Uber Eats dans plus de **300 villes en France**.

Notre objectif : proposer une **offre variée, locale et savoureuse**, tout en faisant découvrir des pépites culinaires à nos utilisateurs.

Concrètement, tu seras responsable de **tout le cycle de vente**. Les échanges se font principalement par téléphone et e-mail, avec quelques déplacements ponctuels selon les priorités business.

### **Tes missions au quotidien**

- Identification des restaurants à très fort potentiel dans ta région
- Prise de contact (prospection)
- Présenter avec clarté et enthousiasme les services et la valeur ajoutée d’Uber Eats aux restaurateurs
- Gérer l’ensemble du processus commercial : de la prospection à la signature, jusqu’à la première commande
- Mener des négociations avec des établissements stratégiques à fort potentiel
- Contribuer à la stratégie commerciale : comment croître vite, partout, et intelligemment
- Prioriser les prospects en fonction de leur potentiel, de la diversité culinaire ou de leur notoriété locale
- Onboarding des nouveaux partenaires sur la plateforme

**Nous recherchons une personne qui :**

- au moins 3 ans d'expérience (post études) en Sales. Avoir géré des cycles de ventes longs et complexes est un plus
- maîtrise les fondamentaux : prospection téléphonique, négociation, closing
- est à l’aise pour créer du lien avec différents interlocuteurs et construire des relations fortes
- est organisée, autonome, orientée résultats, et sait s’adapter à un environnement en constante évolution
- a d’excellentes capacités de communication et un vrai pouvoir de conviction
- parle parfaitement français et possède un bon niveau d’anglais

### **Pourquoi nous rejoindre ?**

- Tu travailleras sur un produit utilisé chaque jour par des millions de personnes
- Tu évolueras dans un environnement stimulant, apprenant, et tourné vers l’impact
- Tu rejoindras une équipe ambitieuse, solidaire, où chacun a un vrai rôle à jouer
- Tu bénéficieras d’un accompagnement et d’opportunités concrètes d’évolution chez Uber

jobs.title: Senior Account Executive
jobs.description:
**About the Role**

Uber Eats is looking for a dynamic and results-driven **Account Executive** to join our team. The Account Executive role is a great opportunity to demonstrate your sales experience to expand the number of restaurants that work with Uber Eats. Your primary focus will be **pitching and onboarding the largest restaurant group partners across the SMB Business** that fit our partnership criteria. You will use your prospecting and negotiation skills through cold-calling, email outreach, and in-person visits to build successful partnerships.

As a **Sr. Account Executive**, you will lead the full sales cycle and sign partnerships with top local restaurants while being a champion for the Uber and Uber Eats brands. Your success in this role is measured by achieving and exceeding your monthly quota and proactively building your pipeline by managing and hitting the weekly metrics (cold calls, emails, and field appointments).

**What the Candidate Will Need / Bonus Points**

\-\-\-\- What the Candidate Will Do ----

1. Own and manage a pipeline of strategic, mid-market restaurant groups to sign new partnerships in your geographic region with a mix of cold-calling (at least 50 dials per day), emails, and in-person meetings.
2. Integrate feedback from multiple cross-functional stakeholders to drive adoption of Uber Eats across our highest profile merchant partners in the SMB business.
3. Create a great first-impression and act as an ambassador of Uber Eats to develop long-term partnerships and clearly communicate the value of Uber
4. Manage contract negotiation to establish the foundation of a strong working relationship with our most sophisticated restaurant partners, ensuring sustainable economic enablement for both parties
5. Help us identify and build standard processes and collaborate with the Account Management team to support a seamless onboarding experience for each new restaurant partner
6. Proactively maintain communication channels with prospects via phone, email, and face-to-face meetings

\-\-\-\- Basic Qualifications ----

1. Own and manage a pipeline of strategic, mid-market restaurant groups to sign new partnerships in your geographic region with a mix of cold-calling (at least 50 dials per day), emails, and in-person meetings.
2. Integrate feedback from multiple cross-functional stakeholders to drive adoption of Uber Eats across our highest profile merchant partners in the SMB business.
3. Create a great first-impression and act as an ambassador of Uber Eats to develop long-term partnerships and clearly communicate the value of Uber
4. Manage contract negotiation to establish the foundation of a strong working relationship with our most sophisticated restaurant partners, ensuring sustainable economic enablement for both parties
5. Help us identify and build standard processes and collaborate with the Account Management team to support a seamless onboarding experience for each new restaurant partner
6. Proactively maintain communication channels with prospects via phone, email, and face-to-face meetings

\-\-\-\- Preferred Qualifications ----

1. Excited to learn and have no fear of picking up the phone - this is a great role to grow or build your career in sales
2. Bachelor's Degree or equivalent
3. Proven achievement in performance-based role
4. Effective communication with colleagues and clients
5. Experience multi-tasking work with attention to detail
6. Coachability, interest in implementing feedback, and dedication to building your brand
7. Spanish-language fluency is a bonus

The OTE includes a base salary range of USD $72,000 - $80,000 and an annualized cash variable incentive target range of $48,000 - $53,333.  The cash variable incentive payment is based on individual sales performance and its payment is based on the terms of the Sales Incentive Plan.

An equity award and other forms of compensation may be included in the offer. You will also be eligible for various benefits. More details can be found at the following link [https://www.uber.com/careers/benefits](https://www.uber.com/careers/benefits).

jobs.title: Service Team Analyst II - Process Optimization Specialist
jobs.description:
**Process Optimization Specialist**

Uber is looking for a Process Optimization Specialist to expand its Team in Krakow.

The Krakow Center of Excellence is taking a new highway to become a major Technology Hub in Central & Eastern Europe, focusing on Process Optimization, Data Analytics & Automation.

**About the role**

You will execute Business Processes that are essential to keep the Uber Operations in good functioning order.

You will ensure your actions are run properly and on time, meeting the expectations in terms of Quality and Service Level Agreements (SLAs), by following the Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs).

While executing these Processes, you will identify areas of improvement, conduct root-cause analyses, build data-driven strategies and implement your enhancements, iteratively and incrementally.

To drive these continuous improvements, you will work closely in collaboration with other Team Members, Data Analysts like Automation Specialists, as well as Subject-Matter Experts.

This is a great opportunity if you want to further develop your analytical skills, learn how to enhance Processes (by writing SQL Queries, using Google Scripts) and create actionable insights for large-scale operations, with concrete impacts.

**About the Team**

The team’s mission: backing creativity with operational efficiency.

Based in the Krakow CoE, the team is cross-functional and supports operations at regional and global level.

We focus on four core areas:

- Business Processes (design, execution, optimization)
- Automation (process automation, real-time monitoring, refactoring)
- Data Analytics (query, deepdive, self-operating dashboard, data pipeline)
- Data Science (modeling, machine learning, patterns identification, prediction)

The span of work is large, covering multiple verticals (such as Uber Rides, Eats, High Capacity Vehicle, Payment, Strategy & Planning) and Mega-Regions (such as Global, EMEA, US&C).

We’re offering a hybrid model of working (60% minimum based out of our Krakow office, 40% optional work from home).

**What You’ll Do**

- Execute Business Processes within defined SLAs
- Maintain High Quality of execution
- Proactively identify areas of improvement in Process Execution
- Build insights on how to optimize these Processes and make them more efficient
- Improve Technical Skills continuously to match evolving Business needs

**What You’ll Need**

- Strong Analytical Skills
- Basic Knowledge of SQL
- Good Knowledge of Google Sheets (Reporting & Trend Analysis)
- Attention to detail
- Excellent written and spoken English (fluent)
- Motivation to learn all along the way and improve continuously
- Ability to work on your own initiative independently (proactive) or in Group (excellent teammate)

jobs.title: Marketing Manager - Uber Eats UK
jobs.description:
**About the Role**

We are looking for a marketing manager to support the UK Marketing team in planning and executing world-class marketing strategies & integrated campaigns that fuel consumer demand, engagement, and drive brand strength.

This is a unique opportunity to join an outstanding team in a fast-paced and rewarding environment. From Eaters to Couriers and the Restaurants we serve, you will help shape the way the UK views and uses Uber Eats.

The ideal candidate is a self-enabler with plenty of entrepreneurial spirit and the ability to foster strong relationships across teams and business units.

**What You'll Do**

- Develop a strategic understanding of market priorities (business targets, P&L priorities, and segmentation), and support the development of marketing strategies and plans that align with the market priorities and global brand strategy
- Work with key stakeholders to develop and execute campaigns across paid and owned channels, including: media, creative, research & insights, performance marketing, CRM, comms, etc. Full funnel thinking and examples of TTL implementation is required
- Support the development & delivery of local research & insights to inform business & brand decisions
- Help manage partnerships with external partners and develop joint marketing activities and co-marketing plans

**What You'll Need**

- A minimum of 4 years experience working in consumer marketing, or related experience delivering work with measurable business results on time and on budget
- Experience in an environment with 360° campaign development, including creative and media agency management as well as through-the-line execution (eg owned channels)
- Strong business acumen and ability to think strategically and analytically
- A strong customer-centric mindset, always thinking about how customers interact with the brand
- Curiosity and creativity, full of fresh ideas to generate user growth and build the brand
- Self-motivation and drive, with the ability to work well independently and within a group setting to push projects to completion
- Ability to succeed in an environment of ambiguity and capability to adapt positively to changing circumstances
- High bar for quality, productivity, and delivering results
- Hands on and solution driven mindset to operationalise projects quickly
- Excellent written and verbal communication skills
- Excellent organisational skills to juggle tasks without losing sight of the highest priorities

**Bonus Points If**

- Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Business, or similar - Advanced degree is a plus
- Experience working for a global brand
- Experience creating regional marketing strategies and plans

jobs.title: Risk and Compliance Specialist II - SPOT
jobs.description:
**About the Role**

At Uber, we ignite opportunity by setting the world in motion. We take on big problems to help drivers, riders, delivery partners, and eaters get moving in more than 10,000 cities around the world.

The Special Projects Operations Team is a critical part of Uber's success, working with partners across the business to ensure compliance to regulatory standards. SPOT agents complete high quality reviews and projects within the scope of the organization, including background checks, audit related work, and fraud mitigation. We work together with the Program teams, Legal teams, and others to ensure compliance to all regulatory standards and mitigate risk.

This role changes daily and relies on multiple tools and modalities to ensure platform-wide compliance and mitigate risk. Your Monday will not look like your Friday, so adaptability and an open mind are crucial.

**What the Candidate Will Do**

- Perform basic research and data entry related to multiple crucial projects
- Maintain excellent interpersonal skills and integrity while delivering outstanding customer service via administrative processing, chat modalities, and/or outbound phone calls
- Be able to learn and master multiple systems used within the workplace
- Communicate quickly and effectively to internal Uber members as needed
- Become an expert on processes and may help with sophisticated problem solving
- Follow process guides to complete tasks and provide support to various crucial initiatives
- Investigate fraud instances and take action accordingly
- Conduct outbound call campaigns and support supply campaigns sought at getting earners on the road
- Take on projects to update and audit partner documentation

**Basic Qualifications**

- More than 6 months of experience in one of the following: compliance, banking, insurance, fraud, consulting or a regulated area
- Experience with Google Suite/Microsoft Office

**Preferred Qualifications**

- Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including the ability to listen effectively and switch tones between internal teams and external customer communication
- Ability to multitask, prioritize, and handle time effectively
- Excellent interpersonal skills, integrity, and follow-through on tasks
- Must work well in a team environment, contributing to a collaborative work environment where people learn from one another and continuously improve processes on behalf of users
- Detail-oriented
- Basic analytical/technical skills
- Ability to work with sensitive customer information
- Demonstrated leadership in workplace, school setting, community, or other environment

jobs.title: Machine Learning Engineer II
locations: New York, New York, United States
jobs.location: New York, New York, United States
jobs.description:
**About the Role**

Uber Marketplace is at the core of Uber's business, and Delivery Pricing is a strategically critical component of Marketplace. The mission of the team is to foster growth and increase profitability of Uber by pushing the frontiers of machine learning, data science, and economics and developing highly reliable and scalable platforms to accelerate Uber's impact on the transportation industry.This role will drive high-impact projects to optimize pricing at Uber using optimization, machine learning, and causal inference. We are looking for individuals who not only excel in problem solving and critical thinking, but also are interested and proficient in writing production code, converting ideas to scalable systems.

**What You Will Do**

- **Problem Formulation:** Partner with Scientists, Product Managers, and stakeholders to translate ambiguous business challenges into concrete ML formulations, system designs, and data requirements
- **Build & Deploy:** Design, build, and deploy the end-to-end infrastructure and services that power our real-time pricing models at a global scale
- **Productionize ML:** Own the full production lifecycle of machine learning models. This includes building scalable training/inference pipelines, optimizing models for low-latency serving, and setting up robust monitoring to ensure system health and reliability
- **Engineer Data:** Develop and maintain the complex feature engineering pipelines that feed our models, working with both batch and near-real-time data sources

**Basic Qualifications**

- Master's/Bachelor's degree in a similar field with 2+ years of relevant industry experience OR Ph.D. in a quantitative field (e.g., Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics)
- Strong programming skills e.g. Python and a deep understanding of object-oriented design, data structures, and algorithms
- Solid knowledge of machine learning fundamentals (e.g., model types, feature engineering, evaluation metrics)

**Preferred Qualifications**

- Hands-on experience building and deploying machine learning models in a production environment
- Experience with high-performance backend languages (e.g., Java, Go, C++) for low-latency microservices
- Experience with large-scale data processing and training systems (e.g., Spark, Hive, Presto)
- Proven ability to work with Product Managers and partner with Scientists to translate research and business needs into scalable engineering solutions
- Excellent communication skills, with the ability to convey complex technical concepts to diverse audiences

For New York, NY-based roles: The base salary range for this role is USD$167,000 per year - USD$185,500 per year.

jobs.title: Head of Restaurant Self-Delivery Operations, Uber Eats - EMEA
jobs.description:
**About the Role**

The Bring Your Own Courier (BYOC) program helps restaurants grow on Uber Eats by enabling them to fulfill orders using their own delivery staff. This model expands restaurant choice, supports sustainable economics, and allows Uber Eats to serve a broader range of partners and delivery models.

As Head of Restaurant Self-Delivery Operations, Uber Eats - EMEA, you’ll define and drive the regional BYOC strategy end to end, from setting long-term priorities and product championing to leading cross-functional execution and financial performance. You’ll work closely with Product, Sales, Account Management, Regional General Managers, and Strategic Finance to build and scale a best-in-class fulfillment model that delivers value to restaurants and to Uber.

This is a player-coach role: you’ll spend most of your time shaping strategy, driving execution, and aligning senior stakeholders, while also managing a small, high-performing team and developing their capabilities to deliver on critical priorities.

**What the Candidate Will Do**

- Define the long-term business and commercial strategy, as well as the Product roadmap, for the Bring Your Own Courier (BYOC) program in EMEA.
- Lead cross-functional execution with Sales, Account Management, Product, and Finance to translate strategy into measurable growth and operational efficiency.
- Partner with Product and Engineering to shape the tech roadmap that improves reliability, restaurant adoption, and fulfillment experience.
- Advise EMEA leadership on portfolio and investment decisions across fulfillment models, ensuring BYOC plays the right strategic role within the regional delivery ecosystem.
- Use data, financial modeling, and competitive and customer insights to inform strategy and measure performance.
- Balance regional scalability with local nuance, codifying learnings and enabling markets to execute with speed and consistency.
- Manage and coach a small, high-performing team while remaining hands-on in key strategic and analytical workstreams.

**Basic Qualifications**

- 10+ years of experience across Strategy, Operations, or General Management roles within global technology, logistics, or consulting companies.
- At least 3 years of people management experience, including responsibility for developing and scaling small, high-performing teams.
- Delivery of strong commercial and financial outcomes in close partnership with Sales, Account Management, Finance, Product, and regional leadership teams.
- Advanced strategic and analytical skills, with hands-on experience in business modeling, P&L ownership, pricing and monetization strategy.

- Experience defining and executing multi-country business strategies, ideally balancing commercial, operational, and financial objectives.
- Deep understanding of restaurant economics within on-demand, logistics, or platform-based businesses.

jobs.title: Senior Mid Market Account Executive, Uber For Business
jobs.description:
**About the Role**

Are you great with cold outreach, prospecting, qualifying, pitching, and closing new customers? Can you deal with constant rejections from prospects and be persistent in following up until you secure a meeting? Do you enjoy and thrive working in a fast-paced environment and consistently exceeding your sales quota and topping the leaderboard every quarter? And finally, do you love winning as a team? If yes, we would like to speak with you.

The day of an Uber For Business account executive looks like this: formulating a go-to-market plan, generating leads through cold outreach via emails and calls, prospecting and qualifying clients by asking insightful questions, understanding client needs through attentive listening, presenting demos, articulating clearly how our products address their pain points, and persistently staying in touch with clients until a deal is secured. Disciplined pipeline management and accurate forecasting are also required daily.

Finally, you have a proven track record of consistently meeting, surpassing, and exceeding sales quotas as a hunter.

**Your Impact in Role**

- Cold outreach, prospect, qualify, demo, pitch, consistently follow up, and sell into the Mid-Market segments (employee size 200 - 500) in Hong Kong.
- Generate opportunities, build a pipeline, and win accounts within an assigned book of business.
- Articulate clearly the value propositions of Uber for Business and demonstrate how they address the specific pain points of clients.
- Close and onboard the client onto Uber for Business and ensure a high usage on our platform.
- Maximize the lifetime value of the client by constantly exploring upsell and cross-sell opportunities. Manage sales pipeline and provide accurate sales forecast.

**What You Will Need**

- Extensive B2B sales experience in a hunter role, acquiring new businesses.
- Skilled in utilizing Salesforce, Gong, Lusha, ZoomInfo, and LinkedIn Sales Navigator.
- English and Cantonese proficiency.
- Possess a hunter mindset with the ability to cold outreach, prospect, qualify, conduct demos, and close new clients.
- You have experience carrying a sales quota and consistently meeting and exceeding it.
- Proven track record of consistently meeting, surpassing, and exceeding sales quotas as a hunter
- Ability to manage complex deal cycle and negotiate with senior executives

jobs.location: New York, New York, United States
jobs.description:
**About The Role**

Join Uber's CRM Strategy, Planning & Operations team as a Marketing Operations Manager and be a key contributor in defining the future of our CRM operations. In this pivotal role, you will be responsible for building and implementing efficient processes, frameworks, and solutions that enable our CRM teams to effectively manage the company's communications across owned digital channels to millions of Uber users, including Drivers, Riders, Couriers, Eaters, and Restaurants.

We are looking for a skilled and experienced Marketing Operations Manager with excellent planning & organization, stakeholder management and communication skills. The ideal candidate will work closely with our global CRM teams, lead cross-functional programs, manage external agencies and act as a liaison to partner teams to drive organizational efficiency.

**What You’ll Do**

- Manage CRM’s E2E processes, identifying opportunities for improvements and efficiencies, and propose, develop and execute solutions in collaboration with appropriate partners and stakeholders to CRM.
- Manage and oversee CRM’s creative agencies, working on process efficiency and quality improvements.
- Support the optimization of existing org-wide central planning processes, project tracking tools and frameworks, including measuring and driving adoption across CRM.
- Manage cross-functional relationships and optimize workflows for CRM, specifically with the Brand Experience, Localization, and Legal teams.
- Establish and maintain a centralized, standardized Source of Truth (SSOT) by consolidating over 150 fragmented CRM resources to improve accessibility, enhance team efficiency, and enable easy search for current campaigns and results for the OneCRM team, while revolutionizing our existing central SoT for CRM to drive organizational effectiveness.
- Lead the end-to-end project management of key strategic, foundational, and highly cross-functional initiatives for the CRM organization.

**Basic Qualifications**

- 5+years of experience in Marketing Operations, Program Management, or Strategic Operations
- Bachelors Degree or commesurate work experience

**Preferred Qualifications**

- Large scale project management experience
- Exceptional ability to clearly and succinctly present complex information to diverse internal and external stakeholders.
- Highly persuasive and effective written and verbal communication skills, adept at navigating, influencing, and building consensus across various functions and teams to drive strategic initiatives.
- Prior experience working on global projects, or in an international setting
- Ability to foster collaboration and facilitate teamwork bringing key partners across functions together
- Demonstrated ability to juggle competing priorities
- Proven track record managing complex projects with multiple stakeholders, tight timelines, and evolving priorities
- High attention to detail and a bias toward action—able to prioritize ruthlessly, execute efficiently, and deliver on time
- Comfortable managing both strategy and execution—balancing big-picture vision with hands-on ownership of tools, workflows, and deliverables
- A self-starter who is organized, resourceful, and constantly looking for ways to optimize systems, improve visibility, and drive impact
- Experience managing external agencies is a plus
- Proven success in driving organizational efficiency through the effective management of documentation and cross-functional resources

jobs.title: Lead Product Manager, Uber AI Solutions
jobs.description:
**About the Role**

At Uber, our mission is to be the platform of choice for flexible earning opportunities, and we’re expanding that vision with Uber AI Solutions.

This is a new, fast-growing team within Uber, operating like a startup, and driven by a passionate, entrepreneurial team. Our goal is to connect businesses with high-quality, cost-effective knowledge work services, such as data labeling, annotation, AI training, translation, agentic simulation and evaluation.

Following initial success, we are now scaling globally and seeking an experienced Product Manager to contribute to the development of the next generation of AI products and tools that will be instrumental in helping us deliver high-quality, efficient, and timely AI training, evaluation and simulation data to our enterprise customers. This role is not just about building tools, but rather leveraging AI and ML to fundamentally rethink how data is created, evaluated, and scaled with consistency and precision. You'll lead the development of intelligent systems that improve data quality end-to-end, and pioneer new approaches to platform design, automation, and agentic workflows.

**What the Candidate Will Do**

- Own the strategy and execution for Uber AI Solutions AI products and tools that deliver high-quality data for our clients.
- Lead with data and customer empathy, blending quantitative insights with a deep understanding of foundational model and agentic AI developer needs to shape product direction.
- Collaborate cross-functionally with Data Science, Engineering, Operations, and Design to execute against an ambitious roadmap.
- Drive alignment across teams, ensuring strategic clarity and execution velocity on complex, cross-functional initiatives.
- Define clear, actionable product requirements, prioritizing initiatives based on impact, effort, and long-term value creation.

**Basic Qualifications**

- 7+ years of Product Management experience, including 2+ years in AI/ML start-ups or advanced AI product environments, across consumer and/or B2B products.
- Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Data Science, or a related technical field.
- **Technical Fluency:** Comfortable working side-by-side with senior ML researchers, infrastructure engineers, and data scientists. Able to translate vague or frontier scientific capabilities into user-facing value quickly and clearly. Engineering background + Coding experience.
- **Experience working directly with customers** – particularly enterprise – to uncover needs, run pilots, and prioritize solutions that can scale (not just one-off engineering efforts).
- **0→1 Product Building**: Hands-on experience taking a product (or significant product feature) from concept through launch to market adoption.
- **Ethical & Responsible AI Awareness**: Familiarity with frameworks for responsible AI development, including compliance, governance, and security considerations.

**Preferred Qualifications**

- Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Data Science, or a related technical field
- Strong product sense with a customer-first mindset and proven ability to translate real user needs into scalable, intuitive solutions.
- Bias to learn fast and operate effectively in technical, data-rich, and dynamic environments.
- Relentlessly high bar for product quality, cross-functional collaboration, and personal contribution.

For Sunnyvale, CA-based roles: The base salary range for this role is USD$216,000 per year - USD$240,000 per year.

Uber Advertising division spearheads the growth of our advertising business. By building a dedicated advertising organisation and a suite of advertising products, Uber Advertising will enable merchants and brands to reach and convert its highly engaged user base across its Mobility and Delivery platforms in 32 markets. You will own the ads sales strategy for a portfolio of top brands and drive adoption of a growing suite of ads offerings across our Mobility and Delivery platforms. You will work closely with our Partner Managers to consistently deliver on our partners’ marketing objectives.

jobs.title: Senior Account Executive - Groceries & Retail
jobs.description:
**About the Role**

At Uber, we ignite opportunity by setting the world in motion. We take on big problems to help drivers, riders, delivery partners, and users get what they want and go where they want in more than 10,000 cities around the world. We welcome people from all backgrounds who seek the opportunity to help build a future where everyone and everything can move independently. If you have the curiosity, passion, and collaborative spirit, work with us, and let’s move the world forward, together.

Uber Eats was launched in Portugal in November 2017 and is now the most downloaded Food Delivery App. We are available in 100+ cities, delivering from over 12,000 stores (restaurants and others) and growing quickly!

Until recently, we focused on bringing the best dishes from the local spots you love and the ones you’ve always wanted to try. Now we are scaling Grocery & Retail too, delivering the best of Portugal, right when users want it.

By joining the Uber Eats Grocery and Retail team you will play a pivotal role in shaping the future of commerce across Portugal. As an Account Executive, you'll be securing high-impact partners and expanding our marketplace. This isn't just a sales job, it's about creating a tangible impact on our platform and helping diverse businesses thrive.

You'll own the full sales lifecycle, from prospecting and pitching to negotiation and closing deals. We're looking for a motivated and resilient self-starter who excels at building long-term, strategic partnerships. You'll work cross-functionally with internal teams to craft winning proposals and ensure a seamless launch, all while acting as a strategic growth partner to our new merchants.

The right candidate will be customer-obsessed, results driven, with passion and grit, able to engage with all types of stakeholders, experienced in pitching and negotiating and able to leverage multiple levers (financial, strategic, operational) to build the strongest value proposition.

**What the Candidate Will Need / Bonus Points**

\-\-\-\- What the Candidate Will Do ----

1. **Sales Strategy & Processes:** Co-develop the sales strategy and necessary processes to scale up our acquisition efforts with the highest potential partnerships. Be proactive, creative, and entrepreneurial in looking for new growth or improvement opportunities for Uber and potential partners to work with.
2. **Own the full sales cycle** for Portugal, unlocking key retailers in high-growth verticals like Convenience, Pharma, Alcohol, and other strategic retail sectors
3. **Drive top-of-funnel activity** by creatively prospecting and pitching new businesses to build a robust pipeline
4. **Negotiate and close complex deals** with key stakeholders, guiding them through a multi-stage sales process
5. **Collaborate cross-functionally** with internal teams, including onboarding specialists, marketing, and operations, to ensure merchants have a strong launch and hit the ground running
6. **Act as a strategic partner** during the first twelve weeks, ensuring new merchants achieve early success and strong performance on the platform

\-\-\-\- Basic Qualifications ----

1. 5+ years of experience in a sales, business development, or commercial role, preferably within the retail sector
2. A proven track record of delivering sales targets and successfully managing complex sales cycle
3. A go-getter attitude with a strong sense of ownership and resilience
4. Exceptional communication and negotiation skills, with a consultative selling background focused on building long-term partnerships
5. Native in portuguese and fluent in english

\-\-\-\- Preferred Qualifications ----

1. Proficiency with CRM tools like Salesforce for pipeline management and reporting
2. Confident collaborating directly with managers of major businesses and ability to build strong working relationships with external partners.
3. Ability to define plans, processes and tools with a creative and constructive mindset, as well as minimal supervision, with detailed execution for large-scale projects (eg. launching new products / categories, onboarding retail partners) and then deliver them to plan regardless of any surprises or ambiguity along the way.

jobs.title: Director, GDX Global Standards
jobs.description:
**About the Role**

The Director of Global Standards leads Uber’s global effort to deliver consistent, high-quality customer and agent experiences by driving standardization, quality, and simplification across Customer Support technologies and operations.

As part of the Global Digital Experiences (GDX) leadership team, this leader acts as the bridge between CommOps and Customer Obsession Product team, ensuring that every support product and policy launched globally is reliable, scalable, and user-centered.

The Director of Global Standards will oversee a large, distributed organization spanning User Acceptance Testing, Usability, Product Evangelism, Global First Product Operations, and support policy Optimisation. Each of these programs plays a critical role in enabling Uber’s transition to tech-first, AI-powered customer support.

**What You’ll Do**

- Define and execute the Global Standards strategy that advances Uber’s vision to unlock transformative, global-first technology and operations for customer support through quality, standardization, and simplification
- Lead and coach senior managers and program leaders overseeing several specialized global programs:

  - **User Acceptance Testing:** Modernize Product Quality and Product Risk processes with automation and AI to ensure stable, high-quality launches
  - **Usability:** Drive user-centered design through scalable usability research and actionable insights
  - **Product Evangelism:** Accelerate adoption and awareness of customer support tech
  - **Global First Product Operations:** Enable rapid, high-quality global rollouts through process design and portfolio management
  - **Policy Optimisation:** Simplify, align, and govern tech-first and global-first support policies across markets, enabling automation and AI-readiness

- Lead and coach a large global team, including managers and program leads, fostering a culture of innovation, inclusion, and accountability
- Partner with Product and CommOps teams to ensure readiness, quality, and alignment on Product launches
- Champion data-driven decision-making and continuous improvement, ensuring measurable progress against operational and experience goals
- Represent Global Standards across leadership and cross-functional forums to elevate visibility, alignment, and strategic impact

**Basic Qualifications**

- 12+ years experience in tech operations, product operations, product management or equivalent
- Strong understanding of GenAI concepts and how to build platforms using Gen AI
- Strong understanding of customer support workflows and Product Development lifecycle and how data can enhance customer experience

**Preferred Qualifications**

- Proven experience driving global-scale transformation initiatives
- Deep understanding of process standardization, product operations, and customer support technology
- Deep understanding of User testing, Product marketing, customer support UX/UI and/or policy authoring in an AI world
- Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a track record of using data to drive decisions
- Strong executive presence
- Experience leading in tech-first or AI-driven environments

For San Francisco, CA-based roles: The base salary range for this role is USD$221,000 per year - USD$245,500 per year.

jobs.title: Program Manager II, Tech - Data Collection
jobs.description:
**About the Role**

We are building one of the most scalable, high-quality data collection engines powering the next generation of AI. Our projects span audio, image, video, LiDAR, text, and multimodal datasets, across dozens of countries and environments.

We are looking for a Program Manager to own and drive complex, multi-country data collection programs end-to-end.

This role is ideal for someone who has thrived in startup environments where speed, hustle, and creative problem-solving matter more than rigid process. You will manage diverse contributor networks, oversee global operations, and ensure datasets meet strict client standards and high quality, at scale.

**\-\-\-\- What You Will Do ----**

**Key Responsibilities**

1. **Program Management and Ownership:** Translate client SOWs into executable programs — scope, timelines, budgets, workforce model, and quality control frameworks.
2. **Execution Excellence:** Solve operational bottlenecks in real time — whether it’s participant churn, equipment issues, location access, or low-quality submissions - and ensure program delivery and success. Build processes, systems and playbooks that help scale data collection programs systemically
3. **Quality & Compliance:** Ensure data meets specs, surpasses accuracy thresholds, and complies with privacy/consent/data protection laws globally.
4. **Stakeholder Management:** Act as the program point of contact with clients, internal teams, and external vendors. Provide progress reports, risk assessments, and mitigation plans.
5. **Analytics & Reporting:** Monitor collection KPIs via dashboards, identify issues early, and drive corrective action.
6. **Continuous Improvement:** Codify learnings into playbooks and SOPs for repeatability and faster future deployments.

**Cross-functional collaboration and influence:** Influence our tech roadmap to build a world class data collection engine. Work with privacy, legal, ops and supply teams to unlock new use cases, markets and scale programs

**\-\-\-\- What You Will Need ----**

1. 8+ years Experience in program management or operations
2. Exposure to AI/ML data programs, sensors, or field data collection.
3. Multi-country operations experience
4. Proven track record managing large-scale distributed programs, ideally in data, logistics, field operations, or crowdsourcing.

\-\-\-\- Preferred Qualifications ----

1. Strong program management fundamentals — planning, governance, risk management.
2. Hands-on hustler who thrives in ambiguity and doesn’t wait for perfect instructions.
3. Exceptional stakeholder management — from C-level clients to field contributors.
4. Data-driven operator — comfortable with metrics, dashboards, and root-cause analysis.
5. Bias for action, resilience under pressure, and ability to work across cultures and geographies.

jobs.title: Sr. HR Business Partner - Delivery
locations: New York, New York, United States
jobs.description:
**About the Role**

Uber’s **People & Places (P&P)** team handles all things people-related so that our employees worldwide are empowered to do their best work. Our HR Business Partner (HRBP) organization partners closely with business leaders to enable their strategies, shape organizational effectiveness, and build high-performing teams.

As a **Senior HR Business Partner** for **Delivery Commercial Operations (DCO)** and **Global** **Strategy & Planning (S&P)**, you’ll support two critical groups that power Uber Delivery:

1. **DCO** drives sales operations, efficiency, and execution across global Delivery markets.
2. **S&P** sets the strategic agenda, allocates resources, and measures performance to ensure Delivery wins in a competitive landscape.

In this role, you’ll be a trusted partner to senior leaders, helping them design and scale high-impact organizations that drive growth, efficiency, and strategic clarity across Uber’s Delivery business worldwide.

**What You’ll Do:**

- **Strategic HR Partnership:** Partner with DCO and S&P senior leaders to shape business strategy through a people lens, ensuring teams are structured, resourced, and led to deliver impact at scale.
- **Organizational Design & Effectiveness:** Drive org design discussions that enhance alignment between strategy and execution. Evaluate operating models, governance, and cross-functional interfaces to improve efficiency and decision-making.
- **Leadership Development:** Coach senior leaders and their teams, strengthen leadership pipelines, and design succession strategies to support Uber’s long-term growth.
- **Change Leadership:** Guide leaders and employees through transformation, whether evolving sales ops models, centralizing processes, or shifting strategic focus. Anticipate global implications and ensure smooth adoption.
- **Data-Driven Insights:** Use people analytics and workforce data to diagnose organizational challenges, inform decision-making, and track progress against goals.
- **Program Integration:** Ensure HR programs (compensation, performance, talent development, etc.) are adopted effectively and tailored to the unique needs of DCO and S&P.
- **Culture & Engagement:** Champion Uber’s cultural values and build engagement strategies that drive belonging, performance, and inclusion in highly analytical and execution-focused teams.
- **Collaboration & Influence:** Navigate a complex matrix of stakeholders across Delivery, P&P, and cross-functional partners. Influence outcomes and priorities without direct control of resources.

**Basic Qualifications**

- 10+ years of either progressive HR or relevant business experience

**Preferred Qualifications**

- Proven ability to influence at senior levels and drive alignment across diverse stakeholders in a fast-paced, complex environment.
- Strong decision-making skills with the ability to balance multiple perspectives, manage trade-offs, and align leaders to effective, principle-based outcomes.
- Deep business acumen with demonstrated experience translating organizational goals into impactful people strategies.
- Track record of driving organizational design, leadership development, and workforce planning at scale.
- Solid understanding of global HR programs and practices, including compensation, performance management, and leadership development.
- Strong analytical capabilities and comfort using data to inform decisions.
- Knowledge of employment laws and their application across global contexts.
- High emotional intelligence, cultural awareness, and interpersonal maturity with a global mindset.
- Excellent communication and presentation skills with the ability to distill complexity into clear, actionable insights.
- Experience in technology or platform businesses, ideally with a global scope and exposure to marketplace dynamics.

jobs.title: Sr Global Customer Success Manager, Global Delivery Partnerships?
locations: New York, New York, United States
jobs.description:
**About the Role**

The Uber Direct team is seeking a sharp, highly motivated individual to join our Global Delivery Partnerships team, focused on managing and expanding relationships with major global restaurant partners, including brands such as McDonald’s, Domino’s, Yum! Brands, RBI, and others. As a Customer Success Manager, you will have a client-facing role, driving partnership growth and operational excellence across key accounts. You will collaborate cross-functionally with Partner Engineering, Operations, Product, Marketing, and Territory teams to optimize performance and deliver meaningful value for both Uber and its partners.

Who are we looking for? Someone who has shown success in building best-in-class partnerships with complex brands and developing deep executive-level relationships. Our ideal candidate is passionate about logistics and Uber and thrives in a fast-paced, cross-functional environment. Uber Direct is a technical API-based product, so the ideal candidate is someone who’d be looking to grow their technical skills.

**What You Will Do**

- Onboard new brands using Uber Direct. Understand recommendations for API or aggregator launches.
- Focus on operational success, using internal data and our reliability team to identify insights and actions to improve delivery timeliness and completion rates.
- Build relationships with C-level executives and key decision makers within partner organizations.
- Develop and complete the partnership strategy to achieve quarterly growth goals.
- Bring your analytical A-game. Develop business models and analyses to understand trends, provide meaningful insights, and track the impact of initiatives against our goals.
- Handle the big picture and the tiny details. You are organized, timely and ensure nothing gets missed; you are also attuned to high-level strategy and consistently come up with new ways to contribute to existing partnerships.
- Partner with cross-functional teams. Be the voice of the customer and effectively navigate internal processes with partners from various teams, such as Product, Marketing, Operations, Legal, Finance, etc.
- Expand product adoption. Clearly communicate the value of our newest products with a lens of creativity to differentiate our offerings.
- Drive initiatives. You will lead and support key initiatives across our team to drive growth for our restaurant partners at scale. This involves wearing many hats and jumping in to help your teammates when the needs arise.
- Employ critical thinking and creative problem-solving skills to navigate relationships and difficult partner conversations.

**Basic Qualifications**

- Minimum of 5 years of full-time professional experience in a client-facing role working with a large enterprise and/or mid-market brands.

**Preferred Qualifications**

- Proven success engaging with large, complex enterprise organizations and global brands.
- Combines analytical rigor with executive presence to translate data into clear narratives that drive alignment and informed decision-making among senior stakeholders
- Strong customer advocacy mindset, with the ability to translate customer insights into actionable internal initiatives
- Track record of designing and executing strategic sales plans that deliver measurable results
- Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience

jobs.title: Scientist II, Earner Experience
locations: New York, New York, United States
jobs.location: New York, New York, United States
jobs.description:
**About the Role**

The Earner org is responsible for the products and programs that make earning through the Uber marketplace a rewarding experience. As a Scientist, you will leverage your expertise in economics, operations, machine learning, and statistical modeling to improve the efficiency of our platform and help direct the development of our products.

**What the Candidate Will Need / Bonus Points**

- Develop creative solutions and build prototypes to business problems using algorithms based on machine learning, statistics, and optimization, and work with engineering/product to productionize those algorithms and create impact in production.
- Drive clarity and solve ambiguous, challenging business problems using data-driven approaches.
- Propose and guide the framework of data analysis to drive business insight and facilitate decisions. Establish standard methodologies for data science including modeling, coding, analytics, and experimentation.
- Leverage data to understand product performance and to identify improvement opportunities.
- Design product experiments and interpret the results to draw detailed and impactful conclusions.
- Communicate with senior management and multi-functional teams.
- Provide recommendations to assist quick product ideation and feature launch decisions.
- Build intelligent data-driven products to provide the best user experience.

**Basic Qualifications**

- 2+ years of industry experience in data science, analytics, or a related quantitative role.
- Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative field (e.g., Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, Engineering, Operations Research).
- Proficiency in SQL and a programming language like Python or R for complex data manipulation and analysis.
- Demonstrated experience designing and analyzing large-scale A/B experiments.
- Proven ability to lead projects, work autonomously, and navigate ambiguity.

**Preferred Qualifications**

- M.S. or Ph.D. in a quantitative field (e.g., Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, Engineering, Operations Research).
- Deep expertise in advanced statistical techniques, including causal inference, quasi-experimental methods, and predictive modeling.
- A track record of successfully influencing product strategy and driving business outcomes through data on a consumer app.

For New York, NY-based roles: The base salary range for this role is USD$155,000 per year - USD$172,000 per year.

jobs.title: Senior Channel Sales Partner Manager
jobs.description:
**#Greatmindsdontthinkalike** Thank you for your interest in a job opportunity at Uber Japan! We take pride in our diversity and working environment that sees you as more than just a person that can do the job, but an outstanding individual that can level up our organization with a perspective only you can offer. Uber provides an equal opportunity to encourage all employees to share their thoughts.

## **About the Team**

Restaurants are at the heart of Uber Eats, and Japan’s dynamic, diverse, and high-quality restaurant scene is one of the strongest contributors to our global business. The Japan Acquisition team plays a pivotal role in scaling Uber Eats’ footprint, particularly in a highly competitive and nuanced market. Our mission: to identify, pitch, and onboard high-potential restaurants that will thrive on our platform and delight customers across Japan. This is your chance to help shape the next phase of growth in one of Uber’s most strategic markets.

As we enter the next chapter of growth, launching and scaling in new cities across Japan is critical to unlocking further potential. The Market Expansion team plays a foundational role, identifying untapped geographies, activating them with precision, and building long-term local success. This is your opportunity to lead one of the highest-priority growth areas for Uber Eats Japan.

**About the Role**

Channel Sales is one of the biggest bets in Eats Japan Sales Org. We need a very strong leader who is able to make the bet be reality! Our team is seeking an experienced senior sales leader to lead our Channel Sales team for Uber Eats in Japan.

This role is responsible for building and driving the strategy for the Channel Sales, managing existing Channel Sales Partners (CSP), and leading the Channel Sales teams to contribute to the Eats Japan business growth.

**Your Impact in the Role**

1. Work with senior sales leadership to drive the sales strategy and growth for the Uber Eats business in Japan.
2. Provide management and leadership for the Channel Sales Team.
3. Build the future of the Channel Sales function in Japan by expanding the Channel sales partners, developing the effective incentive structure, optimizing the sales operational process and building the highly competitive channel sales teams.
4. Meet or exceed monthly team revenue quotas. Implement strategic territory forecasting and planning. Excel in hands-on training, coaching and development of your team
5. Recruit, interview and hire prospective team members. Develop a high-performing team culture

**The Experience You'll Bring**

1. At least 5+ years of experience with managing strategic sales partners, vendors, or enterprise accounts with the goal of driving sales and growth.
2. Leadership experience managing a small to medium size sales team.
3. Data-driven decision-making mentality and commercial judgment.
4. High adaptability to change and ability to execute quickly
5. Japanese and English fluency

**Preferred Qualifications**

Experience of managing Channel Sales Partners (営業代理店マネジメント)

jobs.title: Safety Investigation Specialist I - Dutch Speaker
jobs.description:
**About The Role**

As a Safety Investigations agent, you will work efficiently and optimally through our most critical incidents to drive top results in customer service, accuracy and timely case resolution. Investigators will work closely with our internal customers - Communications, Trust & Safety, Insurance and Legal - to coordinate and facilitate case resolution according to support logic for high severity incidents while balancing external customer service, communications, expectations and demands.

**What You Will Do**

1\. Respond to high volume, live queue of sensitive incident inbound cases and/or outbound queues

2\. Report & document issues with reporting parties using various platforms

3\. Master multiple knowledge bases and contact management systems

4\. S1+ under direct supervision, reviews incoming urgent and critical incidents and acts as a first responder in a reported incident

5\. Respond to driver-partners, riders, eaters, couriers, claimants, third parties, and stakeholders related to incidents/accidents that occur in connection with the platform

6\. Appropriately support reporting parties, ask thorough questions in order to sufficiently understand the details of the incident, establish an empathetic relationship, and ensure thorough documentation of the conversation

7\. Categorize incidents/accidents with appropriate contact types for the Special Investigations Unit to further investigate

**Basic Qualifications**

1\. Proficiency in Dutch and English is required

2\. Strong EQ, emotional regulation, communication, problem-solving, and critical thinking skills

3\. A minimum of 6 months of customer support experience handling sensitive issues. Crisis center, law enforcement or social work experience.

4\. Availability to work in rotating shifts from Monday to Sunday (essential)

5\. Strong sense of responsibility, demonstrating reliability, integrity, and a commitment to maintaining high standards of professionalism in all aspects of work

6\. Executional excellence

**Preferred Qualifications**

1\. Safety experience

2\. Crisis center, law enforcement or social work experience

jobs.title: Product Designer II - Payments Experience
jobs.description:
**About the role**

Payments are fundamental to Uber's global operation across every line of business, from a rider's fare in Paris to a courier's payout in São Paulo. This is high-stakes design work where you build user trust and reduce complexity within a global financial ecosystem, a core tenet of our mission to move the real world.

You will join a hands-on, international team in our Amsterdam tech center, responsible for the end-to-end Payments experience on both Earner and Consumer platforms. Navigating ambiguous technical and regulatory constraints is the norm here, offering depth for continuous growth and impact that directly influences millions of users daily.

**What you’ll do**

- Design and ship secure, highly usable end-to-end payment and account experiences across all Uber apps (Rides, Eats, Freight, etc.).

- Translate complex platform requirements and regulatory constraints into simple, elegant design solutions that seamlessly integrate into the user journey.

- Drive cross-functional alignment by acting as the design domain expert, patiently negotiating trade-offs between speed, user value, and technical capacity.

- Define a coherent design vision and strategy for new payment features, translating ambiguous problem statements into clear execution plans.

- Harness raw user data, including UX research insights and quantitative metrics, to validate hypotheses and relentlessly iterate on design improvements.

- Elevate the standard for design quality across the entire Payments organization by implementing and advocating for our design language and systematic reusable components.


**Basic qualifications**

- Minimum 4 years of professional product design experience in high-growth, technically complex environments.

- A portfolio demonstrating high-quality visual and interaction design work for consumer-facing mobile applications.

- Expert proficiency (4+ years of hands-on experience) with modern design and prototyping tools, including Figma.

- Proven experience applying a systematic approach to design, focusing on reusable components and defining architecture.


**Preferred qualifications**

- Experience designing for financial products, payments, or other highly regulated industries, navigating the tension between compliance and user experience.

- Demonstrated ability to craft product strategy and thrive in situations defined by high ambiguity and shifting technical priorities.

- A track record of shipping measurable and complex design improvements that visibly reduce user friction for a global user base.

- Experience collaborating directly with engineering and data science partners in rigorous experimentation frameworks (e.g., A/B testing).
