Global Payments Operations & Insights is at the forefront of unifying how Uber delivers Payments support to customers and agents globally. The team’s mission is to build a consistent, reliable, and cost-efficient operational ecosystem that empowers agents to deliver world-class support experiences while maintaining operational rigor and scalability.

jobs.title: Sales Manager, Uber for Business
jobs.description:
**About the Role**

This is a unique opportunity to lead the Mid-Market and SMB Sales Teams at Uber for Business in Argentina. We’re looking for creative thinkers, strategic builders, and inspiring sales leaders who are passionate about growing high-performing teams and helping businesses thrive in fast-scaling markets.

As Head of Mid-Market & SMB Sales, you will play a key role in driving growth in one of our most dynamic and rapidly evolving regions. You’ll be responsible for shaping the commercial strategy, supporting and developing your team, and delivering strong business results through the acquisition and expansion of customers.

This is a hybrid role - our team collaborates in-person out of our incredible office in Buenos Aires 3 days/week. We encourage our employees to work from our office on additional days if they desire to do so.

**What you'll do**

- Lead, inspire, and develop a high-performing sales team, helping them reach their full potential.
- Set clear goals and guide the team to achieve outstanding monthly, quarterly, and annual results.
- Drive revenue growth by building strong relationships, identifying opportunities, and closing new business partnerships.
- Collaborate with sales operations to improve processes, increase efficiency, and strengthen data accuracy.
- Design and implement a sales playbook that supports scalable growth and helps train a growing team.
- Balance short-term priorities with long-term strategy, ensuring sustainable success.
- Share insights and best practices with cross-functional teams and other markets.
- Understand client needs, provide tailored solutions, and clearly communicate the value that Uber for Business brings to their operations.

- 6+ years of B2B sales experience, ideally in SaaS or leading successful sales teams.
- Proven track record of exceeding revenue targets and driving business growth.
- Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to understand diverse customer needs and deliver effective solutions.
- Strong analytical mindset and the ability to make data-driven decisions.
- A proactive, adaptable, and positive approach in dynamic and fast-paced environments.
- Exceptional organizational skills and the ability to manage multiple priorities effectively.

**Bonus points**

- Background in SaaS, mobility, or platform-based B2B sales.
- Experience managing complex, multi-stakeholder sales cycles.
- Passion for building strong partnerships and helping businesses grow through technology-driven solutions.

jobs.title: Strategy & Analytics Manager, Uber Direct UK
jobs.description:
## **About the role and team**

This role is for a Strategy & Analytics Manager on the Uber Direct team, a fast-growing business that enables merchants across the UK to offer seamless delivery to their customers. You will solve complex, real-time logistics problems across the delivery marketplace—like optimizing courier assignment, improving batching algorithms, and balancing real-time demand and supply—all while ensuring a best-in-class experience for both our merchant partners and couriers.

The work sits squarely at the intersection of data, strategy, and execution, requiring you to not only diagnose operational performance using data but also to design and drive solutions end-to-end. You will succeed here if you thrive in ambiguity, take full ownership of measurable outcomes, and are energized by the challenge of making hard trade-offs that improve the unit economics of a massive, real-world operation.

## **What you’ll do**

- Drive measurable improvements in key operational metrics (e.g., delivery time, courier utilization, cost efficiency) by using large datasets to identify root causes and build scalable frameworks for optimization.

- Lead complex, cross-functional projects from analysis and strategy design through pilot, execution, and final scale, maintaining alignment across Product, Engineering, Commercial, and Legal teams.

- Shape the product roadmap by translating specific merchant and courier pain points and UK market needs into prioritized features and process changes that enhance platform efficiency and product-market fit.

- Partner with our Commercial teams to strengthen Uber Direct's value proposition across Food, Grocery, and Retail, identifying new merchant needs and co-creating operational solutions to unlock growth.

- Own the end-to-end performance of delivery processes, making clear, data-informed trade-offs under pressure and demonstrating adaptability as market dynamics and priorities shift quickly.


## **Basic qualifications**

- Possess a minimum of 3+ years of professional experience in an analytical or operations-focused role (e.g., Data Analytics, Management Consulting, or Tech Operations).

- Advanced proficiency in SQL with a minimum of 2+ years of demonstrated experience querying and analyzing large, complex datasets to diagnose business performance.

- Proven track record of translating data-driven insights into actionable business strategies and leading those initiatives end-to-end from strategy development to final execution.

- Exceptional written and verbal communication skills, including the ability to influence cross-functional stakeholders and clearly present data-backed recommendations to leadership.

- Demonstrated ability to structure ambiguous problems and apply strong business acumen to make decisions that balance immediate needs with long-term operational health.


## Preferred qualifications

- Industry experience in on-demand delivery, logistics, or managing marketplace operations at scale.

- Proficiency in advanced analytical languages (e.g., Python or R) for complex modeling, simulation, or data manipulation.

- Experience in designing, running, and rigorously analyzing A/B or multivariate tests to validate hypotheses and measure initiative impact.

- Demonstrated ability to manage competing priorities in a fast-paced environment while maintaining strategic focus and a bias toward action.

jobs.title: Staff Machine Learning Engineer
locations: New York, New York, United States
jobs.location: New York, New York, United States
jobs.description:
**About the Role**

Have you ever ordered a car service on Uber, and when the ride arrives, wondered how it got to you so fast? Ever ordered food on UberEats and wondered where the driver was before receiving your order and how long it took to get to the restaurant or if your order was ready when the courier arrived? Ever wondered why your grocery delivery from Uber always has the best apple picked?

If so, Uber is for you. In our Sciences division, we strive to make magic within Uber’s marketplace. This requires judgment to make difficult trade-offs, blending algorithms with human resourcefulness, and the ability to build simplicity from complexity. When we get the balance right for everyone, Uber magic happens. We build systems to peer into the future to craft the most cost-efficient marketplace for matching supply and demand. We are passionate about using innovative economics, machine learning, and scalable distributed software that automates and optimizes every aspect of this intricate dance between participants of the marketplace.

We are involved in every stage of the product development cycle and use data to inform product decisions, build models to power our solutions, and also develop platform tools that are used across teams with a primary focus on Mobility and Delivery. We work with millions of earners across the globe to make this magic happen and want you to join us!

**About the Team**

Earners (drivers and couriers) are an integral part of Uber’s multi-sided marketplace. They provide the time and the means to move people and things. Importantly, they enable the connection between the physical and digital world to make the movement happen at the push of a button for everyone, everywhere.

Within Uber, Earner Growth plays a critical role in earners’ journey as the team is responsible for earner onboarding, activation, early life cycle, and resurrection. This presents the teams with the opportunity to shape and tailor the product experience during earners’ many firsts (i.e., first time interacting on the Uber platform, choosing the earning opportunity, going online, receiving incentive offers, completing a trip, or reading the earnings summary). These firsts can be daunting.

Therefore, making sure that the earner journey is great at every touch point is important to build trust with Earners, communicate Uber’s value proposition, and ensure each firsts to be a great experience.

**What You Will Do**

- Build statistical, optimization, and machine learning models
- Develop innovative new earner incentives that earners for choosing our network and optimizing Uber’s new earner incentives spend
- Optimize Uber’s background check spend and onboarding funnel
- Design recommendation engines to recommend the most relevant earning opportunities and early lifecycle content
- Develop matching algorithms for driver to driver mentorship program
- Model and predict earner behaviors to improve earner experience throughout the onboarding funnel
- The team employs a variety of ML/AI techniques, spanning from causal ML meta learners, supervised ML, RL multi-armed bandits, genAI LLM to deep learning embeddings to build impactful data products.
- Work closely with multi-functional leads to develop technical vision, new methodological approaches, and drive team direction.
- Collaborate with cross-functional teams such as product, engineering, operations, and marketing to drive ML system development end-to-end from conceptualization to final product.

**Basic Qualifications**

- Masters or PhD or equivalent experience in Computer Science, Machine Learning, Operations Research, Statistics, or other related quantitative fields or related field
- 7 years minimum of industry experience as a Machine Learning Engineer/Research Scientist with a strong focus on deep learning and probabilistic modeling.
- Proficiency in multiple object-oriented programming languages (e.g. Python, Go, Java, C++).
- Experience with any of the following: Spark, Hive, Kafka, Cassandra.
- Experience building and productionizing innovative end-to-end Machine Learning systems.
- Experience in exploratory data analysis, statistical modeling, hypothesis testing, and experimental design.
- Experience working with cross-functional teams(product, science, product ops etc).

**Preferred Qualifications**

- 8+ years of industry experience in machine learning, including building and deploying ML models.
- Publications at industry recognized ML conferences.
- Experience in modern deep learning architectures and probabilistic modeling.
- Experience with optimization techniques, including reinforcement learning (RL), Bayesian methods, causal ML meta learners, genAI LLM.
- Expertise in the design and architecture of ML systems and workflows.

Are you seeking an opportunity to have an impact, innovate through your problem solving, and grow professionally? In this role you will take ownership of building new business pipeline, forecasting opportunities and constructing territory and account plans to achieve your quota.

As an Account Coordinator you will play a key role in ensuring business success by supporting both **merchants** and **internal account teams** with setup and admin tasks, documentation, reporting and data analysis, among other activities.

### **What You Will Do:**

1. **Assisting merchants** with setup, administrative tasks, and operational support to ensure smooth onboarding and ongoing success.
2. **Providing support to Client Partners and Account Managers** with documentation, reporting, and data analysis.

jobs.title: Staff Software Engineer
jobs.description:
**About the Role**

Uber aims to help earners make a sustainable living via the platform, and so aside from trip earnings, we have multiple Benefits programs live globally to help earners retain working flexibility while earning per industry standards. As part of the Earner Benefits team, you will have direct responsibility to build and launch new earner benefits in the target marketplaces. You will take ownership of key features and initiatives in designing and building high quality, scalable systems to issue earner payments in an accurate and timely manner. Your work will directly impact the lives of Uber’s partners (drivers, couriers) and operations teams across the globe.

**What the Candidate Will Need / Bonus Points**

\-\-\-\- What the Candidate Will Do ----

1. Build platform components and capabilities for high-throughput distributed systems. GoLang is our primary programming language.
2. Solve challenging problems with simple and elegant solutions, leveraging software design and architecture fundamentals.
3. Owns/Drives the tech architectural vision of the product.
4. Oversee and review all the designs from the team, and ensure high high-quality bar.
5. Drive adoption of best practices in code health, testing, and maintainability.
6. Focus on operational excellence of the systems by improving the ability to observe, monitor, control and improve the health of the systems, including the team's on-call experience.
7. Work with smart and motivated teammates in a fast-paced, collaborative environment.
8. Serve as a resource for the team to connect them with broader engineering directions and initiatives.
9. Collaborates effectively with stakeholders, including Product, Operations, Data Science and other dependent engineering teams to deliver business goals and needs.

\-\-\-\- Basic Qualifications ----

1. 10+ years of experience as a software engineer and building large-scale distributed systems
2. Coding chops, clean, elegant, bug-free code in languages like Java, GO
3. Must have led teams of engineers to deliver autonomously on large cross-functionally driven projects
4. Skilled at architecture: Solid understanding of distributed systems architecture - consensus, convergence, data consistency, and performance/efficiency constructs
5. Strong desire to learn and grow, while building the best-in-class systems
6. Experienced at Cross-Team Communication: Strong flair for effective communication and collaboration - you know when to push on and when to step back. We work closely with several groups, and supporting these other groups is a key part of scaling our business.
7. Push the bar on engineering best practices and help leadership build a strong engineering culture
8. Passionate about helping teams grow by inspiring and mentoring engineers.
9. Ability to identify and resolve performance and scalability issues

\-\-\-\- Preferred Qualifications ----

1. You have prior experience working as a full-stack engineer, including frontend, backend, and databases.
2. Background in building high-performance, scalable distributed systems.
3. Have a proven track record working with/across multiple teams and influenced them.
4. Experience with Spark SQL and Presto Querying language is a Plus.

jobs.title: Sr Operations Manager, Global Merchant Ops, Retail
jobs.description:
**About the Role**

Uber is transforming the future of grocery and retail by building the world’s most reliable and expansive marketplace for on-demand delivery of local commerce. As part of the Global Merchant Operations team for Grocery & Retail (GR), you will help ensure an exceptional experience for the merchants who partner with Uber. You will support their growth and help deliver a best-in-class experience to customers.

In this role, you will collaborate closely with local operations and commercial teams worldwide, as well as GR leadership and product development teams. You will lead projects focused on strengthening our platform for merchants—continuously improving Uber’s processes, programs, and products to help them succeed.

We are looking for someone who brings strong analytical skills, strategic thinking, stakeholder management, collaboration, and operational excellence. Our environment moves quickly, so adaptability and the ability to balance long-term initiatives with shorter, high-impact improvements are essential.

Please submit your application in English.

### What You Will Do

- Deliver an exceptional merchant experience: Drive improvements to Uber’s product solutions, ensuring they continually enhance the experience of merchants partnering with Uber Eats.

- Conduct complex analysis: Perform deep data analyses and strategic reviews to uncover opportunities for improvement. Work across multiple product areas, stakeholders, and data sources to ensure our platform and deliveries meet high standards—and to identify ways to elevate them further.

- Shape strategy and communicate insights: Translate business trends and analytical findings into clear, actionable recommendations for leadership and cross-functional teams.

- Lead project management: Oversee long-term projects and product initiatives that strengthen the merchant experience on the Uber platform.

- Manage stakeholders: Build alignment across leadership, product, legal, operations, and commercial teams. Use data-driven insights to guide decisions and influence outcomes.

- Collaborate across functions: Develop strong relationships across the organization and partner closely with local operations, business development, product teams, and more.


### What You'll Need

### Basic Qualifications

- At least 4 years of experience in strategy, operations, finance, consulting, or a related field

- Bachelor’s degree in business, economics, engineering, or a related field

- Advanced English skills are required
- Strong analytical and problem-solving skills

- Experience managing and influencing cross-functional stakeholders

- Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to engage both technical and non-technical audiences

- Proficiency in Excel/Google Sheets and data analysis

- Intermediate to advanced SQL skills


### Preferred Qualifications

- Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in business, economics, engineering, or a related field

- Experience in the grocery and/or retail industry

- Experience working with product teams

jobs.title: Sr. Strategic Sourcing Analyst - Spend Analytics & AI Solutions
jobs.description:
_**This is a hybrid role and you must be located in, or willing to relocate to, San Francisco for the position.**_

**About the Role**

We are seeking a Senior Analyst - Spend Analytics & AI Solutions to join the Sourcing COE team. This is a high-impact role that combines spend analytics, data visualization, and automation with emerging AI/LLM capabilities. You will extract and analyze data from ERP systems, design executive-ready dashboards, and identify cost-saving opportunities while experimenting with AI-driven solutions to enhance efficiency and collaboration.

**What You’ll Do**

- Extract and analyze spend data from Oracle and ERP systems to identify trends, risks, and savings opportunities.
- Experience establishing data quality standards, monitoring data traceability, and implementing governance practices for core procurement datasets.
- Build and maintain Tableau/Power BI dashboards to deliver real-time, decision-ready insights.
- Run ETL processes and automation to ensure accurate, efficient data workflows.
- Apply advanced analytics (categorization, forecasting, Savings Opportunities, Price benchmarking).
- Design prompts, test LLM models, and deploy AI agents/chatbots to support Sourcing operations.
- Collaborate with cross-functional teams to translate analytics into business strategies.
- Document processes, create training guides, and share best practices.
- Continuously explore new tools and technologies (AI, cloud platforms, automation)

**Basic Qualifications**

- Bachelor’s or Master’s in Engineering, Data Analytics, Finance, Supply Chain, Computer Science, or related field.
- 4+ years of experience in spend, procurement, or financial analytics, with exposure to AI/ML.

**Preferred Qualifications**

**Analytical & Technical Skills**

- Strong SQL expertise and ERP data extraction (Oracle, SAP, Coupa)
- Advanced proficiency in Tableau/Power BI for dashboarding
- Experience in ETL operations, data cleansing, and integration
- Proficiency in Excel and Google Sheets automation
- Strong understanding of spend categorization, cost-saving analysis, supplier performance, and compliance

**AI & Prompt Engineering Skills**

- Proficiency in Python for analytics, ML, and API integration
- Experience with prompt engineering and system design for LLMs (CustomGPT, Gemini, OpenAI/GPT)
- Familiarity with AI model evaluation (accuracy, grounding, hallucination rate)
- Exposure to AI agent development and cloud AI platforms (GCP, Azure, AWS)

For San Francisco, CA-based roles: The base salary range for this role is USD$133,000 per year - USD$148,000 per year.

jobs.title: Senior Commercial Account Manager, Enterprise Mid-Market
jobs.description:
**About the Role**

As an Account Manager in the Enterprise Mid Market team, you will be responsible for driving Uber Eats' long-term commercial relationships with some of our fastest growing enterprise partnerships for Uber Eats across the UK. Working with the likes of Poke House, Tonkotsu, Shake Shack and Ole & Steen. You will help these brands to grow their business sustainably whilst delivering the best experience to our users, with the goal of making Uber Eats their most loved delivery platform.

This role calls for a combination of relationship management, business strategy, commercial negotiations and operational excellence. You should be comfortable in an "all hands on deck" environment, love solving problems, thrive in a startup culture, and above all be passionate about our restaurant partners.

**What you'll do**

- **Commercial Management:** Lead commercial discussions with enterprise partners to build sustainable long-term partnerships.
- **Growth**: Develop plans in conjunction with your partners to grow their business through adding locations, experimenting with new business models (e.g. Uber Direct) or growing same-location sales (e.g. effective marketing, menu optimisation).
- **Operational Improvement:** Drive forward operational improvement with your partners to ensure that together we are delivering the best experience to Uber Eats users - whether that’s making sure they received what they ordered, or they’re receiving it when they expect it.
- **Analysis:** Quantify everything you do. Utilise data-driven decision making to understand the performance of initiatives to ensure you are optimally prioritising those with the highest return on investment.
- **Build tools and processes:** Use your analytical ability combined with operational difficulty to build tools and processes to drive forward partnership KPIs.
- **Partner with internal teams:** Work closely with stakeholders in internal teams both in the UK and globally (e.g. Product, Support, Courier Operations) to solve problems and ensure that feedback received is utilised in improving our product and operations.

**What you'll need**

- At least 3 years of experience in account management or a relevant commercial role
- Previous customer-facing experience at executive levels and have a track record of outperforming metrics-based business goals
- Ability to fuse business, strategy, finance, and legal concepts to lead complex, multifaceted deals.
- A strong background with data and data analysis, making data-led decisions and using sound business judgement
- Great project management experience to develop detailed joint business plans with enterprise partners and consistently deliver above expectations
- Strong executive presence and communication skills (verbal and written)
- Speed, resourcefulness, and go-getter attitude. This team moves fast and always operates in new spaces
- Willingness to hustle, roll up sleeves, and get in the weeds with our highest value partners!

jobs.title: Designer, US&C
jobs.description:
**About the Role**

We’re looking for a conceptual, hands-on designer who brings ideas to life with precision and craft. You should be comfortable fluidly moving between idea and execution. This role focuses on executing and designing deliverables across campaign, CRM, and digital surfaces, transforming creative concepts into high-quality, on-brand executions. This role will blend art direction and design craft, supporting campaign and brand initiatives from concept through delivery.

You’ll collaborate closely with art directors, senior designers, and marketing partners to ensure that every piece of work, from layouts to toolkits, reflects the Uber brand at its best. This designer is a doer and maker who takes pride in craft, consistency, and thoughtful design systems.

**About the Team**

The Creative Team at Uber is charged with boldly connecting our business with our users. Creative excellence is the measure of our success. No matter how large or small the project, we apply our craft with diligence and heart. Across every campaign. Every illustration. Every playbook. Every email. We know that technology isn’t what defines Uber. It is humanity that fuels our platform, allowing us to transcend the cold, impersonal and generic to weave compelling narratives for all our users. Leveraging embedded brand expertise, defined processes, and scalable tools and solutions, we dynamically turn around ideas and deliver with efficiency and speed. We are a global team with a headquarters in San Francisco, CA and teams in NY and Amsterdam.

**What You Will Do**

1. Partner with senior designers and art directors to develop and execute conceptual ideas that ladder up to larger brand or campaign platforms.
2. Design and adapt creative across integrated channels, including digital, CRM, social, and experiential touchpoints.
3. Support in crafting visual systems, toolkits, and design guidelines that ensure consistency and scalability.
4. Participate in brainstorming and creative development sessions, bringing strong visual instincts and cultural awareness.
5. Translate creative direction into high-craft executions, maintaining attention to detail in every deliverable.
6. Assist with production design tasks, including versioning, resizing, and prepping files for delivery, ensuring all outputs are brand-accurate and pixel-perfect.
7. Present work clearly and confidently to creative leads and cross-functional partners.
8. Help maintain and evolve the Uber brand through consistent design application and fresh creative thinking.

**Basic Qualifications**

1. 2+ years experience as a designer or art director for an advertising agency or in-house for a global brand

**Preferred Qualifications**

01. Experience in campaign creative
02. Strong visual sensibility with the ability to concept, design, and execute across mediums.
03. Expertise in Figma and Adobe suite application expertise (motion or 3D experience a plus)
04. Ability to balance conceptual work with production-ready deliverables.
05. Organized, pixel-perfect attention to detail, and able to work quickly under tight timelines.
06. Strong understanding of typography, composition, color, and digital design systems.
07. Understand how to follow brand guidelines and work within a design system
08. Ability to design according to business and technical requirements and comfort with ambiguity and changes in direction
09. Portfolio of beautiful, compelling digital and brand oriented work
10. Fluency extending ideas above and below the line (ATL, BTL)
11. Experience designing for different audiences (B2B, consumer)
12. Experience supporting toolkit development or scalable design systems for regional teams.
13. Experience working on integrated brand or campaign work, with exposure to art direction or photo/video production.
14. Understanding of how to scale ideas for global deliverables
15. Experience in digital marketing (Email, in-app, SMS/PUSH, paid social and display channels) best practices
16. Degree in design, communications, marketing, advertising; or equivalent
17. Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment, and pivot quickly when needed
18. Familiarity with Google Docs and Slides

For San Francisco, CA-based roles: The base salary range for this role is USD$104,000 per year - USD$115,500 per year.

jobs.title: Sr Customer Success Manager - Uber Direct, France
jobs.description:
**About the Role**

As a Senior Customer Success Manager for Uber Direct in France, you will own a portfolio of strategic and complex partners, driving their growth and ensuring operational excellence across their delivery programs. You will tackle advanced commercial, operational, and integration challenges, working closely with local and global stakeholders to deliver scalable, high-impact solutions.

Beyond managing your portfolio, you will play a key role in shaping how Uber Direct operates in France - leading cross-functional initiatives that improve team processes, enhance partner experience, and strengthen execution across the business. You’ll mentor new team members, contribute to onboarding playbooks, and help define best practices to scale our customer success approach.

You’ll collaborate daily with cross-functional teams (Product, Operations, Finance, Legal, Compliance, and Eats counterparts) to ensure that Uber Direct provides a seamless and reliable delivery experience for our partners and their customers.

**What You Will Do**

As a Uber Direct Senior Customer Success Manager, be a strategic partner to the Uber Direct team, to support the growth of the French business:

- **Manage a portfolio of strategic and complex partners**– Build long-term relationships and act as a trusted advisor to merchants with advanced operational or governance models. Collaborate closely with Uber Eats and other internal teams to ensure a coordinated and effective approach across shared stakeholders.
- **Build long-term relationships with Uber Direct customers** \- Develop meaningful and long-lasting relationships with key partners by focusing on building trust and crafting successful joint business plans.
- **Onboard new merchants** \- Be the project manager for merchants technical integration and operational onboarding on Uber Direct. From integration requirements specification to onboarding execution, be responsible for the go-live of new merchants with Uber Direct.
- **Monitor the activity and analyze data**\- Perform a broad range of financial, quantitative, and qualitative analyses to continuously improve the reliability of the orders and capture additional value. Look for ways to achieve and exceed monthly goals (financial and qualitative). Present and report key results to partners, internally and externally
- **Improve Uber Direct operations -** Identify opportunities for improving our operations for merchants, couriers and end-consumers. Analyze the data in detail to come up with initiatives that will have the greatest impact. Have a pragmatic and hands-on approach to implement quick wins while building more sustainable solutions.
- **Promote Uber Direct value proposition** \- Clearly understand and communicate the value of Uber Direct to Enterprise Accounts. Seek and achieve logistics, same-day delivery, delivery as a service industry knowledge to have enriching conversations with Enterprise Accounts. Look for ways to grow our business within existing accounts.
- **Contribute to Uber Direct offering improvement**\- Act as an ambassador of Uber's mission, brand, and product - being a problem solver for partners and team. Identify ways to develop further Uber Direct offering to answer partner’s needs.
- **Lead transversal initiatives within the CSM team** – Take ownership of key projects that improve internal processes, documentation, and knowledge sharing. Drive onboarding and continuous learning for new CSMs and help define scalable frameworks to improve team efficiency.
- **Represent the voice of France’s strategic partners within central and product teams**, ensuring that local needs and operational insights shape product development and regional strategy.

**What You Will Need**

- Minimum 4 years of experience in Account Management, Business Development, Operations, Sales, Consulting, or growing a start-up.

- Strong business acumen and judgment; familiarity with the e-commerce customer journey or willingness to learn.

- Comfortable with technical information and translating it into business requirements for stakeholders.

- Hands-on and proactive mindset; able to deep-dive into operational and technical issues in coordination with cross-functional teams.

- Analytical and data-driven; comfortable using Google Sheets (Excel/SQL knowledge is a plus).

- Proven experience managing strategic or complex accounts with multiple stakeholders, requiring structured governance and strong coordination.

- Skilled in navigating ambiguity, influencing without authority, and aligning internal and external teams.

- Empathetic and relationship-oriented; able to build trust quickly with internal and external partners.

- Experience leading initiatives to improve processes, tools, or operations.

- Adaptable and able to execute quickly in a changing environment.

- Industry knowledge in the on-demand or same-day delivery space.

- Experience in matrixed or global organizations with complex stakeholder environments.

- Proficiency in English and French.

jobs.title: Senior Staff Machine Learning Engineer - Driver Pricing & Marketplace Optimization
jobs.description:
## **About the Role**

We’re seeking an exceptional Senior Staff ML Engineer to lead breakthrough ML innovation in Uber’s Driver Pricing organization. This is a high-impact role where you’ll architect and build next-generation ML systems that directly optimize marketplace efficiency and driver earnings for millions of drivers globally.

You’ll tackle some of the most complex problems in applied machine learning: real-time pricing optimization, supply-demand balancing, and driver behavior modeling at unprecedented scale. Your work will involve cutting-edge techniques including causal inference, reinforcement learning, algorithmic game theory, and multi-objective optimization to solve challenges that don’t exist anywhere else in the industry.

As a Senior Staff ML Engineer reporting directly to the Engineering Director, you’ll drive technical strategy, mentor senior engineers, and establish ML engineering excellence across the Driver Pricing organization while solving problems that directly impact tens of billions of dollars in marketplace transactions.

## **What You Will Do**

**Technical Leadership & Innovation**

- Lead the design and implementation of advanced ML systems for dynamic pricing algorithms serving millions of drivers across 70+ countries around the world
- Architect real-time ML infrastructure handling 1M+ pricing decisions per second with sub-50ms latency requirements
- Drive breakthrough research in causal ML, reinforcement learning, algorithmic game theory, and multi-objective optimization for marketplace optimization with strategic agents
- Own end-to-end ML model lifecycle from research through production deployment and continuous optimization

**Platform & Architecture**

- Build scalable ML architecture and feature management systems supporting Driver Pricing and broader Marketplace teams
- Design experimentation frameworks enabling rapid testing of pricing algorithms using A/B, Switchback, Synthetic Control, and other experimental methodologies
- Establish ML engineering best practices, monitoring, and operational excellence across the organization
- Create platform abstractions that enable other ML engineers to iterate faster on pricing algorithms

**Cross-Functional Impact**

- Partner with Product, Operations, and Earner Experience teams to translate complex business requirements into ML solutions
- Collaborate with Marketplace Engineering and Science teams to productionize cutting-edge ML research
- Work with Platform Engineering teams to ensure ML systems meet reliability and performance standards
- Influence technical roadmaps across multiple teams through technical leadership and strategic thinking

**Team Development**

- Mentor and grow senior ML engineers, establishing technical standards and engineering culture
- Lead technical discussions and architecture reviews for complex ML systems
- Drive knowledge sharing and technical excellence across the Driver Pricing engineering organization

## **Basic Qualifications**

- **PhD in Computer Science, Machine Learning, Operations Research, or related quantitative field OR Master’s degree with 12+ years of industry experience**
- **10+ years of experience building and deploying ML models in large-scale production environments**
- **Expert-level proficiency in modern ML frameworks** (TensorFlow, PyTorch, JAX) and distributed computing platforms (Spark, Ray)
- **Deep expertise across multiple areas including:** Deep Learning, Causal Inference, Reinforcement Learning, Multi-objective Optimization, Algorithmic Game Theory, and Large-scale Ads Ranking/Auction Systems
- **Proven track record of leading complex ML projects** from research through production with significant measurable business impact
- **Strong programming skills** in Python, Java, or Go with experience building production ML systems
- **Experience with feature engineering, model serving, and ML infrastructure** at scale (handling millions of predictions per second)
- **Technical leadership experience** including mentoring senior engineers and driving cross-team technical initiatives

## **Preferred Qualifications**

- **Marketplace or two-sided platform ML experience** with understanding of supply-demand dynamics and pricing mechanisms
- **Publications or patents** in applied machine learning, particularly in areas relevant to optimization, pricing, or marketplace dynamics
- **Experience with causal inference methodologies** and their application to business problems with network effects
- **Reinforcement learning experience** in production environments with long-term optimization and strategic agent considerations
- **Technical leadership experience** including mentoring senior engineers and driving cross-team technical initiatives
- **Experience with real-time ML systems** requiring low-latency inference and high-throughput model serving
- **Background in economics, operations research, or related quantitative disciplines** with application to marketplace problems
- **Experience with Ads ranking and auction systems** with strategic bidding agents and real-time optimization

## **Technical Skills**

**Required:**

- Advanced Deep Learning and Neural Network architectures
- Scalable ML architecture and distributed model training
- Feature engineering and real-time feature serving
- ML model deployment, monitoring, and lifecycle management
- Statistical analysis and experimental design for ML systems
- Causal Machine Learning and causal inference methodologies
- Reinforcement Learning and Multi-Armed Bandits
- Multi-objective optimization and Pareto efficiency
- Algorithmic Game Theory for strategic agent modeling

**Preferred:**

- Personalization and ranking systems at scale
- Time series forecasting and demand prediction
- Graph-based ML for network effects modeling
- Experience with Ads ranking and auction systems

For San Francisco, CA-based roles: The base salary range for this role is USD$257,000 per year - USD$285,500 per year.

jobs.title: COE Specialist I
jobs.description:
**About the Role**

At Uber, providing amazing support that establishes trust for our riders —our community—is a core feature of our product experience. We invest in it and believe in providing the highest quality service executed in the smartest, most efficient way. **COE Specialists** are all about helping and educating riders.

We help people resolve their issues and turn unhappy users into our strongest evangelists. The right candidate is always looking for unique and exciting ways to solve problems with exceptional support and exceptional communication, ensuring that problems are resolved promptly while developing trustworthy relationships with our community.

**What You'll Do**

1. Deliver high-quality service across multiple support platforms (email, chat, phone).
2. Be a passionate advocate for riders while answering any questions that come your way.
3. Show empathy to frustrated riders while solving problems and addressing unsatisfactory experiences.
4. Build loyalty among new users and get our early adopters to fall in love with Uber all over again.
5. Triage issues and escalate them when necessary.

**Basic Qualifications**

01. Excellent English both spoken and written.
02. High proficiency using computers (typing, quickly navigating between various tools)
03. Exceptional reading comprehension and writing skills. Must be able to connect what users are asking for with answers to their true issues.
04. Passion for helping others and creating support experiences that exceed users’ expectations.
05. Ability to troubleshoot problems and find speedy resolutions.
06. Skilled at handling multiple issues at once to efficiently solve a large number of inquiries.
07. Must work well in a team environment, contributing to a synergistic work environment where people learn from one another and continuously improve processes on behalf of users.
08. Work time will be shift based totalling 40 hours per week.
09. Weekend and weekly evening shifts are required.
10. You’re an Uber evangelist — you care deeply about the product and getting others excited to ride and partner with Uber.

**Preferred Qualifications**

1. Bachelor's degree or college experience preferred.
2. Support experience in a high-volume environment, including service industries, retail, hospitality or other support environments.

locations: New York, New York, United States
jobs.location: New York, New York, United States
jobs.description:
**About the Role**

Uber Eats is our food delivery platform that makes getting great food from your favorite local restaurants as easy as requesting a ride. As a full stack engineer on the Engagement Growth team within Uber Eats, you’ll be building amazing design and data-driven features for eaters, delivery partners, and new verticals to help grow the business. The goal of these products is to provide affordable everyday options and optimal experiences for all sides of the Eats marketplace. You will continually strive to unlock greater efficiency and revenue for courier/restaurant partners, and improve the overall efficiency of the UberEats marketplace.

The role would entail strong partnership with cross functional teams across Delivery to drive deeply collaborated initiatives, build frameworks and solutions that help drive the long term strategy for the business.

**\-\-\-\- What the Candidate Will Do ----**

1. Building features at scale by writing maintainable and extensible code with high quality tests and documentation for the Engagement Growth team at Uber
2. Participate in code reviews, provide feedback, and maintain code quality standards to ensure the reliability and maintainability of the web and backend codebase.
3. Troubleshoot issues reported by users or identified during testing, and work towards timely resolution.
4. Understand and use existing systems efficiently, contributing to them where necessary

**\-\-\-\- Basic Qualifications ----**

01. Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related technical field or equivalent practical experience
02. 1-2+ years of experience in professional software development experience, developing and deploying systems in production environments
03. Good understanding of software experimentation philosophy in the earlier work with an understanding of setting up A/B experiments for hypothesis testing.
04. Build instrumentation in the experiments, understand and mine insights, and investigate these to help product with data-driven decisions from experimentation.
05. Strong communication skills, experience working with stakeholders including product managers, design and user research
06. Ability to learn new technologies and frameworks quickly
07. Previous experience working on full-stack development including API design and front-end user experience
08. Previous experience with front-end frameworks such as React, Angular, etc
09. **Proficiency in JavaScript, TypeScript, CSS, and HTML.** Solid experience in core front-end technologies, enabling the development of responsive and accessible web interfaces.
10. **Expertise in Modern Web Application Frameworks.** Hands-on experience with frameworks such as React, Angular etc, including component-based architecture and state management.
11. **Strong UX Sensibility.** Ability to form and advocate for strong opinions on user experience, with meticulous attention to detail in matching implemented UI to design specifications.
12. **Understanding of Distributed Systems and Microservice Architectures.** Familiarity with scalable, resilient backend systems, service-oriented architecture, and inter-service communication patterns.
13. **API Design Skills.** Experience designing clean, maintainable, and efficient RESTful or GraphQL APIs, with a focus on usability, versioning, and documentation.

**\-\-\-\- Preferred Qualifications ----**

1. Previously led projects with multiple engineers, teams to develop consumer experiences across a range of platforms and use-cases
2. Previous experience designing experiments, and developing measurement strategies
3. Experience working on multiple platforms
4. Prior experience developing software at a company with a two or three-sided marketplace
5. Has a growth mindset or past experience working at Growth teams
6. Experience developing for mobile
7. Embedded webviews
8. Familiarity with Go

jobs.title: Representante de Ventas en Campo Querétaro
jobs.description:
## Sobre la oportunidad

Estamos construyendo un Equipo de Ventas de Campo con el objetivo principal de incrementar la oferta en distintas ciudades de México.

El role de Field Sales Representative es clave: será los ojos y oídos de Uber en el mercado. Su misión será asegurar que la oferta responda a la demanda, conectando proactivamente con socios conductores potenciales a través de visitas en campo y llamadas dirigidas, comunicando de forma efectiva la propuesta de valor de Uber.

## Responsabilidades

- Identificar y encontrar prospectos (conductores de taxi o independientes) directamente en campo (80% del tiempo) para referirlos y/o convertirlos a la plataforma.

- Actuar como la voz del socio conductor, capturando información de valor en cada interacción.

- Facilitar sesiones informativas con socios conductores actuales y potenciales, comunicando claramente la propuesta de valor de Uber.

- Participar en campañas dirigidas a conductores potenciales o recientemente registrados.

- Gestionar interacciones con conductores activos o prospectos para entender sus necesidades, inquietudes y objetivos; posicionar a Uber como solución.

- Apoyar a los conductores durante el proceso de registro y asegurarse de que estén listos para completar sus primeros viajes.

- Colaborar con distintos stakeholders para integrar sus insights cuando sea necesario.

- Crear y/o aprovechar procesos escalables de adquisición de conductores que puedan replicarse en múltiples ciudades.

- Gestionar alianzas estratégicas con terceros.


## Requisitos Básicos

- 2+ años de experiencia cuantificable en ventas de campo B2C/B2B, gestión de cuentas o soporte al cliente de alto volumen, con conversión como métrica principal.

- Alto nivel de autonomía y autogestión, habiendo manejado un ciclo de ventas o territorio completo con mínima supervisión.

- Capacidad demostrada para gestionar múltiples prioridades, tomar decisiones rápidas y operar en entornos dinámicos y acelerados.

- Excelentes habilidades interpersonales y pasión por interactuar con personas.

- Nivel de inglés intermedio, necesario para la comunicación con equipos internos y documentación
- Capacidad para operar con resiliencia, persistencia y enfoque ante la ambigüedad o metas de conversión desafiantes.

- Disponibilidad para viajar dentro del país para apoyar campañas estratégicas de oferta y lanzamientos de nuevos mercados.

## Cualidades preferidas

- Conocimiento o experiencia laboral en la industria de taxis, transporte o logística en México.

- Experiencia comprobada en la creación y gestión de alianzas externas o negociaciones con terceros.

jobs.title: KYC Analyst
jobs.description:
**About the Role**

The KYC Analyst (S2) position within Uber’s Payment Compliance team plays a critical role in ensuring regulatory compliance and maintaining the integrity of Uber’s financial ecosystem.

This role bridges all key components of the KYC framework — Customer Due Diligence (CDD), Enhanced Due Diligence (EDD), and Ongoing Due Diligence (ODD) — ensuring a holistic approach to customer verification and risk management.

The analyst will work in a dynamic, cross-functional environment, supporting both operational excellence and strategic initiatives within the Payments Compliance domain. This role offers the opportunity to contribute to the development of best practices, continuous process improvements, and the overall compliance culture within Uber.

**What You'll Do**

1. Perform detailed reviews under CDD, EDD, and ODD standards, ensuring compliance with internal and regulatory requirements.
2. Cover operational queues related to EDD, ODD, and Jira requests, ensuring timely and accurate handling of cases.
3. Collaborate closely with KYC Specialists, KYC Snr. Analysts, and key stakeholders across the organization to maintain process consistency and high-quality standards.
4. Provide actionable insights and feedback to the Team Leader, supporting decision-making and performance optimization.
5. Analyze team metrics and results, identifying trends, recurring issues, and potential areas for improvement.
6. Contribute to ongoing projects and initiatives, supporting process automation, data quality improvements, and efficiency gains.
7. Document and escalate identified risks, inconsistencies, or process gaps in accordance with internal procedures.
8. Maintain up-to-date knowledge of regulatory requirements, internal policies, and industry best practices in KYC/AML compliance.

**Basic Qualifications**

1. Minimum 1 year of experience in KYC, AML, or Compliance (preferably in fintech, financial services, or banking).
2. Fluent English (written and spoken).
3. Strong analytical thinking and the ability to interpret complex information.
4. Proven problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
5. Excellent communication and teamwork skills, with a proactive attitude.
6. Strong organizational and time management skills; able to handle multiple priorities in a fast-paced setting.
7. Demonstrated adaptability, curiosity, and willingness to learn new systems and processes.
8. High level of professional integrity and discretion in handling sensitive information.

**Preferred Qualifications**

1. Hands-on experience with Jira (case tracking and queue management).
2. Advanced proficiency in Google Sheets (data analysis, dashboards, reporting).
3. Familiarity with Salesforce, KYC screening tools
4. Understanding of risk scoring models and document verification workflows.
5. Experience in process documentation, quality control, or internal audits.
6. Understanding of Jira portal is a plus.
7. Passion for process optimization and continuous improvement initiatives.

jobs.title: Senior Program Manager, Tech- Gen AI Data Collections
jobs.description:
**About the Role**

We are building one of the most scalable, high-quality data collection engines powering the next generation of AI. Our projects span audio, image, video, LiDAR, text, and multimodal datasets, across dozens of countries and environments.

We are looking for a Senior Program Manager to own and drive complex, multi-country data collection programs end-to-end.

**What the Candidate Will Do:**

**Program Ownership:** Translate client SOWs into executable programs — scope, timelines, budgets, workforce model, and quality control frameworks.

**Execution Hustle:** Solve operational bottlenecks in real time — whether it’s participant churn, equipment issues, location access, or low-quality submissions.

**Quality & Compliance:** Ensure data meets specs, passes rejection thresholds, and complies with privacy/consent/data protection laws globally.

**Stakeholder Management:** Act as the program point of contact with clients, internal teams, and external vendors. Provide progress reports, risk assessments, and mitigation plans.

**Analytics & Reporting:** Monitor collection KPIs via dashboards, identify issues early, and drive corrective action.

**Continuous Improvement:** Codify learnings into playbooks and SOPs for repeatability and faster future deployments.

**Basic Qualifications:**

- 5–8 years of professional experience in program management or operations.
- Proven track record managing large-scale distributed programs in data, logistics, field operations, or crowdsourcing.
- Planning, governance, and risk management skills.
- Ability to engage and communicate effectively with all levels, including executives and field contributors.
- Comfortable with metrics, dashboards, and root-cause analysis.
- Hands-on, thrives in ambiguity, demonstrates bias for action, resilience under pressure, ability to work across cultures/geographies.

**Preferred Qualifications:**

- Exposure to AI/ML data programs, sensors, or field data collection.

- Multi-country operations experience, especially in emerging markets.

- Fluency in more than one language.

- Startup experience or top-tier consulting experience.

For Sunnyvale, CA-based roles: The base salary range for this role is USD$162,000 per year - USD$180,000 per year.

jobs.title: Account Executive, UberEats, Toronto (Bilingual Required)
jobs.description:
**About the Role**

Uber Eats' Account Executives are dedicated to bringing top local and regional small to medium-sized grocers and retailers to our platform. We're seeking individuals who excel at sales, have a deep knowledge of the best local grocery and retail stores, are passionate about both sales and Uber, and thrive in negotiation.In this role you will lead the full sales cycle and sign partnerships with top local grocers and retailers while being a champion for the Uber and Uber Eats brands. Your success in this role is measured by achieving and exceeding your monthly quota and proactively building your pipeline by managing and hitting the weekly metrics (cold-calls, emails, and field appointments).

**What the Candidate Will Need / Bonus Points**

\-\-\-\- What the Candidate Will Do ----

1. Own and manage a pipeline of local small and medium size grocers and retailers to sign new partnerships from your book of business with a mix of cold-calling (at least 50 dials per day) and in-person meetings
2. Create a great first-impression and act as an ambassador of Uber Eats to develop long-term partnerships and clearly communicate the value of Uber
3. Manage contract negotiation to establish the foundation of a strong working relationship with our retail partners, including sustainable economics for both parties
4. Help us identify and build best practices and collaborate with the Account Management team to support a seamless onboarding experience for each new partner
5. Proactively maintain communication channels with prospects via phone, email, and face-to-face meetings
6. Hybrid role - in office in Toronto office/remote

\-\-\-\- Basic Qualifications ----

1. Fluency in French and English (spoken and written) is **required**
2. 3-5 years of full cycle sales experience
3. Passionate about sales and about helping restaurants and merchants grow their business with Uber Eats
4. No fear of picking up the phone - this role is 70% on the phone and 30% in the field

\-\-\-\- Preferred Qualifications ----

1. Experience with Salesforce and Google Suite

For Canada-based roles: The base hourly rate amount for this role is CAD$31.75 per hour.

jobs.title: Product Counsel, Marketplace
locations: Washington, District of Columbia, United States
jobs.location: Washington, District of Columbia, United States
jobs.description:
### **About the role**

We have an outstanding opportunity for an experienced attorney to support Marketplace for our Product Legal team. The Product Legal team owns and drives all product-related legal reviews at HQ, and advises operations teams. In this role, you’ll advise Uber’s Marketplace product and ops teams responsible for operating Uber’s sophisticated pricing and matching systems that connects riders to drivers and eaters to couriers across billions of annual trips and deliveries.

If you’re passionate about working on a mission at the heart of Uber’s business, solving challenging problems with impact, and advising on complex features involving AI and machine learning, come join our team!

### **What You’ll Do:**

- Lead legal reviews of new Marketplace products or features, including AI/machine learning models, which operationalize the technology for pricing and matching riders / drivers and eaters / couriers using the Uber and UberEats app.
- Coordinate global reviews with our regional partners, create / review terms & conditions, and advise on how to position/structure these products/features to reduce risk.
- Be an active and trusted business partner, and ensure the provision of timely business-focussed advice to the Mobility and Delivery business on marketplace issues of pricing and matching.
- Work closely with regional legal teams, specialist internal legal counsel and represent HQ legal for product reviews and contracts.
- Work collaboratively with teams including tax, policy and communications to strategically advise.
- Understand, interpret and apply current laws and regulations to Uber’s business models in the region and your areas of responsibility.
- Provide critical and proactive legal and strategic feedback on a wide range of sophisticated and strategic issues. It's our job to peer around corners for the business and ensure that we are well-positioned for the future.
- Be a strong communicator and collaborator to effectively support a high-performing, diverse team and outside counsel to achieve our legal and regulatory priorities.

### **Basic Qualifications:**

- J.D. and license to practice law in at least one state.
- Minimum 5+ years of legal experience.

### **Preferred Qualifications:**

- In-house or government experience.
- Background in AI/machine learning, pricing and/or economic modeling.
- The ability to juggle multiple projects at a time in an exciting, fast-paced environment, both collaborating as a team to stay in sync and working independently to get the job done.
- Superior analytical skills, innovative thinking, and a desire to take the initiative and think two steps ahead.
- Strong interpersonal skills and highly collaborative with both business leaders and cross-functional partners, with a strong ability to build relationships, gain credibility, and partner across functions to build consensus.
- Self-motivation with a strong affinity for vision setting, strategic problem solving, and driving action.
- Embody the highest standards of integrity, ethics and accountability.
- Enthusiasm about Uber and our mission!

For San Francisco, CA-based roles: The base salary range for this role is USD$208,000 per year - USD$231,000 per year.

For Washington, DC-based roles: The base salary range for this role is USD$208,000 per year - USD$231,000 per year.

For all US locations, you will be eligible to participate in Uber's bonus program, and may be offered an equity award & other types of comp. You will also be eligible for various benefits. jobs.title: COE Specialist - I SMB Onboarding
jobs.description:
**#Greatmindsdontthinkalike:** At Uber, we take pride in our diversity and working environment that sees you as more than just a person that can do the job, but a unique individual that can level up our organization with a perspective only you can offer. Uber provides a truly open culture that encourages all to voice their thoughts.

## About the Team

Community Operations is the heart and soul of our **#BuildWithHeart** approach at Uber. We work with customers, people earning money on the platform and partners at enormous scale. Community Operations helps operationalise every new and existing product and idea that Uber comes up with - it’s an organisation that touches every part of Uber!

**About the Role**

The Onboarding specialist owns the onboarding process of the merchant from start to finish. A few activities included (but not limited to) would be auditing menus, uploading merchant photos, making outbound calls/emails to help unblock merchants and answer their questions, and checking that merchants meet all requirements to be activated on Uber Eats platform.

**Your Impact in Role:**

- Willing to be moved from time to time to other projects and accounts or where the business needs them
- Onboards merchants by ensuring that **menus and photos comply with Uber Eats quality and brand standards**.
- Conducts **outbound calls to merchants** who are active but not taking trips, identifying potential blockers and providing guidance to improve engagement and activation.
- Investigative and truth-seeking mindset, adopting a curious and analytical mindset to find facts and full understanding of the situation

**Basic Qualifications**

- Work experience in high energy, high pressure, productive environment
- Excellence in both written and spoken English with the ability to clearly and effectively communicate ideas to varied audiences
- Comfortable with Excel/Google Sheets and other technology based business tools
- Customer-focused and has a deep understanding of the user experience and the ability to resolve critical incidents in an empathetic and customer-centric way
- Investigative and truth-seeking mindset, adopting a curious and analytical mindset to find facts and full understanding of the situation
- Exceptional eye for detail, carefully checking everything, knowing that even a small error could lead to potential risk

**Preferred Qualifications**

- A bachelor's degree from any field is preferred but not a requirement

jobs.title: SMB Account Executive, Uber for Business
jobs.description:
## About the Role

Are you ready to work in a world-class sales team inside one of the leading tech organizations in the world? At Uber for Business (U4B) we are customer-obsessed, act like owners, make big ambitious bets and invest in our team so people can go from good to great, and from great to outstanding. We are searching for a highly motivated Account Executive, who thrives in a team environment and is a natural day-to-day doer. Our B2B suite of products has considerably grown in recent years, so we're looking for a highly focused account executive who can prospect, pitch, close and implement our solution to SMB companies. We offer you the possibility to be part of the next growth engine for Uber and truly grow inside this outstanding team, full of incredible people who will, for sure, make this journey a remarkable professional and personal experience.

This is a hybrid role - our team collaborates in-person out of our incredible office in Mexico City 3 days/week. We encourage our employees to work from our office on additional days if they desire so.

## What you'll do:

- **Pitch, sell and negotiate the newest product in the U4B portfolio to diverse decision makers inside SMB companies in every industry for Mexico**
- **Prospect new leads and opportunities to build and maintain a strong pipeline.**
- **Hit bi-annual and quarter targets (quota carrying role).**
- **Construct, forecast, and run your sales pipeline via Salesforce CRM.**
- **Develop your sales skills: Probe for objections, remove obstacles, and eliminate barriers to gain commitment with customers.**
- **Work with a unique multifunctional team inside one of our most important lines of business.**
- **Contribute on building and developing a new U4B product launch in the region.**
- **Participate in periodic team reviews and updates on business progress, best practice sharing etc.**
- **Create documents like process playbooks, performance trackers etc. to help the team scale efficiently.**

## What you'll need:

- 2+ years of B2B experience, with at least 1 years in an Account Executive role or equivalent. SaaS experience is a plus.
- Bachelor's degree in business administration or related field
- Proficiency in English
- Excellent verbal and written communication skills
- Proven track record of growing a customer base and exceeding revenue targets and company goals
- Self-starter, comfortable working autonomously with high volume and under pressure typical of SMB sales
- Proficiency in pipeline management, sales techniques, prioritization, and setting clear expectations
- Proficiency in leveraging data-driven insights to refine sales strategies
- To be driven and passionate about a fast-paced team environment, working with high pressure and high expectations
- Resilience, adaptability, proactivity, taking care of ambiguity, and a can-do attitude
- Creativity, organization and process-orientation to simultaneously handle hundreds of prospects

jobs.title: Analytics Operations Manager, Uber Eats
jobs.description:
**About the Role**

The Uber Eats Delivery Commercial Operations team is looking for an Analytics role in EMEA to support the DCO Edge team to improve Commercial decisions based on data and develop sophisticated analysis. This role will analyze and build models to evaluate the economics, value, and opportunity costs of programs and potential partners to drive selection strategy and multiply sales headcount productivity.

This role sits at the intersection of strategy, data, and execution, acting as a key partner to EMEA DCO Edge team, working closely with regional Commercial Operations, Sales, and Account Management teams to help shape the Delivery sales organization, future direction, and strategy.

**What You Will Do**

1. Drive regional enablement and reporting: Localize global analytics, reporting, and planning initiatives to improve decision-making and ensure consistent adoption of global methodologies across EMEA.
2. Enhance data systems and automation: Maintain and develop SQL-based automations, dashboards, and tools to streamline workflows, improve accuracy, and reduce manual effort across Commercial Operations.
3. Support strategic planning and segmentation: Partner with regional and global teams on BoB planning, segmentation, and headcount allocation initiatives to ensure accurate ownership and optimized coverage models.
4. Deliver high-impact analyses and frameworks: Support EMEA Delivery Commercial Operations and EMEA Commercial teams with sophisticated analyses, scalable reporting, and data tools that enhance forecasting, quota setting, and sales productivity.

**What You Will Need**

1. +5 years of experience in Commercial Operations, Strategy & Planning, Business Analytics, or related fields such as Ads, CPGs, and marketing products, Financial planning, Pricing and revenue management
2. Strong data analysis, automations, and visualization skills – experience with Sheets, SQL, and Tableau is essential.
3. Knowledge of CRM platforms (e.g., Salesforce), Spark, Python, R, AppScripts, and ETL processes is a plus.
4. Excellent communication skills, with the ability to collaborate across teams and influence stakeholders.
5. Strong organizational skills, with the ability to prioritize multiple tasks and manage timelines across teams (Asana and/or JIRA).
6. Strategic thinking with a “roll-up-your-sleeves” mentality — ready to dive into details when needed.
7. Fluency in English
8. Knowledge and proven experience in implementing AI-driven solutions is a plus

locations: Rio de Janeiro, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil
jobs.location: Rio de Janeiro, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil
jobs.description:
**_Please note: this hybrid position is based in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil - welcoming both local professionals and those open to relocating._**

**About the Role** The Tech Center in Brazil is expanding, and our teams in Core Services, Delivery are looking for talented Senior Software Engineers to join and contribute to our projects. You will work with global teams to develop products impacting millions of users worldwide, while supporting our platform teams in enhancing engineering processes. Here’s a closer look at each team:

- **Core Services:** This team builds the foundational infrastructure and platforms that power all of Uber’s products. As a member, you'll develop scalable, reliable, and reusable services that are critical to Uber’s global operations. Your work here will directly influence the performance and stability of our systems, ensuring that millions of transactions and data flows run smoothly every day.
- **Delivery:** The Delivery team is focused on innovating and streamlining how products and services reach our customers. In this role, you'll contribute to building efficient and robust systems that support order processing, logistics, and real-time tracking. Your contributions will help optimize the end-to-end delivery experience, making it more reliable and seamless for both drivers and customers.

**What the Candidate Will Do**

- Contribute to the technical roadmap by developing innovative features and solving complex problems.
- Collaborate with senior engineers to implement and iterate on ambitious product plans.
- Work closely with Product, Operations, Design, and other partners to ensure effective execution of projects.
- Participate in code reviews, design discussions, and technical mentoring to help elevate team capabilities.
- Provide technical expertise and input to shape the vision for your area, while executing on product requirements.

**Basic Qualifications**

- 7+ years relevant engineering experience in successfully designing and building large scale, highly available and reliable engineering systems addressing real world challenging problems.
- Demonstrated experience shipping high-quality product features on schedule and instill a high level of engineering excellence culture (e.g., code reviews, documentation, unit and integration testing).
- Strong software engineering skills, supported by 7+ years of industry experience in one or more programming languages (e.g., Golang, Python, C++, Java) and eagerness to learn more.
- Experience with large-scale distributed storage and database systems (SQL or NoSQL, e.g. MySQL, Cassandra, DynamoDB) utilizing a microservices architecture
- Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including the ability to write detailed technical documents.
- Proven ability to develop other strong junior engineers into senior engineers, operating and leading their own initiatives with cross team scope and high impact.
- English proficiency
- Algorithm & Data Structures fundamentals, including hash tables, trees, stacks, queues, linked list, DFS, BFS.




  **Bonus Points if**


- Experience working at large companies (10k+ employees)
- Experience with international stakeholders

jobs.title: Strategic Account Manager, Uber Direct
jobs.description:
**About the Role**

As an Uber Direct Account Manager, you will use your stakeholder management skills working with a growing base of Partners (Enterprise/Key accounts) to fuel Uber Direct (Delivery as a Service Product) growth in Spain, leading the relationships with top managers in the industry. Direct is a new business that focuses on last-mile and same-day delivery across multiple verticals - Online Food Delivery, Grocery, Retail, Logistics, and more; expanding the ways in which Uber connects the world!

Uber Direct is an on-demand delivery service powered by the same courier network as Uber Eats. It enables merchants to offer on-demand deliveries from their own website or app, but Uber delivers the order. Merchants are able to request on-demand deliveries via either a dashboard or an API integration.

**What You Will Do**

As an Uber Direct Account Manager you will be at the heart of the Uber Direct Spain team, supporting the growth of the Spain business by:

- Promoting Uber Direct value proposition - Clearly understand and communicate the value of Uber Direct to prospects and customers. Seek and achieve logistics, same-day delivery, delivery as a service industry knowledge to have enriching conversations with Enterprise accounts.
- Building long-term relationships with Uber Direct customers - Develop meaningful and long-lasting relationships with key partners by focusing on building trust and crafting successful joint business plans,
- Lead merchants growth strategies
- Provide opportunity status by regularly updating our CRM, doing weekly forecasts, and participating in quarterly business reviews
- Monitoring the activity and analyzing data - Perform a broad range of financial, quantitative, and qualitative analyses to continuously improve the reliability of the orders and capture additional value. Look for ways to achieve and exceed monthly goals (financial and qualitative). Present and report key results to partners, internally and externally.
- Contributing to Uber Direct offering improvement - Act as an ambassador of Uber's mission, brand, and product - being a problem solver for partners and team. Identify ways to further develop Uber Direct offerings to answer to partners’ needs.

**What you Will Need**

- Interest about on demand delivery and retail
- At least, 4 years experience in an account management role incl experience in relationship management
- Willingness to get into the weeds (no matter how deep) and push through despite difficulties
- Customer obsession, proactivity and willingness to build positive and lasting relationships with our partners, bringing them added value and helping them reach their potential on Uber
- Good communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to persuasively communicate recommendations and influence stakeholders
- Analytical skills: Ability to analyze data (experience with excel is needed) and derive conclusions from it to provide recommendation to partners
- English working proficiency and Spanish native proficiency

jobs.title: Retail & Logistics Lead, Uber Direct - France
jobs.description:
**Uber Direct** is our last-mile delivery-as-a-service solution. It enables merchants across a wide range of verticals—Food, Grocery, Retail, Ecommerce—to deliver orders generated on their own platforms (outside of Uber’s marketplace) using our expansive courier network. In addition to working directly with multiple retailers and e-commerce players, Uber Direct is also partnering with traditional third-party logistics providers to combine their strengths and provide an E2E logistic solution to all merchants.

This role will be a pillar of the Uber Direct team in France and report directly to the General Manager of Uber Direct and work closely with cross-functional teams including Operations, Product, and the EMEA Central Uber Direct team.

As a **Retail & Logistics Lead for Uber Direct in France**, you will be responsible for developing and leading the logistics go-to-market strategy. You’ll help define our local value proposition and operating model, manage RFQs and commercial proposals for key enterprise opportunities, and lead the commercial strategy to further build Uber Direct into a competitive logistics solution in the French market, including through tailored partnerships with other logistics players. This role is a unique blend of strategic thinking, solution design, and commercial and operational execution.

**What You Will Do**

- **Define and own Uber Direct’s logistics value proposition in France**, leveraging your market insights to shape our positioning across retail, grocery, and e-commerce, and guiding the development of new operating models for same-day and next-day delivery in collaboration with Operations and Product teams.
- **Develop and execute go-to-market strategy** to grow our footprint in the B2B logistics sector, including the expansion of service offerings and strategic partnerships with key players in the logistics ecosystem.
- **Establish and nurture strategic relationships** with large retailers, aggregators, and traditional 3PL providers, serving as a trusted advisor to support their logistics transformation initiatives.
- **Lead complex commercial engagements**, including managing RFQs and RFPs from Enterprise clients, and aligning internal product and operational capabilities with client requirements. Craft and deliver compelling commercial proposals tailored to prospective partners’ needs to drive adoption and business growth.
- **Partner cross-functionally with key internal stakeholders**—including Legal, Finance, Compliance, Operations, and Product—to align on priorities and ensure seamless deal execution. Influence product and operational roadmap planning by advocating for merchant needs and surfacing data-backed business cases for enhancements.
- **Monitor commercial and operational performance**, ensuring visibility into pipeline health, reporting progress against growth targets, and improving efficiency for scalable growth. Monitoring operational reliability and driving continuous improvement for merchant and end-customer needs, in collaboration with the Operations team.

**What You Will Need**

- Minimum 5 years of experience in logistics, B2B sales, supply chain, transport purchasing, strategy, or business development, ideally within last-mile delivery, e-commerce logistics, or 3PL environments.
- Strong strategic thinking and problem-solving skills with a track record of launching new business lines or verticals or implementing complex cross-functional projects.
- Proven ability to operate cross-functionally and influence without authority.
- Highly analytical and comfortable working with financial models and commercial metrics.
- Comfortable navigating ambiguity and building in "start-up within a scale-up" environments.
- Knowledge of on-demand, same-day, or instant delivery landscape.
- Fluent in French and English.

**Preferred Qualifications**

- Demonstrated experience managing complex sales processes including RFQs, pricing strategy, and commercial negotiation is a plus.
- Experience working with 3PLs or traditional logistics providers.
- Familiarity with Salesforce and sales pipeline reporting.
