locations: New York, New York, United States
jobs.location: New York, New York, United States
jobs.description:
**About the Role**

As the Senior Product Manager for Rider Personalization, you will join a team dedicated to using cutting-edge machine learning and AI to create an app experience that feels intuitive and personalized for millions of users around the world. Your mission will be to ensure that users always feel understood, with the app effortlessly anticipating their needs—whether they’re booking a trip for immediate travel or exploring Uber’s full range of Mobility and Delivery products that can meet future needs they didn’t know Uber can solve.

In this role, you will collaborate closely with machine learning engineers, data scientists, and cross-functional teams to design scalable systems that enable a seamless, intelligent user experience. You’ll focus on helping users discover the right products and services tailored to their context, unlocking new possibilities and ensuring Uber is there for them at every step of their journey.

This is an exciting opportunity to be part of a team with a far-reaching mission to personalize many aspects of the app and make Uber feel like a personal assistant that’s always one step ahead.

**What the Candidate Will Do**

- Define and execute product roadmap and strategy, focusing on personalization and discovery experiences that enhance the user journey.
- Collaborate with machine learning engineers, data scientists, designers, and operations to identify opportunities, prioritize initiatives, and deliver ML and AI-powered features that feel intuitive and assistive.
- Develop scalable systems that help riders easily book trips when they have an immediate need, while also surfacing personalized recommendations for future planning or unmet needs.
- Partner with other product teams to ensure ML frameworks and capabilities are leveraged to create cohesive, delightful user experiences.
- Stay on top of industry trends and emerging best practices in machine learning, personalization, and AI to ensure Uber continues to lead in innovation.

**Basic Qualifications**

- Minimum of 5 years Product Management experience delivering innovative ML and AI-powered products.
- Proven experience working with machine learning systems at scale in a production environment.
- Proven ability to collaborate closely with engineering teams, lead technical direction, and communicate a broader vision effectively.
- Strong platform experience, with a track record of synthesizing diverse use cases into cohesive, scalable solutions in collaboration with internal partners.
- Undergraduate degree in Computer Science or a related field.

**Preferred Qualifications**

- Demonstrated ability to align technical investments with high-impact use cases and broader business objectives.
- Experience crafting an ML-first vision, identifying machine learning needs across multiple products, and proposing solutions that serve long-term user and business needs.
- Experience in consumer-facing products, with a focus on personalization, content recommendation, and understanding user context to create tailored experiences.
- Extensive experience in data analysis and experimentation, with the ability to craft and execute multivariate tests to inform product direction.
- Proven ability to navigate a diverse set of opinions among cross-functional teams, synthesize different perspectives, and drive decisions effectively.
- Strong communication skills, with the ability to articulate complex ideas clearly to both technical and non-technical audiences.
- Advanced degree (Master’s or PhD) in Computer Science, Statistics, or other quantitative fields is a bonus.

jobs.title: Senior Process Optimization Specialist (Amplify - Product)
jobs.description:
**About the Team**

The team’s mission: backing creativity with operational efficiency.

Based in the Krakow CoE, the team is cross-functional and supports operations at the regional and global level.

We focus on four core areas:

- Business Processes (design, execution, optimization)
- Automation (process automation, real-time monitoring, refactoring)
- Data Analytics (query, deepdive, self-operating dashboard, data pipeline)
- Data Science (modeling, machine learning, pattern identification, prediction)

The span of work is large, covering multiple verticals (such as Uber Rides, Eats, High Capacity Vehicle, Payment, Strategy & Planning) and Mega-Regions (such as Global, EMEA, US&C).

We’re offering a hybrid model of working (60% minimum based out of our Krakow office, 40% optional work from home).

**What you’ll do**

- Participate in the design of new business processes
- Write Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) and keep them updated
- Execute complex processes and work on their continuous optimization
- Write queries and scripts to reduce execution time and guide other team members
- Own end-to-end project plan and suggest improvements for the entire portfolio
- Improve technical skills continuously to match evolving business needs
- Work on business-critical processes in coordination with Stakeholders and Team Members

**What you’ll need**

- Good knowledge in Google Sheets (reporting & trend analysis), SQL, and Google Script
- Proven track record in operational excellence and continuous optimization, executing multiple business processes in accordance with SOPs and creating flows (ex., Lucidchart)

- Practical experience in executing and optimizing large-scale processes (mega-region)

- Faculty to guide project designs and continuous improvements

jobs.title: Account Executive, Uber Direct - France
jobs.description:
**About the Role**

Since 2020, Delivery at Uber has grown tremendously on the back of increased demand caused by the pandemic. Merchants across all categories have increased their investment and interest in their digital and delivery offering. Without having their own on-demand logistics capability, merchants are looking for a partner who can fulfill the requirement for last-mile delivery. With millions of drivers and couriers providing on-demand logistics through our existing marketplaces, Uber is well positioned to allow merchants to use our network of couriers, fulfilling the on-demand last-mile-delivery service for orders to their own app and website.

Uber Direct is our last-mile delivery-as-a-service solution. It enables merchants across a wide range of verticals—Food, Grocery, Retail, Ecommerce—to deliver orders generated on their own platforms (outside of Uber’s marketplace) using our expansive courier network. In addition to working directly with multiple retailers and e-commerce players, Uber Direct is also partnering with traditional third-party logistics providers to combine their strengths and provide an E2E logistic solution to all merchants.

This role will be a part of the Uber Direct team in France, and will be working very closely with cross-functional teams as well as international counterparts.

As an Uber Direct Sales Account Executive, you will be part of one of our three vertical teams (Restaurants, Grocery or Retail & Logistics) focusing on prospecting new merchants in France to offer our delivery-as-a-service product and managing the sales cycle from outreach to deal closing.

You will be responsible for building the Direct business pipeline, forecasting opportunities, constructing game plans by account and leading negotiations to sign new merchants.

**What You Will Do**

As a Uber Direct Sales Account Executive, within one of our three vertical teams, you’ll have a key role in growing our business in France

- **Develop the go-to-market strategy** to grow our business within your vertical
- **Develop account plans** to grow pipeline and break into whitespace accounts for Uber Direct
- **Lead and coordinate end-to-end sales motion** for mid-market and enterprise Direct prospects including qualification, education, pricing/quoting, contract negotiation to close deals
- **Build strategic and long-term relationships** to gain positioning with decision-makers while driving growth of Direct business within key mid-market and enterprise prospects
- **Advise merchants on their customer delivery journey** and guide them to customize the delivery experience for their customers
- **Communicate the value of Uber Direct** to prospect accounts. Seek and achieve logistics, same-day delivery, delivery-as-a-service industry knowledge to have enriching conversations with them
- **Collaborate with operations and tech teams** to build a compelling offering for each merchant, incl. new delivery capabilities and custom integrations features
- **Leverage channel partners** to accelerate Direct penetration within their merchants portfolio
- **Contribute to Uber Direct offering improvement.** Identify ways to develop further Uber Direct offering to answer merchants’ needs and build business case to unlock ops & product development

**What You Will Need**

- 3+ years in a Sales, Business Development, Account Management, preferably with exposure to e-commerce, delivery or logistics topics and/or in a start-up / scale-up / fast-growing environment
- Experience in the full B2B sales cycle: prospecting, pitching, negotiating & closing; demonstrated resilience and grit when working with enterprise merchants on long sales cycle
- Proven ability to prioritize across selling activities and follow through in a timely fashion
- Empathetic when dealing with different people; able to quickly build relationships with external and internal partners
- Good communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to persuasively communicate recommendations and effectively champion customer needs
- Great commercial intuition, business acumen and judgment. Comfortable dealing with financial information and thoughtful about overall strategic choices. Ability to negotiate pricing with a focus on retaining value
- Proactive mindset, proven ability to take initiatives and highly autonomous - able to work with minimal supervision
- Entrepreneurial mindset and pro-activity. Comfortable navigating ambiguity and building in "start-up within a scale-up" environments. High adaptability to change and ability to execute quickly
- Fluent in English and French

**Preferred Qualifications**

- Industry knowledge in the on-demand / same-day delivery space
- Preferably proficient with Salesforce

jobs.title: Senior Mid-Market Account Executive, Uber for Business
jobs.description:
**About the Team**

We're on a mission to build the Uber’s B2B community in South Korea and help every organization move forward. As we expand our presence in this vibrant, high-growth market, we're looking for talents who can lead the charge. You will be instrumental in capturing untapped potential and revitalizing the market with our innovative solutions and B2B services.

**About the Role**

We're looking for a senior B2B sales professional with a proven track record of driving new business. This is a role for someone who lives and breathes acquisition and possesses an unwavering growth mindset. As a key player in building Uber's B2B presence in South Korea, you will be relentless in your pursuit to bend the growth curve.

You will own the end-to-end sales cycle: from analyzing the market fit and executing prospecting strategies to connecting with decision-makers, driving pipeline movement, and ensuring post-adoption success. Your ultimate goal is to fully empower organizations in South Korea with the power of Uber.

**Your Impact in Role**

- Prospect, pitch, and sell to Mid-Market businesses (250–2,000 employees).
- Articulate and deliver the value of the Uber for Business platform to corporate customers.
- Lead the entire sales motion, including qualification, education, pricing, and contract negotiation.
- Proactively build, manage and accelerate a robust pipeline of opportunities within your assigned territory.
- Prioritize and engage with key decision-makers to accelerate the sales process.
- Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure effective account launches and successful deal closures.
- Continuously assess customer needs and align our value proposition to drive ongoing adoption.

**What You Will Need**

- Native-level Korean language ability with business-level English.
- Extensive experience in B2B sales and quota-carrying experience.
- The ability to operate with speed, resourcefulness, and a go-getter attitude.
- Strong commercial acumen and mature sales pipeline management.
- Self-motivated and able to independently manage the full sales process from end to end.
- Analytical skills with the ability to extract actionable insights from data.
- Exceptional communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills.
- A proven track record of overachieving sales quotas is preferred
- Previous experience in a startup or B2B SaaS environment is preferred

jobs.location: New York, New York, United States
jobs.description:
**About the Role**

Uber Eats is looking for an expert and strategic Ads Product Management Leader to join our dynamic and fast-paced team. As a Director, Product Management - Ads, you will be responsible for driving the Advertising expansion of Uber Eats by developing and implementing innovative approaches to acquire and retain advertisers, increase advertiser value, and optimize user experience and engagement.

In this role, you’ll work closely with Sales, Data Science, Engineering, Regional General Managers, Strategy, and Finance partners across Uber's businesses and geographies. You will lead with deep customer empathy, and rely on data and user research to make informed decisions with solid product instincts.

**What You’ll Do**

- You will collaborate with cross-functional teams, including Engineering, Sales, Marketing, Data Science, and Design to identify growth opportunities, develop product initiatives, and implement data-driven experiments to improve advertiser experience
- Effectively present and communicate strategy, implementation and growth plans to various stakeholders ranging from business audiences to senior leadership
- Distill the vision and strategy for the team to generate enthusiasm across cross-functional partners and executive leadership Challenge your cross-functional team to think boldly and channel that energy into concrete action.
- Anticipate and remove obstacles that slow down or prevent us from delivering on operational, product and program objectives
- Build, lead, and grow a high performing team of stellar Product Managers
- Be incredibly truth-seeking. Partner closely with Uber's mobility and delivery businesses on deep-dive strategic analyses of key business trends, competitive insights, and customer segments. Collect whatever data and research insights are necessary to inform better investment decisions and product iteration by soliciting and embracing critical feedback
- Collaborate with Business Development to evaluate and implement vital data acquisition partnerships globally

**What You’ll Need**

- Ph.D., M.S. or Bachelors degree in Math, Economics, Bioinformatics, Statistics, Engineering, Computer Science, or other quantitative fields
- Minimum of 10 years of experience with 5 years of experience leader other leaders
- Product Experience: 10+ years of product management experience, with a track record of delivering highly successful and innovative 0-to-1 products

**Bonus Points If**

- Experience working on large-scope advertiser experience or overall advertising optimization initiatives
- Broad experience building and leading product teams, ideally in a complex, global, rapidly evolving environment
- Data-savvy - you find a way to get the data you need and whip it into an insightful story. You know how to use this data to make decisions without getting stuck in analysis paralysis
- Technically proficient - you have collaborated with engineers in developing the technical architecture of the products you have built
- Strategic - you can craft a coherent product vision, multi-year strategy and quarterly roadmap that your team and the business rallies behind
- Strong business judgment; you are data-savvy, highly analytical, and understand the impact of business decisions on the P&L
- Strategic problem solver; you’ve demonstrated an ability to identify important long-term trends and opportunities and translate those to meaningful insights and product priorities
- Consistent track record of linking product development issues to broader business and operational goals, dealing with complex projects and meeting conflicting prioritization and resourcing demands
- High standard for execution; able to effectively drive the roadmap for a large team of data scientists, engineers, and cross-functional partners in a  matrixed organization
- Experience working closely with data science and engineering teams to build high profile data products
- Ability to drive and empower multi-functional teams while excelling and thriving in a fast-paced, fluid, collaborative environment
- Possess a passion for excellence with the ability to inspire others to the highest standards through leading by example
- Exceptional communication and partner management skills, including with C-level executives. You build high-trust relationships across verticals, functions and geographies
- Excellent written and verbal communication skills, especially in describing product management concepts to technical and non-technical audiences
- Committed to attracting and retaining the brightest minds from all backgrounds, while cultivating the power of a diverse organization
- Impeccable judgment, integrity, and ability to set an ethical example
- Experience in strategy consulting, investment banking, or revenue management is a plus

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer, Deployment Engine
jobs.description:
**About the Role**

Our team is designing and building the Unified Deployment Engine, a system responsible for orchestrating the safe rollout of changes throughout all 5.000+ stateless services, 40+ Stateful Technologies (MySQL, Schemaless, Cassandra, etc), OSS K8s operators, thousands of configurations, all changes that support and power the entire Uber product.

Our platform is designed to enforce rollout policies, gather signals and enable lockdowns, ensuring that changes are rolled out incrementally, safely and reverted if signals suggest a potential issue.

The scale we operate is significant:

1.  5000 microservices deployed 750,000 times weekly
2.  25 storage technologies across 3.8 million containers, running on over 100,000 hosts

Our work directly impacts operational excellence, developer velocity, and overall system reliability at a global scale. Reliability is of the utmost importance. Our systems impact daily 33M+ Uber trips.

If you're passionate about building robust, scalable infrastructure, this is your opportunity to shape the future of Uber’s Core Infrastructure.

If this is a space that excites you and you have the appetite to build a best in class Deployment platform, we want you in the team!

For inspiration, read our related blog posts:

1. [https://www.uber.com/en-DK/blog/odin-stateful-platform/](https://www.uber.com/en-DK/blog/odin-stateful-platform/)
2. [https://www.uber.com/en-DK/blog/the-accounter/](https://www.uber.com/en-DK/blog/the-accounter/)
3. [https://www.uber.com/en-DK/blog/continuous-deployment](https://www.uber.com/en-DK/blog/continuous-deployment/)
4. [https://www.uber.com/en-DK/blog/controlling-the-rollout-of-large-scale-monorepo-changes/](https://www.uber.com/en-DK/blog/controlling-the-rollout-of-large-scale-monorepo-changes/)

**What You Will Do**

1. Build elegant backend platform components for high-throughput, low-latency distributed systems.
2. Build the deployment system for safe deployment of open source k8s operators.
3. Establishing a common model for incremental rollouts, enabling higher-order reasoning for automated decision-making, and ensuring critical safety features like rollbacks;
4. Lead and collaborate with team members to maintain system health, ensure code hygiene, refactor, and enhance system robustness and resilience.
5. Promote best practices in code health, testing, and maintainability.
6. Work with motivated and curious teammates in a fast-paced, collaborative environment.

**What You Will Need / Bonus Points**

Basic Qualifications

1. **Coding Skills**: Proficient in writing clean, well tested and elegant code.
2. **Architecture**: Understanding of distributed systems architecture, including consensus, convergence, data consistency, and performance/efficiency constructs. Ability to identify and resolve performance and scalability issues.
3. **Experience**: Proven experience building large-scale distributed systems with landed impact.
4. **Project Management**: Ability to work independently and lead projects, from scoping requirements to launch.
5. **Continuous Learning**: Strong desire to learn, grow, and build best-in-class systems.

Preferred Qualifications

1. **Solution Design**: Lead the design of reliable solutions for business use cases in highly distributed systems.
2. **Software Engineering: experience with the k8s ecosystem and infrastructure systems;**
3. **Problem Solving**: Ability to identify and resolve performance and scalability issues within their team.
4. **Implementation**: Implement solutions in Go, focusing on clean, readable code with unit and integration test coverage, and running it in production.
5. **Communication**: Effective communication and collaboration skills, be a strong team player.

jobs.description:
The DACH Mobility team drives Uber’s growth, profitability, and innovation across Germany, Austria, and Switzerland. jobs.description:
**About the Role**

The Delivery Logistics team builds real-world technology that powers our global marketplace. Our team of scientists works on diverse problems, including building real-time backend matching systems, creating new delightful user experiences, and serving predictions used for decision making across the marketplace. As a Science Manager, you will play a pivotal role in in leading a high-visibility, high-impact team.

**What You Will Do**

- Lead a team of Scientists, including growing and mentoring your team members.
- Use data to understand product performance and to identify improvement opportunities and define product/team roadmaps.
- Design and execute product experiments and non-experimental measurement strategies and interpret the results to draw detailed and actionable conclusions.
- Collaborate with Engineering and Product leads to drive end-to-end development.
- Present findings to senior leadership to inform business decisions.

\-\-\-\- Basic Qualifications ----

- Ph.D., M.S. or Bachelors degree in Statistics, Economics, Mathematics, Operations Research, or other quantitative fields.
- Minimum 6 years of industry experience as a Scientist or equivalent (4+ years if holding a Ph.D. degree).
- Minimum 1 year of experience in managing a team of Scientists.
- Knowledge of underlying mathematical foundations of statistics, machine learning, optimization, economics, experimental design, and analytics.
- Experienced in partnering with cross-functional stakeholders to execute decisions.
- Ability to use Python to work efficiently at scale with large data sets.
- Proficiency in SQL.

\-\-\-\- Preferred Qualifications ----

- Ph.D. or equivalent in Statistics, Economics, Mathematics, Operations Research, or other quantitative fields.
- 8+ years of industry experience as a Scientist or equivalent (6+ years if holding a Ph.D. degree).
- 2+ years of experience in managing a team of Scientists with strong leadership skills.
- Demonstrated expertise in the marketplace domain.

jobs.title: Sr. Product Manager Uber Eats
jobs.description:
**About the Role**

Part of the Merchant team within the Uber Eats delivery marketplace.

Lead a cross-functional team of engineers, designers, data science, product operations, and regional operations to ship best-in-class Merchant Experiences

Form a strong vision and roadmap for a particular part of the merchant journey and sell that vision internally to cross-functional stakeholders as well as to the leadership.

**What the Candidate Will Need / Bonus Points**

This team is responsible for building Enterprise-grade products for highly scaled merchants who work with Uber for online food delivery. This role plays a critical part in improving Merchant outcomes by helping them gain maximum value from the products we build and realize their full potential on the food delivery marketplace. This is a global Product role and serves all 25+ geographies where Uber Eats operates.

1. Internalize and deeply understand Uber's mission and strategies, and use these to define and distill the mission and objectives for your specific teams
2. Understand the needs of our merchants, consumers, and the business to define the vision, strategy, and roadmap
3. Collaborate with market-facing and engineering teams to address business needs with bar-raising product features.
4. Monitor and measure launched products and feed insights into the product development process.
5. Communicate product plans, benefits, and results to a broad spectrum of audiences, from internal users to leadership teams
6. Work closely with engineering, design, data science, and lines of businesses to figure out features to build next
7. Ensure synchronization with other teams across the Merchant portfolio
8. Support leadership and stakeholders with strategic inputs on product enhancements and contribute to cross-team initiatives

**\-\-\-\- Basic Qualifications ----**

01. 5+ years of product management experience delivering highly successful and innovative products with your fingerprints all over them -- and you're deeply proud of what you've accomplished
02. Empathy: For your cross-functional team, for your stakeholders and their goals, and most importantly, for the merchants, you create these experiences for
03. Ability to structure thinking to translate complex problems into simplified next steps
04. Never-ending ability to grow & learn and adapt your thinking to a fast-paced environment
05. Grittiness: You never hesitate to roll up your sleeves and tackle something hands-on
06. Tech Savviness: Ability to understand & translate sophisticated technical concepts across cross-functional teams and to simplify key takeaways for executives
07. Understanding of UX best practices: Proven ability to deliver top-class end-customer experiences
08. Excellent written and verbal communication skills
09. Strong analytical and quantitative skills with the ability to use data and metrics to justify requirements and features and drive the management of product
10. Great attention to detail

**\-\-\-\- Preferred Qualifications ----**

1. Proven track record of building and shipping Products in a tier-1 Product company
2. Experience working on global products and geographically dispersed teams
3. Experience in analyzing complex business problems and developing effective product strategies to solve them

jobs.description:
**About the Role**

As Uber continues to expand its services and technologies globally, the **Business Development team** is seeking a **highly strategic and results-driven dealmaker** to grow strategic product partnerships designed to drive scale with our most valuable merchant and corporate partners.

In this role, you will be responsible for both shaping the strategy and leading the execution of partnerships that span across sectors, including **Uber Eats, Uber Direct, Uber for Business,** and other key verticals to drive Uber’s growth and innovation.

**What You’ll Do:**

- **Identify and evaluate strategic partnership opportunities** across various sectors, with a focus on high-impact collaborations that drive business growth.
- **Lead end-to-end partnership processes**, from initial outreach and business case development to contract negotiations and implementation.
- Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams— **Corporate Development**, **Product, Finance, Compliance, Policy, Marketing, Operations, Legal & Engineering**—to ensure partnership strategies align with overall business goals and drive value.
- Develop and present **strategic deal analytics, competitive research, and market insights** to guide business decision-making and shape partnership strategies.
- Support and contribute to the overall **BD team’s efforts** by driving operational excellence and assisting in key deals or projects that require team collaboration.
- **Own and cultivate partnerships** that you will manage independently, ensuring long-term success through proactive relationship management and performance monitoring.
- **Demonstrate excellent communication skills across all channels** (written, verbal, presentations, and negotiations) to effectively influence stakeholders and secure alignment at all levels of the organization.
- **Be results-driven and comfortable navigating ambiguity**, proactively bringing clarity and structure to complex or undefined situations to drive tangible outcomes.
- **Confidently engage with senior internal and external executives**, building strong relationships and representing Uber’s strategic interests with key decision-makers.
- **Be technically savvy**, with a working knowledge of **API integrations** and the ability to collaborate effectively with engineering and product teams to ensure seamless integration of partnerships.
- **Enjoy problem-solving and finding joy in puzzles**, bringing creativity and an inquisitive mindset to unravel complex challenges, while working with **large, cross-functional teams** in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.

**Basic Qualifications**

- 7+ years of experience, ideally in business development, which may include management consulting, public-private partnerships, government affairs, or commercial development.
- Bachelor's Degree required.
- Working knowledge of API integrations.

**Preferred Qualifications**

- 10+ years of business development experience.
- Proactive, self-directed, and adaptable: thrives in fast-paced, ambiguous environments.
- Analytical mindset with a proven ability to leverage insights and data to inform strategic decision-making.
- Experience with restaurants and/or restaurant technology is a bonus!
- Experience working with enterprise platform partners and understanding of partner-centric go-to-market approach.
- Experience with establishing, maintaining, and leveraging C-level relationships at partner companies.
- Proven track record of building and executing commercial deals and complex partnerships.
- Ability to fuse business, strategy, finance, and legal concepts to lead complex, multi-faceted deals.
- A track record of complex problem solving, attention to detail, and delivering results cross-functionally.
- Clear communicator, team orientated, and willing to take initiative while thinking two steps ahead.
- Inquisitiveness, along with the ability to spot issues, get to the heart of a matter, and articulate plans to address them.
- Passionate about your work and a desire to have a big impact.

- Embody the highest standards of integrity, ethics and accountability.
- Enthusiasm about Uber and our mission!

jobs.title: Account Representative, Restaurants
jobs.description:
Account Representatives at Uber Eats bring the best local and regional small and medium restaurants to the Uber Eats platform. Who are we looking for? Someone who is natural at selling and knows the best local restaurants, passionate about food and Uber, and enjoys negotiating.

In this role you will lead the full sales cycle and sign partnerships with top local restaurants while being a champion for the Uber and Uber Eats brands. Your success in this role is measured by achieving and exceeding your monthly quota and proactively building your pipeline by managing and hitting the weekly metrics (cold-calls, emails, and field appointments).

**What You'll  Do**

1\. Own and manage a pipeline of local small and medium restaurants to sign new partnerships in your geographic region with a mix of cold-calling (at least 50 dials per day) and in-person meetings

2\. Create a great first-impression and act as an ambassador of Uber Eats to develop long-term partnerships and clearly communicate the value of Uber

3\. Manage contract negotiation to establish the foundation of a strong working relationship with our restaurant partners, including sustainable economics for both parties

4\. Help us identify and build standard processes and collaborate with the Account Management team to support a seamless onboarding experience for each new restaurant partner

5\. Proactively maintain communication channels with prospects via phone, email, and face-to-face meetings

**About the Role**

The Account Representative role is a great opportunity to demonstrate your sales skills and abilities in order to expand the number of merchants that work with Uber Eats. Who are we looking for? Someone who is natural at selling and knows where the best eats are around town, passionate about food and Uber, and enjoys negotiating to build the best partnerships. The primary focus will be bringing on new small-and-medium sized merchants (not necessarily only restaurants) that fit our partnership criteria, and you’ll use your skills in emailing, cold-calling, and driving internal processes to set up our partnerships for success.

**What You'll Do**

1\. Leverage prospecting skills and relationships to build partnerships with merchants in your geographic region

2\. Manage contract negotiations aimed at establishing the foundation of a strong working relationship with our merchants, including sustainable economics for both parties

3\. Clearly communicate the value of Uber and its newest products to prospects

4\. Achieve and consistently exceed monthly targets

5\. Partner with our Operations and Account Managers to smoothly activate the best merchants

6\. Help us identify and build best practices

7\. Develop long-term relationships with key in-region partners

8\. Act as an ambassador of Uber Eats' mission, brand, and product

9\. Proactively maintain communication channels with prospects via email, phone, and face-to-face meetings

**Basic Qualifications**

1\. At least 1 year of experience in sales, operations, account management, or similar functions

Preferred Qualifications

1\. Proficiency in Salesforce

2\. Outstanding work ethic and attention to detail

3\. Willingness to roll up your sleeves, and get in the weeds with our highest value partners

4\. Excellent communication and sales skills

5\. Strong critical thinking ability

For Miami, FL-based roles: The base hourly rate amount for this role is USD$24.75 per hour.

jobs.title: Lead Product Designer, Rider Experience
locations: New York, New York, United States
jobs.location: New York, New York, United States
jobs.description:
**About the Role**

The Rider Design team is looking for a Lead Product Designer to craft thoughtful, scalable experiences to help people go anywhere and get anything.

As a designer on the Rider team, you will create intuitive, inclusive, and delightful experiences for people around the world. Your work will span interaction, systems, and service design, grounded in a human-centered process that balances user needs, business goals, and technical possibilities. You will need to consider modular frameworks when designing for different product offerings, geographies, and users in the context of a complex multi-sided marketplace. You will collaborate with engineers, product managers, researchers, data scientists and fellow designers who care deeply about quality and speed.

**What You Will Do**

- **Craft:** Deliver designs that are innovative and elegant, buildable and scalable, and are thoroughly documented. Have a strong understanding of business, data, and engineering requirements, and create experiences that deliver customer value.
- **Scope:** Work on projects of all sizes, from problems that are well-known to those more complex and conceptual, while leading a roadmap in your product area
- **Process:** Build a deep understanding of the users you are designing for through data and research, lead the end-to-end design process, solicit and incorporate feedback from experts, translate your designs to build with engineers, and work flexibly with a variety of teams. Design at all levels of fidelity and practice good judgment on making tradeoffs.
- **Efficiency:** Prioritize and manage your time efficiently, operate with high autonomy, and easily adapt to challenges.
- **Communication:** Communicate with clarity and persuasiveness, and effectively present your work and rationale to all the relevant stakeholders. Proactively communicate with your team and manager, facilitate design sessions, and collaborate with other designers. Maintain honest and trusting relationships with your team.

**Basic Qualifications**

- 8+ years of experience building products for mobile apps, tablets, and web interfaces
- A portfolio showing your high-quality, thoughtful UI and UX work

**Preferred Qualifications**

- A degree in HCI, Graphic Design, or a related field
- Highly proficient in storytelling and prototyping
- Familiarity with designing across physical, digital, and spatial touchpoints, including geospatial computing and location-aware experiences
- Experience working with user researchers and data scientists
- Experience designing with large-scale design systems and frameworks
- Proficiency with Figma or similar tools and prototyping methods
- Ability to strongly articulate your design work and rationale to your peers and cross-functional team

jobs.title: Sales Team Leader, Uber Eats - France
jobs.description:
## About the Role

Whether it’s a sandwich, a burrito, or groceries, the Uber Eats team builds the technology that connects people to what they want—when and where they want it. At the frontline of this mission, our Sales Full Cycle (Account Executives – AEs) and Sales Operations teams bring new merchant partners onto the platform and help them grow with Uber Eats.

As an **Account Executive Manager**, you’ll play a pivotal role in shaping the future of Uber Eats in your market. Leading a team of around 8 AEs, you’ll be responsible for building high-performing teams, scaling best-in-class sales operations, and ensuring merchants, earners, and users enjoy an outstanding experience.

You’ll partner closely with senior leadership to define and deliver commercial strategy, while empowering your team with the tools, coaching, and guidance to consistently exceed targets. This is a unique opportunity to step into a leadership role where your impact will be visible at both a market and regional level.

Join a company where the **Commercial function is at the heart of our strategy**, with dedicated resources, strong cross-functional support, and a relentless drive for performance.

## What You’ll Do

- Lead, inspire, and develop a team of Account Executives across key markets, ensuring alignment with current business priorities.

- Foster strong communication and collaboration between your team and cross-functional stakeholders (Sales Operations, Market Launchers, Sales Enablement, and City Operations).

- Ensure your team builds and maintains healthy pipelines, consistently aligned with business goals.

- Monitor, evaluate, and elevate team performance, driving quota achievement and commercial excellence.

- Mentor and coach AEs through regular 1:1s and team sessions, providing actionable feedback and instilling best practices.

- Recognize and amplify strengths while addressing development areas to accelerate growth.

- Partner with operations teams to analyze performance, identify opportunities, and optimize sales processes and programs.

- Champion a culture of collaboration, ownership, and continuous learning that keeps engagement and performance high.


## Qualifications

- 3–4 years of B2B sales experience, ideally in high-volume, lead generation, or outbound prospecting environments.

- 2+ years of proven success leading and scaling full-cycle sales teams with strong quota attainment.

- Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent professional experience.

- Proficiency with sales methodologies and CRM tools (e.g., Salesforce).

- Demonstrated ability to build and optimize sales processes.

- Strong analytical, coaching, and communication skills to drive performance at scale.

- Experience leading teams through change in fast-paced, evolving environments.

jobs.description:
**About the Role**

Uber Eats is looking for a strategic Growth leader to join our dynamic and fast-paced team. As a Sr Product Manager, you will be responsible for identifying and executing cross-platform opportunities to convert Uber Riders into Uber Eats customers. You’ll drive the end-to-end strategy and roadmap to deepen engagement across the Uber ecosystem—retaining these users, increasing order frequency, and enhancing the overall user experience. You’ll partner closely with teams across Rides and Eats to create seamless, relevant, and high-impact experiences that unlock the full potential of Uber’s multi-platform user base.

In this role, you’ll work closely with Product Design, Data Science, Engineering, Strategy & Ops, and other partners across Uber's businesses and geographies. You will lead with deep customer compassion, relying on data and UXR to make informed decisions grounded in strong product intuition.

**What the Candidate Will Do**

1. Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including Design, Data Science, Engineering and Ops, on both Rides and Eats, to identify growth opportunities, develop product initiatives, and implement data-driven experiments to improve key growth metrics
2. Effectively present and communicate strategy, implementation, and growth plans to various collaborators ranging from business audiences to senior leadership
3. Distill the vision and strategy for the team to generate enthusiasm across cross-functional partners and executive leadership
4. Anticipate and remove obstacles that slow down or prevent us from delivering on operational, product, and program objectives

**Basic Qualifications**

1. 5+ years of Product Management experience delivering highly successful and innovative products with your fingerprints all over them. You should be familiar with systems thinking, analytics and experiment design, and have a solid understanding of software development processes and concepts.
2. Bachelors degree in Computer Science or similar.
3. Mearsurable growth experience and a track record of delivering highly successful and innovative 0-to-1 products.
4. Entrepreneurial experience building and leading businesses, including ownership and optimization of business performance metrics.
5. Experience managing and aligning stakeholders on a global scale.

**Preferred Qualifications**

1. A true passion for Uber’s mission, our products, and the company’s hybrid technology/operations nature.
2. Extensive experience setting and delivering on a strategy you crafted, where you were accountable for the outcomes.
3. You have a knack for taking on complex product challenges and finding elegant solutions that are delightfully simple for our users.
4. You are biased toward action, a great collaborator, a master disambiguator/simplifier, and constantly pushing toward clarity and delivery. You never hesitate to roll up your sleeves and tackle something hands-on.
5. From your own contributions to the people you work with, to the products you work on, you have a never-ending desire to grow and learn.

jobs.title: Staff Scientist, Eats Growth
locations: New York, New York, United States
jobs.location: New York, New York, United States
jobs.description:
**About the Role**

Uber Eats is on a mission to redefine how people discover and enjoy food — and the Growth team is at the heart of that journey. We incubate and scale new tactics for acquiring, engaging, and retaining users across the Uber Eats and Uber Rides apps.

As a Staff Scientist on the team, you’ll play a pivotal role in shaping the user acquisition roadmap. You’ll analyze data across the Uber ecosystem to identify new growth opportunities, optimize conversion funnels, and run experiments to validate new acquisition tactics — from integrations with the Uber Rides app to third-party ecosystems like Instacart. This is a highly visible, cross-functional role where you'll combine technical expertise with product intuition to shape Uber’s platform strategy.

**What You'll Do**

- Design, execute, and analyze large-scale experiments within the Uber Eats and Uber Rides apps.
- Perform analytical deep dives to explore topics including conversion funnels, shopping journeys, personalization & ranking, and user retention.
- Design frameworks for optimizing tradeoffs across competing business objectives to maximize platform growth.
- Collaborate with Product, Engineering, Design, and other cross-functional partners to understand user behavior and guide future product strategy.
- Present findings and recommendations to senior technical and business leaders.

**Basic Qualifications**

- Ph.D., M.S., or Bachelors degree in Statistics, Economics, Operations Research, or other quantitative fields.
- Minimum 5 years of industry experience as a Data Scientist or equivalent role (2+ if holding a Ph.D.)
- Expertise in experimental design and statistical analysis for A/B testing and causal inference.
- Proficiency in SQL & Python for exploratory data analysis and modeling.
- Strong analytical skills, with experience extracting user behavior insights from large datasets.
- Experience with data visualization and dashboarding tools (e.g., Tableau, Matplotlib).

**Preferred Qualifications**

- 6+ years of industry experience, particularly in growth, product, or consumer analytics.
- Proficiency in causal inference, funnel optimization, user segmentation, or lifetime value forecasting.
- Experience in algorithm prototyping and development.
- Exceptional communication skills across technical, non-technical, and executive audiences.
- Prior experience working on a consumer app or a growth team.

jobs.title: Manager II, Applications Developer, FinTech AI
jobs.description:
**About the Role**

We are seeking a **Manager II, FinTech AI Application Development (L5B)** to join Uber’s FinTech team. This role sits at the intersection of finance and AI innovation, driving how generative AI, machine learning, and automation reshape Finance and Accounting at Uber.

This position emphasizes **leadership, product vision, and domain expertise**, while also valuing the ability to engage in technical exploration when appropriate. You will define the roadmap for AI in Finance, guide teams in exploring high-value use cases, and partner closely with stakeholders across Finance, Accounting, Engineering, and Uber’s central AI teams to ensure scalable, impactful adoption of AI solutions.

This is a high-visibility role for a leader who understands both **enterprise finance systems and emerging AI technologies**, and who can bridge technical possibilities with business priorities.

**What You'll Do**

#### **AI Strategy & Roadmap**

1. Own and drive the AI roadmap for Finance and Accounting, in partnership with Finance leadership.
2. Establish structured frameworks for identifying, evaluating, and prioritizing AI opportunities based on ROI, scalability, and risk.
3. Stay ahead of AI and ML advancements, translating them into practical applications for Finance and Accounting.

#### **Stakeholder Partnership**

1. Act as the primary liaison between Finance/Accounting and Engineering, ensuring AI initiatives align with business goals.
2. Champion AI adoption across Finance by influencing stakeholders, shaping narratives, and demonstrating value.
3. Partner with central AI platform teams to leverage infrastructure, tools, and best practices.

#### **Leadership & Execution**

1. Manage and mentor a small but growing AI-focused team, fostering a culture of innovation and learning.
2. Guide the design and validation of AI proofs-of-concept (developed by technical contributors), ensuring alignment with Finance needs.
3. Engage with technical details as needed to evaluate approaches and ensure sound design.
4. Oversee the transition of successful POCs into production through close collaboration with Engineering.
5. Track adoption, measure impact, and report outcomes to senior leadership.

**Basic Qualifications**

1. Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Finance, Accounting, Computer Science, Data Science, or related field.
2. Strong knowledge of enterprise finance platforms (e.g., Oracle EPM, SAP, data warehouses) and finance workflows.
3. Demonstrated ability to lead cross-functional programs and influence senior stakeholders.

**Preferred Qualifications**

1. 10+ years of professional experience, including **5+ years in Finance/Accounting systems, processes, or technology**.
2. At least 2+ years of direct experience with AI/ML concepts, including generative AI, LLMs, or related technologies.
3. CPA, CFA, or advanced degree in Finance, Accounting, or Data Science.
4. Prior experience delivering AI/ML solutions in Finance or Accounting contexts.
5. Familiarity with modern AI tools and techniques (e.g., prompt engineering, RAG, synthetic data).
6. Excellent communication and storytelling skills to translate technical concepts for Finance leaders.
7. Experience managing and mentoring technical teams.

For San Francisco, CA-based roles: The base salary range for this role is USD$211,000 per year - USD$234,000 per year.

jobs.title: Senior Staff Engineer - Autonomous Vehicle Platform
jobs.description:
**About the Role**

The **Autonomous Mobility & Delivery (AM&D)** team is leading Uber’s autonomous future across Rides and Eats. As we move toward a world where autonomous and human-driven vehicles coexist, we're building a hybrid marketplace that seamlessly integrates AVs — ensuring reliability, efficiency, and massive scale.

Our work touches nearly every part of Uber. Over the past year, we have partnered with top Autonomous Vehicle OEMs to successfully bring AVs onto our Mobility and Delivery platforms. And we are just getting started. As we gear up for the next wave of growth, we are looking for a **Senior Staff Engineer** to help drive the vision and platform strategy that will power Uber’s autonomous future.

In this role, you will help design and scale the autonomous platform — building a foundation for faster OEM integrations, strengthening our simulation capabilities, and leveling up our data pipelines and reporting systems.

**What You Will Do**

- **Set the architectural vision:** Define and drive the technical direction for the AM&D platform, partnering closely with product and business leaders to create real impact for Uber and our customers.

- **Lead major platform initiatives:** Own and scale critical systems across the API Gateway, Simulation Platform, and Data Pipelines & Reporting.

- **Mentor and inspire:** Provide technical leadership and coaching to a high-performing team of engineers, helping foster an innovative and collaborative culture.

- **Build for scale and reliability:** Design, develop, and deploy platform components that are resilient, extensible, and easily integrated across multiple Uber surfaces.

- **Collaborate across Uber:** Work with cross-functional and cross-company teams to ensure our autonomous platform aligns with Uber’s broader marketplace and product strategies.


**Basic Qualifications**

- PhD or equivalent in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics or related field **AND** 4-years full-time Software Engineering work experience **OR** 7-years full-time Software Engineering work experience, **WHICH INCLUDES** 4-years total technical software engineering experience in one or more of the following areas:


  - Programming language (e.g. C, C++, Java, Python, or Go)
  - _Note the 4-years total of specialized software engineering experience may have been gained through education and full-time work experience, additional training, coursework, research, or similar (OR some combination of these).  The years of specialized experience are not necessarily in addition to the years of Education & full-time work experience indicated._
- Past experience in developing large-scale, distributed systems
- Strong understanding of technical architecture, system design, and problem solving acuity for sophisticated technical challenges
- Proven track record of leading and scaling high-impact product platform initiatives. Strong technical expertise with deep knowledge of platform architecture, microservices, and best practices for building resilient, scalable systems
- Demonstrated ability to work with cross-functional partners to drive business outcomes through a platform approach

**Preferred Qualifications**

- Experience in building API platforms, data platforms, simulation or other foundational product platforms that serve multiple product teams
- Experience in optimizing multiple-sided marketplace
- Familiarity with Autonomous or Mobility or Delivery Systems, and understand challenges unique to the autonomous or mobility or delivery industries
- Passionate about shaping the future of autonomous delivery and driving innovation in the industry

jobs.title: Senior Staff Engineer - Earner Financials
jobs.description:
**About the Role**

The Earner Financials group is a foundational part of Uber’s Earner organization. Our mission is to enable Uber to be the most reliable and rewarding earnings platform for drivers and couriers across the globe. This organization spans four mission-critical verticals:

1. **Earnings**: To provide earners with clear, consistent, and easily accessible data and visibility into their earnings, performance metrics, and financial status. Help drivers understand their earnings, and strategize on mechanisms to improve their earnings.
2. **Benefits**: A growing portfolio of benefits such as Earning Guarantees, Accrual Benefits and 3rd Party Benefits that Uber provides to the gig workers.
3. **Subscription**: To offer earner-facing subscription products, such as Drive Pass which provide benefits like 0% service fees, and enable earners to evaluate the effectiveness of their subscription through relevant metrics.
4. **Tipping**: Experiences that foster appreciation from riders and eaters to earners.

We are seeking a Senior Staff Engineer (L6) to lead the technical direction and architecture across all verticals in the Earner Financials space. You will be the technical voice for systems that are under intense regulatory scrutiny, responsible for ensuring absolute accuracy, auditability, compliance, and resilience. You’ll be driving engineering direction in one of the most sensitive and high-stakes domains at Uber. As a Senior Staff Engineer, you will be directly responsible for multiple projects from inception to production readiness and will define and deliver on the goals and technical direction within the organization with a sense of urgency.  You will be expected to foresee architectural problems and opportunities the organization will face a year out and work with engineering leadership to address them proactively.

**What the Candidate Will Need / Bonus Points**

**\-\-\-\- What the Candidate Will Do ----**

- **Architect the future** of Earner Financial systems: designing reliable, scalable, and extensible financial platforms that ensure transactional integrity, compliance with local/global regulations, and real-time transparency.
- **Own and drive the long-term technical strategy** across Earner Financials verticals, identifying systemic opportunities and preempting architectural risks before they become bottlenecks.
- **Lead cross-functional efforts** in collaboration with engineering managers, engineering leads, data science, product design, product management, legal, policy and operations teams to translate regulatory requirements and business rules into scalable engineering solutions.
- **Define and raise engineering standards** in observability, reliability, SLOs, incident response, testing, and security . Ensuring mission-critical systems remain performant and correct under all conditions.
- **Mentor, coach, and multiply**: proactively mentor senior engineers and influence teams across the broader Earner organization, fostering a culture of simplicity, technical rigor, and business alignment.
- **Champion compliance and audit readiness** by embedding regulatory guarantees into the core architecture of our financial stack.
- **Drive execution of large-scale, multi-quarter projects**, directly influencing technical roadmaps across multiple engineering teams.
- **Consistently write and document high-quality code** to solve strategically important problems; improve, role model, and promote coding best practices; lead organization-wide development and adoption of key frameworks.

**\-\-\-\- Basic Qualifications ----**

- 12+ years of software engineering experience, with significant tenure in architecting **large-scale distributed systems**.
- Deep expertise in designing **transactional systems** that are correct, auditable, and resilient under regulatory requirements.
- Deep understanding of **software engineering principles** and **backend technologies** (e.g., Java, Go).
- Track record of leading **cross-org technical strategies**, defining architectural vision, and delivering large, complex systems into production.
- Experience leading org-wide **reliability** and **observability** initiatives, including definition and management of SLOs, SLIs, and error budgets.
- Excellent **communication skills**: able to translate complex technical concepts to diverse stakeholders, including non-engineering audiences.
- Demonstrated ability to lead **org-wide engineering projects** through all lifecycle stages, including idea inception, stakeholder engagement, collaboration, requirements gathering, design, balancing priorities, implementation, productionization, and operations.

**\-\-\-\- Preferred Qualifications ----**

- Experience working in or adjacent to compliance-heavy domains (e.g., payments, banking, insurance, or healthcare).
- Proven history of passing regulatory audits or operating under strict financial controls (e.g., SOX, SOC2, FedRamp, PCI-DSS, GDPR).
- Contributions to internal engineering frameworks or external technical communities.
- Demonstrated success in engineering leadership within multi-stakeholder environments.
- Experience in defining and promoting architecture best practices within an organization.

**\-\-\-\- Bonus / Nice to Have ----**

- Familiarity with Generative AI, LLMs, or ML-based infrastructure: especially applications in compliance automation, anomaly detection, or predictive analytics.
- Hands-on experience integrating AI/ML systems in financial applications (e.g., fraud detection, adaptive pricing, earnings prediction, personalized earnings insights).
- Deep interest in leveraging AI responsibly in regulated environments.

jobs.title: Staff Machine Learning Engineer - Marketplace Pricing
locations: New York, New York, United States
jobs.location: New York, New York, United States
jobs.description:
**About the Role**

Uber’s Marketplace is at the heart of Uber’s business and the Dynamic Supply Pricing (DSP) team develops the models, algorithms, signals, and large-scale distributed systems that power real-time driver pricing for billions of rides. Engineers on the team work on cutting-edge marketplace ML problems and real-time multi-objective optimizations serving 1M+ predictions/second. They regularly present $1B+ opportunities to executive stakeholders and receive close mentorship from the most senior engineers within the organization, setting you up for fast-tracked career growth and the opportunity to learn from experienced technical leaders.

We are looking for exceptional ML engineers with a track record of extraordinary impact and with a passion for building large-scale systems that optimize multi-sided real-time marketplaces. In this role, you will lead the design, development, and productionization of advanced ML models and pricing algorithms, covering deep learning, causal modeling, and reinforcement learning. You will work with engineers, product managers, and scientists to set the team’s technical direction and solve some of Uber’s most challenging and most complex business problems in order to provide earnings opportunities for millions of drivers worldwide.

**What You Will Do**

- Drive technical strategy and roadmap ownership over a 1+ year horizon and own the implementation, including platform-level architecture decisions, executive communication and alignment, technical mentorship, and cross-team technical influence
- Lead the design, development, and productionization of end-to-end ML solutions for large-scale distributed systems serving billions of trips
- Develop novel pricing approaches for online marketplaces combining machine learning, algorithmic game theory, and optimization to provide earnings opportunities for millions of drivers
- Work with a team of engineers, product managers, and scientists to design and deliver high-impact technical solutions to complex business problems

**Basic Qualifications**

- Ph.D., M.S. or Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Machine Learning, or Operations Research, or equivalent technical background with exceptional demonstrated impact
- 6+ years experience leading the development and deployment of ML models and optimization algorithms in large-scale production environments at top-tier ML companies (e.g. 1M+ predictions/sec or 100M+ users). Track record of delivering outstanding business impact over multiple quarters
- Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, Scala, Java, or Go
- Proficiency with large-scale data systems (e.g. Spark, Ray), real-time processing (e.g. Flink), and microservices architectures
- Proficiency in the development, training, productionization and monitoring of ML solutions at scale, ranging from offline pipelines to online serving and MLOps
- Experience in developing and deploying pricing algorithms for multi-sided real-time marketplaces with strategic agent behavior
- Deep understanding of modern ML algorithms (e.g. DNNs, multi-task models, transformers) and mathematical optimization (e.g. multi-objective, LP, convex optimization)

**Preferred Qualifications**

- Experience developing multi-year technical strategies and cross-team platform architecture, and proficiency owning technical roadmap and leading complex technical projects while substantially influencing the scope and output of others
- Track record of translating complex business problems into technical solutions and driving multi-functional projects across multiple teams
- Excellent communication skills to lead initiatives across multiple product areas and collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams
- Proficiency in reinforcement learning and causal machine learning

jobs.title: Group Product Manager, Grocery & Retail Advertising
locations: New York, New York, United States
jobs.location: New York, New York, United States
jobs.description:
**Group Product Manager, Grocery & Retail Ads**

**About the Role**

Uber Eats is expanding its mission to help consumers discover and purchase anything they need—and **grocery and retail are at the center of that growth**. Advertising is a critical lever in enabling merchants to scale and helping consumers find the right items at the right moment. We’re looking for a visionary and strategic product leader to shape the future of **grocery and retail advertising** across the Uber Eats ecosystem.

As a **Group Product Manager for Grocery & Retail Ads**, you will own the end-to-end ad experience for both shoppers and merchants. You will define how ads appear, how they perform, how they are measured, and how they contribute to a healthy marketplace that serves millions of customers each day. You’ll set long-term strategy, drive alignment across the Ads, Grocery, Retail, and Consumer organizations, and lead a team responsible for bringing that strategy to life.

You will collaborate deeply with Product Design, Data Science, Engineering, Ads Operations, Sales, UXR, and regional business teams. Your work will rely on rich shopper insights, merchant feedback, experimentation, and a strong understanding of ad systems. You’ll combine product intuition with analytical rigor to build an ads ecosystem that delivers value to merchants while creating a delightful and relevant experience for consumers.

This role requires an owner’s mindset, a high bar for quality, and the passion to build a world-class grocery and retail ads platform. **What the Candidate Will Do**

- **Own the end-to-end strategy for grocery & retail ads**, including sponsored listings, on-site ad formats, discovery surfaces, and placement opportunities across the Uber Eats app.
- **Identify, design, and launch new advertising surfaces and formats** that enhance shopper discovery while driving incremental value for grocery and retail merchants.
- **Partner with Ads Engineering, Data Science, and Applied ML** to improve ad ranking, targeting, bidding, and relevance models to ensure ads are high-quality and contextually useful.
- **Develop and maintain a multi-quarter roadmap** that advances the scalability, performance, and user experience of the grocery & retail ads ecosystem.
- **Lead a rigorous experimentation program** across ad placements, auction mechanics, creative formats, and bidding strategies to validate impact and strengthen marketplace quality.
- **Define and track core metrics for ads success**—including advertiser ROI, ad quality, shopper engagement, and revenue—and use them to guide decisions and prioritization.
- **Collaborate with Ads Sales and Merchant teams** to understand advertiser needs, improve onboarding and performance, and translate merchant insights into product direction.
- **Elevate the consumer ad experience** by ensuring ads are relevant, trustworthy, high-quality, and seamlessly integrated into the shopper journey.
- **Work cross-functionally with Design and UXR** to develop intuitive ad experiences that drive clarity, performance, and long-term trust.
- **Align teams across Ads, Grocery/Retail, Consumer, Marketplace, and regional operations** around a coherent ads vision and execution plan.
- **Identify and mitigate risks** across ad load, marketplace balance, consumer trust, compliance, and merchant performance.
- **Champion ads quality and integrity**, ensuring we scale monetization responsibly while maintaining an excellent consumer experience.

**Basic Qualifications**

- **8+ years of Product Management experience** delivering highly successful, user-facing products at scale.
- Experience owning and driving strategy for complex systems—preferably in ads, marketplaces, or multi-sided platforms.
- Strong analytical capabilities, including experiment design, metrics definition, and proficiency with data tools.
- Deep customer obsession and demonstrated ability to simplify complex problems into elegant, intuitive experiences.
- Proven success scaling products and owning business outcomes in high-growth environments.
- Experience leading cross-functional teams across multiple geographies.

**Preferred Qualifications**

- A **“Driver” mindset**—biased toward action, comfortable with ambiguity, and excellent at clarifying complexity.
- High standards for product quality, with strong attention to detail across UX, data accuracy, and execution.
- Ability to independently pull, analyze, and synthesize data to tell compelling stories and drive decision-making.
- Experience with **advertising ecosystems**, including sponsored listings, ranking models, auction dynamics, advertiser measurement, or performance optimization.
- Passion for building the future of grocery & retail commerce and contributing to Uber’s mission.
- A growth mindset and relentless desire to learn, improve, and push the product forward.

jobs.title: Director, Engineering - Marketplace
jobs.description:
**About the Team**

Uber’s Engineering team executes on the vision and builds the products for the future of urban mobility: deeply understanding our customers to solve their transportation needs with innovative technology. Engineering leaders at Uber move lightning fast to build, test, learn, and iterate, working in small teams that control their own destiny and own their own critical metrics. Leadership helps the vision become a reality and clears obstacles out of the way. Some of the brightest data scientists, designers, engineers, and marketers in the industry are here to build amazing products on top of leading-edge platforms for data, machine learning, and experimentation.

The products we build are used by millions of riders, drivers, eaters, restaurants, merchants and others to earn money for their families, and get around faster, easier, cheaper, and with less environmental impact.

**About the Role**

The Marketplace team is looking for a Director of Engineering to lead a talented team of 40 engineers and applied scientists based in the San Francisco Bay Area.  The team builds the tech and systems that span ML modeling, and optimization for driver pricing.

**What You’ll Do**

- Lead the team responsible for driver pricing & matching.  The role spans backend systems for pricing, offer generation, offer payments, ML models and algorithms, as well as the mobile/front-end surfaces for driver comprehension
- Build the long term vision and tech for driver pricing
- Collaborate closely with Data Science, Products, and Ops to drive and shape the technical direction, both in terms of systems and modeling frameworks
- Strategize and influence the product vision and roadmap in collaboration with the product and business team
- Build trust and foster a collaborative team culture and help grow the respective leaders in each of the focus areas
- Build a strong eng brand for driver pricing and be able to attract and retain talent
- Have an excellent executive presence to communicate the team’s vision/plan effectively and represent the engineering organization and POV in the overall Marketplace business group
- Translate the strategic roadmap into a practical execution plan with quarterly OKR’s
- Build an influential culture of engineering excellence maintaining the balance and right tradeoff for building products for speed and tech debt
- Set up processes to handle ad hoc support requests from customers, sales, and make sure the general execution cycle is not disturbed
- Develop an operational model to achieve operational excellence for Product metrics and Engineering metrics

**Basic Qualifications**

- Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience
- A minimum of 10 years proven experience building software across the stack (mobile, platform, data pipelining and ML) in product engineering
- A minimum of 7 years of management experience leading software engineering teams
- Experience leveraging optimization or machine learning in successful products

**Preferred Qualifications**

- Master’s degree in AI, ML, Data Science or a PhD in EE or CS
- Experience working with consumer facing products
- Experience with optimization and applied machine learning and the ability to think about statistical modeling problems and what the right formulations are
- Experience building scalable backend systems

For San Francisco, CA-based roles: The base salary range for this role is USD$284,000 per year - USD$315,500 per year.

jobs.description:
**About the Role**

Cadence is a modern open source microservice orchestration platform developed at Uber and adopted by many leading companies. It serves as the backbone for more than 1,000 Cadence domains at Uber, powering billions of executions each month. With a rapidly growing open source community, Cadence offers the opportunity to make an impact not just at the company level but across the industry.

We are seeking a software engineer with experience building highly scalable, high throughput, low latency, multi tenant backend systems. Beyond technical expertise, we are looking for someone passionate about open source, someone who listens to the community, helps organize meetups, and addresses community needs. In this role, you will lead a large backend team, shape standards for both the Cadence team and its community, and contribute to the growth of cutting edge distributed technology.

To get more information about Cadence you check our website ([https://cadenceworkflow.io/](https://cadenceworkflow.io/)), LinkedIn page ([https://www.linkedin.com/company/cadenceworkflow](https://www.linkedin.com/company/cadenceworkflow)) or YouTube channel ([https://www.youtube.com/@cadenceworkflow2989/videos](https://www.youtube.com/@cadenceworkflow2989/videos)).

**\-\-\-\- What the Candidate Will Do ----**

1. Contribute to an open source project used by many major companies
2. Write code to build new features to support more use cases
3. Develop and review design documents
4. Improve onboarding, observability and operability experiences for Cadence
5. Define standards for the processes used internally and externally

**\-\-\-\- Basic Qualifications ----**

1. Experience in team and technology leadership
2. Solid background in multiple programming languages, e.g. Go, Java or C++
3. Strong infrastructure experience. Experience in distributed systems and a good understanding of its fundamentals.
4. Great interpersonal skills, deep technical ability, and a portfolio of successful execution. You are open-minded to discuss various technical approaches and able to drive consensus across various stakeholders at Uber.
5. Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including the ability to gather requirements and draft detailed design documents.

jobs.title: Senior Product Manager - Fulfillment Platform
jobs.description:
**About the Role**

The Fulfillment platform is the foundation powering the logistics behind fulfilling user orders from any Uber app. It operates life cycles of orders, trips, drivers, eaters, and other user sessions when they get along with Uber. These interactions are real-time and high-scale with millions of concurrent Uber riders, drivers, eaters, and shoppers.

We seek a multifaceted Product Manager to help build our next generation of product discovery, planning, and order checkout platforms built on top of the Fulfillment platform. Over the next few years, this team will innovate with new offerings like car rentals, autonomous vehicles, third-party drivers, package deliveries, and re-envisioning the entire shopping and checkout flow for Uber. This is a high-impact role where you will partner with Engineering, Data Science, and Ops leaders across the company to identify common functionality that can be standardized as core Fulfillment capability, and help launch new products to improve the overall efficiency of the marketplace.

More info in the [Fulfillment blog here](https://eng.uber.com/fulfillment-platform-rearchitecture/).

**What the Candidate Will Do**

1. Strategic Leadership: Develop a comprehensive vision and strategy for the Fulfillment platform, aligning with Uber's overall strategic goals.
2. Requirements development: Lead exploration to deeply understand client teams’ problems and find opportunities to standardize solutions that will be coordinated into the core Fulfillment functionality.
3. Solution Evangelization: Advocate for the adoption of new capabilities across Uber, ensuring that they meet the diverse needs of client teams.
4. Important Metric Development and Measurement: Establish and supervise key performance indicators (important metrics) for the platform, collaborating with client teams to measure success and impact.
5. Process Development: Implement clear and efficient processes for project prioritization, user research, and other essential functions.

**Basic Qualifications**

1. Bachelor's or Master's degree in Business, Engineering, Computer Science, or an equivalent.
2. 5+ years of Product Management experience
3. Solid understanding of platform software development processes, lifecycle and critical metrics.
4. Proven ability to lead cross-functional teams and drive complex projects.
5. Experience in developing and driving product roadmaps.

**Preferred Qualifications**

1. Experience launching company-wide initiatives in a highly cross-matrixed environment, creating alignment through collaboration and influence around new processes and tools.
2. Proven technical skills - the ability to deep dive with engineering and data science to understand trade-offs and provide prioritization guidance.
