jobs.title: Staff Scientist, Mobility Matching
jobs.description:
**About the Role**

Have you ever wondered why it’s taking so long for an earner to be matched to your trip, why the ETA is so long, or how an Earner is picked from the many around you? If so, the Mobility Matching Science team is for you!

The Matching team at Uber builds the systems that determine the optimal way to fulfill trips on the Mobility platform. We work on the problems of determining which earners to send an offer to and when. The solutions we build are critical for maintaining reliability and ensuring the trust of riders and earners alike.

We are looking for experienced scientists who relish the opportunity to develop novel approaches and apply them at Uber’s scale. They ideally have a good balance of causal inference, analysis, experimentation, and modeling knowledge, as well as, an ability to use these skills to identify business opportunities and deliver product recommendations.

**What You'll Do**

- Develop data-driven business insights and work with cross-functional stakeholders to identify opportunities and recommend prioritization of product, growth and optimization initiatives
- Design and analyze experiments, communicating results that draw detailed and actionable conclusions
- Analyze and contribute to development of optimization algos and ML models for use in mobility matching
- Collaborate with cross-functional teams such as product, engineering and operations to drive system development end-to-end from conceptualization to final product

**Basic Qualifications**

- Ph.D., or M.S. in Statistics, Economics, Machine Learning, Operations Research, Computer Science, or another quantitative field.
- Minimum 5 years of industry experience as an Applied Scientist, Data Scientist, or in a similar quantitative role.
- Strong knowledge of the mathematical foundations of statistics, machine learning, optimization, and economics.
- Proven experience in experimental design (e.g., A/B testing) and causal inference.
- Proficiency in using Python or R for data analysis, modeling, and algorithm prototyping at scale with large datasets.
- Experience with exploratory data analysis, statistical analysis and testing, and model development.

**Preferred Qualifications**

- 6+ years of industry experience as an Applied Scientist, Data Scientist, or in a similar quantitative role.
- Ph.D. in a relevant quantitative field.
- Deep expertise in areas such as marketplace experimentation, causal inference, ML, or optimization, particularly in the context of multi-sided platforms, incentive systems, or logistics.
- Proficiency in SQL.
- Experience in algorithm development and prototyping, and with productionizing algorithms for real-time systems.
- Demonstrated ability to translate complex analytical results into clear, actionable insights and influence product and business strategy.
- Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to articulate technical concepts to diverse audiences, including senior leadership.
- Experience leading technical projects and influencing the scope and direction of research.
- Familiarity with big data technologies (e.g., Spark, Hive, HDFS).
- Strong business acumen and the ability to shape vague questions into well-defined analytical problems and success metrics.

jobs.title: Staff Technical Program Manager
jobs.description:
**About the Role**

As a Technical Program Manager (TPM) at Uber, you play a critical role in driving high-impact org-wide initiatives and continuously improving processes to increase the effectiveness of our engineering organizations. As a member of the Mobility and Platforms TPM team, you will own and drive large, sophisticated cross-team technical initiatives for the organization.

Specifically, you will own the problem space, work closely with engineering leads to conceptualize solutions, organize/align multiple engineering teams for delivery, and drive execution leveraging critical metrics. You will look for ways to standardize, ensure execution is efficient and consistent, and set accountability by tracking progress, resolving dependencies, identifying issues, evaluating risks, and communicating status to leadership and collaborators. You will intrinsically act as a coach to engage and energize the product and engineering teams to achieve aggressive goals.

**What the Candidate Will Do:**

You move fluidly from the big picture to the details so that the team can deliver complex and strategic cross-functional projects, often with tight deadlines. You are a bridge and a connector for the company. You are intuitive, focused, driven, organized, insightful, and productive. You break through communication issues and effectively develop relationships with collaborators at all levels of the organization. You build trust across the organization. You are not afraid to be direct, but you strive to act with emotional intelligence and integrity.

**Following are some of the core responsibilities of TPMs at Uber:**

- Manage complex and large-scale cross-team, multi-functional initiatives. Collaborate with engineering managers and engineers to estimate work efforts, define landmarks, and manage resources.
- Track progress, resolve dependencies, evaluate risks, and communicate status to upper management and program collaborators. Engage and energize ‌project teams to achieve aggressive goals.
- Proactively remove obstacles to drive momentum and progress. Identify communication gaps, handle issue customer concerns, and provide support to teams balancing challenging priorities. Get results proactively.
- Understand technical implementation at the architecture level and propose technical alternatives when necessary. Ask questions that clarify priorities and push the team to be highly effective. Develop broad domain and technical knowledge.
- Understand product compromises. Have the end customer in mind and be able to bridge between end customer and technical aspects with a data-driven approach to increase our efficiency.
- Help manage the cross-functional strategic planning and business planning process, leading conversations with key stakeholders to develop concepts for strategic initiatives, and developing those into detailed program / project plans (including roadmaps, funding planning, resource planning, clear Objectives, measurable outcomes, and hiring goals).
- Continuously improve and scale the organization. Implement continuous improvements to the engineering organization and the program management process. Share program/project process frameworks, tools, and best practices that can be adopted throughout the organization. Improve product development and delivery. Mentor project management skills within our engineering leadership team.

**Basic Qualifications:**

- Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience in Computer Science, Engineering, or equivalent practical experience.
- Demonstrated ability as a TPM or Engineering Manager in a software, SaaS, or systems development environment
- Solid technical capability and an ability to understand technical designs, challenges, and risks. Engineers enjoy working closely with you.
- Excellent written and verbal communication skills and exceptional emotional intelligence.
- Shown strong cross-team and cross-org stakeholder management.
- Analytical and truth-seeking. Ability to understand complex concepts and make reasoned decisions objectively.
- Metrics-driven: Experience resolving effective program critical metrics and using them to measure program success and issues.
- Strong organizational skills to juggle many tasks without losing sight of the highest priority items.
- Excellent in identifying process gaps, measuring progress, and balancing engineering and product efficiency with process overhead.

**Preferred Qualifications:**

- Experienced in complex business and technical domain.
- Strong software development and distributed systems experience.
- Computer Science degree, or related field.

jobs.title: Head of Strategic Grocery Accounts
locations: New York, New York, United States
jobs.description:
**About the Role**

As the Head of Strategic Grocery Accounts, you will be responsible for the sales of our top grocery partnerships throughout the United States. Grocery & Retail is a primary growth bet for Uber, bringing on-demand delivery of almost, almost anything to Uber Eats customers around the world - and this role is absolutely crucial to achieving that goal.

Who are we looking for? Someone who has proven experience closing major accounts and cultivating C-Suite-level relationships, who isn't afraid to dig into the details and get their hands dirty.

**_This is a hybrid role based in our office spaces, with in-person collaboration on Tuesdays, Wednesdays, and Thursdays. We encourage our employees to work from our office on additional days if they desire to do so._**

**What You’ll Do**

_We are looking for a "Player - Coach" to both:_

1. **Build New Partnerships** with our highest impact merchants
2. **Enable the team** with sales tools, continuous improvement, and project management

What will make you successful:

- **Storytelling -** Ability to craft a story that resonates with C-level executives and key decision makers
- **Data Driven** \- Self-sufficient in querying (SQL) and synthesising large sets of data
- **Skilled at negotiation** \- Effectively sell the value of Uber's Grocery & Retail platform to ensure sustainable partnerships for both parties.
- **Strategic thought-leader** \- Someone who is talented at crafting deal proposals and knows their way around a P&L.
- **Expertise in docs, decks, and contracts** \- Imperative that this individual has experience creating proposal docs + decks that are ready for a C-Suite audience.
- **Make things happen** (internally and externally) - Not everything goes to plan - this person needs to be able to rally the troops internally and externally to drive to results. This will be imperative.

**Basic Qualifications**

- Minimum 6 years of Sales, Business Development, Consulting, or Investment Banking experience
- Analytical capabilities (SQL and modeling)
- Strong executive presence
- Exceptional communication skills - internally and externally, written and verbal. This person will be tasked with writing externally-facing documents, such as executive-level presentations, deal proposals, RFP responses, and term sheets.
- Strong use of insights and data to help form overall strategy and drive decision-making. Understand both Uber and Retailer’s P&L to come to the right decision when deal-making.
- Self-starter demeanor with an ability to thrive in a fast-moving, constantly evolving team environment, and a passion for sales
- Ability to clearly frame a value proposition and ask the right questions to be able to overcome objections to gain commitment from external and internal partners
- Willingness to roll-up sleeves, and get in the weeds with internal stakeholders

**Preferred Qualifications**

- Ability to understand the technical aspects of a deal (e.g. tax, contractual language, etc), alongside a deep understanding of how our product works.
- Track record working with cross-functional partners (e.g. Legal, Engineering, Product, Tax, Marketing) to help internally advocate for merchants’ needs.
- CRM experience (Salesforce)
- Experience in On-Demand Delivery or Retail

jobs.title: 2026 Operations Internship, Colombia
jobs.description:
## **About the Internship**

Operations are the heart and soul of Uber. These teams are bridging the gap between the virtual and the physical world every day by enabling movement. Movement of people, things, food, and more. We are looking for highly motivated problem-solvers who are passionate about Operations. You will work alongside Operations Managers and partner with teams across our Mobility or Delivery business.

You will get the chance to work on impactful projects that involve analyzing data sets, providing creative solutions, and leaning into the execution. You will help support decision-making within your teams through your critical thinking, strategic analysis, and data-driven approach.

**What You'll Do**

- **Embark** on a chance to reimagine the way the world moves by focusing on real-time, impactful projects
- **Learn** the vast inner workings of Uber - you will have a direct impact on Riders, Drivers, Consumers, Couriers, Restaurants and/or the Marketplace
- **Solve** key strategic problems through analytical frameworks and insights to advise the team on key decisions
- **Experiment** with new products and efficiencies aiming to improve our operations, spanning pricing, demand building, segmentation, customer operations, and much more
- **Collaborate** and engage with multiple functions across the business - operations, finance, policy, communications, product, marketing, legal, and customer support

**Eligibility**

- **Education:** Enrolled in a Bachelor’s degree program for the full duration of the internship (graduation date between June-December 2027)
- **English proficiency:** Able to present ideas in a comprehensive, yet succinct manner
- **Available to** **work** 30 hours a week for at least 12 months - hybrid mode (Tuesday, Wednesday & Thursday @the office)
- **Work authorization in Colombia -** No visa sponsorship is available for internships

## **Preferred Qualifications**

- **Communication**: Using interpersonal skills and situational awareness to deliver information clearly to a variety of audiences
- **Planning and Organization**: Setting up and maintaining systems to structure appropriately and keep track of tasks and projects
- **Problem Solving**: Effectively resolving issues that involve people, things, and processes by using logic and common sense
- **Stakeholder Management**: Taking time to build meaningful relationships, earning the trust of others within the organization through strong situational awareness and reliability
- **Teamwork**: Demonstrates optimism, respects others, and works well in a team

- **Skills:** Knowledge of data analytics, SQL, and experience with statistical packages or basic programming skills (i.e. Python) is highly regarded

**Internships @ Uber**

We offer a competitive monthly internship allowance, Uber credits, and much more!

You have the rare chance to create a global impact - we're moving real people and assets and reinventing transportation and logistics. We offer expansive mentorship from Uber employees to guide you through your internship experience and for you to build personal connections and friendships with hardworking people who share your passion for technology.

jobs.title: Sr People Programs Analyst
jobs.description:
**About the role and team**

This role is about transforming how the **Global People Partner Organization** uses data to drive its strategy and impact. You’re not just producing reports; you are the embedded analytical consultant who uses HRIS and case data to diagnose systemic issues in our employee experience and service delivery model. The work you do provides leadership with the clear, quantified insights they need to make decisions that impact every employee across Uber, demanding a high degree of precision and accountability for the data’s integrity. Our environment is fast-paced, high-stakes, and often ambiguous, which means you'll have the autonomy to build foundational data frameworks that allow the People team to **move fast and with purpose**.

The team operates at the complex intersection of global scale, localized needs, and sensitive data. You'll be constantly challenged to **see the forest and the trees**, translating granular service metrics into strategic, org-wide actions that drive scalability and efficiency. Success here requires a champion mindset, **grit**, and the ability to influence without direct authority across People Operations, Business Leadership, and HR Tech teams. This is a place to **grow with the challenge** by owning the data narrative for Uber’s most critical people programs.

**What you’ll do**

- **Architect** the data strategy and Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) for core global People Partner programs, defining what success looks like and how to measure it under conditions of ambiguity and high urgency.
- **Diagnose** systemic employee experience blockers and service delivery inefficiencies by analyzing trends in large-scale HRIS and global case management data, and present prescriptive, actionable recommendations to senior leadership.
- **Build** and **maintain** robust, self-service reporting dashboards (using tools like Tableau or Looker Studio) that empower People Partners and business leaders to make informed, data-driven decisions without needing ad-hoc support.
- **Lead** cross-functional problem-solving with People Operations to re-engineer HR service delivery models, ensuring clean data capture and management that scales globally and maintains **One Uber** data integrity.
- **Communicate** complex analytical narratives clearly and succinctly—both verbally and in writing—to non-technical senior executives during operational business reviews and strategic planning sessions.
- **Own** the end-to-end quality and transparency of People data, proactively identifying and resolving data integrity issues to establish a reliable single source of truth for the entire People Partner function.

**Basic qualifications**

- **4+ years** of demonstrated experience in a data analyst role, specifically supporting Human Resources or a global business function, is required.
- **Bachelor’s degree** in a quantitative field (e.g., Data Analytics, Business, Computer Science, Math/Statistics) is required or relevant experience

**Preferred qualifications**

- Experience in data querying and manipulation using SQL to manage and analyze large, complex datasets is required.
- Experience developing, maintaining, and presenting reports and dashboards using professional visualization tools such as Tableau, Google Looker Studio, or a similar platform is required.
- Proficiency with Generative AI tools (e.g., LLMs, prompt engineering) for data analysis, reporting, or process optimization, with an understanding of related data privacy and ethical considerations.
- Experience working within and analyzing data from major HRIS (Workday, Oracle) and HR case management (ServiceNow, Zendesk) tools.
- Demonstrated ability to translate high-level business problems into precise analytical requirements and technical data solutions.
- Experience influencing stakeholders and driving consensus on data strategy across diverse functional and geographic teams.
- Ability to **thrive through constant change** and balance the need for meticulous detail with the urgency of a fast-moving business environment.

For Chicago, IL-based roles: The base salary range for this role is USD$114,000 per year - USD$127,000 per year.

jobs.description:

As a Software Engineer - iOS within Uber’s Finprod org, you will play a key role in developing the next generation of financial products that empower our customers to achieve their financial goals. As an essential part of delivering magical customer experience, our team builds engaging solutions by tackling complex technical challenges unique to Uber’s business.

jobs.title: Sr Staff Software Engineer
jobs.description:
**About the Role**

Uber is seeking Sr staff level engineering candidates with a proven breadth and depth of experience to help take our databases systems to the next level, and pioneer Uber’s next generation of AI. In return, we offer an unmatched opportunity to find the challenges that will take you to the next level.The Storage Platform team builds and operates Uber’s online storage. We use a mix of internally-developed systems and open-source software such as TiDB, Cassandra and MySQL. We are embarking on a journey to modernize our databases for its next generation with AI capabilities and evaluating opportunities to introduce new systems and components to power AI applications that will take us to the next level in scalability, efficiency, availability, and ease of use in the AI era.

What the Candidate Will Do ----

1. Provide technical leadership in architecting and building mission-critical distributed storage systems which underpin Uber’s global operations
2. Collaborate with others, from talented team members within your group, through smart technologists across product lines, to responsible leaders across Uber. Build up positive relationships with people in the organization, meaningfully collaborating and building trust
3. Be a role model on acting with good judgment and responsibility. Engineers across the organization will look to you on how best to plan and execute on projects
4. See the big picture and identify strategically important problems, inefficiencies or opportunities for meaningful improvements. Drive alignment on how to tackle these and deliver high leverage solutions on these at the group and organization level
5. Ability to think broadly and to build alliances across teams; fierce but optimistic in pursuit of the best solution
6. Obsession with understanding what your customers need and making what you build delightful for them to use.
7. Dedication to automation and to engineering production systems for reliability and operability. Up the bar on sustainable engineering by improving best practices, producing best-in-class code, documentation, testing and monitoring
8. Be a humble mentor and trusted advisor for both our talented team members and passionate leaders alike. Deal with a difference in opinions in a mature and fair way, helping teams to commit and move forward

\-\-\-\- Basic Qualifications ----

1. Bachelor's degree or higher in an engineering field (e.g. Computer Science, Computer Engineering, etc.).
2. 8+ years of experience in building large scale distributed systems in a high caliber environment
3. Experience in programming languages such as Java, Go or Python
4. Experience in scalable storage and working with databases
5. Deep expertise in systems engineering at scale in storage or related domains.
6. Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including the ability to write detailed technical documents.
7. Passionate about building systems that are both powerful and easy to use.

\-\-\-\- Preferred Qualifications ----

1. Experience building or operating NewSQL databases at scale, such as TiDB
2. Deep experience building distributed systems at scale. For example, know the tradeoffs of different sharding and replication strategies; can reason about data consistency in a distributed environment; and know some consensus algorithms and/or at least tried studying Paxos
3. Proven track record as reflected by attainment of Staff Engineer level or above on a premier tech company engineering ladder, or comparable achievement elsewhere.
4. Experience working with open-source projects and ecosystem
5. Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including the ability to write detailed technical documents
6. Track record of leading successful teams. Growing, motivating, and inspiring the people around you!
7. Customer obsessed and collaborative within and across teams to meet customer needs. Optimistic in the pursuit of the best solution!
8. Passion for raising the bar in how a world-class engineering culture operates

jobs.title: Sr Data Scientist - Fraud/Risk
jobs.description:
**About the Role**

We’re looking for a Senior Data Scientist to join our Risk Decision Science team. In this role, you’ll apply a data-driven approach to identify, understand, and scope emerging fraud trends across the Uber platform. You will lead critical initiatives in fraud detection and collaborate closely with cross-functional partners, including engineers, product managers, operations, and other data scientists.

This role will be responsible for key performance metrics such as fraud losses, false positive rates, and operational efficiency. Success will require a strong blend of business and technical acumen, along with excellent communication and collaboration skills to work effectively with both internal and external stakeholders.

\-\-\-\- What You Will Do ----

1. Deliver impactful and meaningful strategies to mitigate/stop fraudulent activities and achieve key results (OKRs)
2. Apply data analysis, experimentation, ML/LLM models to support the development of risk strategies and interventions while preserving and improving the user experience
3. Participate in project definition and idea generation, work on collaborative projects with partners across the globe such as product, engineering, comm ops and regional teams with a focus on the Risk/Fraud mitigation
4. Evolve our risk metrics, shape and influence our data models and instrumentation to generate insights and develop new data products and models
5. Communicate efficiently and present findings to the leadership team to strengthen business decisions.
6. Stay highly engaged and always hustle as Uber Risk is a very fast-paced environment

\-\-\-\- Basic Qualifications ----

1. 5+ years in a data-focused role such as product analytics, business analytics, business operations, or data science
2. Bachelor's degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, Economics or other quantitative fields
3. Experience in framing ambiguous business problems into structured analytical work.
4. Highly proficient in data science and visualization tools, such as SQL, Python, R, Tableau
5. Proficient at defining, utilizing and communicating performance metrics.
6. proven track record of applying analytical/statistical methods to solve real-world problems using big data
7. Creative problem solving, critical thinking skills, and get things done attitude
8. Hands-on, data-driven, and attentive to detail

\-\-\-\- Preferred Qualifications ----

1. Advanced degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Economics or other quantitative fields
2. 3+ years in Risk/Fraud/Payments
3. Expertise in statistics and experimental design
4. Demonstrated ability to be an effective leader, producing high-quality work and crafting meaningful relationships
5. Team player -- this is a highly collaborative function that will work with a range of senior leaders
6. Outstanding communication and people skills -- numbers are key but one should be able to explain the implications to an executive audience
7. Passion for Uber!

jobs.title: Merchant Integrations Lead, Grocery & Retail
locations: New York, New York, United States
jobs.location: New York, New York, United States
jobs.description:
**About the Role**

Uber is transforming the future of grocery & retail, building the world’s best and biggest marketplace for on-demand delivery of all local commerce. As part of the Global Merchant Operations team for Grocery & Retail (GR), you will help to ensure an exceptional experience for the merchants on the Uber platform. You will support our merchants as they partner with Uber to grow their business and provide a world-class delivery experience to customers.

In this role, you will work closely with local operations and commercial teams around the globe, as well as GR leadership and product development teams. Specifically, you will be the global leader for our merchant integration strategy, ensuring we provide a magical integration experience for our merchants. The scope of this role spans integrations of all types, including catalog, point-of-sale, order fulfillment, and loyalty programs.

This role calls for a well-rounded combination of analytical ability, strategic thinking, stakeholder management, collaboration skills, and operational excellence. We operate in a fast-paced environment, so we are looking for a highly adaptable candidate who can thrive in a dynamic culture.

**What You'll Do**

- Vision & Leadership: Set a global integration vision and strategy in collaboration with senior GR and Product leadership, then drive organizational focus and cross-functional execution against that strategy
- Integration Strategy: Define, articulate, and lead the global retail merchant integration strategy with a focus on unlocking business value for both Uber and our merchants, ensuring alignment with business goals and translating strategy into clear roadmaps and outcomes
- Post-Integration Support: Define and monitor key metrics related to the merchant’s integration experience with Uber, and drive cross-functional initiatives to continuously improve them
- Prioritization & Roadmapping: Own the intake and prioritization of integration requests, balancing merchant needs with Uber’s strategic objectives and technical constraints
- Program Management: Drive cross-functional execution across product, engineering, operations and commercial teams to deliver high-impact integration initiatives and scaled solutions for long-tail merchants.
- Enablement: Build educational materials and develop the playbooks and tooling needed to promote integration best practices and adoption for our internal commercial and operations teams and external merchant partners
- Quality Standards: Define and monitor key metrics related to the merchant’s integration experience with Uber, and drive cross-functional initiatives to continuously improve them

**Basic Qualifications**

- Bachelor's Degree in business, economics, engineering, or a related field
- 6+ years of experience in strategy, operations, finance, consulting, or a related field
- Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
- Exceptional stakeholder management experience and program management skills
- Excellent communication skills (both written and verbal), to effectively engage and drive consensus across technical and non-technical audiences
- Advanced Excel/google sheets and data analysis skills
- Intermediate/Advanced SQL skills (or a willingness to develop them quickly)
- Proven experience working directly with senior leaders to set and align on functional strategy and execution priorities
- Demonstrated ability to define a long-term vision and lead cross-functional teams toward successful strategy implementation at scale

**Preferred Qualifications**

- Master's Degree in business, economics, engineering, or a related field
- Experience in the grocery and/or retail industry
- Experience defining and executing cross-functional strategies across global teams
- Track record of leading organizational change or transformation efforts tied to B2B approaches

jobs.title: Senior Staff Engineer, Core Infrastructure
jobs.description:
**About the Role**

The Uber Infrastructure team in Aarhus is at the forefront of building and scaling mission-critical systems that power Uber’s global platform. We focus on improving quality, security, modernization, and efficiency across Uber’s backend infrastructure. Our work spans safe deployment, encryption, Kubernetes adoption, workload automation, autoscaling, and ARM migration. As a **Senior Staff Engineer**, you will architect and drive large-scale backend systems, improve developer efficiency and resilience, and shape the next generation of Uber’s infrastructure through cutting-edge technologies and scalable engineering practices.

**What the Candidate Will Do**

- Architect and evolve backend infrastructure to support Uber’s growing workloads, including deployment engines, autoscalers, and hybrid cloud environments.
- Lead safe deployment and rollback automation across stateless, stateful, and batch workloads, improving resilience and developer efficiency.
- Improve infrastructure security and compliance, including encryption-at-rest, ransomware mitigation, and cloud security best practices.
- Advance Uber’s modernization efforts, including Kubernetes migration, unified workload platforms, and PaaS improvements.
- Optimize Uber’s infrastructure efficiency, focusing on ARM adoption, autoscaling enhancements, and cost-effective compute allocation.
- Mentor engineers and drive technical strategy, ensuring Uber’s backend infrastructure remains cutting-edge, reliable, and scalable.

**Basic Qualifications**

- 10+ years of experience in backend software development with distributed systems, infrastructure, or cloud platforms.
- Strong expertise in Go, Java, or similar backend languages, with a deep understanding of Kubernetes, cloud infrastructure, and high-scale systems.
- Experience driving large-scale system modernization, performance optimizations, and deployment safety improvements.

**Preferred Qualifications**

- Experience designing and implementing highly available, efficient, and secure cloud-native architectures.
- Deep understanding of safe deployment strategies, workload automation, and resilience engineering.
- Proven expertise in scaling autoscaling solutions, ARM adoption, hybrid cloud, or GPU support for ML workloads.
- Ability to lead large technical initiatives and drive cross-team collaboration across platform, security, and infrastructure teams.

**If You Want to Find Out More**

For a deeper dive into some of the technologies and infrastructure innovations at Uber, check out the following resources:

- **CPU Scaling**: Vertical CPU Scaling – [https://www.uber.com/en-SE/blog/vertical-cpu-scaling](https://www.uber.com/en-SE/blog/vertical-cpu-scaling)
- **CPU Throttling**: Avoiding CPU Throttling in a Containerized Environment – [https://eng.uber.com/avoiding-cpu-throttling-in-a-containerized-environment/](https://eng.uber.com/avoiding-cpu-throttling-in-a-containerized-environment/)
- **uBuild**: Fast and Safe Building of Thousands of Container Images – [https://www.uber.com/en-US/blog/ubuild-fast-and-safe-building-of-thousands-of-container-images](https://www.uber.com/en-US/blog/ubuild-fast-and-safe-building-of-thousands-of-container-images)
- **Cinnamon**:
- Using Century-Old Tech to Build a Mean Load Shedder – [https://www.uber.com/en-SE/blog/cinnamon-using-century-old-tech-to-build-a-mean-load-shedder](https://www.uber.com/en-SE/blog/cinnamon-using-century-old-tech-to-build-a-mean-load-shedder)
- PID Controller for Cinnamon – [https://www.uber.com/en-SE/blog/pid-controller-for-cinnamon](https://www.uber.com/en-SE/blog/pid-controller-for-cinnamon)
- Cinnamon Auto-Tuner: Adaptive Concurrency in the Wild – [https://www.uber.com/en-SE/blog/cinnamon-auto-tuner-adaptive-concurrency-in-the-wild](https://www.uber.com/en-SE/blog/cinnamon-auto-tuner-adaptive-concurrency-in-the-wild)
- **Unified Config**: How We Unified Configuration Distribution Across Systems at Uber – [https://www.uber.com/en-DK/blog/how-we-unified-configuration-distribution-across-systems-at-uber/](https://www.uber.com/en-DK/blog/how-we-unified-configuration-distribution-across-systems-at-uber/)
- **Up**: Portable Microservices Ready for the Cloud – [https://www.uber.com/en-DK/blog/up-portable-microservices-ready-for-the-cloud/](https://www.uber.com/en-DK/blog/up-portable-microservices-ready-for-the-cloud/)
- **Continuous Deployment (CD)**: Continuous Deployment at Uber – [https://www.uber.com/en-SE/blog/continuous-deployment](https://www.uber.com/en-SE/blog/continuous-deployment)
- **Odin**:
- Stateful Platform – [https://www.uber.com/en-SE/blog/odin-stateful-platform/](https://www.uber.com/en-SE/blog/odin-stateful-platform/)
- The Accounter – [https://www.uber.com/en-SE/blog/the-accounter](https://www.uber.com/en-SE/blog/the-accounter)
- **INCA**: Deduping and Storing Images at Uber Eats – [https://www.uber.com/en-SE/blog/deduping-and-storing-images-at-uber-eats/](https://www.uber.com/en-SE/blog/deduping-and-storing-images-at-uber-eats/)
- **ARM**:
- Adopting ARM at Scale: Bootstrapping Infrastructure – [https://www.uber.com/en-SE/blog/adopting-arm-at-scale-bootstrapping-infrastructure](https://www.uber.com/en-SE/blog/adopting-arm-at-scale-bootstrapping-infrastructure)
- Adopting ARM at Scale: Transitioning to a Multi-Architecture Environment – [https://www.uber.com/en-SE/blog/adopting-arm-at-scale-transitioning-to-a-multi-architecture-environment](https://www.uber.com/en-SE/blog/adopting-arm-at-scale-transitioning-to-a-multi-architecture-environment)

jobs.title: Sr Program Manager, Tech
locations: New York, New York, United States
jobs.location: New York, New York, United States
jobs.description:
**About the team**

Uber is building the world’s best and biggest marketplace for on-demand delivery of all local commerce. What began with a focus on restaurant delivery has rapidly expanded to include groceries, convenience, alcohol, pharmacy and retail, with big ambitions beyond.

Uber’s Catalog team is at the center of this selection flywheel. The Catalog team is responsible for building the most complete, accurate product catalog across nearly 1 billion items. Your work will enable customers to make informed buying decisions with rich product attributes, delivery partners to know exactly what to shop, and merchants and advertisers to onboard and efficiently merchandise their selection.

**About the role**

As a Program Manager for Catalog, you’ll structure and drive high-impact, cross-org initiatives that step-change Uber’s end-to-end catalog quality, intelligence and pricing. You will own the program space and work closely with engineering, product and business leads to ensure its success.

**What the Candidate Will Do:**

**What you'll do**

- **Develop overall program strategy**, defining the objectives, KPIs and milestones against which teams will execute and measure success.
- **Engage and energize teams to deliver efficiently** on program goals. Tactically, partner with tech and business leads to discover and drive opportunities for improvement that come from data analysis, merchant insights, and new process / product design.
- **Be the subject matter expert** on Uber’s catalog identity and pricing intelligence flows. Develop broad domain and technical expertise, understanding the ins and outs of merchant integrations, how new catalog data is ingested and interacts with Uber platform features. Build documentation that distills and scales this expertise to internal and external stakeholders.
- **Elevate technical implementation** at the architecture level, proposing technical design alternatives when necessary. Ask questions that clarify priorities and help engineering balance design quality with velocity.
- **Help reduce exposure to classic failure models** across teams, processes and systems (e.g., requirements not sufficiently understood or documented, ineffective cross-team collaboration, long-term impact(s) from third-party solutions, insufficient stakeholder review, etc).
- **Proactively identify, mitigate and escalate risks** before they become roadblocks.
- **Design, implement and govern KPI reporting** that improves visibility into, and accountability for, program progress and performance.
- **Own communication** with tech and business leadership and executives that impacts critical company-wide objectives.

**Basic Qualifications:**

- **Minimum of 5+ years experience as a TPM, PgM or PM** in a tech environment with a proven track record driving successful programs / products with cross-org accountability and impact.
- **Strong technical aptitude.** You quickly grasp technical design concepts, challenges, and risks. Engineers enjoy working closely with you.
- **Excellent written and verbal communication skills**. You clearly articulate complex problems and priorities across both tech and non-tech audiences. You lean into written documentation to bring clarity and efficiency to decision making and process.
- **Strong bias for action.** Amid ambiguity, you truth seek and marry problems with solutions. You dig deep into data and speak directly to customers to understand the root cause of a problem before working backward to devise an informed solution.
- **Ability to lead through influence.** You form a vision and make owners out of stakeholders. You excel at identifying process gaps, quantifying and tracking progress, and balancing execution speed with design quality and process overhead.
- **SQL Proficient.** You have hands-on experience, are able to troubleshoot and self-serve answers to your own queries.

**Preferred Qualifications:**

- Experience working with product catalogs in an e-commerce or retail environment
- Experience with Product Information Management (PIM), Master Data Management (MDM) or related
- Working knowledge of common integration technologies, e.g. APIs, webhooks, SFTP file transfer

jobs.title: Group Product Manager, Rider Growth
locations: New York, New York, United States
jobs.location: New York, New York, United States
jobs.description:
**About the Role**

Uber is looking for a strategic consumer leader to join our dynamic and fast-paced team. As the Group Product Manager for Rider Growth, you will be responsible for driving new user growth and ressurection globally. You'll figure out our global growth strategy, align with leaders across tech, business teams and marketing, and drive the tech strategy to optimize our growth funnels and acquire new user segments around the world.

In this role, you'll work closely with Product Design, Data Science, Engineering, Strategy & Ops, and other partners across Uber's businesses and geographies. You will lead with deep customer compassion, relying on data and UXR to make informed decisions grounded in strong product intuition. You'll be both creative and bring deep expertise in growth and consumer product to the table, as well as analytically rigorous, driving experimentation and knowing your metrics. You'll operate with a GM mindset, helping galvanize the rider growth strategy for our core mobility business.

**What the Candidate Will Do**

- Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including Design, Data Science, Engineering and Ops, to identify growth opportunities, develop product initiatives, and implement data-driven experiments to improve key growth metrics
- Effectively present and communicate strategy, implementation, and growth plans to various collaborators ranging from business audiences to senior leadership
- Distill the vision and strategy for the team to generate enthusiasm across cross-functional partners and executive leadership
- Anticipate and remove obstacles that slow down or prevent us from delivering on operational, product, and program objectives

**Basic Qualifications**

- 8+ years of Product Management experience delivering highly successful and innovative products with your fingerprints all over them. You should be familiar with systems thinking, analytics and experiment design, and have a solid understanding of software development processes and concepts.
- Ph.D., M.S. or Bachelors degree in Math, Economics, Bioinformatics, Statistics, Engineering, Computer Science, or other quantitative field.
- Must have 3+ years of experience directly managing a team of PM leaders. Looking for someone with extensive experience setting and delivering on a strategy you crafted, where you were accountable for the outcomes.
- Consumer growth experience with a track record of delivering highly successful and innovative products.

**Preferred Qualifications**

- Experience building and leading scaled businesses, including ownership and optimization of business performance metrics.
- A true passion for Uber's mission, our products, and the company's hybrid technology/operations nature.
- Experience leading geographically distributed cross-functional teams in an energetic, high octane environment
- Customer obsession. You have a knack for taking on complex product challenges and finding elegant solutions that are delightfully simple for our users.
- A Driver" mindset. You are biased toward action, a great collaborator, a master disambiguator/simplifier, and constantly pushing toward clarity and delivery. You never hesitate to roll up your sleeves and tackle something hands-on.
- A high bar across the board. From your own contributions to the people you work with, to the products you work on, you have a never-ending desire to grow and learn.

jobs.title: Sr Data Scientist, TLM
jobs.description:
**About the Role**

As a Data Science, Tech Lead Manager (TLM), you will play an instrumental role in shaping how Uber tracks its financial data as well as understands and optimizes its financial performance across diverse business lines. You'll work on a wide range of initiatives from building scalable financial data products and developing predictive models to improving reporting workflows and uncovering insights that drive strategic decisions. And you will lead a small team of data scientists partnering closely with teams in Finance and FinTech. This is a hands-on leadership role where you'll balance managing projects and people with diving deep into data yourself.

**What You Will Do**

1\. Lead a team of data scientists located in the US and India

2\. Actively participate and contribute to the technical solutioning and execution of the data science roadmap including helping develop robust forecasting models and impactful Gen AI applications

3\. Collaborate closely with teams in finance, engineering, product, business analysts, legal and data science teams across different lines of businesses, to design, prototype, and productionize end-to-end data science solutions.

4\. Develop the team with active coaching and mentoring. Help grow the talent in the team via effective hiring and performance management.

5\. Deliver strong presentations to stakeholders and senior leadership on the team's work, models, solutions, and data science findings.

Basic Qualifications:

**Basic Qualifications**

1\. M.S. or Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, Economics, Mathematics, Finance, or other quantitative fields.

2\. Minimum 4 years of industry experience as a data scientist with demonstrated ability working with large data sets, mining actionable insights, statistical methods, and basic ML model development

3\. Domain experience in Finance, Accounting, Payments, FinTech, Tax

4\. Minimum 1 year of experience managing a small team of Data/Applied Scientists with strong leadership skills, growing and mentoring your team members

5\. Proficiency in SQL and at least one programming language used for data analysis (e.g., Python or R)

6\. Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, Looker or similar)

7\. Demonstrated ability to translate business problems into analytical solutions and communicate findings to both technical and non-technical audiences

8\. Strong communication and organizational skills with the ability to manage multiple projects and stakeholders simultaneously.

9\. Bias to action and proven track record of getting things done.

**Preferred Qualifications**

1\. Degree or work experience in finance, augmented with work experience as a data scientist (or experience as a data scientist in finance or a related domain) with minimum 1 year of tech leading or managerial experience

2\. Experience developing forecasting or anomaly detection models, ideally in financial or operational domains

For San Francisco, CA-based roles: The base salary range for this role is USD$169,000 per year - USD$188,000 per year.

jobs.title: Lead Product Manager - Family Safety Experience
locations: New York, New York, United States
jobs.location: New York, New York, United States
jobs.description:
**About the Role**

Uber is a technology company that is changing the way the world thinks about transportation. We are building the technology people use everyday. Whether it's heading home from work, getting a meal delivered from a favorite restaurant, or a way to earn extra income, Uber is becoming part of the fabric of daily life.

As a PM in Uber’s Safety Family team, you will drive innovation in one of the most important aspects of transportation, launching products that will create a huge impact for millions of drivers and riders. If you're ready to go deep working on a rewarding set of challenges and if you've got the skills, experience, drive, and a strong team mentality - get in touch!

We are seeking an experienced and passionate Product Manager with technical depth, product intuition and entrepreneurial spirit to drive the Family Profiles roadmap. The role demands principled thinking, a stubborn refusal to settle, bold innovation, and a mentality that always starts with the user.

You will work with star engineers and product designers in a fast-paced, rapidly growing, hybrid technology + operations environment to build tools, contextual experiences and implement policies to engender trust among our users and promote safety globally. You should be comfortable in uncharted territory as we build unique technologies for eaters, riders, drivers and every user who touches the Uber community. We need your skills and enthusiasm to make it happen.

**What the Candidate Will Need / Bonus Points**

\-\-\-\- What the Candidate Will Do ----

1. Build user-facing products as well as backend solutions that enhance safety for all of our users
2. Internalize and deeply understand Uber’s mission and strategies, as well as how the Uber Safety team's mission and objectives factor into the company strategy
3. Be incredibly truth-seeking. Collect whatever data is necessary to inform product direction by soliciting and embracing critical feedback
4. Identify opportunities for new products that leverage Uber's global scale and build upon its safety infrastructure to provide unique and lasting customer value. You will work with our regional teams to understand issues on the ground and make those solutions a part of your roadmap.
5. Clearly communicate plans, insights, data and results to a spectrum of audiences including executives, other product teams, and other decision-makers across Uber
6. Partner with User Experience Research, Operations and Support teams to seek insights on user problems and evangelize those problems, along with your proposed solutions, across Uber
7. Distill the vision and strategy, and generate enthusiasm across the cross-functional team through creative problem solving and ruthless prioritization.

\-\-\-\- Basic Qualifications ----

1. Depth, expertise, and pragmatism. You have visionary ideals for user safety & freedom and can apply them in a business environment
2. Passion. You’re excited and equipped to share our message on safety and commitment to winning user trust, the industry, and other experts.
3. Leadership. You’re able to educate and win over cross-team stakeholders on product decisions.
4. You’re just as comfortable learning about on-the-ground safety challenges that we are faced with, as you are with thinking big in proactively building products to mitigate problems
5. You have superior design instincts with a keen eye for detail. You have a track record of shipping products with intuitive designs that speak for customer obsession and value
6. A great teammate. Your product instincts are matched by your humility and willingness to problem-solve with others. You can take the lead and have a great sense of what doing ‘the right thing’ is. You are an enabler not a blocker. You seek to mentor and share your knowledge with others
7. Minimum of 7 years experience delivering highly successful solutions in engineering, product management, data analytics or in strategy & operations within a tech company - you're extremely proud of what you've accomplished.

\-\-\-\- Preferred Qualifications ----

1. A computer science undergraduate degree or other engineering degree equivalent.
2. Experience with the user and technical challenges faced in Trust & Safety or Risk engineering and product teams.

jobs.title: SMB Sales Manager, Uber for Business
jobs.description:
## **About the Role**

We are actively recruiting a proven sales leader to build a new pod of  SMB sellers  based in our Chicago  Hub. You will develop a team of sellers for Uber for Business adoption in one of the business’ fastest growing segments. The ideal candidate has experience focussed on leadership in the B2B space and is empathetic, data-driven, and a self-starter with experience in both mature and start-up environments. Does this sound like you?

You’ll succeed in this role if: you embrace rolling up your sleeves with your team; you enjoy finding the balance between short-term needs and long-term investments; your working style is collaborative, process-driven, and decisive. Our team is growing quickly & we're excited you're considering this opportunity!

**_This is a hybrid role based in our office spaces, with in-person collaboration on Tuesdays, Wednesdays, and Thursdays. We encourage our employees to work from our office on additional days if they desire to do so._**

## **What You'll Do**

- Recruit, train, and develop 11-12 Account Executives
- Establish a customer obsessed organization and  and operationalizestrategy to achieve critical metrics.
- Supervise daily operations to maximize sales and meet, exceed revenue targets
- Implement performance management plans to hold sellers to a high level of accountability
- Manage and report accurate weekly forecasts and pipelines, achieve quarterly sales goals, and mentor Account Executives on strategies to reach their goals
- Establish an effective partnership with Operations, Product, Engineering, and Marketing teams

## **Basic Qualifications**

- Minimum of 2 years working in a sales leadership role
- Minimum of 5 years of sales experience
- Excellent written and verbal communication skills, as well as stakeholder management, sales systems design, process driven decision making and data analysis experience
- Desire to take initiative; thrive on change, articulate vision and comfortable with ambiguity

## **Preferred Qualifications**

- 2+ years of sales leadership experience, including building, training, and developing sales professionals
- Experience with Salesforce; ability to develop analysis based on CRM data in a scalable manner
- Experience with sales enablement tools such as; ZoomInfo, Groove, LinkedIn Sales Navigator, Tableau, Google Suite

For Chicago, IL-based roles: The base salary range for this role is USD$113,000 per year - USD$126,000 per year.

jobs.title: Senior Manager, Safety Lead, Middle East Autonomous Mobility & Delivery
jobs.description:
**About the Team**

The Autonomous Mobility and Delivery (AM&D) team at Uber is seeking to accelerate the arrival of safe, secure autonomous mobility and delivery offerings that complement our existing products and are beneficial for our customers, partners, and communities. This role is on Uber’s Autonomous Mobility and Delivery team and reports to the Senior Director, Head of Safety for Autonomous Mobility & Delivery.

**About the Role**

- We are seeking an experienced Safety Leader for Uber's AM&D Safety Team to effectively represent Uber’s Safety standards and requirements to our partners in the Middle East.

- This role requires a strong understanding of safety management system core concepts, tailored to autonomous vehicle operations, and knowledge of the relevant industry standards and regulations that inform these activities. The candidate will contribute to regulatory discussions on safety standards and work closely with AV technology and fleet partners to promote adherence to safety protocols, industry standards, and Uber’s internal safety practices.This will be a highly cross-functional role, requiring collaboration with internal and external stakeholders in the complex and evolving AV space. This role will involve strategy, program management, and partner engagement responsibilities with a strong focus on cross functional collaboration, including local operations.

**What You Will Do**

- **Regulatory Support and Engagement:** Support engagement with local regulators by providing safety insights and technical input on Uber’s AV safety approach and compliance activities. Participate in meetings with regulatory bodies to help communicate Uber’s safety principles and operational practices.
- **Technical Policy Support:** Apply technical understanding of AV safety frameworks to inform and contribute to the development of local safety standards and regulatory guidance. Collaborate with internal teams to ensure alignment with global safety policies.
- **Vehicle and AV Expertise:** Develop technical safety recommendations guiding the deployment of AVs (without a safety officer) on the Uber Platform in commercial operations.
- **Fleet Partner Collaboration:** Work collaboratively with fleet partners to assure that operational safety requirements are met, maintaining high standards in line with Uber's internal safety guidelines.
- **Compliance Monitoring:** Conduct regular assurance reviews to evaluate ongoing compliance with established safety regulations and standards defined in Uber’s Safety Assurance program, ensuring continuous improvement in safety practices.
- **Incident Response:** Liaise with various stakeholders, including Uber team members, fleet partners, and regulatory bodies, to manage and coordinate responses to any safety incidents or concerns.
- **Fleet Partner Safety Enablement:** Identify, track, and execute critical partner-related action items to meet safety requirements against operational goals
- **Industry Awareness:** Maintain up-to-date knowledge of safety and health trends in the AV and transportation industries. Participate in professional safety associations and networks to exchange best practices and emerging insights.
- **Cross-functional Leadership:** Collaborate with many different skilled individuals across Uber, including business development, fleets, product management, legal, policy, safety operations, marketing, engineering, and regional operations teams
- **Standards Collaboration:** Contribute to the development of industry safety best practices and standards by collaborating with peers and experts through organizations such as the AVSC, SAE, and other relevant bodies.

## **What You Will Need**

- **Industry Experience**: Minimum of 6 years of demonstrated experience in transportation, automotive or autonomous vehicle development.
- **AV Standards:** Demonstrated experience with safety standards related to autonomous mobility.
- **Transportation Safety Expertise:** Familiarity with functional safety, operational safety, safety management systems, safety cases, safety critical software development, and safety data analysis.
- **Communication & Relationship Building:** Exceptional communication, negotiation, and relationship management skills, with the ability to work across different cultures and industries.
- **Operational Expertise:** Familiarity with the deployment and operations in a transportation environment
- **Standards Collaboration:** Familiarity with or experience contributing to discussions within industry standards organizations (e.g., SAE, AVSC, IEEE, ISO) focused on safety and best practices for autonomous vehicles.

**Nice to Have**

- Advanced degree in safety, engineering, or related technical fields
- Experience working in the Middle East markets or a similar regulatory landscape
- Familiarity with Uber's Safety Assurance Program and relevant industry standards
- Experience performing data analysis and statistical analysis of operational safety data to generate safety performance indicators
- Experience representing a company or industry group in regulatory or policy discussions.
- Demonstrated ability to lead multi-stakeholder efforts or working groups related to AV safety standards.
- A continuous improvement approach, with a history of quick adaptation and self-directed learning
- A passion for creating empathetic, inspiring, and innovative transportation solutions in pursuit of positive societal outcomes

jobs.title: Manager, AV Fleet Partnerships
jobs.description:
**About the Role**

Uber’s AM&D Business Development team develops and manages strategic partnerships across the autonomous vehicle value chain. This particular role will be focused on understanding the intricacies and requirements stemming from our agreements with AV software providers and OEMs, then designing agreements with qualified fleet operators that align incentives. This role will require close collaboration with the AM&D Fleet Team, Regional BD teams, and many other cross functional stakeholders. Successfully coordinating across these teams will be critical to reaching Uber’s AV expansion goals.

Successful candidates will bring a dynamic combination of intellectual rigor and emotional awareness, maturity, an ability to think strategically and execute tactically, and strong interpersonal skills to maximize value in partnership negotiations and contracting. You enjoy building strategy and structure amid ambiguity, you enjoy operating independently while still remaining connected to your team and a broad set of internal partners. Executing complex and multifaceted long-term deals connected to the core of Uber’s business requires considered internal alignment; senior executives and cross-functional stakeholders will support your deal strategy and execution because they remain convinced your deals and deal structures are right for the business. Understanding that some prospective partners may also intend to be future competitors, you will be able to advocate internally for a prospective partner’s needs and concerns with empathy and an evergreen presumption of positive intent, while also safeguarding Uber’s interests and securing future value for the business.

**What You'll Do**

1. Be a strategic thought partner to team members in different parts of the business, working closely with Ops and Product leadership to formulate strategy and identify how to drive impact through partnerships
2. Build consensus behind deal strategy and timely support for deal execution across diverse internal audiences, from senior executives to cross-functional stakeholders
3. Lead complex, multifaceted deals with prospective partners across the autonomous vehicle value chain
4. Lead the development of long term, mutually beneficial relationships with senior executives of current and prospective partners.
5. Define the right balance between near traction and securing value across a long time horizon
6. Refine deal strategy and deal frameworks through negotiation based on Uber goals, partner goals, and industry and partner situations.

**What You'll Need**

1. _Bachelor's Degree_
2. _6 years of demonstrated ability in business development, management consulting, private equity, general management and/or a combination thereof with exposure to the tech and mobility industry._

**Bonus Points If**

1. Direct experience in strategy consulting, investment banking, venture capital, private equity
2. Exposure to large tech companies, automotive OEMs, advanced technologies
3. Experience building new business units or companies, working on projects with high degrees of ambiguity
4. Strong analytical skills with ability to combine business, strategy, finance and legal concepts to lead complex, multi-faceted deals
5. Be able to work cross functionally with many other roles and stakeholders in the company
6. Exceptional communication skills, both within your team, with leadership, and with partners.
7. Strong interpersonal skills that allow you to build trust and navigate intense negotiations to secure Uber’s interests with partners, and adeptly lead the cross-functional coordination (product, local operations, engineering, finance, legal) required to implement deals
8. High standards and a bias toward action. You can find the context and information you need through relationships across the organization, you push for clarity and delivery, and you hold a high bar from your contributions and those of the people you work with

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer - iOS
jobs.description:
**About the Role**

The Experimentation team provides cutting edge tooling and methodologies for all teams at Uber to make rapid decisions for their product iterations. Experimentation is an exciting domain that combines multiple disciplines of Software Engineering (Backend, Distributed Systems, Mobile, Web, Data Infra), Data Science, and Product Design. Every major launch across any of Uber’s Rides, Delivery, Earner, Freight, and Uber For Business (U4B) organizations leverages the Experimentation platform to determine how new features impact key business metrics. Virtually all Engineers, Scientists, and Product Managers at the company use our platform on a daily basis to launch, monitor, test, and make changes to Uber’s ecosystem.

**What You Will Do**

Your main responsibilities will be:

1. Be responsible for the design, implementation, and delivery of complex projects
2. Build highly reliable and resilient features in our iOS Mobile SDK
3. Collaborate with cross-functional mobile developer teams to enable and support the business
4. Identify and fix bugs and reliability of current systems
5. Bring in your passionate self and positively impact the team around you

\-\-\-\- Basic Qualifications ----

- Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics or related field OR 5-years full-time Software Engineering work experience, WHICH INCLUDES 3-years total technical software engineering experience in one or more of the following specialized areas:
  - iOS development
  - Swift programming
  - Objective C programming
- Note: the 3-year total of specialized software engineering experience may have been gained through education and full-time work experience, additional training, coursework, research, or similar (OR some combination of these). The year of specialized experience is not necessarily in addition to the years of Education & full-time work experience indicated.

\-\-\-\- Preferred Qualifications ----

- At least five (5) years of Software Engineering Experience in iOS Development
- Experience in other mobile **platform** engineering teams (versus product engineering teams)
- Industry experience in mobile Feature Flagging systems
- Industry experience in Experimentation Systems

jobs.title: Staff iOS Engineer
jobs.description:
As an iOS Engineer on the Communications Platform team, you'll work on the code behind apps used by millions globally every day. In hundreds of cities, people tap their phones to get a ride, get food delivered, or earn extra cash with Uber. We're looking for hardworking engineers to make sure the delivery experience is magical. Join us to work on some of the most exciting challenges in tech, with projects ranging from laying the foundation for developers to build upon to designing communication experiences that's perfect for our users.

\-\-\-\- What the Candidate Will Do ----

1. Architect, design, and develop mobile libraries and sdks
2. Lead the development and optimization of mobile experiences using modern technologies
3. Understand and oversee the complex data workflows and pipelines, end-to-end.
4. Raise the bar in terms of observability, reliability and engineering best practices
5. Conduct code reviews, design discussions, and technical mentorship.
6. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to deliver comprehensive, end-to-end solutions.
7. Troubleshoot and resolve critical issues in production and development environments.
8. Provide strategic technical leadership to influence the direction of Uber’s technology stack.
9. Develop and maintain comprehensive documentation for software projects and processes.

\-\-\-\- Basic Qualifications ----

1. 8+ years of software development experience with a focus on iOS.
2. Proficiency in Swift and Objective-C, with extensive experience in SwiftUI and iOS frameworks. A strong understanding of architecture and best practices in mobile development.
3. Hands-on experience with mobile web technologies is a plus.
4. Exceptional analytical skills to solve complex, high-scale technical challenges.
5. Demonstrated ability to lead projects, mentor engineers, and drive a culture of excellence and innovation.
6. Excellent collaborative and communication skills, with the ability to convey complex technical concepts.

\-\-\-\- Preferred Qualifications ----

1. 8+ years of relevant work experience in mobile development.
2. Strong focus on high-quality mobile UI experiences and feature developments.
3. Previous contributions to creating major efficiencies or led cultural initiatives within your team or across several teams.
4. iOS Architecture, Tech Lead, Lead Architect, Team Lead
5. Work on mobile apps scaling to millions of users with experience managing these releases
6. Driving large scale initiatives that span multiple projects, teams, or groups of engineers.
7. Proven expertise in mobile foundations and SDK/framework developments.
8. Knowledge of Cross-platform/ mobile web technologies is a major plus.

jobs.title: Senior Mid-Market Growth Account Executive, Uber for Business
jobs.description:
## **_This is a hybrid role - our team collaborates in-person out of our incredible office in Toronto on Tuesdays, Wednesdays, and Thursdays._**

## **About the Role**

The Uber for Business team is looking for a sharp, highly motivated individual to join our team! As a Senior Mid-Market Growth Account Executive, you will be responsible for driving revenue growth and operational and commercial excellence with our existing customers.

As a Senior Mid-Market Growth Account Executive, you will work closely with existing customers to understand their unique challenges and goals, acting as a consultative partner on the Uber for Business platform to demonstrate how Uber for Business can help them meet their objectives. You will own the relationship and growth strategy by identifying upsell and cross-sell opportunities, negotiating deals that are mutually beneficial, and getting commitment from senior decision-makers. You will succeed by partnering with our implementation team to launch new products, use cases, or expansions with the ultimate goal of growing revenue and driving product adoption.

## **What You’ll Do**

- Develop a comprehensive view of the client that includes their business priorities, competitive edge in the marketplace, industry trends, and key strategic partner relationships.
- Grow and retain a book of business and proactively identify expansion opportunities to drive growth across multiple lines of business, products, and services for customers to exceed revenue goals. (Increase adoption and usage of our current programs, expand to new offices or departments, or cross-sell new product offerings)
- Negotiate contract renewals, amendments, and expansions by collaborating with cross-functional teams and owning the discussion with the client.
- Build, enhance, and implement long-term client relationships and communication at the C-level, with executives, key decision-makers, and influencers. Ensure our partners have an exceptional experience with Uber for Business.
- Conduct monthly or quarterly business reviews to illustrate the adoption of our platform and drive the conversation towards opportunities to expand the partnership and spend with Uber.

## **Basic Qualifications**

- Minimum of 3 years of B2B experience a quota carrying role as an Account Manager or Account Executive with a focus on growing revenue from accounts with existing revenue
- Demonstrated success of hitting sales quotas based on revenue growth

## **Preferred Qualifications**

- Bachelor’s Degree
- 3+ years of client-facing experience
- Experience in Anything-as-a-Service (Tech Based), Tech that is consumption-based, selling into multiple verticals
- Experience selling in the Mid-Market space (1,000+ employees or $500M-$2B in revenue)
- Strong prioritization skills: able to manage time effectively, prioritizing high-value clients, while working with multiple customers to deliver on goals and improve processes
- You operate with speed, resourcefulness, and a go-getter attitude! You pick up things fast and run with them

For Canada-based roles: The base salary range for this role is CAD$85,500 per year - CAD$95,250 per year.

You will be eligible to participate in Uber's bonus program, and may be offered sales bonuses & other types of comp. You will also be eligible for various benefits. More details can be found at the following link [https://www.uber.com/careers/benefits](https://www.uber.com/careers/benefits).

jobs.title: Sr Operations Manager, Fulfillment & Merchant Experience
jobs.description:
この職務内容を日本語で読むには、ブラウザの言語設定を日本語に切り替えてください

**About the Role** As a key member of our Grocery & Retail operations team, you will be responsible for optimizing and scaling our Courier Pick & Pack (CPP) business model in Japan. You will work cross-functionally with Sales, Product, Engineering, and Marketplace Operations to drive cost efficiency, improve fulfillment rates, and enhance the overall experience for merchants, delivery partners, and consumers alike. This role requires a strategic mindset, strong analytical capabilities, and operational excellence to ensure seamless execution and continuous improvement.

**Your Impact in Role**

- Build the operational foundations of a new business model in Japan to unlock step change merchant selection for our consumers.
- Help our merchant partners streamline their delivery operations to grow their online sales penetration.
- Create new and engaging earning opportunities for our delivery partners.

**Key Responsibilities**

_Pick & Pack Operations_

- Define best practices to optimize picking, packing, and payment time, reduce defects, and improve quality on CPP trips.
- Collaborate with Sales and Merchants to improve in-store flow and catalogue structure for efficiency and quality.
- Implement operational improvements to enhance item fulfillment rates.
- Develop and maintain a Quality Management System and training materials to improve couriers’ item fulfillment metrics, defect rates, and picking time per trip.

_Shopper Product Operations_

- Act as the local product champion for the Shopper product in Japan, working closely with global ops, product, and engineering teams.
- Lead go-to-market (GTM) strategies for new shopper product features in collaboration with Marketplace Ops, Sales, and Merchants.
- Represent the voice of merchants and couriers to influence product development to meet the needs of our partners in Japan.
- Develop educational materials for couriers, merchants, and customer support.

_CPP Merchant Operations_

- Build and maintain onboarding processes for CPP merchants.
- Improve efficiency of billing and invoicing processes for CPP merchants to facilitate store expansion.
- Manage execution of monthly invoice issuance and adjustments in collaboration with Sales.
- Define CPP-specific support policies in collaboration with our Community Operations team.

**The Experience You’ll Bring**

- 5+ years of experience in operations, product operations, or related fields.
- Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a data-driven mindset.
- Willingness to dive into the details - to literally walk the aisles of our merchants to understand every detail of their operations.
- Experience working cross-functionally with Product, Sales, and Engineering teams.
- Ability to influence and drive initiatives in a fast-paced environment.
- Experience in e-commerce, logistics, or marketplace operations is a plus.
- Fluency in both Japanese and English is required.

**What’s in it for you?**

**Doing your best work means being your best self. We offer a wide range of benefits and perks that are uniquely Uber to support your health and wellbeing. Check them out here: https://www.uber.com/us/en/careers/benefits/**

jobs.title: Senior Process Optimization Specialist
jobs.description:
**About the Team**

The team’s mission: backing creativity with operational efficiency.

Based in the Krakow CoE, the team is cross-functional and supports operations at the regional and global level.

We focus on four core areas:

- Business Processes (design, execution, optimization)
- Automation (process automation, real-time monitoring, refactoring)
- Data Analytics (query, deepdive, self-operating dashboard, data pipeline)
- Data Science (modeling, machine learning, pattern identification, prediction)

The span of work is large, covering multiple verticals (such as Uber Rides, Eats, High Capacity Vehicle, Payment, Strategy & Planning) and Mega-Regions (such as Global, EMEA, US&C).

We’re offering a hybrid model of working (60% minimum based out of our Krakow office, 40% optional work from home).

**What you’ll do**

- Participate in the design of new business processes
- Write Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) and keep them updated
- Execute complex processes and work on their continuous optimization
- Write queries and scripts to reduce execution time and guide other team members
- Own end-to-end project plan and suggest improvements for the entire portfolio
- Improve technical skills continuously to match evolving business needs
- Work on business-critical processes in coordination with Stakeholders and Team Members

**What you’ll need**

- Good knowledge in Google Sheets (reporting & trend analysis), SQL, and Google Script
- Proven track record in operational excellence and continuous optimization, executing multiple business processes in accordance with SOPs and creating flows (ex., Lucidchart)

- Practical experience in executing and optimizing large-scale processes (mega-region)

- Faculty to guide project designs and continuous improvements
- Ability to work on your own initiative independently (proactive) or in a Group (excellent teammate)
- Strong Analytical Skills, Critical Thinking, Business Acumen
- Excellent written and spoken English (fluent)
